40001001	The book of the generations of Jesus Christ , the son of David , the son of Abraham .
40001002	The son of Abraham was Isaac ; and the son of Isaac was Jacob ; and the sons of Jacob were Judah and his brothers ;
40001003	And the sons of Judah were Perez and Zerah by Tamar ; and the son of Perez was Hezron ; and the son of Hezron was Ram ;
40001004	And the son of Ram was Amminadab ; and the son of Amminadab was Nahshon ; and the son of Nahshon was Salmon ;
40001005	And the son of Salmon by Rahab was Boaz ; and the son of Boaz by Ruth was Obed ; and the son of Obed was Jesse ;
40001006	And the son of Jesse was David the king ; and the son of David was Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah ;
40001007	And the son of Solomon was Rehoboam ; and the son of Rehoboam was Abijah ; and the son of Abijah was Asa ;
40001008	And the son of Asa was Jehoshaphat ; and the son of Jehoshaphat was Joram ; and the son of Joram was Uzziah ;
40001009	And the son of Uzziah was Jotham ; and the son of Jotham was Ahaz ; and the son of Ahaz was Hezekiah ;
40001010	And the son of Hezekiah was Manasseh ; and the son of Manasseh was Amon ; and the son of Amon was Josiah ;
40001011	And the sons of Josiah were Jechoniah and his brothers , at the time of the taking away to Babylon .
40001012	And after the taking away to Babylon , Jechoniah had a son Shealtiel ; and Shealtiel had Zerubbabel ;
40001013	And Zerubbabel had Abiud ; and Abiud had Eliakim ; and Eliakim had Azor ;
40001014	And Azor had Zadok ; and Zadok had Achim ; and Achim had Eliud ;
40001015	And Eliud had Eleazar ; and Eleazar had Matthan ; and Matthan had Jacob ;
40001016	And the son of Jacob was Joseph the husband of Mary , who gave birth to Jesus , whose name is Christ .
40001017	So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations ; and from David to the taking away to Babylon , fourteen generations ; and from the taking away to Babylon to the coming of Christ , fourteen generations .
40001018	Now the birth of Jesus Christ was in this way : when his mother Mary was going to be married to Joseph , before they came together the discovery was made that she was with child by the Holy Spirit .
40001019	And Joseph , her husband , being an upright man , and not desiring to make her a public example , had a mind to put her away privately .
40001020	But when he was giving thought to these things , an angel of the Lord came to him in a dream , saying , Joseph , son of David , have no fear of taking Mary as your wife ; because that which is in her body is of the Holy Spirit .
40001021	And she will give birth to a son ; and you will give him the name Jesus ; for he will give his people salvation from their sins .
40001022	Now all this took place so that the word of the Lord by the prophet might come true ,
40001023	See , the virgin will be with child , and will give birth to a son , and they will give him the name Immanuel , that is , God with us .
40001024	And Joseph did as the angel of the Lord had said to him , and took her as his wife ;
40001025	And he had no connection with her till she had given birth to a son ; and he gave him the name Jesus .
40002001	Now when the birth of Jesus took place in Beth-lehem of Judaea , in the days of Herod the king , there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem ,
40002002	Saying , Where is the King of the Jews whose birth has now taken place ? We have seen his star in the east and have come to give him worship .
40002003	And when it came to the ears of Herod the king , he was troubled , and all Jerusalem with him .
40002004	And he got together all the chief priests and scribes of the people , questioning them as to where the birth-place of the Christ would be .
40002005	And they said to him , In Beth-lehem of Judaea ; for so it is said in the writings of the prophet ,
40002006	You Beth-lehem , in the land of Judah , are not the least among the chiefs of Judah : out of you will come a ruler , who will be the keeper of my people Israel .
40002007	Then Herod sent for the wise men privately , and put questions to them about what time the star had been seen .
40002008	And he sent them to Beth-lehem and said , Go and make certain where the young child is ; and when you have seen him , let me have news of it , so that I may come and give him worship .
40002009	And after hearing the king , they went on their way ; and the star which they saw in the east went before them , till it came to rest over the place where the young child was .
40002010	And when they saw the star they were full of joy .
40002011	And they came into the house , and saw the young child with Mary , his mother ; and falling down on their faces they gave him worship ; and from their store they gave him offerings of gold , perfume , and spices .
40002012	And it was made clear to them by God in a dream that they were not to go back to Herod ; so they went into their country by another way .
40002013	And when they had gone , an angel of the Lord came to Joseph in a dream , saying , Get up and take the young child and his mother , and go into Egypt , and do not go from there till I give you word ; for Herod will be searching for the young child to put him to death .
40002014	So he took the young child and his mother by night , and went into Egypt ;
40002015	And was there till the death of Herod ; so that the word of the Lord through the prophet might come true , Out of Egypt have I sent for my son .
40002016	Then Herod , when he saw that he had been tricked by the wise men , was very angry ; and he sent out , and put to death all the male children in Beth-lehem and in all the parts round about it , from two years old and under , acting on the knowledge which he had got with care from the wise men .
40002017	Then the word of Jeremiah the prophet came true ,
40002018	In Ramah there was a sound of weeping and great sorrow , Rachel weeping for her children , and she would not be comforted for their loss .
40002019	But when Herod was dead , an angel of the Lord came in a dream to Joseph in Egypt ,
40002020	Saying , Get up and take the young child and his mother , and go into the land of Israel : because they who were attempting to take the young child's life are dead .
40002021	And he got up , and took the young child and his mother , and came into the land of Israel .
40002022	But when it came to his ears that Archelaus was ruling over Judaea in the place of his father Herod , he was in fear of going there ; and God having given him news of the danger in a dream , he went out of the way into the country parts of Galilee .
40002023	And he came and was living in a town named Nazareth : so that the word of the prophets might come true , He will be named a Nazarene .
40003001	And in those days John the Baptist came preaching in the waste land of Judaea ,
40003002	Saying , Let your hearts be turned from sin ; for the kingdom of heaven is near .
40003003	For this is he of whom Isaiah the prophet said , The voice of one crying in the waste land , Make ready the way of the Lord , make his roads straight .
40003004	Now John was clothed in camel's hair , with a leather band about him ; and his food was locusts and honey .
40003005	Then Jerusalem and all Judaea went out to him , and all the people from near Jordan ;
40003006	And they were given baptism by him in the river Jordan , saying openly that they had done wrong .
40003007	But when he saw a number of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism , he said to them , Offspring of snakes , at whose word are you going in flight from the wrath to come ?
40003008	Let your change of heart be seen in your works :
40003009	And say not to yourselves , We have Abraham for our father ; because I say to you that God is able from these stones to make children for Abraham .
40003010	And even now the axe is put to the root of the trees ; every tree then which does not give good fruit is cut down , and put into the fire .
40003011	Truly , I give baptism with water to those of you whose hearts are changed ; but he who comes after me is greater than I , whose shoes I am not good enough to take up : he will give you baptism with the Holy Spirit and with fire :
40003012	In whose hand is the instrument with which he will make clean his grain ; he will put the good grain in his store , but the waste will be burned up in the fire which will never be put out .
40003013	Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan , to be given baptism by him .
40003014	But John would have kept him back , saying , It is I who have need of baptism from you , and do you come to me ?
40003015	But Jesus made answer , saying to him , Let it be so now : because so it is right for us to make righteousness complete . Then he gave him baptism .
40003016	And Jesus , having been given baptism , straight away went up from the water ; and , the heavens opening , he saw the Spirit of God coming down on him as a dove ;
40003017	And a voice came out of heaven , saying , This is my dearly loved Son , with whom I am well pleased .
40004001	Then Jesus was sent by the Spirit into the waste land to be tested by the Evil One .
40004002	And after going without food for forty days and forty nights , he was in need of it .
40004003	And the Evil One came and said to him , If you are the Son of God , give the word for these stones to become bread .
40004004	But he made answer and said , It is in the Writings , Bread is not man's only need , but every word which comes out of the mouth of God .
40004005	Then the Evil One took him to the holy town ; and he put him on the highest point of the Temple and said to him ,
40004006	If you are the Son of God , let yourself go down ; for it is in the Writings , He will give his angels care over you ; and , In their hands they will keep you up , so that your foot may not be crushed against a stone .
40004007	Jesus said to him , Again it is in the Writings , You may not put the Lord your God to the test .
40004008	Again , the Evil One took him up to a very high mountain , and let him see all the kingdoms of the world and the glory of them ;
40004009	And he said to him , All these things will I give you , if you will go down on your face and give me worship .
40004010	Then said Jesus to him , Away , Satan : for it is in the Writings , Give worship to the Lord your God and be his servant only .
40004011	Then the Evil One went away from him , and angels came and took care of him .
40004012	Now when it came to his ears that John had been put in prison , he went away to Galilee ;
40004013	And going away from Nazareth , he came and made his living-place in Capernaum , which is by the sea , in the country of Zebulun and Naphtali :
40004014	So that the word of the prophet Isaiah might come true ,
40004015	The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali , by the way of the sea , the other side of Jordan , Galilee of the Gentiles ,
40004016	The people who were in the dark saw a great light , and to those in the land of the shade of death did the dawn come up .
40004017	From that time Jesus went about preaching and saying , Let your hearts be turned from sin , for the kingdom of heaven is near .
40004018	And when he was walking by the sea of Galilee , he saw two brothers , Simon , whose other name was Peter , and Andrew , his brother , who were putting a net into the sea ; for they were fishermen .
40004019	And he said to them , Come after me , and I will make you fishers of men .
40004020	And straight away they let go the nets and went after him .
40004021	And going on from there he saw two other brothers , James , the son of Zebedee , and John , his brother , in the boat with their father , stitching up their nets ; and he said , Come .
40004022	And they went straight from the boat and their father and came after him .
40004023	And Jesus went about in all Galilee , teaching in their Synagogues and preaching the good news of the kingdom , and making well those who were ill with any disease among the people .
40004024	And news of him went out through all Syria ; and they took to him all who were ill with different diseases and pains , those having evil spirits and those who were off their heads , and those who had no power of moving . And he made them well .
40004025	And there went after him great numbers from Galilee and Decapolis and Jerusalem and Judaea and from the other side of Jordan .
40005001	And seeing great masses of people he went up into the mountain ; and when he was seated his disciples came to him .
40005002	And with these words he gave them teaching , saying ,
40005003	Happy are the poor in spirit : for the kingdom of heaven is theirs .
40005004	Happy are those who are sad : for they will be comforted .
40005005	Happy are the gentle : for the earth will be their heritage .
40005006	Happy are those whose heart's desire is for righteousness : for they will have their desire .
40005007	Happy are those who have mercy : for they will be given mercy .
40005008	Happy are the clean in heart : for they will see God .
40005009	Happy are the peacemakers : for they will be named sons of God .
40005010	Happy are those who are attacked on account of righteousness : for the kingdom of heaven will be theirs .
40005011	Happy are you when men give you a bad name , and are cruel to you , and say all evil things against you falsely , because of me .
40005012	Be glad and full of joy ; for great is your reward in heaven : for so were the prophets attacked who were before you .
40005013	You are the salt of the earth ; but if its taste goes from the salt , how will you make it salt again ? it is then good for nothing but to be put out and crushed under foot by men .
40005014	You are the light of the world . A town put on a hill may be seen by all .
40005015	And a burning light is not put under a vessel , but on its table ; so that its rays may be shining on all who are in the house .
40005016	Even so let your light be shining before men , so that they may see your good works and give glory to your Father in heaven .
40005017	Let there be no thought that I have come to put an end to the law or the prophets . I have not come for destruction , but to make complete .
40005018	Truly I say to you , Till heaven and earth come to an end , not the smallest letter or part of a letter will in any way be taken from the law , till all things are done .
40005019	Whoever then goes against the smallest of these laws , teaching men to do the same , will be named least in the kingdom of heaven ; but he who keeps the laws , teaching others to keep them , will be named great in the kingdom of heaven .
40005020	For I say to you , If your righteousness is not greater than the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees , you will never go into the kingdom of heaven .
40005021	You have knowledge that it was said in old times , You may not put to death ; and , Whoever puts to death will be in danger of being judged :
40005022	But I say to you that everyone who is angry with his brother will be in danger of being judged ; and he who says to his brother , Raca , will be in danger from the Sanhedrin ; and whoever says , You foolish one , will be in danger of the hell of fire .
40005023	If then you are making an offering at the altar and there it comes to your mind that your brother has something against you ,
40005024	While your offering is still before the altar , first go and make peace with your brother , then come and make your offering .
40005025	Come to an agreement quickly with him who has a cause against you at law , while you are with him on the way , for fear that he may give you up to the judge and the judge may give you to the police and you may be put into prison .
40005026	Truly I say to you , You will not come out from there till you have made payment of the very last farthing .
40005027	You have knowledge that it was said , You may not have connection with another man's wife :
40005028	But I say to you that everyone whose eyes are turned on a woman with desire has had connection with her in his heart .
40005029	And if your right eye is a cause of trouble to you , take it out and put it away from you ; because it is better to undergo the loss of one part , than for all your body to go into hell .
40005030	And if your right hand is a cause of trouble to you , let it be cut off and put it away from you ; because it is better to undergo the loss of one part , than for all your body to go into hell .
40005031	Again , it was said , Whoever puts away his wife has to give her a statement in writing for this purpose :
40005032	But I say to you that everyone who puts away his wife for any other cause but the loss of her virtue , makes her false to her husband ; and whoever takes her as his wife after she is put away , is no true husband to her .
40005033	Again , you have knowledge that it was said in old times , Do not take false oaths , but give effect to your oaths to the Lord :
40005034	But I say to you , Take no oaths at all : not by the heaven , because it is the seat of God ;
40005035	Or by the earth , because it is the resting-place for his foot ; or by Jerusalem , because it is the town of the great King .
40005036	You may not take an oath by your head , because you are not able to make one hair white or black .
40005037	But let your words be simply , Yes or No : and whatever is more than these is of the Evil One .
40005038	You have knowledge that it was said , An eye for an eye , and a tooth for a tooth :
40005039	But I say to you , Do not make use of force against an evil man ; but to him who gives you a blow on the right side of your face let the left be turned .
40005040	And if any man goes to law with you and takes away your coat , do not keep back your robe from him .
40005041	And whoever makes you go one mile , go with him two .
40005042	Give to him who comes with a request , and keep not your property from him who would for a time make use of it .
40005043	You have knowledge that it was said , Have love for your neighbour , and hate for him who is against you :
40005044	But I say to you , Have love for those who are against you , and make prayer for those who are cruel to you ;
40005045	So that you may be the sons of your Father in heaven ; for his sun gives light to the evil and to the good , and he sends rain on the upright man and on the sinner .
40005046	For if you have love for those who have love for you , what credit is it to you ? do not the tax-farmers the same ?
40005047	And if you say , Good day , to your brothers only , what do you do more than others ? do not even the Gentiles the same ?
40005048	Be then complete in righteousness , even as your Father in heaven is complete .
40006001	Take care not to do your good works before men , to be seen by them ; or you will have no reward from your Father in heaven .
40006002	When then you give money to the poor , do not make a noise about it , as the false-hearted men do in the Synagogues and in the streets , so that they may have glory from men . Truly , I say to you , They have their reward .
40006003	But when you give money , let not your left hand see what your right hand does :
40006004	So that your giving may be in secret ; and your Father , who sees in secret , will give you your reward .
40006005	And when you make your prayers , be not like the false-hearted men , who take pleasure in getting up and saying their prayers in the Synagogues and at the street turnings so that they may be seen by men . Truly I say to you , They have their reward .
40006006	But when you make your prayer , go into your private room , and , shutting the door , say a prayer to your Father in secret , and your Father , who sees in secret , will give you your reward .
40006007	And in your prayer do not make use of the same words again and again , as the Gentiles do : for they have the idea that God will give attention to them because of the number of their words .
40006008	So be not like them ; because your Father has knowledge of your needs even before you make your requests to him .
40006009	Let this then be your prayer : Our Father in heaven , may your name be kept holy .
40006010	Let your kingdom come . Let your pleasure be done , as in heaven , so on earth .
40006011	Give us this day bread for our needs .
40006012	And make us free of our debts , as we have made those free who are in debt to us .
40006013	And let us not be put to the test , but keep us safe from the Evil One .
40006014	For if you let men have forgiveness for their sins , you will have forgiveness from your Father in heaven .
40006015	But if you do not let men have forgiveness for their sins , you will not have forgiveness from your Father for your sins .
40006016	And when you go without food , be not sad-faced as the false-hearted are . For they go about with changed looks , so that men may see that they are going without food . Truly I say to you , They have their reward .
40006017	But when you go without food , put oil on your head and make your face clean ;
40006018	So that no one may see that you are going without food , but your Father in secret ; and your Father , who sees in secret , will give you your reward .
40006019	Make no store of wealth for yourselves on earth , where it may be turned to dust by worms and weather , and where thieves may come in by force and take it away .
40006020	But make a store for yourselves in heaven , where it will not be turned to dust and where thieves do not come in to take it away :
40006021	For where your wealth is , there will your heart be .
40006022	The light of the body is the eye ; if then your eye is true , all your body will be full of light .
40006023	But if your eye is evil , all your body will be dark . If then the light which is in you is dark , how dark it will be !
40006024	No man is able to be a servant to two masters : for he will have hate for the one and love for the other , or he will keep to one and have no respect for the other . You may not be servants of God and of wealth .
40006025	So I say to you , Take no thought for your life , about food or drink , or about clothing for your body . Is not life more than food , and the body more than its clothing ?
40006026	See the birds of heaven ; they do not put seeds in the earth , they do not get in grain , or put it in store-houses ; and your Father in heaven gives them food . Are you not of much more value than they ?
40006027	And which of you by taking thought is able to make himself a cubit taller ?
40006028	And why are you troubled about clothing ? See the flowers of the field , how they come up ; they do no work , they make no thread :
40006029	But I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not clothed like one of these .
40006030	But if God gives such clothing to the grass of the field , which is here today and tomorrow is put into the oven , will he not much more give you clothing , O you of little faith ?
40006031	Then do not be full of care , saying , What are we to have for food or drink ? or , With what may we be clothed ?
40006032	Because the Gentiles go in search of all these things : for your Father in heaven has knowledge that you have need of all these things :
40006033	But let your first care be for his kingdom and his righteousness ; and all these other things will be given to you in addition .
40006034	Then have no care for tomorrow : tomorrow will take care of itself . Take the trouble of the day as it comes .
40007001	Be not judges of others , and you will not be judged .
40007002	For as you have been judging , so you will be judged , and with your measure will it be measured to you .
40007003	And why do you take note of the grain of dust in your brother's eye , but take no note of the bit of wood which is in your eye ?
40007004	Or how will you say to your brother , Let me take out the grain of dust from your eye , when you yourself have a bit of wood in your eye ?
40007005	You false one , first take out the bit of wood from your eye , then will you see clearly to take out the grain of dust from your brother's eye .
40007006	Do not give that which is holy to the dogs , or put your jewels before pigs , for fear that they will be crushed under foot by the pigs whose attack will then be made against you .
40007007	Make a request , and it will be answered ; what you are searching for you will get ; give the sign , and the door will be open to you :
40007008	Because to everyone who makes a request , it will be given ; and he who is searching will get his desire , and to him who gives the sign , the door will be open .
40007009	Or which of you , if his son makes a request for bread , will give him a stone ?
40007010	Or if he makes a request for a fish , will give him a snake ?
40007011	If you , then , being evil , are able to give good things to your children , how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who make requests to him ?
40007012	All those things , then , which you would have men do to you , even so do you to them : because this is the law and the prophets .
40007013	Go in by the narrow door ; for wide is the door and open is the way which goes to destruction , and great numbers go in by it .
40007014	For narrow is the door and hard the road to life , and only a small number make discovery of it .
40007015	Be on the watch for false prophets , who come to you in sheep's clothing , but inside they are cruel wolves .
40007016	By their fruits you will get knowledge of them . Do men get grapes from thorns or figs from thistles ?
40007017	Even so , every good tree gives good fruit ; but the bad tree gives evil fruit .
40007018	It is not possible for a good tree to give bad fruit , and a bad tree will not give good fruit .
40007019	Every tree which does not give good fruit is cut down and put in the fire .
40007020	So by their fruits you will get knowledge of them .
40007021	Not everyone who says to me , Lord , Lord , will go into the kingdom of heaven ; but he who does the pleasure of my Father in heaven .
40007022	A great number will say to me on that day , Lord , Lord , were we not prophets in your name , and did we not by your name send out evil spirits , and by your name do works of power ?
40007023	And then will I say to them , I never had knowledge of you : go from me , you workers of evil .
40007024	Everyone , then , to whom my words come and who does them , will be like a wise man who made his house on a rock ;
40007025	And the rain came down and there was a rush of waters and the winds were driving against that house , but it was not moved ; because it was based on the rock .
40007026	And everyone to whom my words come and who does them not , will be like a foolish man who made his house on sand ;
40007027	And the rain came down and there was a rush of waters and the winds were driving against that house ; and it came down and great was its fall .
40007028	And it came about , when Jesus had come to the end of these words , that the people were surprised at his teaching ,
40007029	for he was teaching as one having authority , and not as their scribes .
40008001	And when he had come down from the mountain , great numbers of people came after him .
40008002	And a leper came and gave him worship , saying , Lord , if it is your pleasure , you have power to make me clean .
40008003	And he put his hand on him , saying , It is my pleasure ; be clean . And straight away he was made clean .
40008004	And Jesus said to him , See that you say nothing about this to anyone ; but go and let the priest see you and make the offering which was ordered by Moses , for a witness to them .
40008005	And when Jesus was come into Capernaum , a certain captain came to him with a request ,
40008006	Saying , Lord , my servant is ill in bed at the house , with no power in his body , and in great pain .
40008007	And he said to him , I will come and make him well .
40008008	And the captain in answer said , Lord , I am not good enough for you to come under my roof ; but only say the word , and my servant will be made well .
40008009	Because I myself am a man under authority , having under me fighting men ; and I say to this one , Go , and he goes ; and to another , Come , and he comes ; and to my servant , Do this , and he does it .
40008010	And when these words came to the ears of Jesus he was surprised , and said to those who came after him , Truly I say to you , I have not seen such great faith , no , not in Israel .
40008011	And I say to you that numbers will come from the east and the west , and will take their seats with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob , in the kingdom of heaven :
40008012	But the sons of the kingdom will be put out into the dark , and there will be weeping and cries of pain .
40008013	And Jesus said to the captain , Go in peace ; as your faith is , so let it be done to you . And the servant was made well in that hour .
40008014	And when Jesus had come into Peter's house , he saw his wife's mother in bed , very ill .
40008015	And he put his hand on hers and the disease went from her , and she got up and took care of his needs .
40008016	And in the evening , they took to him a number of people who had evil spirits ; and he sent the spirits out of them with a word , and made well all who were ill ;
40008017	So that the word of Isaiah the prophet might come true : He himself took our pains and our diseases .
40008018	Now when Jesus saw a great mass of people about him , he gave an order to go to the other side .
40008019	And there came a scribe and said to him , Master , I will come after you wherever you go .
40008020	And Jesus said to him , The foxes have holes , and the birds of heaven have a resting-place ; but the Son of man has nowhere to put his head .
40008021	And another of the disciples said to him , Lord , let me first go and give the last honours to my father .
40008022	But Jesus said to him , Come after me ; and let the dead take care of their dead .
40008023	And when he had got into a boat , his disciples went after him .
40008024	And there came up a great storm in the sea , so that the boat was covered with the waves : but he was sleeping .
40008025	And they came to him , and , awaking him , said , Help , Lord ; destruction is near .
40008026	And he said to them , Why are you full of fear , O you of little faith ? Then he got up and gave orders to the winds and the sea ; and there was a great calm .
40008027	And the men were full of wonder , saying , What sort of man is this , that even the winds and the sea do his orders ?
40008028	And when he had come to the other side , to the country of the Gadarenes , there came out to him from the place of the dead , two who had evil spirits , so violent that no man was able to go that way .
40008029	And they gave a loud cry , saying , What have we to do with you , you Son of God ? Have you come here to give us punishment before the time ?
40008030	Now there was , some distance away , a great herd of pigs taking their food .
40008031	And the evil spirits made strong prayers to him , saying , If you send us out , let us go into the herd of pigs .
40008032	And he said to them , Go . And they came out , and went into the pigs ; and the herd went rushing down a sharp slope into the sea and came to their end in the water .
40008033	And their keepers went in flight to the town and gave an account of everything , and of the men who had the evil spirits .
40008034	And all the town came out to Jesus ; and seeing him they made request that he would go away from their part of the country .
40009001	And he got into a boat and went across and came to his town .
40009002	And they took to him a man stretched on a bed who had no power of moving ; and Jesus , seeing their faith , said to the man who was ill , Son , take heart ; you have forgiveness for your sins .
40009003	And some of the scribes said among themselves , This man has no respect for God .
40009004	And Jesus , having knowledge of what was in their minds , said , Why are your thoughts evil ?
40009005	For which is the simpler , to say , You have forgiveness for your sins ; or to say , Get up and go ?
40009006	But so that you may see that on earth the Son of man has authority for the forgiveness of sins , ( then said he to the man who was ill , ) Get up , and take up your bed , and go to your house .
40009007	And he got up and went away to his house .
40009008	But when the people saw it they were full of fear , and gave glory to God who had given such authority to men .
40009009	And when Jesus was going from there , he saw a man whose name was Matthew , seated at the place where taxes were taken ; and he said to him , Come after me . And he got up and went after him .
40009010	And it came about , when he was in the house taking food , that a number of tax-farmers and sinners came and took their places with Jesus and his disciples .
40009011	And when the Pharisees saw it , they said to his disciples , Why does your Master take food with tax-farmers and sinners ?
40009012	But on hearing this he said , Those who are well have no need of a medical man , but those who are ill .
40009013	But go and take to heart the sense of these words , My desire is for mercy , not offerings : for I have come not to get the upright , but sinners .
40009014	Then the disciples of John came to him , saying , Why do we and the Pharisees frequently go without food , but your disciples do not ?
40009015	And Jesus said to them , Will the friends of the newly-married man be sad as long as he is with them ? But the days will come when he will be taken away from them , and then will they go without food .
40009016	And no man puts a bit of new cloth on an old coat , for by pulling away from the old , it makes a worse hole .
40009017	And men do not put new wine into old wine-skins ; or the skins will be burst and the wine will come out , and the skins are of no more use : but they put new wine into new wine-skins , and so the two will be safe .
40009018	While he was saying these things to them , there came a ruler and gave him worship , saying , My daughter is even now dead ; but come and put your hand on her , and she will come back to life .
40009019	And Jesus got up and went after him , and so did his disciples .
40009020	And a woman , who for twelve years had had a flow of blood , came after him , and put her hand on the edge of his robe :
40009021	Because , she said to herself , if I may but put my hand on his robe , I will be made well .
40009022	But Jesus , turning and seeing her , said , Daughter , take heart ; your faith has made you well . And the woman was made well from that hour .
40009023	And when Jesus came into the ruler's house and saw the players with their instruments and the people making a noise ,
40009024	He said , Make room ; for the girl is not dead , but sleeping . And they were laughing at him .
40009025	But when the people were sent out , he went in and took her by the hand ; and the girl got up .
40009026	And the news of it went out into all that land .
40009027	And when Jesus went on from there , two blind men came after him , crying out , Have mercy on us , you Son of David .
40009028	And when he had come into the house , the blind men came to him ; and Jesus said to them , Have you faith that I am able to do this ? They said to him , Yes , Lord .
40009029	Then he put his hand on their eyes , saying , As your faith is , let it be done to you .
40009030	And their eyes were made open . And Jesus said to them sharply , Let no man have knowledge of it .
40009031	But they went out and gave news of him in all that land .
40009032	And while they were going away , there came to him a man without the power of talking , and with an evil spirit .
40009033	And when the evil spirit had been sent out , the man had the power of talking : and they were all surprised , saying , Such a thing has never been seen in Israel .
40009034	But the Pharisees said , By the ruler of evil spirits , he sends evil spirits out of men .
40009035	And Jesus went about all the towns and small places , teaching in their Synagogues and preaching the good news of the kingdom and making well all sorts of disease and pain .
40009036	But when he saw all the people he was moved with pity for them , because they were troubled and wandering like sheep without a keeper .
40009037	Then he said to his disciples , There is much grain but not enough men to get it in .
40009038	Make prayer , then , to the Lord of the grain-fields , that he may send out workers to get in his grain .
40010001	And he got together his twelve disciples and gave them the power of driving out unclean spirits , and of making well all sorts of disease and pain .
40010002	Now the names of the twelve are these : The first , Simon , who is named Peter , and Andrew , his brother ; James , the son of Zebedee , and John , his brother ;
40010003	Philip and Bartholomew ; Thomas and Matthew , the tax-farmer ; James , the son of Alphaeus , and Thaddaeus ;
40010004	Simon the Zealot , and Judas Iscariot , who was false to him .
40010005	These twelve Jesus sent out and gave them orders , saying , Do not go among the Gentiles , or into any town of Samaria ,
40010006	But go to the wandering sheep of the house of Israel ,
40010007	And , on your way , say , The kingdom of heaven is near .
40010008	Make well those who are ill , give life to the dead , make lepers clean , send evil spirits out of men ; freely it has been given to you , freely give .
40010009	Take no gold or silver or copper in your pockets ;
40010010	Take no bag for your journey and do not take two coats or shoes or a stick : for the workman has a right to his food .
40010011	And into whatever town or small place you go , make search there for someone who is respected , and make his house your resting-place till you go away .
40010012	And when you go in , say , May peace be on this house .
40010013	And if the house is good enough , let your peace come on it : but if not , let your peace come back to you .
40010014	And whoever will not take you in , or give ear to your words , when you go out from that house or that town , put off its dust from your feet .
40010015	Truly I say to you , It will be better for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of God's judging than for that town .
40010016	See , I send you out as sheep among wolves . Be then as wise as snakes , and as gentle as doves .
40010017	But be on the watch against men : for they will give you up to the Sanhedrins , and in their Synagogues they will give you blows ;
40010018	And you will come before rulers and kings because of me , for a witness to them and to the Gentiles .
40010019	But when you are given up into their hands , do not be troubled about what to say or how to say it : for in that hour what you are to say will be given to you ;
40010020	Because it is not you who say the words , but the Spirit of your Father in you .
40010021	And brother will give up brother to death , and the father his child : and children will go against their fathers and mothers , and put them to death .
40010022	And you will be hated by all men because of my name : but he who is strong to the end will have salvation .
40010023	But when they are cruel to you in one town , go in flight to another : for truly , I say to you , You will not have gone through the towns of Israel before the Son of man comes .
40010024	A disciple is not greater than his master , or a servant than his lord .
40010025	It is enough for the disciple that he may be as his master , and the servant as his lord . If they have given the name Beelzebub to the master of the house , how much more to those of his house !
40010026	Have , then , no fear of them : because nothing is covered which will not come to light , or secret which will not be made clear .
40010027	What I say to you in the dark , say in the light : and what comes to your ear secretly , say publicly from the house-tops .
40010028	And have no fear of those who put to death the body , but are not able to put to death the soul . But have fear of him who has power to give soul and body to destruction in hell .
40010029	Are not sparrows two a farthing ? and not one of them comes to an end without your Father :
40010030	But the hairs of your head are all numbered .
40010031	Then have no fear ; you are of more value than a flock of sparrows .
40010032	To everyone , then , who gives witness to me before men , I will give witness before my Father in heaven .
40010033	But if anyone says before men that he has no knowledge of me , I will say that I have no knowledge of him before my Father in heaven .
40010034	Do not have the thought that I have come to send peace on the earth ; I came not to send peace but a sword .
40010035	For I have come to put a man against his father , and the daughter against her mother , and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law :
40010036	And a man will be hated by those of his house .
40010037	He who has more love for his father or mother than for me is not good enough for me ; he who has more love for son or daughter than for me is not good enough for me .
40010038	And he who does not take his cross and come after me is not good enough for me .
40010039	He who has the desire to keep his life will have it taken from him , and he who gives up his life because of me will have it given back to him .
40010040	He who gives honour to you gives honour to me ; and he who gives honour to me gives honour to him who sent me .
40010041	He who gives honour to a prophet , in the name of a prophet , will be given a prophet's reward ; and he who gives honour to an upright man , in the name of an upright man , will be given an upright man's reward .
40010042	And whoever gives to one of these little ones a cup of cold water only , in the name of a disciple , truly I say to you , he will not go without his reward .
40011001	And it came about that when Jesus had come to the end of giving these orders to his twelve disciples , he went away from there , teaching and preaching in their towns .
40011002	Now when John had news in prison of the works of the Christ , he sent his disciples

40011011	Truly I say to you , Among the sons of women there has not been a greater than John the Baptist : but he who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he .

40011013	For all the prophets and the law were in force till John .
40011014	And if you are able to see it , this is Elijah who was to come .
40011015	He who has ears , let him give ear .
40011016	But what comparison may I make of this generation ? It is like children seated in the market-places , crying out to one another ,
40011017	We made music for you and you did not take part in the dance ; we gave cries of sorrow and you made no signs of grief .
40011018	For John came , taking no food or drink , and they say , He has an evil spirit .
40011019	The Son of man has come feasting , and they say , See , a lover of food and wine , a friend of tax-farmers and sinners ! And wisdom is judged to be right by her works .
40011020	Then he went on to say hard things to the towns where most of his works of power were done , because they had not been turned from their sins .
40011021	Unhappy are you , Chorazin ! Unhappy are you , Beth-saida ! For if the works of power which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon , they would have been turned from their sins in days gone by , clothing themselves in haircloth and putting dust on their heads .
40011022	But I say to you , It will be better for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judging , than for you .
40011023	And you , Capernaum , were you not to be lifted up to heaven ? you will go down into hell : for if the works of power which were done in you had been done in Sodom , it would have been here to this day .
40011024	But I say to you that it will be better for the land of Sodom in the day of judging , than for you .
40011025	At that time Jesus made answer and said , I give praise to you , O Father , Lord of heaven and earth , because you have kept these things secret from the wise and the men of learning , and have made them clear to little children .
40011026	Yes , Father , for so it was pleasing in your eyes .
40011027	All things have been given to me by my Father ; and no one has knowledge of the Son , but the Father ; and no one has knowledge of the Father , but the Son , and he to whom the Son will make it clear .
40011028	Come to me , all you who are troubled and weighted down with care , and I will give you rest .
