40011030	For my yoke is good , and the weight I take up is not hard .
40012001	At that time Jesus went through the fields on the Sabbath day ; and his disciples , being in need of food , were taking the heads of grain .
40012002	But the Pharisees , when they saw it , said to him , See , your disciples do that which it is not right to do on the Sabbath .
40012003	But he said to them , Have you no knowledge of what David did when he had need of food , and those who were with him ?
40012004	How he went into the house of God and took for food the holy bread which it was not right for him or for those who were with him to take , but only for the priests ?
40012005	Or is it not said in the law , how the Sabbath is broken by the priests in the Temple and they do no wrong ?
40012006	But I say to you that a greater thing than the Temple is here .
40012007	But if these words had been in your minds , My desire is for mercy and not for offerings , you would not have been judging those who have done no wrong .
40012008	For the Son of man is lord of the Sabbath .
40012009	And he went from there into their Synagogue :
40012010	And there was a man with a dead hand . And they put a question to him , saying , Is it right to make a man well on the Sabbath day ? so that they might have something against him .
40012011	And he said to them , Which of you , having a sheep , if it gets into a hole on the Sabbath day , will not put out a helping hand and get it back ?
40012012	Of how much more value is a man than a sheep ! For this reason it is right to do good on the Sabbath day .
40012013	Then said he to the man , Put out your hand . And he put it out , and it was made as well as the other .
40012014	But the Pharisees went out and made designs against him , how they might put him to death .
40012015	And Jesus , having knowledge of this , went away from there , and a great number went after him ; and he made them all well ,
40012016	Ordering them not to give people word of him :
40012017	So that what was said by Isaiah the prophet might come true ,
40012018	See my servant , the man of my selection , my loved one in whom my soul is well pleased : I will put my Spirit on him , and he will make my decision clear to the Gentiles .
40012019	His coming will not be with fighting or loud cries ; and his voice will not be lifted up in the streets .
40012020	The crushed stem will not be broken by him ; and the feebly burning light will he not put out , till he has made righteousness overcome all .
40012021	And in his name will the Gentiles put their hope .
40012022	Then they took to him one with an evil spirit , who was blind and had no power of talking : and he made him well so that he had the power of talking and seeing .
40012023	And all the people were surprised and said , Is not this the Son of David ?
40012024	But the Pharisees , hearing of it , said , This man only sends evil spirits out of men by Beelzebub , the ruler of evil spirits .
40012025	And having knowledge of their thoughts he said to them , Every kingdom having division in itself is made waste , and every town or house having division in itself will come to destruction .
40012026	And if Satan sends out Satan , he makes war against himself ; how then will he keep his kingdom ?
40012027	And if I by Beelzebub send evil spirits out of men , by whom do your sons send them out ? So let them be your judges .
40012028	But if I by the Spirit of God send out evil spirits , then is the kingdom of God come on you .
40012029	Or how may one go into a strong man's house and take his goods , if he does not first put cords round the strong man ? and then he may take his goods .
40012030	Whoever is not with me is against me ; and he who does not take part with me in getting people together , is driving them away .
40012031	So I say to you , Every sin and every evil word against God will have forgiveness ; but for evil words against the Spirit there will be no forgiveness .
40012032	And whoever says a word against the Son of man , will have forgiveness ; but whoever says a word against the Holy Spirit , will not have forgiveness in this life or in that which is to come .
40012033	Make the tree good , and its fruit good ; or make the tree bad , and its fruit bad ; for by its fruit you will get knowledge of the tree .
40012034	You offspring of snakes , how are you , being evil , able to say good things ? because out of the heart's store come the words of the mouth .
40012035	The good man out of his good store gives good things ; and the evil man out of his evil store gives evil things .
40012036	And I say to you that in the day when they are judged , men will have to give an account of every foolish word they have said .
40012037	For by your words will your righteousness be seen , and by your words you will be judged .
40012038	Then some of the scribes and Pharisees , hearing this , said to him , Master , we are looking for a sign from you .
40012039	But he , answering , said to them , An evil and false generation is looking for a sign ; and no sign will be given to it but the sign of the prophet Jonah :
40012040	For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the stomach of the great fish , so will the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth .
40012041	The men of Nineveh will come up in the day of judging and give their decision against this generation : because they were turned from their sins at the preaching of Jonah ; and now a greater than Jonah is here .
40012042	The queen of the South will come up in the day of judging and give her decision against this generation : for she came from the ends of the earth to give ear to the wisdom of Solomon ; and now a greater than Solomon is here .
40012043	But the unclean spirit , when he is gone out of a man , goes through dry places looking for rest , and getting it not .
40012044	Then he says , I will go back into my house from which I came out ; and when he comes , he sees that there is no one in it , but that it has been made fair and clean .
40012045	Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits worse than himself , and they go in and make it their living-place : and the last condition of that man is worse than the first . Even so will it be with this evil generation .
40012046	While he was still talking to the people , his mother and his brothers came , desiring to have talk with him .
40012047	And one said to him , See , your mother and your brothers are outside , desiring to have talk with you .
40012048	But he in answer said to him who gave the news , Who is my mother and who are my brothers ?
40012049	And he put out his hand to his disciples and said , See , my mother and my brothers !
40012050	For whoever does the pleasure of my Father in heaven , he is my brother , and sister , and mother .
40013001	On that day Jesus went out of the house and was seated by the seaside .
40013002	And great numbers of people came together to him , so that he got into a boat ; and the people took up their position by the sea .
40013003	And he gave them teaching in the form of a story , saying , A man went out to put seed in the earth ;
40013004	And while he did so , some seeds were dropped by the wayside , and the birds came and took them for food :
40013005	And some of the seed went among the stones , where it had not much earth , and straight away it came up because the earth was not deep :
40013006	And when the sun was high , it was burned ; and because it had no root it became dry and dead .
40013007	And some seeds went among thorns , and the thorns came up and they had no room for growth :
40013008	And some , falling on good earth , gave fruit , some a hundred , some sixty , some thirty times as much .
40013009	He who has ears , let him give ear .
40013010	And the disciples came and said to him , Why do you say things to them in the form of stories ?
40013011	And he said to them in answer , To you is given the knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of heaven , but to them it is not given .
40013012	Because whoever has , to him will be given , and he will have more ; but from him who has not , even what he has will be taken away .
40013013	For this reason I put things into the form of stories ; because they see without seeing , and give ear without hearing , and the sense is not clear to them .
40013014	And for them the words of Isaiah have come true , Though you give ear , you will not get knowledge ; and seeing , you will see , but the sense will not be clear to you :
40013015	For the heart of this people has become fat and their ears are slow in hearing and their eyes are shut ; for fear that they might see with their eyes and give hearing with their ears and become wise in their hearts and be turned again to me , so that I might make them well .
40013016	But a blessing be on your eyes , because they see ; and on your ears , because they are open .
40013017	For truly , I say to you that prophets and upright men had a desire to see the things which you see , and saw them not ; and to have knowledge of the words which have come to your ears , and they had it not .
40013018	Give ear , then , to the story of the man who put the seed in the earth .
40013019	When the word of the kingdom comes to anyone , and the sense of it is not clear to him , then the Evil One comes , and quickly takes away that which was put in his heart . He is the seed dropped by the wayside .
40013020	And that which went on the stones , this is he who , hearing the word , straight away takes it with joy ;
40013021	But having no root in himself , he goes on for a time ; and when trouble comes or pain , because of the word , he quickly becomes full of doubts .
40013022	And that which was dropped among the thorns , this is he who has the word ; and the cares of this life , and the deceits of wealth , put a stop to the growth of the word and it gives no fruit .
40013023	And the seed which was put in good earth , this is he who gives ear to the word , and gets the sense of it ; who gives fruit , some a hundred , some sixty , some thirty times as much .
40013024	And he gave them another story , saying , The kingdom of heaven is like a man who put good seed in his field :
40013025	But while men were sleeping , one who had hate for him came and put evil seeds among the grain , and went away .
40013026	But when the green stem came up and gave fruit , the evil plants were seen at the same time .
40013027	And the servants of the master of the house came and said to him , Sir , did you not put good seed in your field ? how then has it evil plants ?
40013028	And he said , Someone has done this in hate . And the servants say to him , Is it your pleasure that we go and take them up ?
40013029	But he says , No , for fear that by chance while you take up the evil plants , you may be rooting up the grain with them .
40013030	Let them come up together till the getting in of the grain ; and then I will say to the workers , Take up first the evil plants , and put them together for burning : but put the grain into my store-house .
40013031	He put another story before them , saying , The kingdom of heaven is like a grain of mustard seed which a man took and put in his field :
40013032	Which is smaller than all seeds ; but when it has come up it is greater than the plants , and becomes a tree , so that the birds of heaven come and make their resting-places in its branches .
40013033	Another story he gave to them : The kingdom of heaven is like leaven , which a woman took , and put in three measures of meal , till it was all leavened .
40013034	All these things Jesus said to the people in the form of stories ; and without a story he said nothing to them :
40013035	That it might come true which was said by the prophet , Opening my mouth , I will give out stories ; I will give knowledge of things kept secret from before all time .
40013036	Then he went away from the people , and went into the house ; and his disciples came to him , saying , Make clear to us the story of the evil plants in the field .
40013037	And he made answer and said , He who puts the good seed in the earth is the Son of man ;
40013038	And the field is the world ; and the good seed is the sons of the kingdom ; and the evil seeds are the sons of the Evil One ;
40013039	And he who put them in the earth is Satan ; and the getting in of the grain is the end of the world ; and those who get it in are the angels .
40013040	As then the evil plants are got together and burned with fire , so will it be in the end of the world .
40013041	The Son of man will send out his angels , and they will take out of his kingdom everything which is a cause of error , and all those who do wrong ,
40013042	And will put them into the fire ; there will be weeping and cries of sorrow .
40013043	Then will the upright be shining as the sun in the kingdom of their Father . He who has ears , let him give ear .
40013044	The kingdom of heaven is like a secret store of wealth in a field , which a man came across and put back again ; and in his joy he goes and gives all he has , to get that field .
40013045	Again , the kingdom of heaven is like a trader searching for beautiful jewels .
40013046	And having come across one jewel of great price , he went and gave all he had in exchange for it .
40013047	Again , the kingdom of heaven is like a net , which was put into the sea and took in every sort of fish :
40013048	When it was full , they took it up on the sands ; and seated there they put the good into vessels , but the bad they put away .
40013049	So will it be in the end of the world : the angels will come and take out the bad from the good ,
40013050	And will put them into the fire : there will be weeping and cries of sorrow .
40013051	Are all these things now clear to you ? They say to him , Yes .
40013052	And he said to them , For this reason every scribe who has become a disciple of the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house , who gives out from his store things new and old .
40013053	And when Jesus had come to the end of these stories he went away from there .
40013054	And coming into his country , he gave them teaching in their Synagogue , so that they were greatly surprised and said , Where did this man get this wisdom and these works of power ?
40013055	Is not this the woodworker's son ? is not his mother named Mary ? and his brothers James and Joseph and Simon and Judas ?
40013056	And his sisters , are they not all with us ? from where , then , has he all these things ?
40013057	And they were bitter against him . But Jesus said to them , A prophet is nowhere without honour but in his country and among his family .
40013058	And the works of power which he did there were small in number because they had no faith .
40014001	At that time news of Jesus came to Herod the king ;
40014002	And he said to his servants , This is John the Baptist ; he has come back from the dead , and so these powers are working in him .
40014003	For Herod had taken John and put him in prison because of Herodias , his brother Philip's wife .
40014004	Because John had said to him , It is not right for you to have her .
40014005	And he would have put him to death , but for his fear of the people , because in their eyes John was a prophet .
40014006	But when Herod's birthday came , the daughter of Herodias was dancing before them , and Herod was pleased with her .
40014007	So he gave her his word with an oath to let her have whatever she might make request for .
40014008	And she , at her mother's suggestion , said , Give me here on a plate the head of John the Baptist .
40014009	And the king was sad ; but because of his oaths and because of his guests , he gave the order for it to be given to her ;
40014010	And he sent and had John's head cut off in the prison .
40014011	And his head was put on a plate and given to the girl ; and she took it to her mother .
40014012	And his disciples came , and took up his body and put it in the earth ; and they went and gave Jesus news of what had taken place .
40014013	Now when it came to the ears of Jesus , he went away from there in a boat , to a waste place by himself : and the people hearing of it , went after him on foot from the towns .
40014014	And he came out and saw a great number of people and he had pity on them , and made well those of them who were ill .
40014015	And when evening had come , the disciples came to him , saying , This place is waste land , and the time is now past ; send the people away so that they may go into the towns and get themselves food .
40014016	But Jesus said to them , There is no need for them to go away ; give them food yourselves .
40014017	And they say to him , We have here but five cakes of bread and two fishes .
40014018	And he said , Give them to me .
40014019	And he gave orders for the people to be seated on the grass ; and he took the five cakes of bread and the two fishes and , looking up to heaven , he said words of blessing , and made division of the food , and gave it to the disciples , and the disciples gave it to the people .
40014020	And they all took of the food and had enough : and they took up twelve baskets full of broken bits which were not used .
40014021	And those who had food were about five thousand men , in addition to women and children .
40014022	And straight away he made the disciples get into the boat and go before him to the other side , till he had sent the people away .
40014023	And after he had sent the people away , he went up into the mountain by himself for prayer : and when evening was come , he was there by himself .
40014024	But the boat was now in the middle of the sea , and was troubled by the waves : for the wind was against them .
40014025	And in the fourth watch of the night he came to them , walking on the sea .
40014026	And when they saw him walking on the sea , they were troubled , saying , It is a spirit ; and they gave cries of fear .
40014027	But straight away Jesus said to them , Take heart ; it is I , have no fear .
40014028	And Peter , answering , said to him , Lord , if it is you , give me the order to come to you on the water .
40014029	And he said , Come . And Peter got out of the boat , and walking on the water , went to Jesus .
40014030	But when he saw the wind he was in fear and , starting to go down , he gave a cry , saying , Help , Lord .
40014031	And straight away Jesus put out his hand and took a grip of him , and said to him , O man of little faith , why were you in doubt ?
40014032	And when they had got into the boat , the wind went down .
40014033	And those who were in the boat gave him worship , saying , Truly you are the Son of God .
40014034	And when they had gone across , they came to land at Gennesaret .
40014035	And when the men of that place had news of him , they sent into all the country round about , and took to him all who were ill ,
40014036	With the request that they might only put their hands on the edge of his robe : and all those who did so were made well .
40015001	Then there came to Jesus from Jerusalem Pharisees and scribes , saying ,
40015002	Why do your disciples go against the teaching of the fathers ? for they take food with unwashed hands .
40015003	And in answer he said to them , Why do you , yourselves , go against the word of God on account of the teaching which has been handed down to you ?
40015004	For God said , Give honour to your father and mother : and , He who says evil of father or mother will be put to death .
40015005	But you say , If a man says to his father or his mother , That by which you might have had profit from me is given to God ;
40015006	There is no need for him to give honour to his father . And you have made the word of God without effect because of your teaching .
40015007	You false ones , well did Isaiah say of you ,
40015008	These people give me honour with their lips , but their heart is far from me .
40015009	But their worship is to no purpose , while they give as their teaching the rules of men .
40015010	And he got the people together and said to them , Give ear , and let my words be clear to you :
40015011	Not that which goes into the mouth makes a man unclean , but that which comes out of the mouth .
40015012	Then the disciples came and said to him , Did you see that the Pharisees were troubled when these words came to their ears ?
40015013	But he said in answer , Every plant which my Father in heaven has not put in the earth , will be taken up by the roots .
40015014	Let them be : they are blind guides . And if a blind man is guiding a blind man , the two will go falling into a hole together .
40015015	Then Peter said to him , Make the story clear to us .
40015016	And he said , Are you , like them , still without wisdom ?
40015017	Do you not see that whatever goes into the mouth goes on into the stomach , and is sent out as waste ?
40015018	But the things which come out of the mouth come from the heart ; and they make a man unclean .
40015019	For out of the heart come evil thoughts , the taking of life , broken faith between the married , unclean desires of the flesh , taking of property , false witness , bitter words :
40015020	These are the things which make a man unclean ; but to take food with unwashed hands does not make a man unclean .
40015021	And Jesus went away from there into the country of Tyre and Sidon .
40015022	And a woman of Canaan came out from those parts , crying and saying , Have pity on me , O Lord , Son of David ; my daughter is greatly troubled with an unclean spirit .
40015023	But he gave her no answer . And his disciples came and said to him , Send her away , for she is crying after us .
40015024	But he made answer and said , I was sent only to the wandering sheep of the house of Israel .
40015025	But she came and gave him worship , saying , Help , Lord .
40015026	And he made answer and said , It is not right to take the children's bread and give it to the dogs .
40015027	But she said , Yes , Lord : but even the dogs take the bits from under their masters ' table .
40015028	Then Jesus , answering , said to her , O woman , great is your faith : let your desire be done . And her daughter was made well from that hour .
40015029	And Jesus went from there and came to the sea of Galilee ; and he went up into the mountain , and took his seat there .
40015030	And there came to him great numbers of people having with them those who were broken in body , or blind , or without voice , or wounded , or ill in any way , and a number of others ; they put them down at his feet and he made them well :
40015031	So that the people were full of wonder when they saw that those who had no voice were talking , the feeble were made strong , those whose bodies were broken had the power of walking , and the blind were able to see : and they gave glory to the God of Israel .
40015032	And Jesus got his disciples together and said , I have pity for the people , because they have now been with me three days and have no food : and I will not send them away without food , or they will have no strength for the journey .
40015033	And the disciples say to him , How may we get enough bread in a waste place , to give food to such a number of people ?
40015034	And Jesus says to them , How much bread have you ? And they said , Seven cakes , and some small fishes .
40015035	Then he gave an order to the people to be seated on the earth ,
40015036	And he took the seven cakes of bread and the fishes ; and having given praise , he gave the broken bread to the disciples , and the disciples gave it to the people .
40015037	And they all took food , and had enough ; and they took up of the broken bits , seven baskets full .
40015038	And there were four thousand men who took food , together with women and children .
40015039	And when he had sent the people away , he got into the boat , and came into the country of Magadan .
40016001	And the Pharisees and Sadducees came and , testing him , made a request to him to give them a sign from heaven .
40016002	But in answer he said to them , At nightfall you say , The weather will be good , for the sky is red .
40016003	And in the morning , The weather will be bad today , for the sky is red and angry . You are able to see the face of heaven , but not the signs of the times .
40016004	An evil and false generation is searching after a sign ; and no sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah . And he went away from them .
40016005	And when the disciples came to the other side they had not taken thought to get bread .
40016006	And Jesus said to them , Take care to have nothing to do with the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees .
40016007	And they were reasoning among themselves , saying , We took no bread .
40016008	And Jesus , seeing it , said , O you of little faith , why are you reasoning among yourselves , because you have no bread ?
40016009	Do you still not see , or keep in mind the five cakes of bread of the five thousand , and the number of baskets you took up ?
40016010	Or the seven cakes of bread of the four thousand , and the number of baskets you took up ?
40016011	How is it that you do not see that I was not talking to you about bread , but about keeping away from the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees ?
40016012	Then they saw that it was not the leaven of bread which he had in mind , but the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees .
40016013	Now when Jesus had come into the parts of Caesarea Philippi , he said , questioning his disciples , Who do men say that the Son of man is ?
40016014	And they said , Some say , John the Baptist ; some , Elijah ; and others , Jeremiah , or one of the prophets .
40016015	He says to them , But who do you say that I am ?
40016016	And Simon Peter made answer and said , You are the Christ , the Son of the living God .
40016017	And Jesus made answer and said to him , A blessing on you , Simon Bar-jonah : because this knowledge has not come to you from flesh and blood , but from my Father in heaven .
40016018	And I say to you that you are Peter , and on this rock will my church be based , and the doors of hell will not overcome it .
40016019	I will give to you the keys of the kingdom of heaven : and whatever is fixed by you on earth will be fixed in heaven : and whatever you make free on earth will be made free in heaven .
40016020	Then he gave orders to the disciples to give no man word that he was the Christ .
40016021	From that time Jesus went on to make clear to his disciples how he would have to go up to Jerusalem , and undergo much at the hands of those in authority and the chief priests and scribes , and be put to death , and the third day come again from the dead .
40016022	And Peter , protesting , said to him , Be it far from you , Lord ; it is impossible that this will come about .
40016023	But he , turning to Peter , said , Get out of my way , Satan : you are a danger to me because your mind is not on the things of God , but on the things of men .
40016024	Then Jesus said to his disciples , If any man would come after me , let him give up all , and take up his cross , and come after me .
40016025	Because whoever has a desire to keep his life safe will have it taken from him ; but whoever gives up his life because of me , will have it given back to him .
40016026	For what profit has a man , if he gets all the world with the loss of his life ? or what will a man give in exchange for his life ?
40016027	For the Son of man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels ; and then he will give to every man the reward of his works .
40016028	Truly I say to you , There are some of those here who will not have a taste of death , till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom .
40017001	And after six days Jesus takes with him Peter , and James , and John , his brother , and makes them go up with him into a high mountain by themselves .
40017002	And he was changed in form before them ; and his face was shining like the sun , and his clothing became white as light .
40017003	And Moses and Elijah came before their eyes , talking with him .
40017004	And Peter made answer and said to Jesus , Lord , it is good for us to be here : if you will let me , I will make here three tents , one for you , and one for Moses , and one for Elijah .
40017005	While he was still talking , a bright cloud came over them : and a voice out of the cloud , saying , This is my dearly loved Son , with whom I am well pleased ; give ear to him .
40017006	And at these words the disciples went down on their faces in great fear .
40017007	And Jesus came and put his hand on them and said , Get up and have no fear .
40017008	And lifting up their eyes , they saw no one , but Jesus only .
40017009	And when they were coming down from the mountain , Jesus gave them orders , saying , Let no man have word of what you have seen , till the Son of man has come again from the dead .
40017010	And his disciples , questioning him , said , Why then do the scribes say that Elijah has to come first ?
40017011	And in answer he said , Elijah truly has to come and put all things right :
40017012	But I say to you that Elijah has come , and they had no knowledge of him , but did to him whatever they were pleased to do ; the same will the Son of man undergo at their hands .
40017013	Then the disciples saw that he was talking to them of John the Baptist .
40017014	And when they came to the people , a man went down on his knees to him , saying ,
40017015	Lord have mercy on my son : for he is off his head , and is in great pain ; and frequently he goes falling into the fire , and frequently into the water .
40017016	And I took him to your disciples , and they were not able to make him well .
40017017	And Jesus , answering , said , O false and foolish generation , how long will I be with you ? how long will I put up with you ? let him come here to me .
40017018	And Jesus gave orders to the unclean spirit , and it went out of him : and the boy was made well from that hour .
40017019	Then the disciples came to Jesus privately , and said , Why were we not able to send it out ?
40017020	And he says to them , Because of your little faith : for truly I say to you , If you have faith as a grain of mustard seed , you will say to this mountain , Be moved from this place to that ; and it will be moved ; and nothing will be impossible to you .
40017022	And while they were going about in Galilee , Jesus said to them , The Son of man will be given up into the hands of men ;
40017023	And they will put him to death , and the third day he will come again from the dead . And they were very sad .
40017024	And when they had come to Capernaum , those who took the Temple tax came to Peter and said , Does not your master make payment of the Temple tax ?
40017025	He says , Yes . And when he came into the house , Jesus said to him , What is your opinion , Simon ? from whom do the kings of the earth get payment or tax ? from their sons or from other people ?
40017026	And when he said , From other people , Jesus said to him , Then are the sons free .
40017027	But , so that we may not be a cause of trouble to them , go to the sea , and let down a hook , and take the first fish which comes up ; and in his mouth you will see a bit of money : take that , and give it to them for me and you .
40018001	In that hour the disciples came to Jesus , saying , Who is greatest in the kingdom of heaven ?
40018002	And he took a little child , and put him in the middle of them ,
40018003	And said , Truly , I say to you , If you do not have a change of heart and become like little children , you will not go into the kingdom of heaven .
40018004	Whoever , then , will make himself as low as this little child , the same is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven .
40018005	And whoever gives honour to one such little child in my name , gives honour to me :
40018006	But whoever is a cause of trouble to one of these little ones who have faith in me , it would be better for him to have a great stone fixed to his neck , and to come to his end in the deep sea .
40018007	A curse is on the earth because of trouble ! for it is necessary for trouble to come ; but unhappy is that man through whom the trouble comes .
40018008	And if your hand or your foot is a cause of trouble , let it be cut off and put it away from you : it is better for you to go into life with the loss of a hand or a foot than , having two hands or two feet , to go into the eternal fire .
40018009	And if your eye is a cause of trouble to you , take it out , and put it away from you : it is better for you to go into life with one eye than , having two eyes , to go into the hell of fire .
40018010	Let it not seem to you that one of these little ones is of no value ; for I say to you that in heaven their angels see at all times the face of my Father in heaven .
40018012	What would you say now ? if a man has a hundred sheep , and one of them has gone wandering away , will he not let the ninety-nine be , and go to the mountains in search of the wandering one ?
40018013	And if he comes across it , truly I say to you , he has more joy over it than over the ninety-nine which have not gone out of the way .
40018014	Even so it is not the pleasure of your Father in heaven for one of these little ones to come to destruction .
40018015	And if your brother does wrong to you , go , make clear to him his error between you and him in private : if he gives ear to you , you have got your brother back again .
40018016	But if he will not give ear to you , take with you one or two more , that by the lips of two or three witnesses every word may be made certain .
40018017	And if he will not give ear to them , let it come to the hearing of the church : and if he will not give ear to the church , let him be to you as a Gentile and a tax-farmer .
40018018	Truly I say to you , Whatever things are fixed by you on earth will be fixed in heaven : and whatever you make free on earth will be made free in heaven .
40018019	Again , I say to you , that if two of you are in agreement on earth about anything for which they will make a request , it will be done for them by my Father in heaven .
40018020	For where two or three are come together in my name , there am I among them .
40018021	Then Peter came and said to him , Lord , what number of times may my brother do wrong against me , and I give him forgiveness ? till seven times ?
40018022	Jesus says to him , I say not to you , Till seven times ; but , Till seventy times seven .
40018023	For this reason the kingdom of heaven is like a king , who went over his accounts with his servants .
40018024	And at the start , one came to him who was in his debt for ten thousand talents .
40018025	And because he was not able to make payment , his lord gave orders for him , and his wife , and his sons and daughters , and all he had , to be given for money , and payment to be made .
40018026	So the servant went down on his face and gave him worship , saying , Lord , give me time to make payment and I will give you all .
40018027	And the lord of that servant , being moved with pity , let him go , and made him free of the debt .
40018028	But that servant went out , and meeting one of the other servants , who was in debt to him for one hundred pence , he took him by the throat , saying , Make payment of your debt .
40018029	So that servant went down on his face , requesting him and saying , Give me time and I will make payment to you .
40018030	And he would not : but went and put him into prison till he had made payment of the debt .
40018031	So when the other servants saw what was done they were very sad , and came and gave word to their lord of what had been done .
40018032	Then his lord sent for him and said , You evil servant ; I made you free of all that debt , because of your request to me :
40018033	Was it not right for you to have mercy on the other servant , even as I had mercy on you ?
40018034	And his lord was very angry , and put him in the hands of those who would give him punishment till he made payment of all the debt .
40018035	So will my Father in heaven do to you , if you do not everyone , from your hearts , give forgiveness to his brother .
40019001	And it came about that after saying these words , Jesus went away from Galilee , and came into the parts of Judaea on the other side of Jordan .
40019002	And a great number went after him ; and he made them well there .
40019003	And certain Pharisees came to him , testing him , and saying , Is it right for a man to put away his wife for every cause ?
40019004	And he said in answer , Have you not seen in the Writings , that he who made them at the first made them male and female , and said ,
40019005	For this cause will a man go away from his father and mother , and be joined to his wife ; and the two will become one flesh ?
40019006	So that they are no longer two , but one flesh . Then let not that which has been joined by God be parted by man .
40019007	They say to him , Why then did Moses give orders that a husband might give her a statement in writing and be free from her ?
40019008	He says to them , Moses , because of your hard hearts , let you put away your wives : but it has not been so from the first .
40019009	And I say to you , Whoever puts away his wife for any other cause than the loss of her virtue , and takes another , is a false husband : and he who takes her as his wife when she is put away , is no true husband to her .
40019010	The disciples say to him , If this is the position of a man in relation to his wife , it is better not to be married .
40019011	But he said to them , Not all men are able to take in this saying , but only those to whom it is given .
40019012	For there are men who , from birth , were without sex : and there are some who were made so by men : and there are others who have made themselves so for the kingdom of heaven . He who is able to take it , let him take it .
40019013	Then some people took little children to him , so that he might put his hands on them in blessing : and the disciples said sharp words to them .
40019014	But Jesus said , Let the little ones come to me , and do not keep them away : for of such is the kingdom of heaven .
40019015	And he put his hands on them , and went away .
40019016	And one came to him and said , Master , what good thing have I to do , so that I may have eternal life ?
40019017	And he said to him , Why are you questioning me about what is good ? One there is who is good : but if you have a desire to go into life , keep the rules of the law .
40019018	He says to him , Which ? And Jesus said , Do not put anyone to death , Do not be untrue in married life , Do not take what is not yours , Do not give false witness ,
40019019	Give honour to your father and your mother : and , Have love for your neighbour as for yourself .
40019020	The young man says to him , All these things have I done : what more is there ?
40019021	Jesus said to him , If you have a desire to be complete , go , get money for your property , and give it to the poor , and you will have wealth in heaven : and come after me .
40019022	But hearing these words the young man went away sorrowing : for he had much property .
40019023	And Jesus said to his disciples , Truly I say to you , It is hard for a man with much money to go into the kingdom of heaven .
40019024	And again I say to you , It is simpler for a camel to go through a needle's eye , than for a man with much money to go into the kingdom of God .
40019025	And the disciples , hearing this , were greatly surprised , saying , Who then may have salvation ?
40019026	And Jesus , looking at them , said , With men this is not possible ; but with God all things are possible .
40019027	Then Peter said to him , See , we have given up everything and have come after you ; what then will we have ?
40019028	And Jesus said to them , Truly I say to you that in the time when all things are made new , and the Son of man is seated in his glory , you who have come after me will be seated on twelve seats , judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
40019029	And everyone who has given up houses , or brothers , or sisters , or father , or mother , or child , or land , for my name , will be given a hundred times as much , and have eternal life .
40019030	But a great number who are first will be last , and some who are last will be first .
40020001	For the kingdom of heaven is like the master of a house , who went out early in the morning to get workers into his vine-garden .
40020002	And when he had made an agreement with the workmen for a penny a day , he sent them into his vine-garden .
40020003	And he went out about the third hour , and saw others in the market-place doing nothing ;
40020004	And he said to them , Go into the vine-garden with the others , and whatever is right I will give you . And they went to work .
40020005	Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour , and did the same .
40020006	And about the eleventh hour he went out and saw others doing nothing ; and he says to them , Why are you here all the day doing nothing ?
40020007	They say to him , Because no man has given us work . He says to them , Go in with the rest , into the vine-garden .
40020008	And when evening came , the lord of the vine-garden said to his manager , Let the workers come , and give them their payment , from the last to the first .
40020009	And when those men came who had gone to work at the eleventh hour , they were given every man a penny .
40020010	Then those who came first had the idea that they would get more ; and they , like the rest , were given a penny .
40020011	And when they got it , they made a protest against the master of the house ,
40020012	Saying , These last have done only one hour's work , and you have made them equal to us , who have undergone the hard work of the day and the burning heat .
40020013	But he in answer said to one of them , Friend , I do you no wrong : did you not make an agreement with me for a penny ?
40020014	Take what is yours , and go away ; it is my pleasure to give to this last , even as to you .
40020015	Have I not the right to do as seems good to me in my house ? or is your eye evil , because I am good ?
40020016	So the last will be first , and the first last .
40020017	And when Jesus was going up to Jerusalem , he took the twelve disciples on one side , and said to them ,
40020018	See , we go up to Jerusalem ; and the Son of man will be given into the hands of the chief priests and scribes ; and they will give orders for him to be put to death ,
40020019	And will give him up to the Gentiles to be made sport of and to be whipped and to be put to death on the cross : and the third day he will come back again from the dead .
40020020	Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons , giving him worship and making a request of him .
40020021	And he said to her , What is your desire ? She says to him , Let my two sons be seated , the one at your right hand , and the other at your left , in your kingdom .
40020022	But Jesus made answer and said , You have no idea what you are requesting . Are you able to take of the cup which I am about to take ?
40020023	They say to him , We are able . He says to them , Truly , you will take of my cup : but to be seated at my right hand and at my left is not for me to give , but it is for those for whom my Father has made it ready .
40020024	And when it came to the ears of the ten , they were angry with the two brothers .
40020025	But Jesus said to them , You see that the rulers of the Gentiles are lords over them , and their great ones have authority over them .
40020026	Let it not be so among you : but if anyone has a desire to become great among you , let him be your servant ;
40020027	And whoever has a desire to be first among you , let him take the lowest place :
40020028	Even as the Son of man did not come to have servants , but to be a servant , and to give his life for the salvation of men .
40020029	And when they were going out from Jericho , a great number went after him .
40020030	And two blind men seated by the wayside , when they had the news that Jesus was going by , gave a loud cry , saying , Lord , Son of David , have mercy on us .
40020031	And the people gave them orders to be quiet ; but they went on crying even louder , Lord , Son of David , have mercy on us .
40020032	And Jesus , stopping , sent for them , and said , What would you have me do to you ?
40020033	They say to him , Lord , that our eyes may be open .
40020034	And Jesus , being moved with pity , put his fingers on their eyes : and straight away they were able to see , and went after him .
40021001	And when they were near Jerusalem , and had come to Beth-phage , to the Mountain of Olives , Jesus sent two disciples ,
40021002	Saying to them , Go into the little town in front of you , and straight away you will see an ass with a cord round her neck , and a young one with her ; let them loose and come with them to me .
40021003	And if anyone says anything to you , you will say , The Lord has need of them ; and straight away he will send them .
40021004	Now this took place so that these words of the prophet might come true ,
40021005	Say to the daughter of Zion , See , your King comes to you , gentle and seated on an ass , and on a young ass .
40021006	And the disciples went and did as Jesus had given them orders ,
40021007	And got the ass and the young one , and put their clothing on them , and he took his seat on it .
40021008	And all the people put their clothing down in the way ; and others got branches from the trees , and put them down in the way .
40021009	And those who went before him , and those who came after , gave loud cries , saying , Glory to the Son of David : A blessing on him who comes in the name of the Lord : Glory in the highest .
40021010	And when he came into Jerusalem , all the town was moved , saying , Who is this ?
40021011	And the people said , This is the prophet Jesus , from Nazareth of Galilee .
40021012	And Jesus went into the Temple and sent out all who were trading there , overturning the tables of the money-changers and the seats of those trading in doves .
40021013	And he said to them , It is in the Writings , My house is to be named a house of prayer , but you are making it a hole of thieves .
40021014	And the blind and the broken in body came to him in the Temple , and he made them well .
40021015	But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the works of power which he did , and the children crying out in the Temple , Glory to the son of David , they were angry and said to him ,
40021016	Have you any idea what these are saying ? And Jesus said to them , Yes : have you not seen in the Writings , From the lips of children and babies at the breast you have made your praise complete ?
40021017	And he went away from them , and went out of the town to Bethany , and was there for the night .
40021018	Now in the morning when he was coming back to the town , he had a desire for food .
40021019	And seeing a fig-tree by the wayside , he came to it , and saw nothing on it but leaves only ; and he said to it , Let there be no fruit from you from this time forward for ever . And straight away the fig-tree became dry and dead .
40021020	And when the disciples saw it they were surprised , saying , How did the fig-tree become dry in so short a time ?
40021021	And Jesus in answer said to them , Truly I say to you , If you have faith , without doubting , not only may you do what has been done to the fig-tree , but even if you say to this mountain , Be taken up and put into the sea , it will be done .
40021022	And all things , whatever you make request for in prayer , having faith , you will get .
40021023	And when he had come into the Temple , the chief priests and those in authority over the people came to him while he was teaching , and said , By what authority do you do these things ? and who gave you this authority ?
40021024	And Jesus said to them in answer , I will put one question to you , and if you give me the answer , I will say by what authority I do these things .
40021025	The baptism of John , where did it come from ? from heaven or from men ? And they were reasoning among themselves , saying , If we say , From heaven ; he will say to us , Why then did you not have faith in him ?
40021026	But if we say , From men ; we are in fear of the people , because all take John to be a prophet .
40021027	And they made answer and said , We have no idea . Then he said to them , And I will not say to you by what authority I do these things .
40021028	But how does it seem to you ? A man had two sons ; and he came to the first , and said , Son , go and do work today in the vine-garden .
40021029	And he said in answer , I will not : but later , changing his decision , he went .
40021030	And he came to the second and said the same . And he made answer and said , I go , sir : and went not .
40021031	Which of the two did his father's pleasure ? They say , The first . Jesus said to them , Truly I say to you , that tax-farmers and loose women are going into the kingdom of God before you .
40021032	For John came to you in the way of righteousness , and you had no faith in him , but the tax-farmers and the loose women had faith in him : and you , when you saw it , did not even have regret for your sins , so as to have faith in him .
40021033	Give ear to another story . A master of a house made a vine garden , and put a wall round it , and made a place for crushing out the wine , and made a tower , and let it out to field-workers , and went into another country .
40021034	And when the time for the fruit came near , he sent his servants to the workmen , to get the fruit .
40021035	And the workmen made an attack on his servants , giving blows to one , putting another to death , and stoning another .
40021036	Again , he sent other servants more in number than the first : and they did the same to them .
40021037	But after that he sent his son to them , saying , They will have respect for my son .
40021038	But when the workmen saw the son , they said among themselves , This is he who will one day be the owner of the property ; come , let us put him to death and take his heritage .
40021039	And they took him and , driving him out of the vine-garden , put him to death .
40021040	When , then , the lord of the vine-garden comes , what will he do to those workmen ?
40021041	They say to him , He will put those cruel men to a cruel death , and will let out the vine-garden to other workmen , who will give him the fruit when it is ready .
40021042	Jesus says to them , Did you never see in the Writings , The stone which the builders put on one side , the same has been made the chief stone of the building : this was the Lord's doing , and it is a wonder in our eyes ?
40021043	For this reason I say to you , The kingdom of God will be taken away from you , and will be given to a nation producing the fruits of it .
40021044	Any man falling on this stone will be broken , but he on whom it comes down will be crushed to dust .
40021045	And when his stories came to the ears of the chief priests and the Pharisees , they saw that he was talking of them .
40021046	And though they had a desire to take him , they were in fear of the people , because in their eyes he was a prophet .
40022001	And Jesus , talking to them again in stories , said :
40022002	The kingdom of heaven is like a certain king , who made a feast when his son was married ,
40022003	And sent out his servants to get in the guests to the feast : and they would not come .
40022004	Again he sent out other servants , with orders to say to the guests , See , I have made ready my feast : my oxen and my fat beasts have been put to death , and all things are ready : come to the feast .
40022005	But they gave no attention , and went about their business , one to his farm , another to his trade :
40022006	And the rest put violent hands on his servants , and did evil to them , and put them to death .
40022007	But the king was angry ; and he sent his armies , and those who had put his servants to death he gave to destruction , burning down their town with fire .
40022008	Then he said to his servants , The feast is ready but the guests were not good enough .
40022009	Go then to the cross-roads , and get all those whom you see to come to the bride-feast .
40022010	And those servants went out into the streets , and got together all those whom they came across , bad and good : and the feast was full of guests .
40022011	But when the king came in to see the guests , he saw there a man who had not on a guest's robe ;
40022012	And he says to him , Friend , how came you in here not having a guest's robe ? And he had nothing to say .
40022013	Then the king said to the servants , Put cords round his hands and feet and put him out into the dark ; there will be weeping and cries of sorrow .
40022014	For out of all to whom the good news has come , only a small number will get salvation .
40022015	Then the Pharisees went and had a meeting to see how they might make use of his words to take him .
40022016	And they sent to him their disciples , with the Herodians , saying , Master , we see that you are true , and that you are teaching the true way of God , and have no fear of anyone , because you have no respect for a man's position .
40022017	Give us , then , your opinion of this : Is it right to give tax to Caesar , or not ?
40022018	But Jesus saw their trick and said , Oh false ones , why are you attempting to put me in the wrong ?
40022019	Let me see the tax money . And they gave him a penny .
40022020	And he said to them , Whose is this image and name on it ?
40022021	They say to him , Caesar's . Then he said to them , Give to Caesar the things which are Caesar's , and to God the things which are God's .
40022022	And hearing it , they were full of wonder , and went away from him .
40022023	On the same day there came to him the Sadducees , who say that there is no coming back from the dead : and they put a question to him , saying ,
40022024	Master , Moses said , If a man , at the time of his death , has no children , let his brother take his wife , and get a family for his brother ;
40022025	Now there were among us seven brothers ; and the first was married and at his death , having no seed , gave his wife to his brother ;
40022026	In the same way the second and the third , up to the seventh .
40022027	And last of all the woman came to her end .
40022028	When they come back from the dead , then , whose wife will she be of the seven ? because they all had her .
40022029	But Jesus said to them in answer , You are in error , not having knowledge of the Writings , or of the power of God .
40022030	For when they come back from the dead there are no husbands and wives , but they are as the angels in heaven .
40022031	But about the dead coming back to life , have you no knowledge of what was said to you by God in the Writings :
40022032	I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ? God is not the God of the dead but of the living .
40022033	And the people hearing it were surprised at his teaching .
40022034	But the Pharisees , hearing how the mouths of the Sadducees had been stopped , came together ;
40022035	And one of them , a teacher of the law , put a question to him , testing him , and saying ,
40022036	Master , which is the chief rule in the law ?
40022037	And he said to him , Have love for the Lord your God with all your heart , and with all your soul , and with all your mind .
40022038	This is the first and greatest rule .
40022039	And a second like it is this , Have love for your neighbour as for yourself .
40022040	On these two rules all the law and the prophets are based .
40022041	Now while the Pharisees were together , Jesus put a question to them , saying ,
40022042	What is your opinion of the Christ ? whose son is he ? They say to him , The Son of David .
40022043	He says to them , How then does David in the Spirit give him the name of Lord , saying ,
40022044	The Lord said to my Lord , Be seated at my right hand , till I put under your feet all those who are against you ?
40022045	If David then gives him the name of Lord , how is he his son ?
40022046	And no one was able to give him an answer , and so great was their fear of him , that from that day no one put any more questions to him .
40023001	Then Jesus said to the people and to his disciples :
40023002	The scribes and the Pharisees have the authority of Moses ;
40023003	All things , then , which they give you orders to do , these do and keep : but do not take their works as your example , for they say and do not .
40023004	They make hard laws and put great weights on men's backs ; but they themselves will not put a finger to them .
40023005	But all their works they do so as to be seen by men : for they make wide their phylacteries , and the edges of their robes ,
40023006	And the things desired by them are the first places at feasts , and the chief seats in the Synagogues ,
40023007	And words of respect in the market-places , and to be named by men , Teacher .
40023008	But you may not be named Teacher : for one is your teacher , and you are all brothers .
40023009	And give no man the name of father on earth : because one is your Father , who is in heaven .
40023010	And you may not be named guides : because one is your Guide , even Christ .
40023011	But let the greatest among you be your servant .
40023012	And whoever makes himself high will be made low , and whoever makes himself low will be made high .
40023013	But a curse is on you , scribes and Pharisees , false ones ! because you are shutting the kingdom of heaven against men : for you do not go in yourselves , and those who are going in , you keep back .
40023015	A curse is on you , scribes and Pharisees , false ones ! for you go about land and sea to get one disciple and , having him , you make him twice as much a son of hell as yourselves .
40023016	A curse is on you , blind guides , who say , Whoever takes an oath by the Temple , it is nothing ; but whoever takes an oath by the gold of the Temple , he is responsible .
40023017	You foolish ones and blind : which is greater , the gold , or the Temple which makes the gold holy ?
40023018	And , Whoever takes an oath by the altar , it is nothing ; but whoever takes an oath by the offering which is on it , he is responsible .
40023019	You blind ones : which is greater , the offering , or the altar which makes the offering holy ?
40023020	He , then , who takes an oath by the altar , takes it by the altar and by all things on it .
40023021	And he who takes an oath by the Temple , takes it by the Temple and by him whose house it is .
40023022	And he who takes an oath by heaven , takes it by the seat of God , and by him who is seated on it .
40023023	A curse is on you , scribes and Pharisees , false ones ! for you make men give a tenth of all sorts of sweet-smelling plants , but you give no thought to the more important things of the law , righteousness , and mercy , and faith ; but it is right for you to do these , and not to let the others be undone .
40023024	You blind guides , who take out a fly from your drink , but make no trouble over a camel .
40023025	A curse is on you , scribes and Pharisees , false ones ! for you make clean the outside of the cup and of the plate , but inside they are full of violent behaviour and uncontrolled desire .
40023026	You blind Pharisee , first make clean the inside of the cup and of the plate , so that the outside may become equally clean .
40023027	A curse is on you , scribes and Pharisees , false ones ! for you are like the resting-places of the dead , which are made white , and seem beautiful on the outside , but inside are full of dead men's bones and of all unclean things .
40023028	Even so you seem to men to be full of righteousness , but inside you are all false and full of wrongdoing .
40023029	A curse is on you , scribes and Pharisees , false ones ! because you put up buildings for housing the dead bodies of the prophets , and make fair the last resting-places of good men , and say ,
40023030	If we had been living in the days of our fathers , we would not have taken part with them in the blood of the prophets .
40023031	So that you are witnesses against yourselves that you are the sons of those who put the prophets to death .
40023032	Make full , then , the measure of your fathers .
40023033	You snakes , offspring of snakes , how will you be kept from the punishment of hell ?
40023034	For this reason , I send you prophets , and wise men , and scribes : some of them you will put to death and put on the cross , and to some of them you will give blows in your Synagogues , driving them from town to town ;
40023035	So that on you may come all the blood of the upright on the earth , from the blood of upright Abel to the blood of Zachariah , son of Barachiah , whom you put to death between the Temple and the altar .
40023036	Truly I say to you , All these things will come on this generation .
40023037	O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , putting to death the prophets , and stoning those who are sent to her ! Again and again would I have taken your children to myself as a bird takes her young ones under her wings , and you would not !
40023038	See , your house is made waste .
40023039	For I say to you , You will not see me from this time till you say , A blessing on him who comes in the name of the Lord .
40024001	And Jesus went out of the Temple , and on the way his disciples came to him , pointing out the buildings of the Temple .
40024002	But he , answering , said to them , See you not all these things ? truly I say to you that here there will not be one stone resting on another , which will not be pulled down .
40024003	And while he was seated on the Mountain of Olives , the disciples came to him privately , saying , Make clear to us , when will these things be ? and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the world ?
40024004	And Jesus said to them in answer , Take care that you are not tricked .
40024005	For people will come in my name , saying , I am the Christ ; and a number will be turned from the true way through them .
40024006	And news will come to you of wars and talk of wars : do not be troubled , for these things have to be ; but it is still not the end .
40024007	For nation will be moved against nation , and kingdom against kingdom , and men will be without food , and the earth will be shaking in different places ;
40024008	But all these things are the first of the troubles .
40024009	Then they will be cruel to you , and will put you to death : and you will be hated by all nations because of my name .
40024010	And numbers of people will be turned from the right way , and will give one another up and have hate for one another .
40024011	And a number of false prophets will come , causing error .
40024012	And because wrongdoing will be increased , the love of most people will become cold .
40024013	But he who goes through to the end will get salvation .
40024014	And this good news of the kingdom will be given through all the world for a witness to all nations ; and then the end will come .
40024015	When , then , you see in the holy place the unclean thing which makes destruction , of which word was given by Daniel the prophet ( let this be clear to the reader ) ,
40024016	Then let those who are in Judaea go in flight to the mountains :
40024017	Let not him who is on the house-top go down to take anything out of his house :
40024018	And let not him who is in the field go back to get his coat .
40024019	But it will be hard for women who are with child and for those with babies at the breast in those days .
40024020	And say a prayer that your flight may not be in the winter , or on a Sabbath .
40024021	Because in those days there will be great sorrow , such as there has not been from the start of the world till now , or ever will be .
40024022	And if those days had not been made short there would have been no salvation for any , but because of the saints those days will be made short .
40024023	Then if any man says to you , See , here is the Christ , or , Here ; do not put faith in him ;
40024024	For there will come up false Christs , and false prophets , who will do great signs and wonders ; so that if possible even the saints might be tricked .
40024025	See , I have made it clear to you before it comes about .
40024026	If , then , they say to you , See , he is in the waste land ; go not out : See , he is in the inner rooms ; put no faith in it .
40024027	Because as in a thunderstorm the bright light coming from the east is seen even in the west ; so will be the coming of the Son of man .
40024028	Wherever the dead body is , there will the eagles come together .
40024029	But straight away , after the trouble of those days , the sun will be made dark and the moon will not give her light and the stars will come down from heaven and the powers of heaven will be moved :
40024030	And then the sign of the Son of man will be seen in heaven : and then all the nations of the earth will have sorrow , and they will see the Son of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory .
40024031	And he will send out his angels with a great sound of a horn , and they will get his saints together from the four winds , from one end of heaven to the other .
40024032	Now take an example from the fig-tree : when her branch has become soft and puts out its leaves , you are certain that the summer is near ;
40024033	Even so , when you see all these things , you may be certain that he is near , even at the doors .
40024034	Truly I say to you , This generation will not come to an end till all these things are complete .
40024035	Heaven and earth will come to an end , but my words will not come to an end .
40024036	But of that day and hour no one has knowledge , not even the angels in heaven , or the Son , but the Father only .
40024037	And as were the days of Noah , so will be the coming of the Son of man .
40024038	Because as in those days before the overflowing of the waters , they were feasting and taking wives and getting married , till the day when Noah went into the ark ,
40024039	And they had no care till the waters came and took them all away ; so will be the coming of the Son of man .
40024040	Then two men will be in the field ; one is taken , and one let go ;
40024041	Two women will be crushing grain ; one is taken , and one let go .
40024042	Be watching , then ! for you have no knowledge on what day your Lord will come .
40024043	But be certain of this , that if the master of the house had had knowledge of the time when the thief was coming , he would have been watching , and would not have let his house be broken into .
40024044	Be ready then ; for at a time which you have no thought of the Son of man will come .
40024045	Who is the true and wise servant , whom his lord has put over those in his house , to give them their food at the right time ?
40024046	A blessing on that servant , who will be doing so when his lord comes .
40024047	Truly , I say to you , he will put him over all he has .
40024048	But if that evil servant says in his heart , My lord is a long time in coming ;
40024049	And is cruel to the other servants , taking his pleasure with those who are overcome with wine ;
40024050	The lord of that servant will come in a day when he is not looking for him , and in an hour of which he has no knowledge ,
40024051	And will have him cut in two , and will give him a part in the fate of the false ones : there will be weeping and cries of sorrow .
40025001	Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins , the friends of the bride , who took their lights , and went out with the purpose of meeting the husband .
40025002	And five of them were foolish , and five were wise .
40025003	For the foolish , when they took their lights , took no oil with them .
40025004	But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lights .
40025005	Now the husband was a long time in coming , and they all went to sleep .
40025006	But in the middle of the night there is a cry , The husband comes ! Go out to him .
40025007	Then all those virgins got up , and made ready their lights .
40025008	And the foolish said to the wise , Give us of your oil ; for our lights are going out .
40025009	But the wise made answer , saying , There may not be enough for us and you ; it would be better for you to go to the traders and get oil for yourselves .
40025010	And while they went to get oil , the master came ; and those who were ready went in with him to the feast : and the door was shut .
40025011	After that the other virgins came , saying , Lord , Lord , let us in .

40025014	For it is as when a man , about to take a journey , got his servants together , and gave them his property .
40025015	And to one he gave five talents , to another two , to another one ; to everyone as he was able ; and he went on his journey .
40025016	Straight away he who had been given the five talents went and did trade with them , and made five more .
40025017	In the same way he who had been given the two got two more .
40025018	But he who was given the one went away and put it in a hole in the earth , and kept his lord's money in a secret place .
40025019	Now after a long time the lord of those servants comes , and makes up his account with them .
40025020	And he who had the five talents came with his other five talents , saying , Lord , you gave into my care five talents : see , I have got five more .
40025021	His lord said to him , Well done , good and true servant : you have been true in a small thing , I will give you control over great things : take your part in the joy of your lord .
40025022	And he who had the two talents came and said , Lord , you gave into my care two talents : see , I have got two more .
40025023	His lord said to him , Well done , good and true servant : you have been true in a small thing , I will give you control over great things : take your part in the joy of your lord .
40025024	And he who had had the one talent came and said , Lord , I had knowledge that you are a hard man , getting in grain where you have not put seed , and making profits for which you have done no work :
40025025	And I was in fear , and went away , and put your talent in the earth : here is what is yours .
40025026	But his lord in answer said to him , You are a bad and unready servant ; if you had knowledge that I get in grain where I did not put seed , and make profits for which I have done no work ,
40025027	Why , then , did you not put my money in the bank , and at my coming I would have got back what is mine with interest ?
40025028	Take away , then , his talent and give it to him who has the ten talents .
40025029	For to everyone who has will be given , and he will have more : but from him who has not , even what he has will be taken away .

40025031	But when the Son of man comes in his glory , and all the angels with him , then will he be seated in his glory :
40025032	And before him all the nations will come together ; and they will be parted one from another , as the sheep are parted from the goats by the keeper .
40025033	And he will put the sheep on his right , but the goats on the left .
40025034	Then will the King say to those on his right , Come , you who have the blessing of my Father , into the kingdom made ready for you before the world was :
40025035	For I was in need of food , and you gave it to me : I was in need of drink , and you gave it to me : I was wandering , and you took me in ;
40025036	I had no clothing , and you gave it to me : when I was ill , or in prison , you came to me .

40025038	And when did we see you wandering , and take you in ? or without clothing , and give it to you ?
40025039	And when did we see you ill , or in prison , and come to you ?
40025040	And the King will make answer and say to them , Truly I say to you , Because you did it to the least of these my brothers , you did it to me .

40025042	For I was in need of food , and you gave it not to me ; I was in need of drink , and you gave it not to me :
40025043	I was wandering , and you took me not in ; without clothing , and you gave me no clothing ; ill , and in prison , and you came not to me .

40026001	And when Jesus had come to the end of all these words , he said to his disciples ,

40026020	Now when evening was come , he was seated at table with the twelve disciples ;
40026021	And while they were taking food , he said , Truly I say to you that one of you will be false to me .

40027001	Now when it was morning , all the chief priests and those in authority took thought together with the purpose of putting Jesus to death .
40027002	And they put cords on him and took him away , and gave him up to Pilate , the ruler .

40027004	Saying , I have done wrong in giving into your hands an upright man . But they said , What is that to us ? it is your business .

40027022	Pilate says to them , What , then , am I to do with Jesus , who is named Christ ? They all say , Let him be put to death on the cross .

41003031	And his mother and brothers came and were outside , and sent for him , requesting to see him .
41003032	And a great number were seated round him ; and they said to him , See , your mother and your brothers are outside looking for you .
41003033	And he said in answer , Who are my mother and my brothers ?
41003034	And looking round at those who were seated about him , he said , See , my mother and my brothers !
41003035	Whoever does God's pleasure , the same is my brother , and sister , and mother .
41004001	And again he was teaching by the seaside . And a very great number of people had come to him , so that he got into a boat on the sea and took his seat ; and all the people were on the land by the seaside .
41004002	And he gave them teaching about a number of things in the form of stories , and said to them in his teaching , Give ear :
41004003	A man went out to put seed in the earth :
41004004	And while he was doing it , some was dropped by the wayside , and the birds came and took it for food .
41004005	And some went on the stones , where it had not much earth ; and it came up straight away , because the earth was not deep :
41004006	And when the sun was high , it was burned ; and because it had no root , it became dry and dead .
41004007	And some went among the thorns , and the thorns came up , and it had no room for growth and gave no fruit .
41004008	And some , falling on good earth , gave fruit , coming up and increasing , and giving thirty , sixty , and a hundred times as much .
41004009	And he said to them , Whoever has ears , let him give ear .
41004010	And when he was by himself , those who were round him with the twelve put questions to him about the purpose of the stories .
41004011	And he said to them , To you is given the secret of the kingdom of God , but to those who are outside , all things are given in the form of stories ;
41004012	So that seeing they may see , and it will not be clear to them ; and hearing it , they will not get the sense ; for fear that they may be turned again to me and have forgiveness .
41004013	And he said to them , If you are not clear about this story , how will you be clear about the others ?
41004014	The seed is the word .
41004015	And these are they by the wayside , where the word is planted ; and when they have given ear , the Evil One comes straight away and takes away the word which has been planted in them .
41004016	And in the same way , these are they who are planted on the stones , who , when the word has come to their ears , straight away take it with joy ;
41004017	And they have no root in themselves , but go on for a time ; then , when trouble comes or pain , because of the word , they quickly become full of doubts .
41004018	And others are those planted among the thorns ; these are they who have given ear to the word ,
41004019	And the cares of this life , and the deceits of wealth , and the desire for other things coming in , put a stop to the growth of the word , and it gives no fruit .
41004020	And these are they who were planted on the good earth ; such as give ear to the word , and take it into their hearts , and give fruit , thirty and sixty and a hundred times as much .
41004021	And he said to them , When the light comes in , do people put it under a vessel , or under the bed , and not on its table ?
41004022	There is nothing covered which will not be seen openly , and nothing has been made secret which will not come to light .
41004023	If any man has ears , let him give ear .
41004024	And he said to them , Take care what you give ear to : in the same measure as you give you will get , and more will be given to you .
41004025	He who has , to him will be given : and he who has not , from him will be taken even that which he has .
41004026	And he said , Such is the kingdom of God , as if a man put seed in the earth ,
41004027	And went to sleep and got up , night and day , and the seed came to growth , though he had no idea how .
41004028	The earth gives fruit by herself ; first the leaf , then the head , then the full grain .
41004029	But when the grain is ready , he quickly sends men to get it cut , because the time for cutting has come .
41004030	And he said , What picture may we give of the kingdom of God , or with what story may we make it clear ?
41004031	It is like a grain of mustard seed , which , when it is put in the earth , is smaller than all the seeds on the earth ,
41004032	But when it is planted , it comes up , and becomes taller than all the plants , and puts out great branches , so that the birds of heaven are able to take rest in its shade .
41004033	And with a number of such stories he gave them his teaching , as they were able to take it :
41004034	And without a story he said nothing to them : but privately to his disciples he made all things clear .
41004035	And on that day , when the evening had come , he said to them , Let us go over to the other side .
41004036	And going away from the people , they took him with them , as he was , in the boat . And other boats were with him .
41004037	And a great storm of wind came up , and the waves came into the boat , so that the boat was now becoming full .
41004038	And he himself was in the back of the boat , sleeping on the cushion : and they , awaking him , said , Master , is it nothing to you that we are in danger of destruction ?
41004039	And he came out of his sleep , and gave strong orders to the wind , and said to the sea , Peace , be at rest . And the wind went down , and there was a great calm .
41004040	And he said to them , Why are you full of fear ? have you still no faith ?
41004041	And their fear was great , and they said one to another , Who then is this , that even the wind and the sea do his orders ?
41005001	And they came to the other side of the sea , into the country of the Gerasenes .
41005002	And when he had got out of the boat , straight away there came to him from the place of the dead a man with an unclean spirit .
41005003	He was living in the place of the dead : and no man was able to keep him down , no , not with a chain ;
41005004	Because he had frequently been prisoned in chains and iron bands , and the chains had been parted and the bands broken by him : and no man was strong enough to make him quiet .
41005005	And all the time , by day and by night , in the place of the dead , and in the mountains , he was crying out and cutting himself with stones .
41005006	And when he saw Jesus from far off , he went quickly to him and gave him worship ;
41005007	And crying out with a loud voice he said , What have I to do with you , Jesus , Son of the Most High God ? In God's name , do not be cruel to me .
