41005008	For Jesus had said to him , Come out of the man , you unclean spirit .
41005009	And Jesus said , What is your name ? And he made answer , My name is Legion , because there are a great number of us .
41005010	And he made strong prayers to him not to send them away out of the country .
41005011	Now on the mountain side there was a great herd of pigs getting their food .
41005012	And they said to him , Send us into the pigs , so that we may go into them .
41005013	And he let them do it . And the unclean spirits came out and went into the pigs ; and the herd went rushing down a sharp slope into the sea , about two thousand of them ; and they came to their death in the sea .
41005014	And their keepers went running and gave an account of it in the town and in the country . And people came to see what had taken place .
41005015	And they came to Jesus , and saw the man in whom had been the evil spirits seated , clothed and with full use of his senses , and they were full of fear .
41005016	And those who had seen it gave them an account of what had been done to him who had the evil spirits , and of the fate of the pigs .
41005017	And they made a request to him to go out of their country .
41005018	And when he was getting into the boat , the man in whom had been the evil spirits had a great desire to come with him .
41005019	And he would not let him , but said to him , Go to your house , to your friends , and give them news of the great things the Lord has done for you , and how he had mercy on you .
41005020	And he went on his way , and made public in the country of Decapolis what great things Jesus had done for him : and all men were full of wonder .
41005021	And when Jesus had gone over again in the boat to the other side , a great number of people came to him : and he was by the sea .
41005022	And one of the rulers of the Synagogue , Jairus by name , came , and seeing him , went down at his feet ,
41005023	And made strong prayers to him , saying , My little daughter is near to death : it is my prayer that you will come and put your hands on her , so that she may be made well , and have life .
41005024	And he went with him ; and a great number of people went after him , and came round him .
41005025	And a woman , who had had a flow of blood for twelve years ,
41005026	And had undergone much at the hands of a number of medical men , and had given all she had , and was no better , but even worse ,
41005027	When she had news of the things which Jesus did , went among the people coming after him , and put her hand on his robe .
41005028	For she said , If I may only put my hand on his robe , I will be made well .
41005029	And straight away the fountain of her blood was stopped , and she had a feeling in her body that her disease had gone and she was well .
41005030	And straight away Jesus was conscious that power had gone out of him ; and , turning to the people , he said , Who was touching my robe ?
41005031	And his disciples said to him , You see the people round you on every side , and you say , Who was touching me ?
41005032	And on his looking round to see her who had done this thing ,
41005033	The woman , shaking with fear , conscious of what had been done to her , came and , falling on her face before him , gave him a true account of everything .
41005034	And he said to her , Daughter , your faith has made you well ; go in peace , and be free from your disease .
41005035	And while he was still talking , they came from the ruler of the Synagogue's house , saying , Your daughter is dead : why are you still troubling the Master ?
41005036	But Jesus , giving no attention to their words , said to the ruler of the Synagogue , Have no fear , only have faith .
41005037	And he did not let anyone come with him , but Peter and James and John , the brother of James .
41005038	And they came to the house of the ruler of the Synagogue ; and he saw people running this way and that , and weeping and crying loudly .
41005039	And when he had gone in , he said to them , Why are you making such a noise and weeping ? The child is not dead , but sleeping .
41005040	And they were laughing at him . But he , having sent them all out , took the father of the child and her mother and those who were with him , and went in where the child was .
41005041	And taking her by the hand , he said to her , Talitha cumi , which is , My child , I say to you , Get up .
41005042	And the young girl got up straight away , and was walking about ; she being twelve years old . And they were overcome with wonder .
41005043	And he gave them special orders that they were not to say anything of this ; and he said that some food was to be given to her .
41006001	And he went away from there , and came into his country ; and his disciples went with him .
41006002	And when the Sabbath day had come , he was teaching in the Synagogue ; and a number of people hearing him were surprised , saying , From where did this man get these things ? and , What is the wisdom given to this man , and what are these works of power done by his hands ?
41006003	Is not this the woodworker , the son of Mary , and brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon ? and are not his sisters here with us ? And they were bitter against him .
41006004	And Jesus said to them , A prophet is nowhere without honour , but in his country , and among his relations , and in his family .
41006005	And he was unable to do any work of power there , but only to put his hands on one or two persons who were ill , and make them well .
41006006	And he was greatly surprised because they had no faith . And he went about the country places teaching .
41006007	And he gave orders to the twelve , and sent them out two by two ; and he gave them authority over the unclean spirits ;
41006008	And he said that they were to take nothing for their journey , but a stick only ; no bread , no bag , no money in their pockets ;
41006009	They were to go with common shoes on their feet , and not to take two coats .
41006010	And he said to them , Wherever you go into a house , make that your resting-place till you go away .
41006011	And whatever place will not take you in and will not give ear to you , when you go away , put off the dust from your feet as a witness against them .
41006012	And they went out , preaching the need for a change of heart in men .
41006013	And they sent out a number of evil spirits , and put oil on a great number who were ill , and made them well .
41006014	And king Herod had news of him , because his name was on the lips of all ; and he said , John the Baptist has come back from the dead , and for this reason these powers are working in him .
41006015	But others said , It is Elijah . And others said , It is a prophet , even like one of the prophets .
41006016	But Herod , when he had news of it , said , John , whom I put to death , has come back from the dead .
41006017	For Herod himself had sent men out to take John and put him in prison , because of Herodias , his brother Philip's wife , whom he had taken for himself .
41006018	For John said to Herod , It is wrong for you to have your brother's wife .
41006019	And Herodias was bitter against him , desiring to put him to death ; but she was not able ;
41006020	For Herod was in fear of John , being conscious that he was an upright and holy man , and kept him safe . And hearing him , he was much troubled ; and he gave ear to him gladly .
41006021	And the chance came when Herod on his birthday gave a feast to his lords , and the high captains , and the chief men of Galilee ;
41006022	And when the daughter of Herodias herself came in and did a dance , Herod and those who were at table with him were pleased with her ; and the king said to the girl , Make a request for anything and I will give it you .
41006023	And he took an oath , saying to her , Whatever is your desire I will give it to you , even half of my kingdom .
41006024	And she went out and said to her mother , What is my request to be ? And she said , The head of John the Baptist .
41006025	And she came in quickly to the king , and said , My desire is that you give me straight away on a plate the head of John the Baptist .
41006026	And the king was very sad ; but because of his oaths , and those who were with him at table , he would not say ' No ' to her .
41006027	And straight away the king sent out one of his armed men , and gave him an order to come back with the head : and he went and took off John's head in prison ,
41006028	And came back with the head on a plate , and gave it to the girl ; and the girl gave it to her mother .
41006029	And when his disciples had news of it , they came and took up his body , and put it in its last resting-place .
41006030	And the twelve came together to Jesus ; and they gave him an account of all the things they had done , and all they had been teaching .
41006031	And he said to them , Come away by yourselves to a quiet place , and take a rest for a time . Because there were a great number coming and going , and they had no time even for food .
41006032	And they went away in the boat to a waste place by themselves .
41006033	And the people saw them going , and a number of them , having knowledge who they were , went running there together on foot from all the towns , and got there before them .
41006034	And he got out , and saw a great mass of people , and he had pity on them , because they were like sheep without a keeper : and he gave them teaching about a number of things .
41006035	And at the end of the day , his disciples came to him and said , This place is waste land , and it is late :
41006036	Send them away , so that they may go into the country and small towns round about , and get some food for themselves .
41006037	But he said to them in answer , Give them food yourselves . And they said to him , Are we to go and get bread for two hundred pence , and give it to them ?
41006038	And he said to them , How much bread have you ? go and see . And when they had seen , they said , Five cakes of bread and two fishes .
41006039	And he made them all be seated in groups on the green grass .
41006040	And they were placed in groups , by hundreds and by fifties .
41006041	And he took the five cakes of bread and the two fishes and , looking up to heaven , he said words of blessing over them ; and when the cakes were broken , he gave them to the disciples to put before the people ; and he made division of the two fishes among them all .
41006042	And they all took of the food and had enough .
41006043	And they took up twelve baskets full of the broken bits and of the fishes .
41006044	And those who took of the bread were five thousand men .
41006045	And straight away he made his disciples get into the boat , and go before him to the other side to Beth-saida , while he himself sent the people away .
41006046	And after he had sent them away , he went up into a mountain for prayer .
41006047	And by evening , the boat was in the middle of the sea , and he by himself on the land .
41006048	And seeing that they had trouble in getting their boat through the water , because the wind was against them , about the fourth watch of the night he came to them , walking on the sea ; and he would have gone past them ;
41006049	But they , when they saw him walking on the sea , took him for a spirit , and gave a loud cry :
41006050	For they all saw him , and were troubled . But straight away he said to them , Take heart , it is I , have no fear .
41006051	And he went to them into the boat , and the wind went down , and they were full of wonder in themselves ;
41006052	For it was not clear to them about the bread ; but their hearts were hard .
41006053	And when they had gone across , they came to Gennesaret , and got their boat to land .
41006054	And when they had got out of the boat , the people quickly had news of him ,
41006055	And went running through all the country round about , and took on their beds those who were ill , to where it was said that he was .
41006056	And wherever he went , into small towns , or great towns , or into the country , they took those who were ill into the market-places , requesting him that they might put their hands even on the edge of his robe : and all those who did so were made well .
41007001	And there came together to him the Pharisees and certain of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem ,
41007002	And had seen that some of his disciples took their bread with unclean , that is , unwashed , hands .
41007003	Now the Pharisees , and all the Jews , do not take food without washing their hands with care , keeping the old rule which has been handed down to them :
41007004	And when they come from the market-place , they take no food till their hands are washed ; and a number of other orders there are , which have been handed down to them to keep--washings of cups and pots and brass vessels .
41007005	And the Pharisees and the scribes put the question to him , Why do your disciples not keep the rules of the fathers , but take their bread with unwashed hands ?
41007006	And he said , Well did Isaiah say of you , you false ones : These people give me honour with their lips , but their heart is far from me .
41007007	But their worship is to no purpose , while they give as their teaching the rules of men .
41007008	For , turning away from the law of God , you keep the rules of men .
41007009	And he said to them , Truly you put on one side the law of God , so that you may keep the rules which have been handed down to you .
41007010	For Moses said , Give honour to your father and mother , and , He who says evil of father or mother , let him have the punishment of death :
41007011	But you say , If a man says to his father or his mother , That by which you might have had profit from me is Corban , that is to say , Given to God ,
41007012	You no longer let him do anything for his father or his mother ;
41007013	Making the word of God of no effect by your rule , which you have given : and a number of other such things you do .
41007014	And turning to the people again , he said to them , Give ear to me all of you , and let my words be clear to you :
41007015	There is nothing outside the man which , going into him , is able to make him unclean : but the things which come out of the man are those which make the man unclean .
41007017	And when he had gone into the house away from all the people , his disciples put questions to him about the saying .
41007018	And he said to them , Have even you so little wisdom ? Do you not see that whatever goes into a man from outside is not able to make him unclean ,
41007019	Because it goes not into the heart but into the stomach , and goes out with the waste ? He said this , making all food clean .
41007020	And he said , That which comes out of the man , that makes the man unclean .
41007021	Because from inside , from the heart of men , come evil thoughts and unclean pleasures ,
41007022	The taking of goods and of life , broken faith between husband and wife , the desire of wealth , wrongdoing , deceit , sins of the flesh , an evil eye , angry words , pride , foolish acts :
41007023	All these evil things come from inside , and make the man unclean .
41007024	And he went away from there to the country of Tyre and Sidon . And he went into a house , desiring that no man might have knowledge of it : and he was not able to keep it secret .
41007025	But a woman , whose little daughter had an unclean spirit , having had news of him , came straight away and went down at his feet .
41007026	Now the woman was a Greek , a Syro-phoenician by birth : and she made a request to him that he would send the evil spirit out of her daughter .
41007027	And he said to her , Let the children first have their food : for it is not right to take the children's bread and give it to the dogs .
41007028	But she said to him in answer , Yes , Lord : even the dogs under the table take the bits dropped by the children .
41007029	And he said to her , For this saying go your way ; the evil spirit has gone out of your daughter .
41007030	And she went away to her house , and saw the child on the bed , and the evil spirit gone out .
41007031	And again he went out from Tyre , and came through Sidon to the sea of Galilee , through the country of Decapolis .
41007032	And they came to him with one who had no power of hearing and had trouble in talking ; and they made a request to him to put his hands on him .
41007033	And he took him on one side from the people privately , and put his fingers into his ears , and he put water from his mouth on the man's tongue with his finger ;
41007034	And looking up to heaven , he took a deep breath , and said to him , Ephphatha , that is , Be open .
41007035	And his ears became open , and the band of his tongue was made loose , and his words became clear .
41007036	And he gave them orders not to give news of it to anyone ; but the more he made this request , so much the more they made it public .
41007037	And they were overcome with wonder , saying , He has done all things well : he even gives back the power of hearing and the power of talking to those who have been without them .
41008001	In those days again , when there was a great mass of people and they had no food , he made his disciples come to him and said to them ,
41008002	I have pity for these people because they have been with me now three days , and have no food ;
41008003	If I send them away to their houses with no food , they will be overcome by weariness on the way ; and some of them have come from far .
41008004	And his disciples said in answer , How will it be possible to get enough bread for these men here in a waste place ?
41008005	And he put the question , How much bread have you ? And they said , Seven cakes .
41008006	And he made the people be seated on the earth : and he took the seven cakes and , having given praise , he gave the broken bread to his disciples to put before them ; and they put it before the people .
41008007	And they had some small fishes ; and blessing them he had them put before the people in the same way .
41008008	And they took the food , and had enough ; and they took up seven baskets full of the broken bits .
41008009	And there were about four thousand people : and he sent them away .
41008010	And he got into the boat with his disciples straight away , and came into the country of Dalmanutha .
41008011	And the Pharisees came out and put questions to him , requesting from him a sign from heaven , testing him .
41008012	And he was very sad in spirit , and said , Why is this generation looking for a sign ? truly , I say to you , No sign will be given to this generation .
41008013	And he went away from them , and again got into the boat and went across to the other side .
41008014	And they had taken no thought to get bread ; and they had only one cake of bread with them in the boat .
41008015	And he said to them , Take care to be on the watch against the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod .
41008016	And they said to one another , We have no bread .
41008017	And Jesus , hearing it , said to them , Why are you reasoning among yourselves because you have no bread ? do you still not see , and is it still not clear to you ? are your hearts so hard ?
41008018	Having eyes , do you not see ? and having ears , have you no hearing ? and have you no memory ?
41008019	When I made a division of the five cakes of bread among the five thousand , what number of baskets full of broken bits did you take up ? They said to him , Twelve .
41008020	And when the seven among the four thousand , what number of baskets full of broken bits did you take up ? And they said to him , Seven .
41008021	And he said to them , Is it still not clear to you ?
41008022	And they came to Beth-saida . And they took a blind man to him , requesting him to put his hands on him .
41008023	And he took the blind man by the hand , and went with him out of the town ; and when he had put water from his mouth on his eyes , and put his hands on him , he said , Do you see anything ?
41008024	And looking up , he said , I see men ; I see them like trees , walking .
41008025	Then again he put his hands on his eyes ; and looking hard , he was able to see , and saw all things clearly .
41008026	And he sent him away to his house , saying , Do not even go into the town .
41008027	And Jesus went out , with his disciples , into the little towns round Caesarea Philippi ; and on the way he put a question to his disciples , saying , Who do men say that I am ?
41008028	And they made answer , John the Baptist ; and others , Elijah ; but others , One of the prophets .
41008029	And he said to them , But who do you say I am ? Peter said in answer , You are the Christ .
41008030	And he put them under orders not to say this of him to anyone .
41008031	And teaching them , he said that the Son of man would have to undergo much , and be hated by those in authority , and the chief priests , and the scribes , and be put to death , and after three days come back from the dead .
41008032	And he said this openly . And Peter took him , and was protesting .
41008033	But he , turning about , and seeing his disciples , said sharply to Peter , Get out of my way , Satan : for your mind is not on the things of God , but on the things of men .
41008034	And turning to the mass of people with his disciples , he said to them , If any man has the desire to come after me , let him give up all other desires , and take up his cross and come after me .
41008035	Whoever has a desire to keep his life , will have it taken from him ; and whoever gives up his life because of me and the good news , will keep it .
41008036	What profit has a man if he gets all the world with the loss of his life ?
41008037	And what would a man give in exchange for his life ?
41008038	Whoever has a feeling of shame because of me and my words in this false and evil generation , the Son of man will have a feeling of shame because of him , when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels .
41009001	And he said to them , Truly I say to you , There are some here who will have no taste of death till they see the kingdom of God come with power .
41009002	And after six days Jesus took with him Peter and James and John , and made them go up with him into a high mountain by themselves : and he was changed in form before them :
41009003	And his clothing became shining , very white , as no cleaner on earth would make it .
41009004	And there came before them Elijah with Moses , and they were talking with Jesus .
41009005	And Peter said to Jesus , Master , it is good for us to be here : and let us make three tents ; one for you , one for Moses , and one for Elijah .
41009006	Because he was not certain what to say , for they were in great fear .
41009007	And a cloud came over them ; and a voice came out of the cloud , saying , This is my dearly loved Son , give ear to him .
41009008	And suddenly looking round about , they saw no one any longer , but Jesus only with themselves .
41009009	And while they were coming down from the mountain , he gave them orders not to give word to any man of the things they had seen , till the Son of man had come back from the dead .
41009010	And they kept the saying , questioning among themselves what the coming back from the dead might be .
41009011	And they put a question to him , saying , Why do the scribes say that Elijah has to come first ?
41009012	And he said to them , Truly , Elijah does come first , and puts all things in order ; and how is it said in the Writings that the Son of man will go through much sorrow and be made as nothing ?
41009013	But I say to you that Elijah has come , and they have done to him whatever they were pleased to do , even as the Writings say about him .
41009014	And when they came to the disciples , they saw a great mass of people about them , and scribes questioning them .
41009015	And straight away all the people , when they saw him , were full of wonder , and running to him , gave him worship .
41009016	And he said , What are you questioning them about ?
41009017	And one of the number said to him in answer , Master , I came to you with my son , who has in him a spirit which takes away his power of talking ;
41009018	And wherever it takes him , it puts him down violently , streaming at the lips and twisted with pain ; and his strength goes from him ; and I made a request to your disciples to send it out , and they were not able .
41009019	And he said to them in answer , O generation without faith , how long will I have to be with you ? how long will I put up with you ? let him come to me .
41009020	And they took him to him : and when he saw him , the spirit in him straight away became violent ; and he went down on the earth , rolling about and streaming at the lips .
41009021	And Jesus questioning the father said , How long has he been like this ? And he said , From a child .
41009022	And frequently it has sent him into the fire and into the water , for his destruction ; but if you are able to do anything , have pity on us , and give us help .
41009023	And Jesus said to him , If you are able ! All things are possible to him who has faith .
41009024	Straight away the father of the child gave a cry , saying , I have faith ; make my feeble faith stronger .
41009025	And when Jesus saw that the people came running together , he gave orders to the unclean spirit , saying to him , You , spirit , who are the cause of his loss of voice and hearing , I say to you , come out of him , and never again go into him .
41009026	And after crying out and shaking him violently , it came out : and the child became like one dead ; so that most of them said , He is dead .
41009027	But Jesus took him by the hand , lifting him up ; and he got up .
41009028	And when he had gone into the house , his disciples said to him privately , Why were we unable to send it out ?
41009029	And he said to them , Nothing will make this sort come out but prayer .
41009030	And they went out from there , through Galilee ; and it was his desire that no man might have knowledge of it ;
41009031	For he was giving his disciples teaching , and saying to them , The Son of man is given up into the hands of men , and they will put him to death ; and when he is dead , after three days he will come back from the dead .
41009032	But the saying was not clear to them , and they were in fear of questioning him about it .
41009033	And they came to Capernaum : and when he was in the house , he put the question to them , What were you talking about on the way ?
41009034	But they said nothing : because they had had an argument between themselves on the way , about who was the greatest .
41009035	And seating himself , he made the twelve come to him ; and he said to them , If any man has the desire to be first , he will be last of all and servant of all .
41009036	And he took a little child , and put him in the middle of them ; and taking him in his arms , he said to them ,
41009037	Whoever will give honour to one such little child in my name , gives honour to me : and whoever gives honour to me , gives honour not to me , but to him who sent me .
41009038	John said to him , Master , we saw one driving out evil spirits in your name : and we said that he might not , because he is not one of us .
41009039	But Jesus said , Say not so : for there is no man who will do a great work in my name , and be able at the same time to say evil of me .
41009040	He who is not against us is for us .
41009041	Whoever gives you a cup of water , because you are Christ's , truly I say to you , he will in no way be without his reward .
41009042	And whoever is a cause of trouble to one of these little ones who have faith in me , it would be better for him if a great stone was put round his neck and he was dropped into the sea .
41009043	And if your hand is a cause of trouble to you , let it be cut off ; it is better for you to go into life with one hand than to have two hands and go into hell , into the eternal fire .
41009045	And if your foot is a cause of trouble to you , let it be cut off : it is better for you to go into life with one foot than to have two feet and go into hell .
41009047	And if your eye is a cause of trouble to you , take it out : it is better for you to go into the kingdom of God with one eye than , having two eyes , to go into hell ,
41009048	Where their worm is ever living and the fire is not put out .
41009049	Everyone will be salted with fire .
41009050	Salt is good ; but if the taste goes from it , how will you make it salt again ? Have salt in yourselves , and be at peace one with another .
41010001	And he got up , and went into the country of Judaea on the other side of Jordan : and great numbers of people came together to him again ; and , as was his way , he gave them teaching .
41010002	And Pharisees came to him , testing him with the question , Is it right for a man to put away his wife ?
41010003	And he said to them in answer , What did Moses say you were to do ?
41010004	And they said to him , Moses let us give her a statement in writing , and be free from her .
41010005	But Jesus said to them , Because of your hard hearts he gave you this law .
41010006	But from the first , male and female made he them .
41010007	For this cause will a man go away from his father and mother , and be joined to his wife ;
41010008	And the two will become one flesh ; so that they are no longer two , but one flesh .
41010009	Let not that which has been joined together by God be parted by man .
41010010	And in the house the disciples put questions to him again about this thing .
41010011	And he said to them , Whoever puts away his wife and takes another , is false to his wife ;
41010012	And if she herself puts away her husband and takes another , she is false to her husband .
41010013	And they took to him little children , so that he might put his hands on them : and the disciples said sharp words to them .
41010014	And when Jesus saw it , he was angry , and said to them , Let the little children come to me , and do not keep them away ; for of such is the kingdom of God .
41010015	Truly I say to you , Whoever does not put himself under the kingdom of God like a little child , will not come into it at all .
41010016	And he took them in his arms , and gave them a blessing , putting his hands on them .
41010017	And while he was going out into the way , a man came running to him , and went down on his knees , saying , Good Master , what have I to do so that I may have eternal life ?
41010018	And Jesus said to him , Why do you say I am good ? no one is good but one , and that is God .
41010019	You have knowledge of what is said in the law , Do not put any one to death , Do not be untrue in married life , Do not take what is not yours , Do not give false witness , Do not get money by deceit , Give honour to your father and mother .
41010020	And he said to him , Master , all these laws I have kept from the time when I was young .
41010021	And Jesus , looking on him and loving him , said , There is one thing needed : go , get money for your goods , and give it to the poor , and you will have wealth in heaven : and come with me .
41010022	But his face became sad at the saying , and he went away sorrowing : for he was one who had much property .
41010023	And Jesus , looking round about , said to his disciples , How hard it is for those who have wealth to come into the kingdom of God !
41010024	And the disciples were full of wonder at his words . But Jesus said to them again , Children , how hard it is for those who put faith in wealth to come into the kingdom of God !
41010025	It is simpler for a camel to go through a needle's eye , than for a man of wealth to come into the kingdom of God .
41010026	And they were greatly surprised , saying to him , Who then may have salvation ?
41010027	Jesus , looking on them , said , With men it is impossible , but not with God : for all things are possible with God .
41010028	Peter said to him , See , we have given up everything , and come after you .
41010029	Jesus said , Truly I say to you , There is no man who has given up house , or brothers , or sisters , or mother , or father , or children , or land , because of me and the good news ,
41010030	Who will not get a hundred times as much now in this time , houses , and brothers , and sisters , and mothers , and children , and land--though with great troubles ; and , in the world to come , eternal life .
41010031	But a great number who are first will be last : and those who are last will be first .
41010032	And they were on the way , going up to Jerusalem ; and Jesus was going before them : and they were full of wonder ; but those who came after him were in fear . And again he took the twelve , and gave them word of the things which were to come on him ,
41010033	Saying , See , we go up to Jerusalem ; and the Son of man will be given up to the chief priests and the scribes ; and they will give an order for his death , and will give him up to the Gentiles :
41010034	And they will make sport of him , and put shame on him , and give him cruel blows , and will put him to death ; and after three days he will come back from the dead .
41010035	And there came to him James and John , the sons of Zebedee , saying to him , Master , will you give us whatever may be our request ?
41010036	And he said to them , What would you have me do for you ?
41010037	And they said to him , Let us be seated , one at your right hand and one at your left , in your glory .
41010038	But Jesus said to them , You have no knowledge of what you are saying . Are you able to take of my cup ? or to undergo the baptism which I am to undergo ?
41010039	And they said to him , We are able . And Jesus said to them , You will take of the cup from which I take ; and the baptism which I am about to undergo you will undergo :
41010040	But to be seated at my right hand or at my left is not for me to give : but it is for those for whom it has been made ready .
41010041	And hearing this , the ten became very angry with James and John .
41010042	And Jesus made them come to him , and said to them , You see that those who are made rulers over the Gentiles are lords over them , and their great ones have authority over them .
41010043	But it is not so among you : but whoever has a desire to become great among you , let him be your servant :
41010044	And whoever has a desire to be first among you , let him be servant of all .
41010045	For truly the Son of man did not come to have servants , but to be a servant , and to give his life for the salvation of men .
41010046	And they came to Jericho : and when he was going out of Jericho , with his disciples and a great number of people , the son of Timaeus , Bartimaeus , a blind man , was seated by the wayside , with his hand out for money .
41010047	And when it came to his ears that it was Jesus of Nazareth , he gave a cry , and said , Jesus , Son of David , have mercy on me .
41010048	And some of them , turning in protest , gave him an order to be quiet : but he went on crying out all the more , Son of David , have mercy on me .
41010049	And Jesus came to a stop and said , Let him come . And crying out to the blind man , they said to him , Be comforted : come , he has sent for you .
41010050	And he , putting off his coat , got up quickly , and came to Jesus .
41010051	And Jesus said to him , What would you have me do to you ? And the blind man said , Master , make me able to see .
41010052	And Jesus said to him , Go on your way ; your faith has made you well . And straight away he was able to see , and went after him in the way .
41011001	And when they came near to Jerusalem , to Beth-phage and Bethany , at the Mountain of Olives , he sent two of his disciples ,
41011002	And said to them , Go into the little town opposite : and when you come to it , you will see a young ass with a cord round his neck , on which no man has ever been seated ; let him loose , and come back with him .
41011003	And if anyone says to you , Why are you doing this ? say , The Lord has need of him and will send him back straight away .
41011004	And they went away and saw a young ass by the door outside in the open street ; and they were getting him loose .
41011005	And some of those who were there said to them , What are you doing , taking the ass ?
41011006	And they said to them the words which Jesus had said ; and they let them go .
41011007	And they took the young ass to Jesus , and put their clothing on him , and he got on his back .
41011008	And a great number put down their clothing in the way ; and others put down branches which they had taken from the fields .
41011009	And those who went in front , and those who came after , were crying , Glory : A blessing on him who comes in the name of the Lord :
41011010	A blessing on the coming kingdom of our father David : Glory in the highest .
41011011	And he went into Jerusalem into the Temple ; and after looking round about on all things , it being now evening , he went out to Bethany with the twelve .
41011012	And on the day after , when they had come out from Bethany , he was in need of food .
41011013	And seeing a fig-tree in the distance with leaves , he went to see if by chance it had anything on it : and when he came to it , he saw nothing but leaves , for it was not the time for the fruit .
41011014	And he said to it , Let no man take fruit from you for ever . And his disciples took note of his words .
41011015	And they came to Jerusalem ; and he went into the Temple , and sent out those who were trading there , overturning the tables of the money-changers and the seats of those who were offering doves for money ;
41011016	And he would not let any man take a vessel through the Temple .
41011017	And he gave them teaching , and said to them , Is it not in the Writings , My house is to be named a house of prayer for all the nations ? but you have made it a hole of thieves .
41011018	And it came to the ears of the chief priests and scribes , and they took thought how they might put him to death ; being in fear of him , because all the people were full of wonder at his teaching .
41011019	And every evening he went out of the town .
41011020	And when they were going by in the morning , they saw the fig-tree dead from the roots .
41011021	And Peter , having a memory of it , said to him , Master , see , the tree which was cursed by you is dead .
41011022	And Jesus , answering , said to them , Have God's faith .
41011023	Truly I say to you , Whoever says to this mountain , Be taken up and be put into the sea ; and has no doubt in his heart , but has faith that what he says will come about , he will have his desire .
41011024	For this reason I say to you , Whatever you make a request for in prayer , have faith that it has been given to you , and you will have it .
41011025	And whenever you make a prayer , let there be forgiveness in your hearts , if you have anything against anyone ; so that you may have forgiveness for your sins from your Father who is in heaven .
41011027	And they came again to Jerusalem : and while he was walking in the Temple , there came to him the chief priests and the scribes and those in authority :
41011028	And they said to him , By what authority do you do these things ? or who gave you authority to do these things ?
41011029	And Jesus said to them , I will put to you one question ; give me an answer , and I will say by what authority I do these things .
41011030	The baptism of John , was it from heaven or from men ? give me an answer .
41011031	And they gave thought to it among themselves , saying , If we say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then did you not have faith in him ?
41011032	But if we say , From men--they were in fear of the people , because all took John to be truly a prophet .
41011033	And they said in answer to Jesus , We have no idea . And Jesus said to them , And I will not say to you by what authority I do these things .
41012001	And he gave them teaching in the form of stories . A man had a vine-garden planted , and put a wall about it , and made a place for crushing out the wine , and put up a tower , and let it out to field-workers , and went into another country .
41012002	And when the time came , he sent a servant to get from the workmen some of the fruit of the garden .
41012003	And they took him , and gave him blows , and sent him away with nothing .
41012004	And again he sent to them another servant ; and they gave him wounds on the head , and were very cruel to him .
41012005	And he sent another ; and they put him to death : and a number of others , whipping some , and putting some to death .
41012006	He still had one , a dearly loved son : he sent him last to them , saying , They will have respect for my son .
41012007	But those workmen said among themselves , This is he who will one day be the owner of the property ; come , let us put him to death , and the heritage will be ours .
41012008	And they took him and put him to death , pushing his body out of the garden .
41012009	What then will the master of the garden do ? He will come and put the workmen to death , and will give the garden into the hands of others .
41012010	Have you not seen this which is in the Writings : The stone which the builders put on one side , the same was made the chief stone of the building :
41012011	This was the Lord's doing , and it is a wonder in our eyes ?
41012012	And they made attempts to take him ; but they were in fear of the people , because they saw that the story was against them ; and they went away from him .
41012013	Then they sent to him certain of the Pharisees and the Herodians , so that they might make use of his words to take him by a trick .
41012014	And when they had come , they said to him , Master , we are certain that you are true , and have no fear of anyone : you have no respect for a man's position , but you are teaching the true way of God : Is it right to give taxes to Caesar or not ?
41012015	Are we to give or not to give ? But he , conscious of their false hearts , said to them , Why do you put me to the test ? give me a penny , so that I may see it .
41012016	And they gave him one . And he said to them , Whose is this image and name on it ? And they said to him , Caesar's .
41012017	And Jesus said to them , Give to Caesar the things which are Caesar's , and to God the things which are God's . And they were full of wonder at him .
41012018	And there came to him Sadducees , who say there is no coming back from the dead ; and they put a question to him , saying ,
41012019	Master , in the law Moses says , If a man's brother comes to his end , and has a wife still living and no child , it is right for his brother to take his wife , and get a family for his brother .
41012020	There were seven brothers : and the first took a wife , and at his death there were no offspring ;
41012021	And the second took her , and at his death there were no offspring ; and the third the same :
41012022	And all the seven had no seed . Last of all the woman herself came to her death .
41012023	In the future life , when they come back from the dead , whose wife will she be ? for the seven had her for a wife .
41012024	Jesus said to them , Is not this the reason for your error , that you have no knowledge of the holy Writings or of the power of God ?
41012025	When they come back from the dead , they do not get married , but are like the angels in heaven .
41012026	But as to the dead coming back to life ; have you not seen in the book of Moses , about the burning thorn-tree , how God said to him , I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ?
41012027	He is not the God of the dead , but of the living : you are greatly in error .
41012028	And one of the scribes came , and hearing their argument together , and seeing that he had given them a good answer , put the question to him , Which law is the first of all ?
41012029	Jesus said in answer , The first is , Give ear , O Israel : The Lord our God is one Lord ;
41012030	And you are to have love for the Lord your God with all your heart , and with all your soul , and with all your mind , and with all your strength .
41012031	The second is this , Have love for your neighbour as for yourself . There is no other law greater than these .
41012032	And the scribe said to him , Truly , Master , you have well said that he is one , and there is no other but he :
41012033	And to have love for him with all the heart , and with all the mind , and with all the strength , and to have the same love for his neighbour as for himself , is much more than all forms of offerings .
41012034	And when Jesus saw that he gave a wise answer , he said to him , You are not far from the kingdom of God . And every man after that was in fear of questioning him any more .
41012035	And Jesus , when he was teaching in the Temple , said , How do the scribes say that the Christ is the Son of David ?
41012036	David himself said in the Holy Spirit , The Lord said to my Lord , Be seated at my right hand , till I put those who are against you under your feet .
41012037	David himself gives him the name of Lord ; and how then is he his son ? And the common people gave ear to him gladly .
41012038	And in his teaching he said , Be on your watch against the scribes , whose pleasure it is to go about in long robes and be respected in the market-places ,
41012039	And to have the chief seats in the Synagogues and the first places at feasts ;
41012040	Who take away the property of widows , and before the eyes of men make long prayers ; these will be judged more hardly .
41012041	And he took a seat by the place where the money was kept , and saw how the people put money into the boxes : and a number who had wealth put in much .
41012042	And there came a poor widow , and she put in two little bits of money , which make a farthing .
41012043	And he made his disciples come to him , and said to them , Truly I say to you , This poor widow has put in more than all those who are putting money into the box :
41012044	Because they all put in something out of what they had no need for ; but she out of her need put in all she had , even all her living .
41013001	And when he was going out of the Temple , one of his disciples said to him , Master , see , what stones and what buildings !
41013002	And Jesus said to him , Do you see these great buildings ? there is not one stone here resting on another which will not be overturned .
41013003	And while he was seated on the Mountain of Olives opposite the Temple , Peter and James and John and Andrew said to him privately ,
41013004	Say when these things will be , and what will be the sign when these things are all about to be done .
41013005	And Jesus said to them , Take care that you are not tricked by anyone .
41013006	People will come in my name , saying , I am he ; and a number will be turned from the true way .
41013007	And when you have news of wars and talk of wars , do not be troubled ; these things have to be , but it is still not the end .
41013008	Nation will go to war with nation , and kingdom with kingdom : there will be earth-shocks in different places ; there will be times when there is no food ; these things are the first of the troubles .
41013009	But take care : for they will give you up to the Sanhedrins ; and in Synagogues you will be whipped ; and you will be taken before rulers and kings because of me , for a sign to them .
41013010	And the good news has first to be given to all the nations .
41013011	And when you are taken and given up to be judged , do not be troubled about what to say : but whatever is given to you in that hour , say : because it is not you who say it , but the Holy Spirit .
41013012	And brother will give up brother to death , and the father his child ; and children will go against their fathers and mothers , and put them to death .
41013013	And you will be hated by all men , because of my name ; but he who goes through to the end will have salvation .
41013014	But when you see the unclean thing which makes destruction , in the place where it has no right to be ( let this be clear to the reader ) , then let those who are in Judaea go quickly to the mountains :
41013015	And let him who is on the house-top not go down , or go in , to take anything out of his house :
41013016	And let not him who is in the field go back to take his coat .
41013017	And it will be hard for women who are with child and for her who has a baby at the breast in those days .
41013018	And say a prayer that it may not be in the winter .
41013019	For in those days there will be sorrow , such as there has not been from the time when God made the world till now , and will not ever be again .
41013020	And if the Lord had not made the time short , no flesh would have been kept from destruction ; but because of the saints he has made the time short .
41013021	And then if any man says to you , See , here is Christ ; or , See , there ; have no faith in it :
41013022	Because there will be false Christs and false prophets , and they will give signs and wonders in the hope of turning even the saints from the true way .
41013023	But take care ; see , I have made all things clear to you before the time .
41013024	But in those days , after that time of trouble , the sun will be made dark and the moon will not give her light ,
41013025	And the stars will be falling from heaven , and the powers which are in the heavens will be moved .
41013026	And then they will see the Son of man coming in clouds with great power and glory .
41013027	And then he will send out the angels , and will get together his saints from the four winds , from the farthest part of the earth to the farthest part of heaven .
41013028	Take an example from the fig-tree : when its branches become soft and put out their leaves , you see that the summer is near ;
41013029	Even so , when you see these things taking place , you may be certain that he is near , even at the doors .
41013030	Truly , I say to you , This generation will not come to an end till all these things are complete .
41013031	Heaven and earth will come to an end , but my words will not come to an end .
41013032	But of that day or that hour no one has knowledge , not even the angels in heaven , or the Son , but the Father .
41013033	Take care , keep watch with prayer : for you are not certain when the time will be .
41013034	It is as when a man who is in another country for a time , having gone away from his house , and given authority to his servants and to everyone his work , gives the porter an order to keep watch .
41013035	So you are to keep watch : because you are not certain when the master of the house is coming , in the evening , or in the middle of the night , or at the cock's cry , or in the morning ;
41013036	For fear that , coming suddenly , he sees you sleeping .
41013037	And what I say to you , I say to all , Keep watch .
41014001	It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread : and the chief priests and the scribes made designs how they might take him by deceit and put him to death :
41014002	But they said , Not while the feast is going on , for fear there may be trouble among the people .
41014003	And while he was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper , seated at table , there came a woman with a bottle of perfumed oil of great price ; and when the bottle was broken she put the perfume on his head .
41014004	But some of them were angry among themselves , saying , For what purpose has this oil been wasted ?
41014005	We might have got more than three hundred pence for it , and given the money to the poor . And they said things against her among themselves .
41014006	But Jesus said , Let her be ; why are you troubling her ? she has done a kind act to me .
41014007	The poor you have ever with you , and whenever you have the desire you may do them good : but me you have not for ever .
41014008	She has done what she was able : she has put oil on my body to make it ready for its last resting-place .
41014009	And truly I say to you , Wherever the good news goes out through all the earth , what this woman has done will be talked of in memory of her .
41014010	And Judas Iscariot , who was one of the twelve , went away to the chief priests , so that he might give him up to them .
41014011	And hearing what he said , they were glad , and gave him their word to make him a payment of money . And he took thought how he might best give him up to them .
41014012	And on the first day of unleavened bread , when the Passover lamb is put to death , his disciples said to him , Where are we to go and make ready for you to take the Passover meal ?
41014013	And he sent two of his disciples , and said to them , Go into the town , and there will come to you a man with a vessel of water : go after him ;
41014014	And wherever he goes in , say to the owner of the house , The Master says , Where is my guest-room , where I may take the Passover with my disciples ?
41014015	And he will take you up himself to a great room with a table and seats : there make ready for us .
41014016	And the disciples went out and came into the town , and saw that it was as he had said : and they made ready the Passover .
41014017	And when it was evening he came with the twelve .
41014018	And while they were seated taking food , Jesus said , Truly I say to you , One of you will be false to me , one who is taking food with me .
41014019	They were sad , and said to him one by one , Is it I ?
41014020	And he said to them , It is one of the twelve , one who is putting his bread with me into the same plate .
41014021	The Son of man goes , even as the Writings say of him : but cursed is that man through whom the Son of man is given up ! It would have been well for that man if he had never been given birth .
41014022	And while they were taking food , he took bread , and after blessing it , he gave the broken bread to them , and said , Take it : this is my body .
41014023	And he took a cup , and when he had given praise , he gave it to them : and they all had a drink from it .
41014024	And he said to them , This is my blood of the testament , which is given for men .
41014025	Truly I say to you , I will take no more of the fruit of the vine till the day when I take it new in the kingdom of God .
41014026	And after a song of praise to God they went out to the Mountain of Olives .
41014027	And Jesus said to them , You will all be turned away from me : for it is in the Writings , I will put the keeper of the sheep to death , and the sheep will be put to flight .
41014028	But after I have come back from the dead , I will go before you into Galilee .
41014029	But Peter said to him , Though the others may be turned away from you , I will not .
41014030	And Jesus said to him , Truly , I say to you that you , today , even this night , before the cock's second cry , will say three times that you have no knowledge of me .
41014031	But he said with passion , If I have to be put to death with you , I will not be false to you . And they all said the same .
41014032	And they came to a place which was named Gethsemane : and he said to his disciples , Be seated here while I say a prayer .
41014033	And he took with him Peter and James and John , and grief and great trouble came on him .
41014034	And he said to them , My soul is very sad , even to death : be here a little time , and keep watch .
41014035	And he went forward a little , and falling down on the earth , made request that , if possible , the hour might go from him .
41014036	And he said , Abba , Father , all things are possible to you ; take away this cup from me : but even so let not my pleasure , but yours be done .
41014037	And he came , and saw them sleeping , and said to Peter , Simon , are you sleeping ? were you not able to keep watch one hour ?
41014038	Keep watch with prayer , so that you may not be put to the test ; the spirit truly is ready , but the flesh is feeble .
41014039	And again he went away , and said a prayer , using the same words .
41014040	And again he came and saw them sleeping , because their eyes were very tired ; and they had nothing to say in answer .
41014041	And he came the third time , and said to them , Go on sleeping now and take your rest : it is enough ; the hour has come ; see , the Son of man is given up into the hands of evil men .
41014042	Get up , let us be going ; see , he who gives me up is near .
41014043	And straight away , while he was still talking , Judas , one of the twelve , came , and with him a great band with swords and sticks , from the chief priests and the scribes and those in authority .
41014044	Now he who had been false to him had given them a sign , saying , The one to whom I give a kiss , that is he ; take him , and get him away safely .
41014045	And when he had come , he went straight to him and said , Master ; and gave him a kiss .
41014046	And they put their hands on him , and took him .
41014047	But a certain one of those who were near took out his sword , and gave the servant of the high priest a blow , cutting off his ear .
41014048	And Jesus said to them , Have you come out as against a thief , with swords and sticks to take me ?
41014049	I was with you every day in the Temple teaching , and you did not take me ; but this is done so that the Writings may come true .
41014050	And they all went away from him in fear .
41014051	And a certain young man went after him , with only a linen cloth about his body ; and they put their hands on him ;
41014052	But he got away unclothed , without the linen cloth .
41014053	And they took Jesus away to the high priest ; and there came together with him all the chief priests and those in authority and the scribes .
41014054	And Peter had come after him at a distance , even into the house of the high priest ; and he was seated with the captains , warming himself in the light of the fire .
41014055	Now the chief priests and all the Sanhedrin were looking for witness against Jesus so that they might put him to death ; and they were unable to get any .
41014056	For a number gave false witness against him and their witness was not in agreement .
41014057	Then some got up and gave false witness against him , saying ,
41014058	He said in our hearing , I will put an end to this Temple which is made with hands , and in three days I will make another without hands .
41014059	And even so their witness was not in agreement .
41014060	And the high priest got up in the middle of them , and said to Jesus , Do you say nothing in answer ? what is it which these say against you ?
41014061	But he kept quiet and said nothing . Again the high priest questioning him said , Are you the Christ , the son of the Holy One ?
41014062	And Jesus said , I am : and you will see the Son of man seated at the right hand of power , and coming with the clouds of heaven .
41014063	And the high priest , violently parting his robes , said , What more need have we of witnesses ?
41014064	His words against God have come to your ears : what is your opinion ? And they all said it was right for him to be put to death .
41014065	And some put shame on him and , covering his face , gave him blows and said to him , Now say what is to come : and the captains took him and gave him blows with their hands .
41014066	And while Peter was down in the open square of the building , one of the servant-girls of the high priest came ;
41014067	And seeing Peter warming himself by the fire , she gave him a look , and said , You were with this Nazarene , even Jesus .
41014068	But he said , I have no knowledge of him , or of what you are saying : and he went out into the doorway ; and there came the cry of a cock .
41014069	And the girl saw him , and said again to those who were near , This is one of them .
41014070	But again he said it was not so . And after a little time , again those who were near said to Peter , Truly you are one of them ; for you are a Galilaean .
41014071	But , with curses and oaths , he said , I have no knowledge of the man about whom you are talking .
41014072	And in the same minute , the cock gave a second cry . And it came to Peter's mind how Jesus had said to him , Before the cock's second cry , you will say three times that you have no knowledge of me . And at this thought he was overcome with weeping .
41015001	And the first thing in the morning the chief priests , with those in authority and the scribes and all the Sanhedrin , had a meeting , and put cords round Jesus , and took him away , and gave him up to Pilate .
41015002	And Pilate put a question to him , Are you the King of the Jews ? And he , answering , said to him , You say so .
41015003	And the chief priests said a number of things against him .
41015004	And Pilate again put a question , Do you say nothing in answer ? see how much evil they say you have done .
41015005	But Jesus gave no more answers , so that Pilate was full of wonder .
41015006	Now at the feast every year he let one prisoner go free at their request .
41015007	And there was one named Barabbas , in prison with those who had gone against the government and in the fight had taken life .
41015008	And the people went up , requesting him to do as he had done for them in other years .
41015009	And Pilate said in answer to them , Is it your desire that I let the King of the Jews go free ?
41015010	For he saw that the chief priests had given him up through envy .
41015011	But the people were moved by the chief priests to make him let Barabbas go free .
41015012	And Pilate again said in answer to them , What then am I to do to him to whom you give the name of the King of the Jews ?
41015013	And they said again loudly , To the cross with him !
41015014	And Pilate said to them , Why , what evil has he done ? But their cry was the louder , To the cross !
41015015	And Pilate , desiring to do what was pleasing to the people , let Barabbas go free , and gave up Jesus , when he had been whipped , to be put to death on the cross .
41015016	And the men of the army took him away into the square in front of the building which is the Praetorium , and they got together all the band .
41015017	And they put a purple robe on him , and twisting a crown of thorns , they put it on him ;
41015018	And , as if honouring him , they said , Long life to the King of the Jews !
41015019	And they gave him blows on the head with a stick and put shame on him and , going down on their knees , gave him worship .
41015020	And when they had made sport of him , they took the purple robe off him and put his clothing on him . And they took him out to put him to death on the cross .
41015021	And they made one , Simon of Cyrene , the father of Alexander and Rufus , who was going by , coming from the country , go with them , so that he might take his cross .
41015022	And they took him to the place named Golgotha , which is , Dead Man's Head .
41015023	And they gave him wine mixed with myrrh ; but he did not take it .
41015024	And he was nailed to the cross ; and they made a division of his clothing among them , putting to the decision of chance what everyone was to take .
41015025	And it was the third hour when they put him on the cross .
41015026	And the statement of his crime was put in writing on the cross , THE KING OF THE JEWS .
41015027	And they put two thieves on crosses with him , one on his right side , and one on his left .
41015029	And those who went by made sport of him , shaking their heads , and saying , Ha ! you who give the Temple to destruction , and put it up again in three days ,
41015030	Keep yourself from death , and come down from the cross .
41015031	In the same way the chief priests , laughing at him among themselves with the scribes , said , A saviour of others , he has no salvation for himself .
41015032	Let the Christ , the King of Israel , come down now from the cross , so that we may see and have belief . And those who were put on crosses with him said evil things against him .
41015033	And when the sixth hour had come , it was dark over all the land till the ninth hour .
41015034	And at the ninth hour , Jesus said in a loud voice , Eloi , Eloi , lama sabachthani ? which is , My God , my God , why are you turned away from me ?
41015035	And some of those who were near , hearing it , said , See , he is crying to Elijah .
41015036	And one of them went quickly and , getting a sponge full of bitter wine , put it on a rod , and gave it to him for drink , saying , Let be ; let us see if Elijah will come to take him down .
41015037	And Jesus gave a loud cry , and gave up his spirit .
41015038	And the curtain of the Temple was parted in two from end to end .
41015039	And when the captain , who was near , saw how he gave up his spirit , he said , Truly this man was a son of God .
41015040	And there were women watching from a distance : among them were Mary Magdalene , and Mary , the mother of James the less and of Joses , and Salome ,
41015041	Who went with him when he was in Galilee and took care of him ; and a number of other women who came up with him to Jerusalem .
41015042	And when it was evening , because it was the time of getting ready , that is , the day before the Sabbath ,
41015043	There came Joseph of Arimathaea , a responsible man in high honour , who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God ; and he went in to Pilate without fear , and made a request for the body of Jesus .
41015044	And Pilate was surprised that he was dead ; and , sending for the captain , he put a question to see if he had been dead for long .
41015045	And when he had news of it from the captain , he let Joseph have the body .
41015046	And he got a linen cloth and , taking him down , put the linen cloth round him , and put him in a place for the dead which had been cut out of a rock ; and a stone was rolled against the door .
41015047	And Mary Magdalene and Mary , the mother of Joses , saw where he was put .
41016001	And when the Sabbath was past , Mary Magdalene and Mary , the mother of James , and Salome , got spices , so that they might come and put them on him .
41016002	And very early after dawn on the first day of the week , they came at the time of the coming up of the sun to the place where the body had been put .
41016003	And they were saying among themselves , Who will get the stone rolled away from the door for us ?
41016004	And looking up , they saw that the stone was rolled back ; and it was of great size .
41016005	And when they went in , they saw a young man seated on the right side , dressed in a white robe ; and they were full of wonder .
41016006	And he said to them , Do not be troubled : you are looking for Jesus , the Nazarene , who has been put to death on the cross ; he has come back from the dead ; he is not here : see , the place where they put him !
41016007	But go , say to his disciples and to Peter , He goes before you into Galilee : there you will see him , as he said to you .
41016008	And they went out quickly from the place , because fear and great wonder had come on them : and they said nothing to anyone , because they were full of fear that . . .
41016009	Now when he came back from the dead early on the first day of the week , he went first to Mary Magdalene , from whom he had sent out seven evil spirits .
41016010	She went and gave news of it to those who had been with him , while they were sorrowing and weeping .
41016011	And they , when it came to their ears that he was living , and had been seen by her , had no belief in it .
41016012	And after these things he was seen in another form by two of them , while they were walking on their way into the country .
41016013	And they went away and gave news of it to the rest ; and they had no belief in what was said .
41016014	And later he was seen by the eleven themselves while they were taking food ; and he said sharp words to them because they had no faith and their hearts were hard , and because they had no belief in those who had seen him after he had come back from the dead .
41016015	And he said to them , Go into all the world , and give the good news to everyone .
41016016	He who has faith and is given baptism will get salvation ; but he who has not faith will be judged .
41016017	And these signs will be with those who have faith : in my name they will send out evil spirits ; and they will make use of new languages ;
41016018	They will take up snakes , and if there is poison in their drink , it will do them no evil ; they will put their hands on those who are ill , and they will get well .
41016019	So then the Lord Jesus , after he had said these words to them , was taken up into heaven and took his seat at the right hand of God .
41016020	And they went out , preaching everywhere , the Lord working with them , and giving witness to the word by the signs which came after . So be it .
42001001	As a number of attempts have been made to put together in order an account of those events which took place among us ,
42001002	As they were handed down to us by those who saw them from the first and were preachers of the word ,
42001003	It seemed good to me , having made observation , with great care , of the direction of events in their order , to put the facts in writing for you , most noble Theophilus ;
42001004	So that you might have certain knowledge of those things about which you were given teaching .
42001005	In the days of Herod , king of Judaea , there was a certain priest , by name Zacharias , of the order of Abijah ; and he had a wife of the family of Aaron , and her name was Elisabeth .
42001006	They were upright in the eyes of God , keeping all the rules and orders of God , and doing no wrong .
42001007	And they were without children , because Elisabeth had never given birth , and they were at that time very old .
42001008	Now it came about that in his turn he was acting as priest before God ,
42001009	And as was the way of the priests , he had to go into the Temple to see to the burning of perfumes .
42001010	And all the people were offering prayers outside , at the time of the burning of perfumes .
42001011	And he saw an angel of the Lord in his place on the right side of the altar .
42001012	And Zacharias was troubled when he saw him , and fear came on him .
42001013	But the angel said , Have no fear , Zacharias , for your prayer has come to the ears of God , and your wife Elisabeth will have a son , and his name will be John .
42001014	And you will be glad and have great delight ; and numbers of people will have joy at his birth .
42001015	For he will be great in the eyes of the Lord ; he will not take wine or strong drink ; and he will be full of the Spirit of God from his birth .
42001016	And through him great numbers of the children of Israel will be turned to the Lord their God .
42001017	And he will go before his face in the spirit and power of Elijah , turning the hearts of fathers to their children , and wrongdoers to the way of righteousness ; to make ready a people whose hearts have been turned to the Lord .
42001018	And Zacharias said to the angel , How may I be certain of this ? For I am an old man , and my wife is far on in years .
42001019	And the angel , answering , said , I am Gabriel , whose place is before God ; I have been sent to say these words to you and to give you this good news .
42001020	Now , see , you will be without voice or language till the day when these things come about , because you had not faith in my words , which will have effect at the right time .
42001021	And the people were waiting for Zacharias and were surprised because he was in the Temple for such a long time .
42001022	And when he came out he was not able to say anything , and they saw that he had seen a vision in the Temple ; and he was making signs to them without words .
42001023	And when the days of his work in the Temple were ended , he went back to his house .
42001024	After that time , Elisabeth , being certain that she was to become a mother , kept herself from men's eyes for five months , saying ,
42001025	The Lord has done this to me , for his eyes were on me , to take away my shame in the eyes of men .
42001026	Now in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town in Galilee , named Nazareth ,
42001027	To a virgin who was to be married to a man named Joseph , of the family of David ; and the name of the virgin was Mary .
42001028	And the angel came in to her and said , Peace be with you , to whom special grace has been given ; the Lord is with you .
42001029	But she was greatly troubled at his words , and said to herself , What may be the purpose of these words ?
42001030	And the angel said to her , Have no fear , Mary , for you have God's approval .
42001031	And see , you will give birth to a son , and his name will be Jesus .
42001032	He will be great , and will be named the Son of the Most High : and the Lord God will give him the kingdom of David , his father :
42001033	He will have rule over the house of Jacob for ever , and of his kingdom there will be no end .
42001034	And Mary said to the angel , How may this be , because I have had no knowledge of a man ?
42001035	And the angel in answer said to her , The Holy Spirit will come on you , and the power of the Most High will come to rest on you , and so that which will come to birth will be named holy , Son of God .
42001036	Even now Elisabeth , who is of your family , is to be a mother , though she is old : and this is the sixth month with her who was without children .
42001037	For there is nothing which God is not able to do .
42001038	And Mary said : I am the servant of the Lord ; may it be to me as you say . And the angel went away .
42001039	Then Mary got up and went quickly into the high lands , to a town of Judah ;
42001040	And went into the house of Zacharias and took Elisabeth in her arms .
42001041	And when the voice of Mary came to the ears of Elisabeth , the baby made a sudden move inside her ; then Elisabeth was full of the Holy Spirit ,
42001042	And she said with a loud voice : May blessing be on you among women , and a blessing on the child of your body .
42001043	How is it that the mother of my Lord comes to me ?
42001044	For , truly , when the sound of your voice came to my ears , the baby in my body made a sudden move for joy .
42001045	Happy will she be who had faith that the things which the Lord has said to her will be done .
42001046	And Mary said : My soul gives glory to God ;
42001047	My spirit is glad in God my Saviour .
42001048	For he has had pity on his servant , though she is poor and lowly placed : and from this hour will all generations give witness to the blessing which has come to me .
42001049	For he who is strong has done great things for me ; and holy is his name .
42001050	His mercy is for all generations in whom is the fear of him .
42001051	With his arm he has done acts of power ; he has put to flight those who have pride in their hearts .
42001052	He has put down kings from their seats , lifting up on high the men of low degree .
42001053	Those who had no food he made full of good things ; the men of wealth he sent away with nothing in their hands ;
42001054	His help he has given to Israel , his servant , so that he might keep in mind his mercy to Abraham and his seed for ever ,
42001055	As he gave his word to our fathers .
42001056	And Mary was with her for about three months and then went back to her house .
42001057	Now it was time for Elisabeth to give birth , and she had a son .
42001058	And it came to the ears of her neighbours and relations that the Lord had been very good to her , and they took part in her joy .
42001059	And on the eighth day they came to see to the circumcision of the child , and they would have given him the name of Zacharias , his father's name ;
42001060	But his mother made answer and said , No , his name is John .
42001061	And they said , Not one of your relations has that name .
42001062	And they made signs to his father , to say what name was to be given to him .
42001063	And he sent for writing materials and put down : His name is John ; and they were all surprised .
42001064	And straight away his mouth was open and his tongue was free and he gave praise to God .
42001065	And fear came on all those who were living round about them : and there was much talk about all these things in all the hill-country of Judaea .
42001066	And all who had word of them kept them in their minds and said , What will this child be ? For the hand of the Lord was with him .
42001067	And his father , Zacharias , was full of the Holy Spirit , and with the voice of a prophet said these words :
42001068	Praise be to the Lord , the God of Israel , for he has come to his people and made them free ,
42001069	Lifting up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David ,
42001070	( As he said , by the mouth of his holy prophets , from the earliest times , )
42001071	Salvation from those who are against us , and from the hands of those who have hate for us ;
42001072	To do acts of mercy to our fathers and to keep in mind his holy word ,
42001073	The oath which he made to Abraham , our father ,
42001074	That we , being made free from the fear of those who are against us , might give him worship ,
42001075	In righteousness and holy living before him all our days .
42001076	And you , child , will be named the prophet of the Most High : you will go before the face of the Lord , to make ready his ways ;
42001077	To give knowledge of salvation to his people , through the forgiveness of sins ,
42001078	Because of the loving mercies of our God , by which the dawn from heaven has come to us ,
42001079	To give light to those in dark places , and in the shade of death , so that our feet may be guided into the way of peace .
42001080	And the child became tall , and strong in spirit ; and he was living in the waste land till the day when he came before the eyes of Israel .
42002001	Now it came about in those days that an order went out from Caesar Augustus that there was to be a numbering of all the world .
42002002	This was the first numbering , which was made when Quirinius was ruler of Syria .
42002003	And all men went to be numbered , everyone to his town .
42002004	And Joseph went up from Galilee , out of the town of Nazareth , into Judaea , to Beth-lehem , the town of David , because he was of the house and family of David ,
42002005	To be put on the list with Mary , his future wife , who was about to become a mother .
42002006	And while they were there , the time came for her to give birth .
42002007	And she had her first son ; and folding him in linen , she put him to rest in the place where the cattle had their food , because there was no room for them in the house .
42002008	And in the same country there were keepers of sheep in the fields , watching over their flock by night .
42002009	And an angel of the Lord came to them , and the glory of the Lord was shining round about them : and fear came on them .
42002010	And the angel said , Have no fear ; for truly , I give you good news of great joy which will be for all the people :
42002011	For on this day , in the town of David , a Saviour has come to birth , who is Christ the Lord .
42002012	And this is the sign to you : you will see a young child folded in linen , in the place where the cattle have their food .
42002013	And suddenly there was with the angel a great band of spirits from heaven , giving praise to God , and saying ,
42002014	Glory to God in the highest , and on the earth peace among men with whom he is well pleased .
