44016020	And when they had taken them before the authorities , they said , These men , who are Jews , are greatly troubling our town ;
44016021	Teaching rules of living which it is not right for us to have or to keep , being Romans .
44016022	And the people made an attack on them all together : and the authorities took their clothing off them , and gave orders for them to be whipped .
44016023	And when they had given them a great number of blows , they put them in prison , giving orders to the keeper of the prison to keep them safely :
44016024	And he , having such orders , put them into the inner prison with chains on their feet .
44016025	But about the middle of the night , Paul and Silas were making prayers and songs to God in the hearing of the prisoners ;
44016026	And suddenly there was an earth-shock , so that the base of the prison was moved : and all the doors came open , and everyone's chains came off .
44016027	And the keeper , coming out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , took his sword and was about to put himself to death , fearing that the prisoners had got away .
44016028	But Paul said in a loud voice , Do yourself no damage , for we are all here .
44016029	And he sent for lights and came rushing in and , shaking with fear , went down on his face before Paul and Silas ,
44016030	And took them out and said , Sirs , what have I to do to get salvation ?
44016031	And they said , Have faith in the Lord Jesus , and you and your family will have salvation .
44016032	And they gave the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house .
44016033	And that same hour of the night , he took them , and when he had given attention to their wounds , he and all his family had baptism straight away .
44016034	And he took them into his house and gave them food , and he was full of joy , having faith in God with all his family .
44016035	But when it was day , the authorities sent the police , saying , Let these men go .
44016036	And the keeper said to Paul , The authorities have given orders to let you go : come out now , and go in peace .
44016037	But Paul said to them , They have given us who are Romans a public whipping without judging us , and have put us in prison . Will they now send us out secretly ? no , truly , let them come themselves and take us out .
44016038	And the police gave an account of these words to the authorities , and they were full of fear on hearing that they were Romans ;
44016039	Then they came and made prayers to them , requesting them , when they had taken them out , to go away from the town .
44016040	And they came out of the prison and went to the house of Lydia : and when they had seen the brothers they gave them comfort and went away .
44017001	Now when they had gone through Amphipolis and Apollonia they came to Thessalonica , where there was a Synagogue of the Jews :
44017002	And Paul , as he generally did , went in to them , and on three Sabbath days had discussions with them from the holy Writings ,
44017003	Saying to them clearly and openly that Christ had to be put to death and come back to life again ; and that this Jesus , whom , he said , I am preaching to you , is the Christ .
44017004	And some of them had faith , and were joined to Paul and Silas ; and a number of the God-fearing Greeks , and some of the chief women .
44017005	But the Jews , being moved with envy , took with them certain low persons from among the common people , and getting together a great number of people , made an outcry in the town , attacking the house of Jason with the purpose of taking them out to the people .
44017006	And when they were not able to get them , they took Jason and some of the brothers by force before the rulers of the town , crying , These men , who have made trouble all over the world have now come here ;
44017007	Whom Jason has taken into his house : and they are acting against the orders of Caesar , saying that there is another king , Jesus .
44017008	And hearing these things the people and the rulers of the town were troubled .
44017009	And having made Jason and the others give an undertaking to keep the peace , they let them go .
44017010	And the brothers straight away sent Paul and Silas away by night to Beroea : and they , when they came there , went to the Synagogue of the Jews .
44017011	Now these were more noble than the Jews of Thessalonica , for they gave serious attention to the word , searching in the holy Writings every day , to see if these things were so .
44017012	And a number of them had faith , and no small number of the Greek women of high position and of the men .
44017013	But when the Jews of Thessalonica had news that Paul was preaching the word at Beroea , they came there , troubling the people and working them up .
44017014	So the brothers sent Paul straight away to the sea : but Silas and Timothy kept there still .
44017015	But those who went with Paul took him as far as Athens , and then went away , with orders from him to Silas and Timothy to come to him quickly .
44017016	Now while Paul was waiting for them at Athens , his spirit was troubled , for he saw all the town full of images of the gods .
44017017	So he had discussions in the Synagogue with the Jews and God-fearing Gentiles , and every day in the market-place with those who were there .
44017018	And some of those who were supporters of the theories of the Epicureans and the Stoics , had a meeting with him . And some said , What is this talker of foolish words saying ? And others , He seems to be a preacher of strange gods : because he was preaching of Jesus and his coming back from the dead .
44017019	And they took him to Mars ' Hill , saying , Will you make clear to us what is this new teaching of yours ?
44017020	For you seem to us to say strange things , and we have a desire to get the sense of them .
44017021	( Now all the Athenians and the men from other lands who come there were giving all their time to talking or hearing of anything new . )
44017022	And Paul got to his feet on Mars ' Hill and said , O men of Athens , I see that you are overmuch given to fear of the gods .
44017023	For when I came by , I was looking at the things to which you give worship , and I saw an altar with this writing on it , TO THE GOD OF WHOM THERE IS NO KNOWLEDGE . Now , what you , without knowledge , give worship to , I make clear to you .
44017024	The God who made the earth and everything in it , he , being Lord of heaven and earth , is not housed in buildings made with hands ;
44017025	And he is not dependent on the work of men's hands , as if he had need of anything , for he himself gives to all life and breath and all things ;
44017026	And he has made of one blood all the nations of men living on all the face of the earth , ordering their times and the limits of their lands ,
44017027	So that they might make search for God , in order , if possible , to get knowledge of him and make discovery of him , though he is not far from every one of us :
44017028	For in him we have life and motion and existence ; as certain of your verse writers have said , For we are his offspring .
44017029	If then we are the offspring of God , it is not right for us to have the idea that God is like gold or silver or stone , formed by the art or design of man .
44017030	Those times when men had no knowledge were overlooked by God ; but now he gives orders to all men in every place to undergo a change of heart :
44017031	Because a day has been fixed in which all the world will be judged in righteousness by the man who has been marked out by him for this work ; of which he has given a sign to all men by giving him back from the dead .
44017032	Now on hearing about the coming back from death , some of them made sport of it , but others said , Let us go more fully into this another time .
44017033	And so Paul went away from among them .
44017034	But some men gave him their support : among whom was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
44018001	After these things , he went away from Athens , and came to Corinth .
44018002	And there he came across a certain Jew named Aquila , a man of Pontus by birth , who not long before had come from Italy with his wife Priscilla , because Claudius had given orders that all Jews were to go away from Rome : and he came to them ;
44018003	And because he was of the same trade , he was living with them , and they did their work together ; for by trade they were tent-makers .
44018004	And every Sabbath he had discussions in the Synagogue , turning Jews and Greeks to the faith .
44018005	And when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia , Paul was completely given up to the word , preaching to the Jews that the Christ was Jesus .
44018006	And when they put themselves against him , and said evil words , he said , shaking his clothing , Your blood be on your heads , I am clean : from now I will go to the Gentiles .
44018007	And moving from there , he went into the house of a man named Titus Justus , a God-fearing man , whose house was very near the Synagogue .
44018008	And Crispus , the ruler of the Synagogue , with all his family , had faith in the Lord ; and a great number of the people of Corinth , hearing the word , had faith and were given baptism .
44018009	And the Lord said to Paul in the night , in a vision , Have no fear and go on preaching :
44018010	For I am with you , and no one will make an attack on you to do you damage : for I have a number of people in this town .
44018011	And he was there for a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
44018012	But when Gallio was ruler of Achaia , all the Jews together made an attack on Paul , and took him to the judge's seat ,
44018013	Saying , This man is teaching the people to give worship to God in a way which is against the law .
44018014	But when Paul was about to say something , Gallio said to the Jews , If this was anything to do with wrongdoing or crime , there would be a reason for me to give you a hearing :
44018015	But if it is a question of words or names or of your law , see to it yourselves ; I will not be a judge of such things .
44018016	And he sent them away from the judge's seat .
44018017	And they all made an attack on Sosthenes , the ruler of the Synagogue , and gave him blows before the judge's seat ; but Gallio gave no attention to these things .
44018018	And Paul , after waiting some days , went away from the brothers and went by ship to Syria , Priscilla and Aquila being with him ; and he had had his hair cut off in Cenchrea , for he had taken an oath .
44018019	And they came down to Ephesus and he left them there : and he himself went into the Synagogue and had a discussion with the Jews .
44018020	And being requested by them to be there for a longer time , he said , No ;
44018021	And went from them , saying , I will come back to you if God lets me ; and he took ship from Ephesus .
44018022	And when he had come to land at Caesarea , he went to see the church , and then went down to Antioch .
44018023	And having been there for some time , he went through the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , making the disciples strong in the faith .
44018024	Now a certain Jew named Apollos , an Alexandrian by birth , and a man of learning , came to Ephesus ; and he had great knowledge of the holy Writings .
44018025	This man had been trained in the way of the Lord ; and burning in spirit , he gave himself up to teaching the facts about Jesus , though he had knowledge only of John's baptism :
44018026	And he was preaching in the Synagogue without fear . But Priscilla and Aquila , hearing his words , took him in , and gave him fuller teaching about the way of God .
44018027	And when he had a desire to go over into Achaia , the brothers gave him help , and sent letters to the disciples requesting them to take him in among them : and when he had come , he gave much help to those who had faith through grace :
44018028	For he overcame the Jews in public discussion , making clear from the holy Writings that the Christ was Jesus .
44019001	And it came about that while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul , having gone through the higher country , came to Ephesus , where there were certain disciples :
44019002	And he said to them , Did you get the Holy Spirit when you had faith ? And they said to him , No , we have had no knowledge of the Holy Spirit .
44019003	And he said , What sort of baptism did you have ? And they said , The baptism of John .
44019004	And Paul said , John gave a baptism which goes with a change of heart , saying to the people that they were to have faith in him who was coming after him , that is , in Jesus .
44019005	And hearing this , they had baptism in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	And when Paul had put his hands on them , the Holy Spirit came on them ; and they had the power of talking in tongues , and acting like prophets .
44019007	And there were about twelve of these men .
44019008	And he went into the Synagogue , and for three months he was preaching there without fear , reasoning and teaching about the kingdom of God .
44019009	But because some of the people were hard-hearted and would not give hearing , saying evil words about the Way before the people , he went away from them , and kept the disciples separate , reasoning every day in the school of Tyrannus .
44019010	And this went on for two years , so that all those who were living in Asia had knowledge of the word of the Lord , Greeks as well as Jews .
44019011	And God did special works of power by the hands of Paul :
44019012	So that bits of linen and clothing from his body were taken to people who were ill , and their diseases went away from them and the evil spirits went out .
44019013	But some of the Jews who went from place to place driving out evil spirits , took it on themselves to make use of the name of the Lord Jesus over those who had evil spirits , saying , I give you orders , by Jesus , whom Paul is preaching .
44019014	And there were seven sons of a man named Sceva , a Jew and a chief priest , who did this .
44019015	And the evil spirit , answering , said to them , I have knowledge of Jesus , and of Paul , but who are you ?
44019016	And the man in whom the evil spirit was , jumping on them , was stronger than the two of them , and overcame them , so that they went running from that house , wounded and without their clothing .
44019017	And this came to the ears of all those , Jews and Greeks , who were living at Ephesus ; and fear came on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was made great .
44019018	And a number of those who had faith came and made a public statement of their sins and all their acts .
44019019	And a great number of those who were experts in strange arts took their books and put them on the fire in front of everyone : and when the books were valued they came to fifty thousand bits of silver .
44019020	So the word of the Lord was increased very greatly and was full of power .
44019021	Now after these things were ended , Paul came to a decision that when he had gone through Macedonia and Achaia he would go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I have a desire to see Rome .
44019022	And having sent two of his helpers , Timothy and Erastus , into Macedonia , he himself went on living in Asia for a time .
44019023	And about that time a great outcry took place about the Way .
44019024	For there was a certain man named Demetrius , a silver-worker , who made silver boxes for the images of Diana , and gave no small profit to the workmen ;
44019025	Whom he got together , with other workmen of the same trade , and said to them , Men , it is clear that from this business we get our wealth .
44019026	And you see , for it has come to your ears , that not only at Ephesus , but almost all through Asia , this Paul has been teaching numbers of people and turning them away , saying that those are not gods who are made by men's hands :
44019027	And there is danger , not only that our trade may be damaged in the opinion of men , but that the holy place of the great goddess Diana may be no longer honoured , and that she to whom all Asia and the world give worship , will be put down from her high position .
44019028	And hearing this , they were very angry , crying out and saying , Great is Diana of Ephesus .
44019029	And the town was full of noise and trouble , and they all came running into the theatre , having taken by force Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia who were journeying in company with Paul .
44019030	And when Paul was about to go in to the people , the disciples did not let him .
44019031	And some of the rulers of Asia , being his friends , sent to him , requesting him seriously not to put himself in danger by going into the theatre .
44019032	And some said one thing , and some another : for there was no order in the meeting ; and most of them had no idea why they had come together .
44019033	Then they took Alexander out from among the people , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander , making a sign with his hand , was about to make a statement to the people in answer :
44019034	But when they saw that he was a Jew , all of them with one voice went on crying out for about two hours , Great is Diana of Ephesus .
44019035	And when the chief secretary had got the people quiet , he said , Men of Ephesus , is any man without knowledge that the town of Ephesus is the keeper of the holy place of the great Diana , who was sent down from Jupiter ?
44019036	So then , because these things may not be doubted , it would be better for you to be quiet , and do nothing unwise .
44019037	For you have taken these men , who are not doing damage to the holy place or talking against our goddess .
44019038	If , then , Demetrius and the workmen who are with him have a protest to make against any man , the law is open to them , and there are judges ; let them put up a cause at law against one another .
44019039	But if any other business is in question , let it be taken up in the regular meeting .
44019040	For , truly , we are in danger of being made responsible for this day's trouble , there being no cause for it : and we are not able to give any reason for this coming together .
44019041	And when he had said this , he sent the meeting away .
44020001	And after the noise had come to an end , Paul , having sent for the disciples and given them comfort , went away from them to Macedonia .
44020002	And when he had gone through those parts and given them much teaching , he came into Greece .
44020003	And when he had been there three months , because the Jews had made a secret design against him when he was about to take ship for Syria , he made a decision to go back through Macedonia .
44020004	And Sopater of Beroea , the son of Pyrrhus , and Aristarchus and Secundus of Thessalonica , and Gaius of Derbe , and Timothy , and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia , went with him as far as Asia .
44020005	But these had gone before , and were waiting for us at Troas .
44020006	And we went away from Philippi by ship after the days of unleavened bread , and came to them at Troas in five days ; and we were there for seven days .
44020007	And on the first day of the week , when we had come together for the holy meal , Paul gave them a talk , for it was his purpose to go away on the day after ; and he went on talking till after the middle of the night .
44020008	And there were a number of lights in the room where we had come together .
44020009	And a certain young man named Eutychus , who was seated in the window , went into a deep sleep ; and while Paul went on talking , being overcome by sleep , he had a fall from the third floor , and was taken up dead .
44020010	And Paul went down and , falling on him , took him in his arms and said , Do not be troubled , for his life is in him .
44020011	And when he had gone up , and had taken the broken bread , he went on talking to them for a long time , even till dawn , and then he went away .
44020012	And they took the boy in , living , and were greatly comforted .
44020013	But we , going before him by ship , went to Assos with the purpose of taking Paul in there : for so he had given orders , because he himself was coming by land .
44020014	And when he came up with us at Assos , we took him in the ship and went on to Mitylene .
44020015	And going from there by sea , we came on the day after opposite Chios , and touching at Samos on the day after that , we came on the third day to Miletus .
44020016	For Paul's purpose was to go past Ephesus , so that he might not be kept in Asia ; for he was going quickly , in order , if possible , to be at Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost .
44020017	And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus for the rulers of the church .
44020018	And when they had come , he said to them , You yourselves have seen what my life has been like all the time from the day when I first came into Asia ,
44020019	Doing the Lord's work without pride , through all the sorrow and troubles which came on me because of the evil designs of the Jews :
44020020	And how I kept back nothing which might be of profit to you , teaching you publicly and privately ,
44020021	Preaching to Jews and to Greeks the need for a turning of the heart to God , and faith in the Lord Jesus Christ .
44020022	And now , as you see , I am going to Jerusalem , a prisoner in spirit , having no knowledge of what will come to me there :
44020023	Only that the Holy Spirit makes clear to me in every town that prison and pains are waiting for me .
44020024	But I put no value on my life , if only at the end of it I may see the work complete which was given to me by the Lord Jesus , to be a witness of the good news of the grace of God .
44020025	And now I am conscious that you , among whom I have gone about preaching the kingdom , will not see my face again .
44020026	And so I say to you this day that I am clean from the blood of all men .
44020027	For I have not kept back from you anything of the purpose of God .
44020028	Give attention to yourselves , and to all the flock which the Holy Spirit has given into your care , to give food to the church of God , for which he gave his blood .
44020029	I am conscious that after I am gone , evil wolves will come in among you , doing damage to the flock ;
44020030	And from among yourselves will come men who will give wrong teaching , turning away the disciples after them .
44020031	So keep watch , having in mind that for three years without resting I was teaching every one of you , day and night , with weeping .
44020032	And now , I give you into the care of God and the word of his grace , which is able to make you strong and to give you your heritage among all the saints .
44020033	I have had no desire for any man's silver or gold or clothing .
44020034	You yourselves have seen that with these hands I got what was necessary for me and those who were with me .
44020035	In all things I was an example to you of how , in your lives , you are to give help to the feeble , and keep in memory the words of the Lord Jesus , how he himself said , There is a greater blessing in giving than in getting .
44020036	And having said these words , he went down on his knees in prayer with them all .
44020037	And they were all weeping , falling on Paul's neck and kissing him ,
44020038	Being sad most of all because he had said that they would not see his face again . And so they went with him to the ship .
44021001	And after parting from them , we put out to sea and came straight to Cos , and the day after to Rhodes , and from there to Patara :
44021002	And as there was a ship going to Phoenicia , we went in it .
44021003	And when we had come in view of Cyprus , going past it on our left , we went on to Syria , and came to land at Tyre : for there the goods which were in the ship had to be taken out .
44021004	And meeting the disciples we were there for seven days : and they gave Paul orders through the Spirit not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021005	And when these days came to an end , we went on our journey ; and they all , with their wives and children , came with us on our way till we were out of the town : and after going on our knees in prayer by the sea ,
44021006	We said our last words to one another , and got into the ship , and they went back to their houses .
44021007	And journeying by ship from Tyre we came to Ptolemais ; and there we had talk with the brothers and were with them for one day .
44021008	And on the day after , we went away and came to Caesarea , where we were guests in the house of Philip , the preacher , who was one of the seven .
44021009	And he had four daughters , virgins , who were prophets .
44021010	And while we were waiting there for some days , a certain prophet , named Agabus , came down from Judaea .
44021011	And he came to us , and took the band of Paul's clothing , and putting it round his feet and hands , said , The Holy Spirit says these words , So will the Jews do to the man who is the owner of this band , and they will give him up into the hands of the Gentiles .
44021012	And hearing these things , we and those who were living in that place made request to him not to go to Jerusalem .
44021013	Then Paul said , What are you doing , weeping and wounding my heart ? for I am ready , not only to be a prisoner , but to be put to death at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
44021014	And as he might not be moved we did no more , saying , Let the purpose of God be done .
44021015	And after these days we got ready and went up to Jerusalem .
44021016	And some of the disciples from Caesarea went with us , taking a certain Mnason of Cyprus , one of the early disciples , in whose house we were to be living .
44021017	And when we came to Jerusalem , the brothers were pleased to see us .
44021018	And on the day after , Paul went with us to James , and all the rulers of the church were present .
44021019	And when he had said how glad he was to see them , he gave them a detailed account of the things which God had done through his work among the Gentiles .
44021020	And hearing it , they gave praise to God ; and they said to him , You see , brother , what thousands there are among the Jews , who have the faith ; and they all have a great respect for the law :
44021021	And they have had news of you , how you have been teaching all the Jews among the Gentiles to give up the law of Moses , and not to give circumcision to their children , and not to keep the old rules .
44021022	What then is the position ? They will certainly get news that you have come .
44021023	Do this , then , which we say to you : We have four men who have taken an oath ;
44021024	Go with these , and make yourself clean with them , and make the necessary payments for them , so that they may be free from their oath : and everyone will see that the statements made about you are not true , but that you put yourself under rule , and keep the law .
44021025	But as to the Gentiles who have the faith , we sent a letter , giving our decision that they were to keep themselves from offerings made to false gods , and from blood , and from the flesh of animals put to death in ways against the law , and from the evil desires of the body .
44021026	Then Paul took the men , and on the day after , making himself clean with them , he went into the Temple , giving out the statement that the days necessary for making them clean were complete , till the offering was made for every one of them .
44021027	And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews from Asia , seeing him in the Temple , got the people together and put their hands on him ,
44021028	Crying out , Men of Israel , come to our help : this is the man who is teaching all men everywhere against the people and the law and this place : and in addition , he has taken Greeks into the Temple , and made this holy place unclean .
44021029	For they had seen him before in the town with Trophimus of Ephesus , and had the idea that Paul had taken him with him into the Temple .
44021030	And all the town was moved , and the people came running together and put their hands on Paul , pulling him out of the Temple : and then the doors were shut .
44021031	And while they were attempting to put him to death , news came to the chief captain of the band that all Jerusalem was out of control .
44021032	And straight away he took some armed men and went quickly down to them : and the Jews , seeing them , gave no more blows to Paul .
44021033	Then the chief captain came near and took him , and gave orders for him to be put in chains , questioning them as to who he was and what he had done .
44021034	And some said one thing and some another , among the people : and as he was not able to get a knowledge of the facts because of the noise , he gave orders for Paul to be taken into the army building .
44021035	And when he came on to the steps , he was lifted up by the armed men , because of the force of the people ;
44021036	For a great mass of people came after them , crying out , Away with him !
44021037	And when Paul was about to be taken into the building , he said to the chief captain , May I say something to you ? And he said , Have you a knowledge of Greek ?
44021038	Are you by chance the Egyptian who , before this , got the people worked up against the government and took four thousand men of the Assassins out into the waste land ?
44021039	But Paul said , I am a Jew of Tarsus in Cilicia , which is not an unimportant town : I make a request to you to let me say a word to the people .
44021040	And when he let him do so , Paul , from the steps , made a sign with his hand to the people , and when they were all quiet , he said to them in the Hebrew language ,
44022001	My brothers and fathers , give ear to the story of my life which I now put before you .
44022002	And , hearing him talking in the Hebrew language , they became the more quiet , and he said ,
44022003	I am a Jew of Tarsus in Cilicia by birth , but I had my education in this town at the feet of Gamaliel , being trained in the keeping of every detail of the law of our fathers ; given up to the cause of God with all my heart , as you are today .
44022004	And I made attacks on this Way , even to death , taking men and women and putting them in prison .
44022005	Of which the high priest will be a witness , and all the rulers , from whom I had letters to the brothers ; and I went into Damascus , to take those who were there as prisoners to Jerusalem for punishment .
44022006	And it came about that while I was on my journey , coming near to Damascus , about the middle of the day , suddenly I saw a great light from heaven shining round me .
44022007	And when I went down on the earth , a voice came to my ears saying to me , Saul , Saul , why are you attacking me so cruelly ?
44022008	And I , answering , said , Who are you ; Lord ? And he said to me , I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom you are attacking .
44022009	And those who were with me saw the light , but the voice of him who was talking to me came not to their ears .
44022010	And I said , What have I to do , Lord ? And the Lord said to me , Get up , and go into Damascus ; and it will be made clear to you what you have to do .
44022011	And because I was unable to see because of the glory of that light , those who were with me took me by the hand , and so I came to Damascus .
44022012	And one Ananias , a God-fearing man , who kept the law , and of whom all the Jews in that place had a high opinion ,
44022013	Came to my side and said , Brother Saul , let your eyes be open . And in that very hour I was able to see him .
44022014	And he said , You have been marked out by the God of our fathers to have knowledge of his purpose , and to see the Upright One and to give ear to the words of his mouth .
44022015	For you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and of what has come to your ears .
44022016	And now , why are you waiting ? get up , and have baptism , for the washing away of your sins , giving worship to his name .
44022017	And it came about that when I had come back to Jerusalem , while I was at prayer in the Temple , my senses became more than naturally clear ,
44022018	And I saw him saying to me , Go out of Jerusalem straight away because they will not give hearing to your witness about me .
44022019	And I said , Lord , they themselves have knowledge that I went through the Synagogues putting in prison and whipping all those who had faith in you :
44022020	And when Stephen your witness was put to death , I was there , giving approval , and looking after the clothing of those who put him to death .
44022021	And he said to me , Go , for I will send you far away to the Gentiles .
44022022	And they gave him a hearing as far as this word ; then with loud voices they said , Away with this man from the earth ; it is not right for him to be living .
44022023	And while they were crying out , and pulling off their clothing , and sending dust into the air ,
44022024	The chief captain gave orders for him to be taken into the army building , saying that he would put him to the test by whipping , so that he might have knowledge of the reason why they were crying out so violently against him .
44022025	And when they had put leather bands round him , Paul said to the captain who was present , Is it the law for you to give blows to a man who is a Roman and has not been judged ?
44022026	And hearing this , the man went to the chief captain and gave him an account of it , saying , What are you about to do ? for this man is a Roman .
44022027	And the chief captain came to him and said , Give me an answer , are you a Roman ? And he said , Yes .
44022028	And the chief captain said , I got Roman rights for myself at a great price . And Paul said , But I had them by birth .
44022029	Then those who were about to put him to the test went away : and the chief captain was in fear , seeing that he was a Roman , and that he had put chains on him .
44022030	But on the day after , desiring to have certain knowledge of what the Jews had to say against him , he made him free , and gave orders for the chief priests and all the Sanhedrin to come together , and he took Paul and put him before them .
44023001	And Paul , looking fixedly at the Sanhedrin , said , My brothers , my life has been upright before God till this day .
44023002	And the high priest , Ananias , gave orders to those who were near him to give him a blow on the mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him , God will give blows to you , you whitewashed wall : are you here to be my judge by law , and by your orders am I given blows against the law ?
44023004	And those who were near said , Do you say such words against God's high priest ?
44023005	And Paul said , Brother , I had no idea that he was the high priest : for it has been said , You may not say evil about the ruler of your people .
44023006	But when Paul saw that half of them were Sadducees and the rest Pharisees , he said in the Sanhedrin , Brothers , I am a Pharisee , and the son of Pharisees : I am here to be judged on the question of the hope of the coming back from the dead .
44023007	And when he had said this , there was an argument between the Pharisees and the Sadducees , and a division in the meeting .
44023008	For the Sadducees say that there is no coming back from the dead , and no angels or spirits : but the Pharisees have belief in all these .
44023009	And there was a great outcry : and some of the scribes on the side of the Pharisees got up and took part in the discussion , saying , We see no evil in this man : what if he has had a revelation from an angel or a spirit ?
44023010	And when the argument became very violent , the chief captain , fearing that Paul would be pulled in two by them , gave orders to the armed men to take him by force from among them , and take him into the army building .
44023011	And the night after , the Lord came to his side and said , Be of good heart , for as you have been witnessing for me in Jerusalem , so will you be my witness in Rome .
44023012	And when it was day , the Jews came together and put themselves under an oath that they would take no food or drink till they had put Paul to death .
44023013	And more than forty of them took this oath .
44023014	And they came to the chief priests and the rulers and said , We have taken a great oath to take no food till we have put Paul to death
44023015	So now , will you and the Sanhedrin make a request to the military authorities to have him sent down to you , as if you were desiring to go into the business in greater detail ; and we , before ever he gets to you , will be waiting to put him to death .
44023016	But Paul's sister's son had word of their design , and he came into the army building and gave news of it to Paul .
44023017	And Paul sent for a captain and said , Take this young man to your chief , for he has news for him .
44023018	So he took him to the chief captain and said , Paul , the prisoner , made a request to me to take this young man to you , for he has something to say to you .
44023019	And the chief took him by the hand and , going on one side , said to him privately , What is it you have to say to me ?
44023020	And he said , The Jews are in agreement together to make a request to you for Paul to be taken , on the day after this , into the Sanhedrin , to be questioned in greater detail .
44023021	But do not give way to them , for more than forty of them are waiting for him , having taken an oath not to take food or drink till they have put him to death : and now they are ready , waiting for your order .
44023022	So the chief captain let the young man go , saying to him , Do not say to anyone that you have given me word of these things .
44023023	And he sent for two captains and said , Make ready two hundred men , with seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen , to go to Caesarea , at the third hour of the night :
44023024	And get beasts so that they may put Paul on them , and take him safely to Felix , the ruler .
44023025	And he sent a letter in these words :
44023026	Claudius Lysias , to the most noble ruler , Felix , peace be with you .
44023027	This man was taken by the Jews , and was about to be put to death by them , when I came on them with the army and took him out of danger , having knowledge that he was a Roman .
44023028	And , desiring to get at the reason for their attack on him , I took him down to their Sanhedrin :
44023029	Then it became clear to me that it was a question of their law , and that nothing was said against him which might be a reason for prison or death .
44023030	And when news was given to me that a secret design was being made against the man , I sent him straight away to you , giving orders to those who are against him to make their statements before you .
44023031	So the armed men , as they were ordered , took Paul and came by night to Antipatris .
44023032	But on the day after , they sent the horsemen on with him , and went back to their place :
44023033	And they , when they came to Caesarea , gave the letter to the ruler , and took Paul before him .
44023034	And after reading it , he said , What part of the country do you come from ? And , hearing that he was from Cilicia ,
44023035	I will give hearing to your cause , he said , when those who are against you have come . And he gave orders for him to be kept in Herod's Praetorium .
44024001	And after five days , the high priest , Ananias , came with certain of the rulers , and an expert talker , one Tertullus ; and they made a statement to Felix against Paul .
44024002	And when he had been sent for , Tertullus , starting his statement , said , Because by you we are living in peace , and through your wisdom wrongs are put right for this nation ,
44024003	In all things and in all places we are conscious of our great debt to you , most noble Felix .
44024004	But , so that I may not make you tired , I make a request to you of your mercy , to give hearing to a short statement .
44024005	For this man , in our opinion , is a cause of trouble , a maker of attacks on the government among Jews through all the empire , and a chief mover in the society of the Nazarenes :
44024006	Who , in addition , was attempting to make the Temple unclean : whom we took ,
44024008	And from whom you will be able , by questioning him yourself , to get knowledge of all the things which we say against him .
44024009	And the Jews were in agreement with his statement , saying that these things were so .
44024010	Then when the ruler had given him a sign to make his answer , Paul said , Because I have knowledge that you have been a judge over this nation for a number of years , I am glad to make my answer :
44024011	Seeing that you are able to make certain of the fact that it is not more than twelve days from the time when I came up to Jerusalem for worship ;
44024012	And they have not seen me in argument with any man in the Temple , or working up the feelings of the people , in the Synagogues or in the town :
44024013	And they are not able to give facts in support of the things which they say against me now .
44024014	But this I will say openly to you , that I do give worship to the God of our fathers after that Way , which to them is not the true religion : but I have belief in all the things which are in the law and in the books of the prophets :
44024015	Hoping in God for that which they themselves are looking for , that there will be a coming back from the dead for upright men and wrongdoers .
44024016	And in this , I do my best at all times to have no reason for shame before God or men .
44024017	Now after a number of years I came to give help and offerings to my nation :
44024018	And having been made clean , I was in the Temple , but not with a great number of people , and not with noise : but there were certain Jews from Asia ,
44024019	And it would have been better if they had come here to make a statement , if they have anything against me .
44024020	Or let these men here present say what wrongdoing was seen in me when I was before the Sanhedrin ,
44024021	But only this one thing which I said among them in a loud voice , I am this day being judged on the question of the coming back from the dead .
44024022	But Felix , who had a more detailed knowledge of the Way , put them off , saying , When Lysias , the chief captain , comes down , I will give attention to your business .
44024023	And he gave orders to the captain to keep Paul under his control , and to let him have everything he had need of ; and not to keep his friends from coming to see him .
44024024	But after some days , Felix came with Drusilla his wife , who was of the Jews by birth , and sent for Paul , and gave hearing to him about faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	And while he was talking about righteousness and self-control and the judging which was to come , Felix had great fear and said , Go away for the present , and when the right time comes I will send for you .
44024026	For he was hoping that Paul would give him money : so he sent for him more frequently and had talk with him .
44024027	But after two years Porcius Festus took the place of Felix , who , desiring to have the approval of the Jews , kept Paul in chains .
44025001	So Festus , having come into that part of the country which was under his rule , after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea .
44025002	And the chief priests and the chief men of the Jews made statements against Paul ,
44025003	Requesting Festus to give effect to their design against him , and send him to Jerusalem , when they would be waiting to put him to death on the way .
44025004	But Festus , in answer , said that Paul was being kept in prison at Caesarea , and that in a short time he himself was going there .
44025005	So , he said , let those who have authority among you go with me , and if there is any wrong in the man , let them make a statement against him .
44025006	And when he had been with them not more than eight or ten days , he went down to Caesarea ; and on the day after , he took his place on the judge's seat , and sent for Paul .
44025007	And when he came , the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem came round him , and made all sorts of serious statements against him , which were not supported by the facts .
44025008	Then Paul , in his answer to them , said , I have done no wrong against the law of the Jews , or against the Temple , or against Caesar .
44025009	But Festus , desiring to get the approval of the Jews , said to Paul , Will you go up to Jerusalem , and be judged before me there in connection with these things ?
44025010	And Paul said , I am before the seat of Caesar's authority where it is right for me to be judged : I have done no wrong to the Jews , as you are well able to see .
44025011	If , then , I am a wrongdoer and there is a cause of death in me , I am ready for death : if it is not as they say against me , no man may give me up to them . Let my cause come before Caesar .
44025012	Then Festus , having had a discussion with the Jews , made answer , You have said , Let my cause come before Caesar ; to Caesar you will go .
44025013	Now when some days had gone by , King Agrippa and Bernice came to Caesarea and went to see Festus .
44025014	And as they were there for some days , Festus gave them Paul's story , saying , There is a certain man here who was put in prison by Felix :
44025015	Against whom the chief priests and the rulers of the Jews made a statement when I was at Jerusalem , requesting me to give a decision against him .
44025016	To whom I gave answer that it is not the Roman way to give a man up , till he has been face to face with those who are attacking him , and has had a chance to give an answer to the statements made against him .
44025017	So , when they had come together here , straight away , on the day after , I took my place on the judge's seat and sent for the man .
44025018	But when they got up they said nothing about such crimes as I had in mind :
44025019	But had certain questions against him in connection with their religion , and about one Jesus , now dead , who , Paul said , was living .
44025020	And as I had not enough knowledge for the discussion of these things , I made the suggestion to him to go to Jerusalem and be judged there .
44025021	But when Paul made a request that he might be judged by Caesar , I gave orders for him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar .
44025022	And Agrippa said to Festus , I have a desire to give the man a hearing myself . Tomorrow , he said , you may give him a hearing .
44025023	So on the day after , when Agrippa and Bernice in great glory had come into the public place of hearing , with the chief of the army and the chief men of the town , at the order of Festus , Paul was sent for .
44025024	And Festus said , King Agrippa , and all those who are present here with us , you see this man , about whom all the Jews have made protests to me , at Jerusalem and in this place , saying that it is not right for him to be living any longer .
44025025	But , in my opinion , there is no cause of death in him , and as he himself has made a request to be judged by Caesar , I have said that I would send him .
44025026	But I have no certain account of him to send to Caesar . So I have sent for him to come before you , and specially before you , King Agrippa , so that after the business has been gone into , I may have something to put in writing .
44025027	For it seems to me against reason to send a prisoner without making clear what there is against him .
44026001	And Agrippa said to Paul , You may put your cause before us . Then Paul , stretching out his hand , made his answer , saying :
44026002	In my opinion I am happy , King Agrippa , to be able to give my answer before you today to all these things which the Jews say against me :
44026003	The more so , because you are expert in all questions to do with the Jews and their ways : so I make my request to you to give me a hearing to the end .
44026004	All the Jews have knowledge of my way of life from my early years , as it was from the start among my nation , and at Jerusalem ;
44026005	And they are able to say , if they would give witness , that I was living as a Pharisee , in that division of our religion which is most regular in the keeping of the law .
44026006	And now I am here to be judged because of the hope given by God's word to our fathers ;
44026007	For the effecting of which our twelve tribes have been working and waiting night and day with all their hearts . And in connection with this hope I am attacked by the Jews , O king !
44026008	Why , in your opinion , is it outside belief for God to make the dead come to life again ?
44026009	For I , truly , was of the opinion that it was right for me to do a number of things against the name of Jesus of Nazareth .
44026010	And this I did in Jerusalem : and numbers of the saints I put in prison , having had authority given to me from the chief priests , and when they were put to death , I gave my decision against them .
44026011	And I gave them punishment frequently , in all the Synagogues , forcing them to say things against God ; and burning with passion against them , I went after them even into far-away towns .
44026012	Then , when I was journeying to Damascus with the authority and orders of the chief priests ,
44026013	In the middle of the day , on the road I saw a light from heaven , brighter than the sun , shining round me and those who were journeying with me .
44026014	And when we had all gone down on the earth , a voice came to me , saying in the Hebrew language , Saul , Saul , why are you attacking me so cruelly ? It is hard for you to go against the impulse which is driving you .
44026015	And I said , Who are you , Lord ? And the Lord said , I am Jesus , whom you are attacking .
44026016	But get up on your feet : for I have come to you for this purpose , to make you a servant and a witness of the things in which you have seen me , and of those in which you will see me ;
44026017	And I will keep you safe from the people , and from the Gentiles , to whom I send you ,
44026018	To make their eyes open , turning them from the dark to the light , and from the power of Satan to God , so that they may have forgiveness of sins and a heritage among those who are made holy by faith in me .
44026019	So , then , King Agrippa , I did not go against the vision from heaven ;
44026020	But I went about , first to those in Damascus and Jerusalem , and through all the country of Judaea , and then to the Gentiles , preaching a change of heart , so that they , being turned to God , might give , in their works , the fruits of a changed heart .
44026021	For this reason , the Jews took me in the Temple , and made an attempt to put me to death .
44026022	And so , by God's help , I am here today , witnessing to small and great , saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would come about ;
44026023	That the Christ would go through pain , and being the first to come back from the dead , would give light to the people and to the Gentiles .
44026024	And when he made his answer in these words , Festus said in a loud voice , Paul , you are off your head ; your great learning has made you unbalanced .
44026025	Then Paul said , I am not off my head , most noble Festus , but my words are true and wise .
44026026	For the king has knowledge of these things , to whom I am talking freely ; being certain that all this is common knowledge to him ; for it has not been done in secret .
44026027	King Agrippa , have you faith in the prophets ? I am certain that you have .
44026028	And Agrippa said to Paul , A little more and you will be making me a Christian .
44026029	And Paul said , It is my prayer to God that , in little or great measure , not only you , but all those hearing me today might be even as I am , but for these chains .
44026030	And the king and the ruler and Bernice and those who were seated with them got up ;
44026031	And when they had gone away they said to one another , This man has done nothing which might give cause for death or prison .
44026032	And Agrippa said to Festus , This man might have been made free , if he had not put his cause before Caesar .
44027001	And when the decision had been made that we were to go by sea to Italy , they gave Paul and certain other prisoners into the care of a captain named Julius , of the Augustan band .
44027002	And we went to sea in a ship of Adramyttium which was sailing to the sea towns of Asia , Aristarchus , a Macedonian of Thessalonica , being with us .
44027003	And on the day after , we came to Sidon ; and Julius was kind to Paul , and let him go to see his friends and take a rest .
44027004	And sailing again from there , we went on under cover of Cyprus , because the wind was against us .
44027005	And having gone across the sea off Cilicia and Pamphylia we came to Myra , in Lycia .
44027006	And there the captain came across a ship of Alexandria , sailing for Italy , and put us in it .
44027007	And when we had gone on slowly for a long time , and had had hard work getting across to Cnidus , for the wind was against us , we went under cover of Crete , in the direction of Salmone ;
44027008	And sailing down the side of it , as well as we were able , we came to a certain place named Fair Havens , near which was the town of Lasea .
44027009	And as a long time had gone by , and the journey was now full of danger , because it was late in the year , Paul put the position before them ,
44027010	Saying , Friends , I see that this journey will be one of great damage and loss , not only to the goods and the ship , but to ourselves .
44027011	But the captain gave more attention to the master and the owner of the ship than to what Paul said .
44027012	And as the harbour was not a good one in which to be for the winter , the greater number of them were for going out to sea , in order , if possible , to put in for the winter at Phoenix , a harbour of Crete , looking to the north-east and south-east .
44027013	And when the south wind came softly , being of the opinion that their purpose might be effected , they let the ship go and went sailing down the side of Crete , very near to the land .
44027014	But after a little time , a very violent wind , named Euraquilo , came down from it with great force .
44027015	And when the ship got into the grip of it , and was not able to make headway into the wind , we gave way , and went before it .
44027016	And , sailing near the side of a small island named Cauda , we were able , though it was hard work , to make the ship's boat safe :
44027017	And having got it up , they put cords under and round the ship ; but fearing that they might be pushed on to the Syrtis , they let down the sails and so went running before the wind .
44027018	And , still fighting the storm with all our strength , the day after they made a start at getting the goods out of the ship ;
44027019	And on the third day , they let all the sailing apparatus go over the side .
44027020	And as we had not seen the sun or stars for a long time , and a great storm was on us , all hope of salvation was gone .
44027021	And when they had been without food for a long time , Paul got up among them and said , Friends , it would have been better if you had given attention to me and not gone sailing out from Crete , to undergo this damage and loss .
44027022	But now , I say to you , be of good heart , for there will be no loss of life , but only of the ship .
44027023	For this night there came to my side an angel of the God who is my Master and whose servant I am ,
44027024	Saying , Have no fear , Paul , for you will come before Caesar , and God has given to you all those who are sailing with you .
44027025	And so , O men , be of good heart , for I have faith in God that it will be as he said to me .
44027026	But we will be sent on to a certain island .
44027027	But when the fourteenth day came , while we were going here and there in the Adriatic sea , about the middle of the night the sailors had an idea that they were getting near land ;
44027028	And they let down the lead , and saw that the sea was a hundred and twenty feet deep ; and after a little time they did it again and it was ninety feet .
44027029	Then , fearing that by chance we might come on to the rocks , they let down four hooks from the back of the ship , and made prayers for the coming of day .
44027030	Then the sailors made attempts secretly to get away from the ship , letting down a boat as if they were about to put down hooks from the front of the ship ;
44027031	But Paul said to the captain and his men , If you do not keep these men in the ship , you will not be safe .
44027032	Then the armed men , cutting the cords of the boat , let her go .
44027033	And when dawn was near , Paul gave them all orders to take food , saying , This is the fourteenth day you have been waiting and taking no food .
44027034	So I make request to you to take food ; for this is for your salvation : not a hair from the head of any of you will come to destruction .
44027035	And when he had said this and had taken bread , he gave praise to God before them all , and took a meal of the broken bread .
44027036	Then they all took heart and did the same .
44027037	And we were , in the ship , two hundred and seventy-six persons .
44027038	And when they had had enough food , they made the weight of the ship less , turning the grain out into the sea .
44027039	And when it was day , they had no knowledge of the land , but they saw an inlet of the sea with a floor of sand , and they had the idea of driving the ship up on to it if possible .
44027040	So cutting away the hooks , and letting them go into the sea , and freeing the cords of the guiding-blades , and lifting up the sail to the wind , they went in the direction of the inlet .
44027041	And coming to a point between two seas , they got the ship to land ; and the front part was fixed in the sand and not able to be moved , but the back part was broken by the force of the waves .
44027042	Then the armed men were for putting the prisoners to death , so that no one would get away by swimming .
44027043	But the captain , desiring to keep Paul safe , kept them from their purpose , and gave orders that those who had knowledge of swimming were to go off the ship and get first to land :
44027044	And the rest , some on boards and some on things from the ship . And so it came about that they all got safe to land .
44028001	And when we were safe , we made the discovery that the island was named Melita .
44028002	And the simple people living there were uncommonly kind to us , for they made a fire for us , and took us in , because it was raining and cold .
44028003	But when Paul had got some sticks together and put them on the fire , a snake came out , because of the heat , and gave him a bite on the hand .
44028004	And when the people saw it hanging on his hand , they said to one another , Without doubt this man has put someone to death , and though he has got safely away from the sea , God will not let him go on living .
44028005	But shaking off the beast into the fire , he got no damage .
44028006	But they had the idea that they would see him becoming ill , or suddenly falling down dead ; but after waiting a long time , and seeing that no damage came to him , changing their opinion , they said he was a god .
44028007	Now near that place there was some land , the property of the chief man of the island , who was named Publius ; who very kindly took us into his house as his guests for three days .
44028008	And the father of Publius was ill , with a disease of the stomach ; to whom Paul went , and put his hands on him , with prayer , and made him well .
44028009	And when this took place , all the others in the island who had diseases came and were made well .
44028010	Then they gave us great honour , and , when we went away , they put into the ship whatever things we were in need of .
44028011	And after three months we went to sea in a ship of Alexandria sailing under the sign of the Dioscuri , which had been at the island for the winter .
44028012	And going into the harbour at Syracuse , we were waiting there for three days .
44028013	And from there , going about in a curve , we came to Rhegium : and after one day a south wind came up and on the day after we came to Puteoli :
44028014	Where we came across some of the brothers , who kept us with them for seven days ; and so we came to Rome .
44028015	And the brothers , when they had news of us , came out from town as far as Appii Forum and the Three Taverns to have a meeting with us : and Paul , seeing them , gave praise to God and took heart .
44028016	And when we came into Rome , they let Paul have a house for himself and the armed man who kept watch over him .
44028017	Then after three days he sent for the chief men of the Jews : and when they had come together , he said to them , My brothers , though I had done nothing against the people or the ways of our fathers , I was given , a prisoner from Jerusalem , into the hands of the Romans .
44028018	Who , when they had put questions to me , were ready to let me go free , because there was no cause of death in me .
44028019	But when the Jews made protest against it , I had to put my cause into Caesar's hands ; not because I have anything to say against my nation .
44028020	But for this reason I sent for you , to see and have talk with you : for because of the hope of Israel I am in these chains .
44028021	And they said to him , We have not had letters from Judaea about you , and no one of the brothers has come to us here to give an account or say any evil about you .
44028022	But we have a desire to give hearing to your opinion : for as to this form of religion , we have knowledge that in all places it is attacked .
44028023	And when a day had been fixed , they came to his house in great numbers ; and he gave them teaching , giving witness to the kingdom of God , and having discussions with them about Jesus , from the law of Moses and from the prophets , from morning till evening .
44028024	And some were in agreement with what he said , but some had doubts .
44028025	And they went away , for there was a division among them after Paul had said this one thing : Well did the Holy Spirit say by the prophet Isaiah to your fathers ,
44028026	Go to this people and say , Though you give ear , you will not get knowledge ; and seeing , you will see , but the sense will not be clear to you :
44028027	For the heart of this people has become fat and their ears are slow in hearing and their eyes are shut ; for fear that they might see with their eyes and give hearing with their ears and become wise in their hearts and be turned again to me , so that I might make them well .
44028028	Be certain , then , that the salvation of God is sent to the Gentiles , and they will give hearing .
44028030	And for the space of two years , Paul was living in the house of which he had the use , and had talk with all those who went in to see him ,
44028031	Preaching the kingdom of God and teaching about the Lord Jesus Christ without fear , and no orders were given that he was not to do so .
45001001	Paul , a servant of Jesus Christ , an Apostle by the selection of God , given authority as a preacher of the good news ,
45001002	Of which God had given word before by his prophets in the holy Writings ,
45001003	About his Son who , in the flesh , came from the family of David ,
45001004	But was marked out as Son of God in power by the Holy Spirit through the coming to life again of the dead ; Jesus Christ our Lord ,
45001005	Through whom grace has been given to us , sending us out to make disciples to the faith among all nations , for his name :
45001006	Among whom you in the same way have been marked out to be disciples of Jesus Christ :
45001007	To all those who are in Rome , loved by God , marked out as saints : Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
45001008	First of all , I give praise to my God through Jesus Christ for you all , because news of your faith has gone into all the world .
45001009	For God is my witness , whose servant I am in spirit in the good news of his Son , that you are at all times in my memory and in my prayers ,
45001010	And that I am ever making prayers that God will give me a good journey to you .
45001011	For I have a strong desire to see you , and to give you some grace of the spirit , so that you may be made strong ;
45001012	That is to say , that all of us may be comforted together by the faith which is in you and in me .
45001013	You may be certain , my brothers , that it has frequently been in my mind to come to you ( but till now I was kept from it ) , so that I might have some fruit from you in the same way as I have had it from the other nations .
45001014	I have a debt to Greeks and to the nations outside ; to the wise and to those who have no learning .
45001015	For which reason I have the desire , as far as I am able , to give the knowledge of the good news to you who are in Rome .
45001016	For I have no feeling of shame about the good news , because it is the power of God giving salvation to everyone who has faith , to the Jew first , and then to the Greek .
45001017	For in it there is the revelation of the righteousness of God from faith to faith : as it is said in the holy Writings , The man who does righteousness will be living by his faith .
45001018	For there is a revelation of the wrath of God from heaven against all the wrongdoing and evil thoughts of men who keep down what is true by wrongdoing ;
45001019	Because the knowledge of God may be seen in them , God having made it clear to them .
45001020	For from the first making of the world , those things of God which the eye is unable to see , that is , his eternal power and existence , are fully made clear , he having given the knowledge of them through the things which he has made , so that men have no reason for wrongdoing :
45001021	Because , having the knowledge of God , they did not give glory to God as God , and did not give praise , but their minds were full of foolish things , and their hearts , being without sense , were made dark .
45001022	Seeming to be wise , they were in fact foolish ,
45001023	And by them the glory of the eternal God was changed and made into the image of man who is not eternal , and of birds and beasts and things which go on the earth .
45001024	For this reason God gave them up to the evil desires of their hearts , working shame in their bodies with one another :
45001025	Because by them the true word of God was changed into that which is false , and they gave worship and honour to the thing which is made , and not to him who made it , to whom be blessing for ever . So be it .
45001026	For this reason God gave them up to evil passions , and their women were changing the natural use into one which is unnatural :
45001027	And in the same way the men gave up the natural use of the woman and were burning in their desire for one another , men doing shame with men , and getting in their bodies the right reward of their evil-doing .
45001028	And because they had not the mind to keep God in their knowledge , God gave them up to an evil mind , to do those things which are not right ;
45001029	Being full of all wrongdoing , evil , desire for the goods of others , hate , envy , putting to death , fighting , deceit , cruel ways , evil talk , and false statements about others ;
45001030	Hated by God , full of pride , without respect , full of loud talk , given to evil inventions , not honouring father or mother ,
45001031	Without knowledge , not true to their undertakings , unkind , having no mercy :
45001032	Who , though they have knowledge of the law of God , that the fate of those who do these things is death , not only go on doing these things themselves , but give approval to those who do them .
45002001	So you have no reason , whoever you are , for judging : for in judging another you are judging yourself , for you do the same things .
45002002	And we are conscious that God is a true judge against those who do such things .
45002003	But you who are judging another for doing what you do yourself , are you hoping that God's decision will not take effect against you ?
45002004	Or is it nothing to you that God had pity on you , waiting and putting up with you for so long , not seeing that in his pity God's desire is to give you a change of heart ?
45002005	But by your hard and unchanged heart you are storing up wrath for yourself in the day of the revelation of God's judging in righteousness ;
45002006	Who will give to every man his right reward :
45002007	To those who go on with good works in the hope of glory and honour and salvation from death , he will give eternal life :
45002008	But to those who , from a love of competition , are not guided by what is true , will come the heat of his wrath ,
45002009	Trouble and sorrow on all whose works are evil , to the Jew first and then to the Greek ;
45002010	But glory and honour and peace to all whose works are good , to the Jew first and then to the Greek :
45002011	For one man is not different from another before God .
45002012	All those who have done wrong without the law will get destruction without the law : and those who have done wrong under the law will have their punishment by the law ;
45002013	For it is not the hearers of the law who will be judged as having righteousness before God , but only the doers :
45002014	For when the Gentiles without the law have a natural desire to do the things in the law , they are a law to themselves ;
45002015	Because the work of the law is seen in their hearts , their sense of right and wrong giving witness to it , while their minds are at one time judging them and at another giving them approval ;
45002016	In the day when God will be a judge of the secrets of men , as it says in the good news of which I am a preacher , through Jesus Christ .
45002017	But as for you who have the name of Jew , and are resting on the law , and take pride in God ,
45002018	And have knowledge of his desires , and are a judge of the things which are different , having the learning of the law ,
45002019	In the belief that you are a guide to the blind , a light to those in the dark ,
45002020	A teacher of the foolish , having in the law the form of knowledge and of what is true ;
45002021	You who give teaching to others , do you give it to yourself ? you who say that a man may not take what is not his , do you take what is not yours ?
45002022	You who say that a man may not be untrue to his wife , are you true to yours ? you who are a hater of images , do you do wrong to the house of God ?
45002023	You who take pride in the law , are you doing wrong to the honour of God by behaviour which is against the law ?
45002024	For the name of God is shamed among the Gentiles because of you , as it is said in the holy Writings .
45002025	It is true that circumcision is of use if you keep the law , but if you go against the law it is as if you had it not .
45002026	If those who have not circumcision keep the rules of the law , will it not be credited to them as circumcision ?
45002027	And they , by their keeping of the law without circumcision , will be judges of you , by whom the law is broken though you have the letter of the law and circumcision .
45002028	The true Jew is not one who is only so publicly , and circumcision is not that which may be seen in the flesh :
45002029	But he is a Jew who is a secret one , whose circumcision is of the heart , in the spirit and not in the letter ; whose praise is not from men , but from God .
45003001	How then is the Jew better off ? or what profit is there in circumcision ?
45003002	Much in every way : first of all because the words of God were given to them .
45003003	And if some have no faith , will that make the faith of God without effect ?
45003004	In no way : but let God be true , though every man is seen to be untrue ; as it is said in the Writings , That your words may be seen to be true , and you may be seen to be right when you are judged .
45003005	But if the righteousness of God is supported by our wrongdoing what is to be said ? is it wrong for God to be angry ( as men may say ) ?
45003006	In no way : because if it is so , how is God able to be the judge of all the world ?
45003007	But if , because I am untrue , God being seen to be true gets more glory , why am I to be judged as a sinner ?
45003008	Let us not do evil so that good may come ( a statement which we are falsely said by some to have made ) , because such behaviour will have its right punishment .
45003009	What then ? are we worse off than they ? In no way : because we have before made it clear that Jews as well as Greeks are all under the power of sin ;
45003010	As it is said in the holy Writings , There is not one who does righteousness ;
45003011	Not one who has the knowledge of what is right , not one who is a searcher after God ;
45003012	They have all gone out of the way , there is no profit in any of them ; there is not one who does good , not so much as one :
45003013	Their throat is like an open place of death ; with their tongues they have said what is not true : the poison of snakes is under their lips :
45003014	Whose mouth is full of curses and bitter words :
45003015	Their feet are quick in running after blood ;
45003016	Destruction and trouble are in their ways ;
45003017	And of the way of peace they have no knowledge :
45003018	There is no fear of God before their eyes .
45003019	Now , we have knowledge that what the law says is for those who are under the law , so that every mouth may be stopped , and all men may be judged by God :
45003020	Because by the works of the law no man is able to have righteousness in his eyes , for through the law comes the knowledge of sin .
45003021	But now without the law there is a revelation of the righteousness of God , to which witness is given by the law and the prophets ;
45003022	That is , the righteousness of God through faith in Jesus Christ , to all those who have faith ; and one man is not different from another ,
45003023	For all have done wrong and are far from the glory of God ;
45003024	And they may have righteousness put to their credit , freely , by his grace , through the salvation which is in Christ Jesus :
45003025	Whom God has put forward as the sign of his mercy , through faith , by his blood , to make clear his righteousness when , in his pity , God let the sins of earlier times go without punishment ;
45003026	And to make clear his righteousness now , so that he might himself be upright , and give righteousness to him who has faith in Jesus .
45003027	What reason , then , is there for pride ? It is shut out . By what sort of law ? of works ? No , but by a law of faith .
45003028	For this reason , then , a man may get righteousness by faith without the works of the law .
45003029	Or is God the God of Jews only ? is he not in the same way the God of Gentiles ? Yes , of Gentiles :
45003030	If God is one ; and he will give righteousness because of faith to those who have circumcision , and through faith to those who have not circumcision .
45003031	Do we , then , through faith make the law of no effect ? in no way : but we make it clear that the law is important .
45004001	What , then , may we say that Abraham , our father after the flesh , has got ?
45004002	For if Abraham got righteousness by works , he has reason for pride ; but not before God .
45004003	But what does it say in the holy Writings ? And Abraham had faith in God , and it was put to his account as righteousness .
45004004	Now , the reward is credited to him who does works , not as of grace but as a debt .
45004005	But to him who without working has faith in him who gives righteousness to the evil-doer , his faith is put to his account as righteousness .
45004006	As David says that there is a blessing on the man to whose account God puts righteousness without works , saying ,
45004007	Happy are those who have forgiveness for their wrongdoing , and whose sins are covered .
45004008	Happy is the man against whom no sin is recorded by the Lord .
45004009	Is this blessing , then , for the circumcision only , or in the same way for those who have not circumcision ? for we say that the faith of Abraham was put to his account as righteousness .
45004010	How , then , was it judged ? when he had circumcision , or when he had it not ? Not when he had it , but when he did not have it :
45004011	And he was given the sign of circumcision as a witness of the faith which he had before he underwent circumcision : so that he might be the father of all those who have faith , though they have not circumcision , and so that righteousness might be put to their account ;
45004012	And the father of circumcision to those who not only are of the circumcision , but who keep to the way of that faith which our father Abraham had before he underwent circumcision .
45004013	For God's word , that the earth would be his heritage , was given to Abraham , not through the law , but through the righteousness of faith .
45004014	For if they who are of the law are the people who get the heritage , then faith is made of no use , and the word of God has no power ;
45004015	For the outcome of the law is wrath ; but where there is no law it will not be broken .
45004016	For this reason it is of faith , so that it may be through grace ; and so that the word of God may be certain to all the seed ; not only to that which is of the law , but to that which is of the faith of Abraham , who is the father of us all ,
45004017	( As it is said in the holy Writings , I have made you a father of a number of nations ) before him in whom he had faith , that is , God , who gives life to the dead , and to whom the things which are not are as if they were .
45004018	Who without reason for hope , in faith went on hoping , so that he became the father of a number of nations , as it had been said , So will your seed be .
45004019	And not being feeble in faith though his body seemed to him little better than dead ( he being about a hundred years old ) and Sarah was no longer able to have children :
45004020	Still , he did not give up faith in the undertaking of God , but was made strong by faith , giving glory to God ,
45004021	And being certain that God was able to keep his word .
45004022	For which reason it was put to his account as righteousness .
45004023	Now , it was not because of him only that this was said ,
45004024	But for us in addition , to whose account it will be put , if we have faith in him who made Jesus our Lord come back again from the dead ,
45004025	Who was put to death for our evil-doing , and came to life again so that we might have righteousness .
45005001	For which reason , because we have righteousness through faith , let us be at peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ ;
45005002	Through whom , in the same way , we have been able by faith to come to this grace in which we now are ; and let us have joy in hope of the glory of God .
45005003	And not only so , but let us have joy in our troubles : in the knowledge that trouble gives us the power of waiting ;
45005004	And waiting gives experience ; and experience , hope :
45005005	And hope does not put to shame ; because our hearts are full of the love of God through the Holy Spirit which is given to us .
45005006	For when we were still without strength , at the right time Christ gave his life for evil-doers .
45005007	Now it is hard for anyone to give his life even for an upright man , though it might be that for a good man someone would give his life .
