45005008	But God has made clear his love to us , in that , when we were still sinners , Christ gave his life for us .
45005009	Much more , if we now have righteousness by his blood , will salvation from the wrath of God come to us through him .
45005010	For if , when we were haters of God , the death of his Son made us at peace with him , much more , now that we are his friends , will we have salvation through his life ;
45005011	And not only so , but we have joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , through whom we are now at peace with God .
45005012	For this reason , as through one man sin came into the world , and death because of sin , and so death came to all men , because all have done evil :
45005013	Because , till the law came , sin was in existence , but sin is not put to the account of anyone when there is no law to be broken .
45005014	But still death had power from Adam till Moses , even over those who had not done wrong like Adam , who is a picture of him who was to come .
45005015	But the free giving of God is not like the wrongdoing of man . For if , by the wrongdoing of one man death came to numbers of men , much more did the grace of God , and the free giving by the grace of one man , Jesus Christ , come to men .
45005016	And the free giving has not the same effect as the sin of one : for the effect of one man's sin was punishment by the decision of God , but the free giving had power to give righteousness to wrongdoers in great number .
45005017	For , if by the wrongdoing of one , death was ruling through the one , much more will those to whom has come the wealth of grace and the giving of righteousness , be ruling in life through the one , even Jesus Christ .
45005018	So then , as the effect of one act of wrongdoing was that punishment came on all men , even so the effect of one act of righteousness was righteousness of life for all men .
45005019	Because , as numbers of men became sinners through the wrongdoing of one man , even so will great numbers get righteousness through the keeping of the word of God by one man .
45005020	And the law came in addition , to make wrongdoing worse ; but where there was much sin , there was much more grace :
45005021	That , as sin had power in death , so grace might have power through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
45006001	What may we say , then ? are we to go on in sin so that there may be more grace ?
45006002	In no way . How may we , who are dead to sin , be living in it any longer ?
45006003	Or are you without the knowledge that all we who had baptism into Christ Jesus , had baptism into his death ?
45006004	We have been placed with him among the dead through baptism into death : so that as Christ came again from the dead by the glory of the Father , we , in the same way , might be living in new life .
45006005	For , if we have been made like him in his death , we will , in the same way , be like him in his coming to life again ;
45006006	Being conscious that our old man was put to death on the cross with him , so that the body of sin might be put away , and we might no longer be servants to sin .
45006007	Because he who is dead is free from sin .
45006008	But if we are dead with Christ , we have faith that we will be living with him ;
45006009	Having knowledge that because Christ has come back from the dead , he will never again go down to the dead ; death has no more power over him .
45006010	For his death was a death to sin , but his life now is a life which he is living to God .
45006011	Even so see yourselves as dead to sin , but living to God in Christ Jesus .
45006012	For this cause do not let sin be ruling in your body which is under the power of death , so that you give way to its desires ;
45006013	And do not give your bodies to sin as the instruments of wrongdoing , but give yourselves to God , as those who are living from the dead , and your bodies as instruments of righteousness to God .
45006014	For sin may not have rule over you : because you are not under law , but under grace .
45006015	What then ? are we to go on in sin because we are not under law but under grace ? Let it not be so .
45006016	Are you not conscious that you are the servants of him to whom you give yourselves to do his desire ? if to sin , the end being death , or if to do the desire of God , the end being righteousness .
45006017	But praise be to God that though you were the servants of sin , you have now given yourselves freely to that form of teaching under which you were placed ;
45006018	And being made free from sin you have been made the servants of righteousness .
45006019	I am using words in the way of men , because your flesh is feeble : as you gave your bodies as servants to what is unclean , and to evil to do evil , so now give them as servants to righteousness to do what is holy .
45006020	When you were servants of sin you were free from righteousness .
45006021	What fruit had you at that time in the things which are now a shame to you ? for the end of such things is death .
45006022	But now , being free from sin , and having been made servants to God , you have your fruit in that which is holy , and the end is eternal life .
45006023	For the reward of sin is death ; but what God freely gives is eternal life in Jesus Christ our Lord .
45007001	Is it not clear , my brothers ( I am using an argument to those who have knowledge of the law ) , that the law has power over a man as long as he is living ?
45007002	For the woman who has a husband is placed by the law under the power of her husband as long as he is living ; but if her husband is dead , she is free from the law of the husband .
45007003	So if , while the husband is living , she is joined to another man , she will get the name of one who is untrue to her husband : but if the husband is dead , she is free from the law , so that she is not untrue , even if she takes another man .
45007004	In the same way , my brothers , you were made dead to the law through the body of Christ , so that you might be joined to another , even to him who came again from the dead , so that we might give fruit to God .
45007005	For when we were in the flesh , the evil passions which came into being through the law were working in our bodies to give the fruit of death .
45007006	But now we are free from the law , having been made dead to that which had power over us ; so that we are servants in the new way of the spirit , not in the old way of the letter .
45007007	What then is to be said ? is the law sin ? in no way . But I would not have had knowledge of sin but for the law : for I would not have been conscious of desire if the law had not said , You may not have a desire for what is another's .
45007008	But sin , taking its chance through that which was ordered by the law , was working in me every form of desire : because without the law sin is dead .
45007009	And there was a time when I was living without the law : but when the law gave its orders , sin came to life and put me to death ;
45007010	And I made the discovery that the law whose purpose was to give life had become a cause of death :
45007011	For I was tricked and put to death by sin , which took its chance through the law .
45007012	But the law is holy , and its orders are holy , upright , and good .
45007013	Was then that which is good , death to me ? In no way . But the purpose was that sin might be seen to be sin by working death to me through that which is good ; so that through the orders of the law sin might seem much more evil .
45007014	For we are conscious that the law is of the spirit ; but I am of the flesh , given into the power of sin .
45007015	And I have no clear knowledge of what I am doing , for that which I have a mind to do , I do not , but what I have hate for , that I do .
45007016	But , if I do that which I have no mind to do , I am in agreement with the law that the law is good .
45007017	So it is no longer I who do it , but the sin living in me .
45007018	For I am conscious that in me , that is , in my flesh , there is nothing good : I have the mind but not the power to do what is right .
45007019	For the good which I have a mind to do , I do not : but the evil which I have no mind to do , that I do .
45007020	But if I do what I have no mind to do , it is no longer I who do it , but the sin living in me .
45007021	So I see a law that , though I have a mind to do good , evil is present in me .
45007022	In my heart I take pleasure in the law of God ,
45007023	But I see another law in my body , working against the law of my mind , and making me the servant of the law of sin which is in my flesh .
45007024	How unhappy am I ! who will make me free from the body of this death ?
45007025	I give praise to God through Jesus Christ our Lord . So with my mind I am a servant to the law of God , but with my flesh to the law of sin .
45008001	For this cause those who are in Christ Jesus will not be judged as sinners .
45008002	For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has made me free from the law of sin and death .
45008003	For what the law was not able to do because it was feeble through the flesh , God , sending his Son in the image of the evil flesh , and as an offering for sin , gave his decision against sin in the flesh :
45008004	So that what was ordered by the law might be done in us , who are living , not in the way of the flesh , but in the way of the Spirit .
45008005	For those who are living in the way of the flesh give their minds to the things of the flesh , but those who go in the way of the Spirit , to the things of the Spirit .
45008006	For the mind of the flesh is death , but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace :
45008007	Because the mind of the flesh is opposite to God ; it is not under the law of God , and is not able to be :
45008008	So that those who are in the flesh are not able to give pleasure to God .
45008009	You are not in the flesh but in the Spirit , if the Spirit of God is in you . But if any man has not the Spirit of Christ he is not one of his .
45008010	And if Christ is in you , the body is dead because of sin , but the Spirit is life because of righteousness .
45008011	But if the Spirit of him who made Jesus come again from the dead is in you , he who made Christ Jesus come again from the dead will in the same way , through his Spirit which is in you , give life to your bodies which now are under the power of death .
45008012	So then , my brothers , we are in debt , not to the flesh to be living in the way of the flesh :
45008013	For if you go in the way of the flesh , death will come on you ; but if by the Spirit you put to death the works of the body , you will have life .
45008014	And all those who are guided by the Spirit of God are sons of God .
45008015	For you did not get the spirit of servants again to put you in fear , but the spirit of sons was given to you , by which we say , Abba , Father .
45008016	The Spirit is witness with our spirit that we are children of God :
45008017	And if we are children , we have a right to a part in the heritage ; a part in the things of God , together with Christ ; so that if we have a part in his pain , we will in the same way have a part in his glory .
45008018	I am of the opinion that there is no comparison between the pain of this present time and the glory which we will see in the future .
45008019	For the strong desire of every living thing is waiting for the revelation of the sons of God .
45008020	For every living thing was put under the power of change , not by its desire , but by him who made it so , in hope
45008021	That all living things will be made free from the power of death and will have a part with the free children of God in glory .
45008022	For we are conscious that all living things are weeping and sorrowing in pain together till now .
45008023	And not only so , but we who have the first fruits of the Spirit , even we have sorrow in our minds , waiting for the time when we will take our place as sons , that is , the salvation of our bodies .
45008024	For our salvation is by hope : but hope which is seen is not hope : for who is hoping for what he sees ?
45008025	But if we have hope for that which we see not , then we will be able to go on waiting for it .
45008026	And in the same way the Spirit is a help to our feeble hearts : for we are not able to make prayer to God in the right way ; but the Spirit puts our desires into words which are not in our power to say ;
45008027	And he who is the searcher of hearts has knowledge of the mind of the Spirit , because he is making prayers for the saints in agreement with the mind of God .
45008028	And we are conscious that all things are working together for good to those who have love for God , and have been marked out by his purpose .
45008029	Because those of whom he had knowledge before they came into existence , were marked out by him to be made like his Son , so that he might be the first among a band of brothers :
45008030	And those who were marked out by him were named ; and those who were named were given righteousness ; and to those to whom he gave righteousness , in the same way he gave glory .
45008031	What may we say about these things ? If God is for us , who is against us ?
45008032	He who did not keep back his only Son , but gave him up for us all , will he not with him freely give us all things ?
45008033	Who will say anything against the saints of God ? It is God who makes us clear from evil ;
45008034	Who will give a decision against us ? It is Christ Jesus who not only was put to death , but came again from the dead , who is now at the right hand of God , taking our part .
45008035	Who will come between us and the love of Christ ? Will trouble , or pain , or cruel acts , or the need of food or of clothing , or danger , or the sword ?
45008036	As it is said in the holy Writings , Because of you we are put to death every day ; we are like sheep ready for destruction .
45008037	But we are able to overcome all these things and more through his love .
45008038	For I am certain that not death , or life , or angels , or rulers , or things present , or things to come , or powers ,
45008039	Or things on high , or things under the earth , or anything which is made , will be able to come between us and the love of God which is in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45009001	I say what is true in Christ , and not what is false , my mind giving witness with me in the Holy Spirit ,
45009002	That I am full of sorrow and pain without end .
45009003	For I have a desire to take on myself the curse for my brothers , my family in the flesh :
45009004	Who are Israelites : who have the place of sons , and the glory , and the agreements with God , and the giving of the law , and the worship , and the hope offered by God :
45009005	Whose are the fathers , and of whom came Christ in the flesh , who is over all , God , to whom be blessing for ever . So be it .
45009006	But it is not as if the word of God was without effect . For they are not all Israel , who are of Israel :
45009007	And they are not all children because they are the seed of Abraham ; but , In Isaac will your seed be named .
45009008	That is , it is not the children of the flesh , but the children of God's undertaking , who are named as the seed .
45009009	For this is the word of God's undertaking , At this time will I come , and Sarah will have a son .
45009010	And not only so , but Rebecca being about to have a child by our father Isaac - -
45009011	Before the children had come into existence , or had done anything good or bad , in order that God's purpose and his selection might be effected , not by works , but by him whose purpose it is ,
45009012	It was said to her , The older will be the servant of the younger .
45009013	Even as it is said , I had love for Jacob , but for Esau I had hate .
45009014	What may we say then ? is God not upright ? let it not be said .
45009015	For he says to Moses , I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy , and pity on whom I will have pity .
45009016	So then , it is not by the desire or by the attempt of man , but by the mercy of God .
45009017	For the holy Writings say to Pharaoh , For this same purpose did I put you on high , so that I might make my power seen in you , and that there might be knowledge of my name through all the earth .
45009018	So then , at his pleasure he has mercy on a man , and at his pleasure he makes the heart hard .
45009019	But you will say to me , Why does he still make us responsible ? who is able to go against his purpose ?
45009020	But , O man , who are you , to make answer against God ? May the thing which is made say to him who made it , Why did you make me so ?
45009021	Or has not the potter the right to make out of one part of his earth a vessel for honour , and out of another a vessel for shame ?
45009022	What if God , desiring to let his wrath and his power be seen , for a long time put up with the vessels of wrath which were ready for destruction :
45009023	And to make clear the wealth of his glory to vessels of mercy , which he had before made ready for glory ,
45009024	Even us , who were marked out by him , not only from the Jews , but from the Gentiles ?
45009025	As he says in Hosea , They will be named my people who were not my people , and she will be loved who was not loved .
45009026	And in the place where it was said to them , You are not my people , there they will be named the sons of the living God .
45009027	And Isaiah says about Israel , Even if the number of the children of Israel is as the sand of the sea , only a small part will get salvation :
45009028	For the Lord will give effect to his word on the earth , putting an end to it and cutting it short .
45009029	And , as Isaiah had said before , If the Lord of armies had not given us a seed , we would have been like Sodom and Gomorrah .
45009030	What then may we say ? That the nations who did not go after righteousness have got righteousness , even the righteousness which is of faith :
45009031	But Israel , going after a law of righteousness , did not get it .
45009032	Why ? Because they were not searching for it by faith , but by works . They came up against the stone which was in the way ;
45009033	As it is said , See , I am putting in Zion a stone causing a fall , and a rock in the way : but he who has faith in him will not be put to shame .
45010001	Brothers , my heart's desire and my prayer to God for them is , that they may get salvation .
45010002	For I give witness of them that they have a strong desire for God , but not with knowledge .
45010003	Because , not having knowledge of God's righteousness , and desiring to give effect to their righteousness , they have not put themselves under the righteousness of God .
45010004	For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who has faith .
45010005	For Moses says that the man who does the righteousness which is of the law will get life by it .
45010006	But the righteousness which is of faith says these words , Say not in your heart , Who will go up to heaven ? ( that is , to make Christ come down : )
45010007	Or , Who will go down into the deep ? ( that is , to make Christ come again from the dead : )
45010008	But what does it say ? The word is near you , in your mouth and in your heart : that is , the word of faith of which we are the preachers :
45010009	Because , if you say with your mouth that Jesus is Lord , and have faith in your heart that God has made him come back from the dead , you will have salvation :
45010010	For with the heart man has faith to get righteousness , and with the mouth he says that Jesus is Lord to get salvation .
45010011	Because it is said in the holy Writings , Whoever has faith in him will not be shamed .
45010012	And the Jew is not different from the Greek : for there is the same Lord of all , who is good to all who have hope in his name :
45010013	Because , Whoever will give worship to the name of the Lord will get salvation .
45010014	But how will they give worship to him in whom they have no faith ? and how will they have faith in him of whom they have not had news ? and how will they have news without a preacher ?
45010015	And how will there be preachers if they are not sent ? As it is said , How beautiful are the feet of those who give the glad news of good things .
45010016	But they have not all given ear to the good news . For Isaiah says , Lord , who has had faith in our word ?
45010017	So faith comes by hearing , and hearing by the word of Christ .
45010018	But I say , Did not the word come to their ears ? Yes , certainly : Their sound has gone out into all the earth , and their words to the ends of the world .
45010019	But I say , Had Israel no knowledge ? First Moses says , You will be moved to envy by that which is not a nation , and by a foolish people I will make you angry .
45010020	And Isaiah says without fear , Those who were not searching for me made discovery of me ; and I was seen by those whose hearts were turned away from me .
45010021	But about Israel he says ; All the day my hands have been stretched out to a people whose hearts were turned away , and who put themselves against my word .
45011001	So I say , Has God put his people on one side ? Let there be no such thought . For I am of Israel , of the seed of Abraham , of the tribe of Benjamin .
45011002	God has not put away the people of his selection . Or have you no knowledge of what is said about Elijah in the holy Writings ? how he says words to God against Israel ,
45011003	Lord , they have put your prophets to death , and made waste your altars , and now I am the last , and they are searching for me to take away my life .
45011004	But what answer does God make to him ? I have still seven thousand men whose knees have not been bent to Baal .
45011005	In the same way , there are at this present time some who are marked out by the selection of grace .
45011006	But if it is of grace , then it is no longer of works : or grace would not be grace .
45011007	What then ? That which Israel was searching for he did not get , but those of the selection got it and the rest were made hard .
45011008	As it was said in the holy Writings , God gave them a spirit of sleep , eyes which might not see , and ears which have no hearing , to this day .
45011009	And David says , Let their table be made a net for taking them , and a stone in their way , and a punishment :
45011010	Let their eyes be made dark so that they may not see , and let their back be bent down at all times .
45011011	So I say , Were their steps made hard in order that they might have a fall ? In no way : but by their fall salvation has come to the Gentiles , so that they might be moved to envy .
45011012	Now , if their fall is the wealth of the world , and their loss the wealth of the Gentiles , how much greater will be the glory when they are made full ?
45011013	But I say to you , Gentiles , in so far as I am the Apostle of the Gentiles , I make much of my position :
45011014	If in any way those who are of my flesh may be moved to envy , so that some of them may get salvation by me .
45011015	For , if by their putting away , the rest of men have been made friends with God , what will their coming back again be , but life from the dead ?
45011016	And if the first-fruit is holy , so is the mass : and if the root is holy , so are the branches .
45011017	But if some of the branches were broken off , and you , an olive-tree of the fields , were put in among them , and were given a part with them in the root by which the olive-tree is made fertile ,
45011018	Do not be uplifted in pride over the branches : because it is not you who are the support of the root , but it is by the root that you are supported .
45011019	You will say , Branches were broken off so that I might be put in .
45011020	Truly , because they had no faith they were broken off , and you have your place by reason of your faith . Do not be lifted up in pride , but have fear ;
45011021	For , if God did not have mercy on the natural branches , he will not have mercy on you .
45011022	See then that God is good but his rules are fixed : to those who were put away he was hard , but to you he has been good , on the condition that you keep in his mercy ; if not , you will be cut off as they were .
45011023	And they , if they do not go on without faith , will be united to the tree again , because God is able to put them in again .
45011024	For if you were cut out of a field olive-tree , and against the natural use were united to a good olive-tree , how much more will these , the natural branches , be united again with the olive-tree which was theirs ?
45011025	For it is my desire , brothers , that this secret may be clear to you , so that you may not have pride in your knowledge , that Israel has been made hard in part , till all the Gentiles have come in ;
45011026	And so all Israel will get salvation : as it is said in the holy Writings , There will come out of Zion the One who makes free ; by him wrongdoing will be taken away from Jacob :
45011027	And this is my agreement with them , when I will take away their sins .
45011028	As far as the good news is in question , they are cut off from God on account of you , but as far as the selection is in question , they are loved on account of the fathers .
45011029	Because God's selection and his mercies may not be changed .
45011030	For as you , in time past , were not under the rule of God , but now have got mercy through their turning away ,
45011031	So in the same way these have gone against the orders of God , so that by the mercy given to you they may now get mercy .
45011032	For God has let them all go against his orders , so that he might have mercy on them all .
45011033	O how deep is the wealth of the wisdom and knowledge of God ! no one is able to make discovery of his decisions , and his ways may not be searched out .
45011034	Who has knowledge of the mind of the Lord ? or who has taken part in his purposes ?
45011035	Or who has first given to him , and it will be given back to him again ?
45011036	For of him , and through him , and to him , are all things . To him be the glory for ever . So be it .
45012001	For this reason I make request to you , brothers , by the mercies of God , that you will give your bodies as a living offering , holy , pleasing to God , which is the worship it is right for you to give him .
45012002	And let not your behaviour be like that of this world , but be changed and made new in mind , so that by experience you may have knowledge of the good and pleasing and complete purpose of God .
45012003	But I say to every one of you , through the grace given to me , not to have an over-high opinion of himself , but to have wise thoughts , as God has given to every one a measure of faith .
45012004	For , as we have a number of parts in one body , but all the parts have not the same use ,
45012005	So we , though we are a number of persons , are one body in Christ , and are dependent on one another ;
45012006	And having different qualities by reason of the grace given to us , such as the quality of a prophet , let it be made use of in relation to the measure of our faith ;
45012007	Or the position of a Deacon of the church , let a man give himself to it ; or he who has the power of teaching , let him make use of it ;
45012008	He who has the power of comforting , let him do so ; he who gives , let him give freely ; he who has the power of ruling , let him do it with a serious mind ; he who has mercy on others , let it be with joy .
45012009	Let love be without deceit . Be haters of what is evil ; keep your minds fixed on what is good .
45012010	Be kind to one another with a brother's love , putting others before yourselves in honour ;
45012011	Be not slow in your work , but be quick in spirit , as the Lord's servants ;
45012012	Being glad in hope , quiet in trouble , at all times given to prayer ,
45012013	Giving to the needs of the saints , ready to take people into your houses .
45012014	Give blessing and not curses to those who are cruel to you .
45012015	Take part in the joy of those who are glad , and in the grief of those who are sorrowing .
45012016	Be in harmony with one another . Do not have a high opinion of yourselves , but be in agreement with common people . Do not give yourselves an air of wisdom .
45012017	Do not give evil for evil to any man . Let all your business be well ordered in the eyes of all men .
45012018	As far as it is possible for you be at peace with all men .
45012019	Do not give punishment for wrongs done to you , dear brothers , but give way to the wrath of God ; for it is said in the holy Writings , Punishment is mine , I will give reward , says the Lord .
45012020	But if one who has hate for you is in need of food or of drink , give it to him , for in so doing you will put coals of fire on his head .
45012021	Do not let evil overcome you , but overcome evil by good .
45013001	Let everyone put himself under the authority of the higher powers , because there is no power which is not of God , and all powers are ordered by God .
45013002	For which reason everyone who puts himself against the authority puts himself against the order of God : and those who are against it will get punishment for themselves .
45013003	For rulers are not a cause of fear to the good work but to the evil . If you would have no fear of the authority , do good and you will have praise ;
45013004	For he is the servant of God to you for good . But if you do evil , have fear ; for the sword is not in his hand for nothing : he is God's servant , making God's punishment come on the evil-doer .
45013005	So put yourselves under the authority , not for fear of wrath , but because you have the knowledge of what is right .
45013006	For the same reason , make payment of taxes ; because the authority is God's servant , to take care of such things at all times .
45013007	Give to all what is their right : taxes to him whose they are , payment to him whose right it is , fear to whom fear , honour to whom honour is to be given .
45013008	Be in debt for nothing , but to have love for one another : for he who has love for his neighbour has kept all the law .
45013009	And this , Do not be untrue in married life , Do not put to death , Do not take what is another's , Do not have desire for what is another's , and if there is any other order , it is covered by this word , Have love for your neighbour as for yourself .
45013010	Love does no wrong to his neighbour , so love makes the law complete .
45013011	See then that the time has come for you to be awake from sleep : for now is your salvation nearer than when you first had faith .
45013012	The night is far gone , and the day is near : so let us put off the works of the dark , arming ourselves with light ,
45013013	With right behaviour as in the day ; not in pleasure-making and drinking , not in bad company and unclean behaviour , not in fighting and envy .
45013014	But put on the Lord Jesus Christ , and do not give thought to the flesh to do its desires .
45014001	Do not put on one side him who is feeble in faith , and do not put him in doubt by your reasonings .
45014002	One man has faith to take all things as food : another who is feeble in faith takes only green food .
45014003	Let not him who takes food have a low opinion of him who does not : and let not him who does not take food be a judge of him who does ; for he has God's approval .
45014004	Who are you to make yourself a judge of another man's servant ? it is to his master that he is responsible for good or bad . Yes , his place will be safe , because the Lord is able to keep him from falling .
45014005	This man puts one day before another : to that man they are the same . Let every man be certain in his mind .
45014006	He who keeps the day , keeps it to the Lord ; and he who takes food , takes it as to the Lord , for he gives praise to God ; and he who does not take food , to the Lord he takes it not , and gives praise to God .
45014007	For every man's life and every man's death has a relation to others as well as to himself .
45014008	As long as we have life we are living to the Lord ; or if we give up our life it is to the Lord ; so if we are living , or if our life comes to an end , we are the Lord's .
45014009	And for this purpose Christ went into death and came back again , that he might be the Lord of the dead and of the living .
45014010	But you , why do you make yourself your brother's judge ? or again , why have you no respect for your brother ? because we will all have to take our place before God as our judge .
45014011	For it is said in the holy Writings , By my life , says the Lord , to me every knee will be bent , and every tongue will give worship to God .
45014012	So every one of us will have to give an account of himself to God .
45014013	Then let us not be judges of one another any longer : but keep this in mind , that no man is to make it hard for his brother , or give him cause for doubting .
45014014	I am conscious of this , and am certain in the Lord Jesus , that nothing is unclean in itself ; but for the man in whose opinion it is unclean , for him it is unclean .
45014015	And if because of food your brother is troubled , then you are no longer going on in the way of love . Do not let your food be destruction to him for whom Christ went into death .
45014016	Let it not be possible for men to say evil about your good :
45014017	For the kingdom of God is not food and drink , but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit .
45014018	And he who in these things is Christ's servant , is pleasing to God and has the approval of men .
45014019	So then , let us go after the things which make peace , and the things by which we may be a help to one another .
45014020	Do not let the work of God come to nothing on account of food . All things are certainly clean ; but it is evil for that man who by taking food makes it hard for another .
45014021	It is better not to take meat or wine or to do anything which might be a cause of trouble to your brother .
45014022	The faith which you have , have it to yourself before God . Happy is the man who is not judged by that to which he gives approval .
45014023	But he who is in doubt is judged if he takes food , because he does it not in faith ; and whatever is not of faith is sin .
45015001	We who are strong have to be a support to the feeble , and not give pleasure to ourselves .
45015002	Let every one of us give pleasure to his neighbour for his good , to make him strong .
45015003	For Christ did not give pleasure to himself , but , as it is said , The bitter words of those who were angry with you came on me .
45015004	Now those things which were put down in writing before our time were for our learning , so that through quiet waiting and through the comfort of the holy Writings we might have hope .
45015005	Now may the God who gives comfort and strength in waiting make you of the same mind with one another in harmony with Christ Jesus :
45015006	So that with one mouth you may give glory to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
45015007	So then , take one another to your hearts , as Christ took us , to the glory of God .
45015008	Now I say that Christ has been made a servant of the circumcision to give effect to the undertakings given by God to the fathers ,
45015009	And so that the Gentiles might give glory to God for his mercy ; as it is said , For this reason I will give praise to you among the Gentiles , and I will make a song to your name .
45015010	And again he says , Take part , you Gentiles , in the joy of his people .
45015011	And again , Give praise to the Lord , all you Gentiles ; and let all the nations give praise to him .
45015012	And again Isaiah says , There will be the root of Jesse , and he who comes to be the ruler over the Gentiles ; in him will the Gentiles put their hope .
45015013	Now may the God of hope make you full of joy and peace through faith , so that all hope may be yours in the power of the Holy Spirit .
45015014	And I myself am certain of you , brothers , that you are full of what is good , complete in all knowledge , able to give direction to one another .
45015015	But I have , in some measure , less fear in writing to you to put these things before you again , because of the grace which was given to me by God ,
45015016	To be a servant of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles , doing the work of a priest in the good news of God , so that the offering of the Gentiles might be pleasing to God , being made holy by the Holy Spirit .
45015017	So I have pride in Christ Jesus in the things which are God's .
45015018	And I will keep myself from talking of anything but those things which Christ has done by me to put the Gentiles under his rule in word and in act ,
45015019	By signs and wonders , in the power of the Holy Spirit ; so that from Jerusalem and round about as far as Illyricum I have given all the good news of Christ ;
45015020	Making it my purpose not to take the good news where Christ was named , so that my work might not be resting on that of others ;
45015021	But as it is said in the holy Writings , They will see , to whom the news of him had not been given , and those to whose ears it had not come will have knowledge .
45015022	For which reason I was frequently kept from coming to you :
45015023	But now , having no longer any place in these parts and having had for a number of years a great desire to come to you ,
45015024	Whenever I go to Spain ( for it is my hope to see you on my way , and to be sent on there by you , if first I may in some measure have been comforted by your company ) - -
45015025	But now I go to Jerusalem , taking help for the saints .
45015026	For it has been the good pleasure of those of Macedonia and Achaia to send a certain amount of money for the poor among the saints at Jerusalem .
45015027	Yes , it has been their good pleasure ; and they are in their debt . For if the Gentiles have had a part in the things of the Spirit which were theirs , it is right for them , in the same way , to give them help in the things of the flesh .
45015028	So when I have done this , and have given them this fruit of love , I will go on by you into Spain .
45015029	And I am certain that when I come , I will be full of the blessing of Christ .
45015030	Now I make request to you , brothers , by our Lord Jesus Christ , and by the love of the Spirit , that you will be working together with me in your prayers to God for me ;
45015031	So that I may be kept safe from those in Judaea who have not put themselves under the rule of God , and that the help which I am taking for Jerusalem may be pleasing to the saints ;
45015032	So that I may come to you in joy by the good pleasure of God , and have rest with you .
45015033	Now may the God of peace be with you all . So be it .
45016001	It is my desire to say a good word for Phoebe , who is a servant of the church in Cenchreae :
45016002	That you will take her in kindly , after the way of the saints , as one who is the Lord's , and give her help in anything in which she may have need of you : because she has been a help to a great number and to myself .
45016003	Give my love to Prisca and Aquila , workers with me in Christ Jesus ,
45016004	Who for my life put their necks in danger ; to whom not only I but all the churches of the Gentiles are in debt :
45016005	And say a kind word to the church which is in their house . Give my love to my dear Epaenetus , who is the first fruit of Asia to Christ .
45016006	Give my love to Mary , who gave much care to you .
45016007	Give my love to Andronicus and Junia , my relations , who were in prison with me , who are noted among the Apostles , and who were in Christ before me .
45016008	Give my love to Ampliatus , who is dear to me in the Lord ,
45016009	Give my love to Urbanus , a worker in Christ with us , and to my dear Stachys .
45016010	Give my love to Apelles , who has the approval of Christ . Say a kind word to those who are of the house of Aristobulus .
45016011	Give my love to Herodion , my relation . Say a kind word to those of the house of Narcissus , who are in the Lord .
45016012	Give my love to Tryphaena and Tryphosa , workers in the Lord . Give my love to my dear Persis , who did much work in the Lord .
45016013	Give my love to Rufus , one of the Lord's selection , and to his mother and mine .
45016014	Give my love to Asyncritus , Phlegon , Hermes , Patrobas , Hermas , and the brothers who are with them .
45016015	Give my love to Philologus and Julia , Nereus and his sister , and Olympas , and all the saints who are with them .
45016016	Give one another a holy kiss . All the churches of Christ send their love to you .
45016017	Now , it is my desire , brothers , that you will take note of those who are causing division and trouble among you , quite against the teaching which was given to you : and keep away from them .
45016018	For such people are not servants of the Lord Christ , but of their stomachs ; and by their smooth and well-said words the hearts of those who have no knowledge of evil are tricked .
45016019	For all have knowledge of how you do what you are ordered . For this reason I have joy in you , but it is my desire that you may be wise in what is good , and without knowledge of evil .
45016020	And the God of peace will be crushing Satan under your feet before long . The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
45016021	Timothy , who is working with me , sends his love to you , so do Lucius and Jason and Sosipater , my relations .
45016022	I , Tertius , who have done the writing of this letter , send love in the Lord .
45016023	Gaius , with whom I am living , whose house is open to all the church , sends his love , so does Erastus , the manager of the accounts of the town , and Quartus , the brother .
45016025	Now to him who is able to make you strong in agreement with the good news which I gave you and the preaching of Jesus Christ , in the light of the revelation of that secret which has been kept through times eternal ,
45016026	But is now made clear ; and by the writings of the prophets , by the order of the eternal God , the knowledge of it has been given to all the nations , so that they may come under the rule of the faith ;
45016027	To the only wise God , through Jesus Christ , be the glory for ever . So be it .
46001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the purpose of God , and Sosthenes the brother ,
46001002	To the church of God which is in Corinth , to those who have been made holy in Christ Jesus , saints by the selection of God , with all those who in every place give honour to the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , their Lord and ours :
46001003	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
46001004	I give praise to my God for you at all times , because of the grace of God which has been given to you in Christ Jesus ;
46001005	So that in him you have wealth in all things , in word and in knowledge of every sort ;
46001006	Even as the witness of the Christ has been made certain among you :
46001007	So that having every grace you are living in the hope of the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ ;
46001008	Who will give you strength to the end , to be free from all sin in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46001009	God is true , through whom you have been given a part with his Son , Jesus Christ our Lord .
46001010	Now I make request to you , my brothers , in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , that you will all say the same thing , and that there may be no divisions among you , so that you may be in complete agreement , in the same mind and in the same opinion .
46001011	Because it has come to my knowledge , through those of the house of Chloe , that there are divisions among you , my brothers .
46001012	That is , that some of you say , I am of Paul ; some say , I am of Apollos ; some say , I am of Cephas ; and some say , I am Christ's .
46001013	Is there a division in Christ ? was Paul nailed to the cross for you ? or were you given baptism in the name of Paul ?
46001014	I give praise to God that not one of you had baptism from me , but Crispus and Gaius ;
46001015	So that no one may be able to say that you had baptism in my name .
46001016	And I gave baptism to the house of Stephanas ; but I am not certain that any others had baptism from me .
46001017	For Christ sent me , not to give baptism , but to be a preacher of the good news : not with wise words , for fear that the cross of Christ might be made of no value .
46001018	For the word of the cross seems foolish to those who are on the way to destruction ; but to us who are on the way to salvation it is the power of God .
46001019	As it says in the holy Writings , I will put an end to the wisdom of the wise , and will put on one side the designs of those who have knowledge .
46001020	Where is the wise ? where is he who has knowledge of the law ? where is the man of this world who has a love of discussion ? has not God made foolish the wisdom of this world ?
46001021	For because , by the purpose of God , the world , with all its wisdom , had not the knowledge of God , it was God's pleasure , by so foolish a thing as preaching , to give salvation to those who had faith in him .
46001022	Seeing that the Jews make request for signs , and the Greeks are looking for knowledge :
46001023	But we give the good news of Christ on the cross , a hard thing to the Jews , and a foolish thing to the Gentiles ;
46001024	But to those of God's selection , Jews and Greeks , Christ is the power and the wisdom of God .
46001025	Because what seems foolish in God is wiser than men ; and what seems feeble in God is stronger than men .
46001026	For you see God's design for you , my brothers , that he has not taken a great number of the wise after the flesh , not the strong , not the noble :
46001027	But God made selection of the foolish things of this world so that he might put the wise to shame ; and the feeble things that he might put to shame the strong ;
46001028	And the low things of the world , and the things without honour , did God make selection of , yes , even the things which are not , so that he might make as nothing the things which are :
46001029	So that no flesh might have glory before God .
46001030	But God has given you a place in Christ Jesus , through whom God has given us wisdom and righteousness and salvation , and made us holy :
46001031	So that , as it is said in the holy Writings , Whoever has a desire for glory , let his glory be in the Lord .
46002001	And when I came to you , my brothers , I did not come with wise words of knowledge , putting before you the secret of God .
46002002	For I had made the decision to have knowledge of nothing among you but only of Jesus Christ on the cross .
46002003	And I was with you without strength , in fear and in doubt .
46002004	And in my preaching there were no honeyed words of wisdom , but I was dependent on the power of the Spirit to make it clear to you :
46002005	So that your faith might be based not on man's wisdom but on the power of God .
46002006	But still we have wisdom for those who are complete in knowledge , though not the wisdom of this world , and not of the rulers of this world , who are coming to nothing :
46002007	But we give the news of the secret wisdom of God , which he had kept in store before the world came into existence , for our glory ;
46002008	Of which not one of the rulers of this world had knowledge : for if they had , they would not have put the Lord of glory on the cross :
46002009	But as it says in the holy Writings , Things which the eye saw not , and which had not come to the ears or into the heart of man , such things as God has made ready for those who have love for him .
46002010	But God has given us the revelation of these things through his Spirit , for the Spirit makes search into all things , even the deep things of God .
46002011	For who has knowledge of the things of a man but the spirit of the man which is in him ? in the same way , no one has knowledge of the things of God but the Spirit of God .
46002012	But we have not the spirit of the world , but the Spirit which comes from God , so that we may have knowledge of the things which are freely given to us by God .
46002013	And these are the things which we say , not in the language of man's wisdom , but in words given to us by the Spirit , judging the things of the spirit by the help of the Spirit .
46002014	For the natural man is not able to take in the things of the Spirit of God : for they seem foolish to him , and he is not able to have knowledge of them , because such knowledge comes only through the Spirit .
46002015	But he who has the Spirit , though judging all things , is himself judged by no one .
46002016	For who has knowledge of the mind of the Lord , so as to be his teacher ? But we have the mind of Christ .
46003001	And the teaching I gave you , my brothers , was such as I was able to give , not to those who have the Spirit , but to those who are still in the flesh , even to children in Christ .
46003002	I gave you milk and not meat , because you were , then , unable to take it , and even now you are not able ;
46003003	Because you are still in the flesh : for when there is envy and division among you , are you not still walking after the way of the flesh , even as natural men ?
46003004	For when one says , I am of Paul ; and another says , I am of Apollos ; are you not talking like natural men ?
46003005	What then is Apollos ? and what is Paul ? They are but servants who gave you the good news as God gave it to them .
46003006	I did the planting , Apollos did the watering , but God gave the increase .
46003007	So then the planter is nothing , and the waterer is nothing ; but God who gives the increase .
46003008	Now the planter and the waterer are working for the same end : but they will have their separate rewards in the measure of their work .
46003009	For we are workers with God : you are God's planting , God's building .
46003010	In the measure of the grace given to me , I , as a wise master-builder , have put the base in position , and another goes on building on it . But let every man take care what he puts on it .
46003011	For there is no other base for the building but that which has been put down , which is Jesus Christ .
46003012	But on the base a man may put gold , silver , stones of great price , wood , dry grass , cut stems ;
46003013	Every man's work will be made clear in that day , because it will be tested by fire ; and the fire itself will make clear the quality of every man's work .
46003014	If any man's work comes through the test , he will have a reward .
46003015	If the fire puts an end to any man's work , it will be his loss : but he will get salvation himself , though as by fire .
46003016	Do you not see that you are God's holy house , and that the Spirit of God has his place in you ?
46003017	If anyone makes the house of God unclean , God will put an end to him ; for the house of God is holy , and you are his house .
46003018	Let no man have a false idea . If any man seems to himself to be wise among you , let him become foolish , so that he may be wise .
46003019	For the wisdom of this world is foolish before God . As it is said in the holy Writings , He who takes the wise in their secret designs :
46003020	And again , The Lord has knowledge of the reasonings of the wise , that they are nothing .
46003021	So let no one take pride in men . For all things are yours ;
46003022	Paul , or Apollos , or Cephas , or the world , or life , or death , or things present , or things to come ; all are yours ;
46003023	And you are Christ's ; and Christ is God's .
46004001	Let us be judged as servants of Christ , and as those who are responsible for the secret things of God .
46004002	And it is right for such servants to be safe persons .
46004003	But it is a small thing to me that I am judged by you or by man's judging ; I am not even a judge of myself .
46004004	For I am not conscious of any wrong in myself ; but this does not make me clear , for it is the Lord who is my judge .
46004005	For this reason let there be no judging before the time , till the Lord comes , who will make clear the secret things of the dark , and the designs of the heart ; and then will every man have his praise from God .
46004006	My brothers , it is because of you that I have taken Apollos and myself as examples of these things , so that in us you might see that it is not wise to go farther than what is in the holy Writings , so that no one of you may be lifted up against his brother .
46004007	For who made you better than your brother ? or what have you that has not been given to you ? but if it has been given to you , what cause have you for pride , as if it had not been given to you ?
46004008	For even now you are full , even now you have wealth , you have been made kings without us : truly , I would be glad if you were kings , so that we might be kings with you .
46004009	For it seems to me that God has put us the Apostles last of all , as men whose fate is death : for we are put on view to the world , and to angels , and to men .
46004010	We are made to seem foolish for Christ , but you are wise in Christ ; we are feeble , but you are strong ; you have glory , but we have shame .
46004011	Even to this hour we are without food , drink , and clothing , we are given blows and have no certain resting-place ;
46004012	And with our hands we do the hardest work : when they give us curses we give blessings , when we undergo punishment we take it quietly ;
46004013	When evil things are said about us we give gentle answers : we are made as the unclean things of the world , as that for which no one has any use , even till now .
46004014	I am not saying these things to put you to shame , but so that , as my dear children , you may see what is right .
46004015	For even if you had ten thousand teachers in Christ , you have not more than one father : for in Christ Jesus I have given birth to you through the good news .
46004016	So my desire is that you take me as your example .
46004017	For this cause I have sent Timothy to you , who is my dear and true child in the Lord ; he will make clear to you my ways in Christ , even as I am teaching everywhere in every church .
46004018	Now some are full of pride , as if I was not coming to you .
46004019	But I will come to you in a short time , if it is pleasing to the Lord , and I will take note , not of the word of those who are full of pride , but of the power .
46004020	For the kingdom of God is not in word but in power .
46004021	What is your desire ? is my coming to be with punishment , or is it to be in love and a gentle spirit ?
46005001	It is said , in fact , that there is among you a sin of the flesh , such as is not seen even among the Gentiles , that one of you has his father's wife .
46005002	And in place of feeling sorrow , you are pleased with yourselves , so that he who has done this thing has not been sent away from among you .
46005003	For I myself , being present in spirit though not in body , have come to a decision about him who has done this thing ;
46005004	In the name of our Lord Jesus , when you have come together with my spirit , with the power of our Lord Jesus ,
46005005	That this man is to be handed over to Satan for the destruction of the flesh , so that his spirit may have forgiveness in the day of the Lord Jesus .
46005006	This pride of yours is not good . Do you not see that a little leaven makes a change in all the mass ?
46005007	Take away , then , the old leaven , so that you may be a new mass , even as you are without leaven . For Christ has been put to death as our Passover .
46005008	Let us then keep the feast , not with old leaven , and not with the leaven of evil thoughts and acts , but with the unleavened bread of true thoughts and right feelings .
46005009	In my letter I said to you that you were not to keep company with those who go after the desires of the flesh ;
46005010	But I had not in mind the sinners who are outside the church , or those who have a desire for and take the property of others , or those who give worship to images ; for it is not possible to keep away from such people without going out of the world completely :
46005011	But the sense of my letter was that if a brother had the name of being one who went after the desires of the flesh , or had the desire for other people's property , or was in the way of using violent language , or being the worse for drink , or took by force what was not his , you might not keep company with such a one , or take food with him .
46005012	For it is no business of mine to be judging those who are outside ; but it is yours to be judging those who are among you ;
46005013	As for those who are outside , God is their judge . So put away the evil man from among you .
46006001	How is it , that if any one of you has a cause at law against another , he takes it before a Gentile judge and not before the saints ?
46006002	Is it not certain that the saints will be the judges of the world ? if then the world will be judged by you , are you unable to give a decision about the smallest things ?
46006003	Is it not certain that we are to be the judges of angels ? how much more then of the things of this life ?
46006004	If then there are questions to be judged in connection with the things of this life , why do you put them in the hands of those who have no position in the church ?
46006005	I say this to put you to shame . Is there not among you one wise man who may be able to give a decision between his brothers ?
46006006	But a brother who has a cause at law against another takes it before Gentile judges .
46006007	More than this , it is not to your credit to have causes at law with one another at all . Why not put up with wrong ? why not undergo loss ?
46006008	So far from doing this , you yourselves do wrong and take your brothers ' property .
46006009	Have you not knowledge that evil-doers will have no part in the kingdom of God ? Have no false ideas about this : no one who goes after the desires of the flesh , or gives worship to images , or is untrue when married , or is less than a man , or makes a wrong use of men ,
46006010	Or is a thief , or the worse for drink , or makes use of strong language , or takes by force what is not his , will have any part in the kingdom of God .
46006011	And such were some of you ; but you have been washed , you have been made holy , you have been given righteousness in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and in the Spirit of our God .
46006012	I am free to do all things ; but not all things are wise . I am free to do all things ; but I will not let myself come under the power of any .
46006013	Food is for the stomach and the stomach for food , and God will put an end to them together . But the body is not for the desires of the flesh , but for the Lord ; and the Lord for the body :
46006014	And God who made the Lord Jesus come back from the dead will do the same for us by his power .
46006015	Do you not see that your bodies are part of the body of Christ ? how then may I take what is a part of the body of Christ and make it a part of the body of a loose woman ? such a thing may not be .
46006016	Or do you not see that he who is joined to a loose woman is one body with her ? for God has said , The two of them will become one flesh .
46006017	But he who is united to the Lord is one spirit .
46006018	Keep away from the desires of the flesh . Every sin which a man does is outside of the body ; but he who goes after the desires of the flesh does evil to his body .
46006019	Or are you not conscious that your body is a house for the Holy Spirit which is in you , and which has been given to you by God ? and you are not the owners of yourselves ;
46006020	For a payment has been made for you : let God be honoured in your body .
46007001	Now , as to the things in your letter to me : It is good for a man to have nothing to do with a woman .
46007002	But because of the desires of the flesh , let every man have his wife , and every woman her husband .
46007003	Let the husband give to the wife what is right ; and let the wife do the same to the husband .
46007004	The wife has not power over her body , but the husband ; and in the same way the husband has not power over his body , but the wife .
46007005	Do not keep back from one another what is right , but only for a short time , and by agreement , so that you may give yourselves to prayer , and come together again ; so that Satan may not get the better of you through your loss of self-control .
46007006	But this I say as my opinion , and not as an order of the Lord .
46007007	It is my desire that all men might be even as I am . But every man has the power of his special way of life given him by God , one in this way and one in that .
46007008	But I say to the unmarried and to the widows , It is good for them to be even as I am .
46007009	But if they have not self-control let them get married ; for married life is better than the burning of desire .
46007010	But to the married I give orders , though not I but the Lord , that the wife may not go away from her husband
46007011	( Or if she goes away from him , let her keep unmarried , or be united to her husband again ) ; and that the husband may not go away from his wife .
46007012	But to the rest I say , and not the Lord ; If a brother has a wife who is not a Christian , and it is her desire to go on living with him , let him not go away from her .
46007013	And if a woman has a husband who is not a Christian , and it is his desire to go on living with her , let her not go away from her husband .
46007014	For the husband who has not faith is made holy through his Christian wife , and the wife who is not a Christian is made holy through the brother : if not , your children would be unholy , but now are they holy .
46007015	But if the one who is not a Christian has a desire to go away , let it be so : the brother or the sister in such a position is not forced to do one thing or the other : but it is God's pleasure that we may be at peace with one another .
46007016	For how may you be certain , O wife , that you will not be the cause of salvation to your husband ? or you , O husband , that you may not do the same for your wife ?
46007017	Only , as the Lord has given to a man , and as is the purpose of God for him , so let him go on living . And these are my orders for all the churches .
46007018	If any man who is a Christian has had circumcision , let him keep so ; and if any man who is a Christian has not had circumcision , let him make no change .
46007019	Circumcision is nothing , and its opposite is nothing , but only doing the orders of God is of value .
46007020	Let every man keep the position in which he has been placed by God .
46007021	If you were a servant when you became a Christian , let it not be a grief to you ; but if you have a chance to become free , make use of it .
46007022	For he who was a servant when he became a Christian is the Lord's free man ; and he who was free when he became a Christian is the Lord's servant .
46007023	It is the Lord who has made payment for you : be not servants of men .
46007024	My brothers , let every man keep in that condition which is the purpose of God for him .
46007025	Now about virgins I have no orders from the Lord : but I give my opinion as one to whom the Lord has given mercy to be true to him .
46007026	In my opinion then , because of the present trouble , it is good for a man to keep as he is .
46007027	If you are married to a wife , make no attempt to get free from her : if you are free from a wife , do not take a wife .
46007028	If you get married it is not a sin ; and if an unmarried woman gets married it is not a sin . But those who do so will have trouble in the flesh . But I will not be hard on you .
46007029	But I say this , my brothers , the time is short ; and from now it will be wise for those who have wives to be as if they had them not ;
46007030	And for those who are in sorrow , to give no signs of it ; and for those who are glad , to give no signs of joy ; and for those who are getting property , to be as if they had nothing ;
46007031	And for those who make use of the world , not to be using it fully ; for this world's way of life will quickly come to an end .
46007032	But it is my desire for you to be free from cares . The unmarried man gives his mind to the things of the Lord , how he may give pleasure to the Lord :
46007033	But the married man gives his attention to the things of this world , how he may give pleasure to his wife .
46007034	And the wife is not the same as the virgin . The virgin gives her mind to the things of the Lord , so that she may be holy in body and in spirit : but the married woman takes thought for the things of the world , how she may give pleasure to her husband .
46007035	Now I say this for your profit ; not to make things hard for you , but because of what is right , and so that you may be able to give all your attention to the things of the Lord .
46007036	But if , in any man's opinion , he is not doing what is right for his virgin , if she is past her best years , and there is need for it , let him do what seems right to him ; it is no sin ; let them be married .
46007037	But the man who is strong in mind and purpose , who is not forced but has control over his desires , does well if he comes to the decision to keep her a virgin .
46007038	So then , he who gets married to his virgin does well , and he who keeps her unmarried does better .
46007039	It is right for a wife to be with her husband as long as he is living ; but when her husband is dead , she is free to be married to another ; but only to a Christian .
46007040	But it will be better for her to keep as she is , in my opinion : and it seems to me that I have the Spirit of God .
46008001	Now about things offered to images : we all seem to ourselves to have knowledge . Knowledge gives pride , but love gives true strength .
46008002	If anyone seems to himself to have knowledge , so far he has not the right sort of knowledge about anything ;
46008003	But if anyone has love for God , God has knowledge of him .
46008004	So , then , as to the question of taking food offered to images , we are certain that an image is nothing in the world , and that there is no God but one .
46008005	For though there are those who have the name of gods , in heaven or on earth , as there are a number of gods and a number of lords ,
46008006	There is for us only one God , the Father , of whom are all things , and we are for him ; and one Lord , Jesus Christ , through whom are all things , and we have our being through him .
46008007	Still , all men have not that knowledge : but some , being used till now to the image , are conscious that they are taking food which has been offered to the image ; and because they are not strong in the faith , their minds are troubled .
46008008	But God's approval of us is not based on the food we take : if we do not take it we are no worse for it ; and if we take it we are no better .
46008009	But take care that this power of yours does not give cause for trouble to the feeble .
46008010	For if a man sees you , who have knowledge , taking food as a guest in the house of an image , will it not give him , if he is feeble , the idea that he may take food offered to images ?
46008011	And so , through your knowledge , you are the cause of destruction to your brother , for whom Christ underwent death .
46008012	And in this way , doing evil to the brothers , and causing trouble to those whose faith is feeble , you are sinning against Christ .
46008013	For this reason , if food is a cause of trouble to my brother , I will give up taking meat for ever , so that I may not be a cause of trouble to my brother .
46009001	Am I not free ? am I not an Apostle ? have I not seen Jesus our Lord ? are you not my work in the Lord ?
46009002	If to others I am not an Apostle , at least I am one to you : for the fact that you are Christians is the sign that I am an Apostle .
46009003	My answer to those who are judging me is this .
46009004	Have we no right to take food and drink ?
46009005	Have we no right to take about with us a Christian wife , like the rest of the Apostles , and the brothers of the Lord , and Cephas ?
46009006	Or I only and Barnabas , have we no right to take a rest from work ?
46009007	Who ever goes to war without looking to someone to be responsible for his payment ? who puts in vines and does not take the fruit of them ? or who takes care of sheep without drinking of their milk ?
46009008	Am I talking as a man ? does not the law say the same ?
46009009	For it says in the law of Moses , It is not right to keep the ox from taking the grain when he is crushing it . Is it for the oxen that God is giving orders ?
46009010	Or has he us in mind ? Yes , it was said for us ; because it is right for the ploughman to do his ploughing in hope , and for him who is crushing the grain to do his work hoping for a part in the fruits of it .
46009011	If we have been planting the things of the Spirit for you , does it seem a great thing for you to give us a part in your things of this world ?
46009012	If others have a part in this right over you , have we not even more ? But we did not make use of our right , so that we might put nothing in the way of the good news of Christ .
46009013	Do you not see that the servants of the holy things get their living from the Temple , and the servants of the altar have their part in the food which is offered on the altar ?
46009014	Even so did the Lord give orders that the preachers of the good news might get their living from the good news .
46009015	But I have not made use of any of these things : and I am not writing this in the hope that it may be so for me : for it would be better for me to undergo death , than for any man to make this pride of mine of no effect .
46009016	For if I am a preacher of the good news , I have no cause for pride in this ; because I am forced to do so , for a curse is on me if I do not .
46009017	But if I do it gladly , I have a reward ; and if not , I am under orders to do it .
46009018	What then is my reward ? This , that when I am giving the good news , I may give it without payment , not making use of my rights as a preacher of the good news .
46009019	For though I was free from all men , I made myself a servant to all , so that more might have salvation .
46009020	And to the Jews I was as a Jew , so that I might give the good news to them ; to those under the law I was the same , not as being myself under the law , but so that I might give the good news to those under the law .
46009021	To those without the law I was as one without the law , not as being without law to God , but as under law to Christ , so that I might give the good news to those without the law .
46009022	To the feeble , I was as one who is feeble , so that they might have salvation : I have been all things to all men , so that some at least might have salvation .
46009023	And I do all things for the cause of the good news , so that I may have a part in it .
46009024	Do you not see that in a running competition all take part , but only one gets the reward ? So let your minds be fixed on the reward .
46009025	And every man who takes part in the sports has self-control in all things . Now they do it to get a crown which is of this world , but we for an eternal crown .
46009026	So then I am running , not uncertainly ; so I am fighting , not as one who gives blows in the air :
46009027	But I give blows to my body , and keep it under control , for fear that , after having given the good news to others , I myself might not have God's approval .
46010001	For it is my desire , my brothers , that you may keep in mind how all our fathers were under the cloud , and they all went through the sea ;
46010002	And they all had baptism from Moses in the cloud and in the sea ;
46010003	And they all took the same holy food ;
46010004	And the same holy drink : for they all took of the water from the holy rock which came after them : and the rock was Christ .
46010005	But with most of them God was not pleased : for they came to their end in the waste land .
46010006	Now these things were for an example to us , so that our hearts might not go after evil things , as they did .
46010007	Then do not go after false gods , as some of them did ; as it is said in the holy Writings , After resting and feasting , the people got up to take their pleasure .
46010008	Again , let us not give way to the desires of the flesh , as some of them did , of whom twenty-three thousand came to their end in one day .
46010009	And let us not put the Lord to the test , as some of them did , and came to their death by snakes .
46010010	And do not say evil things against the Lord , as some of them did , and destruction overtook them .
46010011	Now these things were done as an example ; and were put down in writing for our teaching , on whom the last days have come .
46010012	So let him who seems to himself to be safe go in fear of a fall .
46010013	You have been put to no test but such as is common to man : and God is true , who will not let any test come on you which you are not able to undergo ; but he will make with the test a way out of it , so that you may be able to go through it .
46010014	For this cause , my dear brothers , give no worship to false gods .
46010015	What I am saying is for wise men , do you be the judges of it .
46010016	The cup of blessing which we take , does it not give us a part in the blood of Christ ? and is not the broken bread a taking part in the body of Christ ?
46010017	Because we , being a number of persons , are one bread , we are one body : for we all take part in the one bread .
46010018	See Israel after the flesh : do not those who take as food the offerings of the altar take a part in the altar ?
46010019	Do I say , then , that what is offered to images is anything , or that the image is anything ?
46010020	What I say is that the things offered by the Gentiles are offered to evil spirits and not to God ; and it is not my desire for you to have any part with evil spirits .
46010021	It is not possible for you , at the same time , to take the cup of the Lord and the cup of evil spirits ; you may not take part in the table of the Lord and the table of evil spirits .
46010022	Or may we be the cause of envy to the Lord ? are we stronger than he ?
46010023	We are free to do all things , but there are things which it is not wise to do . We are free to do all things , but not all things are for the common good .
46010024	Let a man give attention not only to what is good for himself , but equally to his neighbour's good .
46010025	Whatever meat may be had at the public market , take as food without question of right or wrong ;
46010026	For the earth is the Lord's and all things in it .
46010027	If a Gentile makes a feast for you , and you are pleased to go as a guest , take whatever is put before you , without question of right or wrong .
46010028	But if anyone says to you , This food has been used as an offering , do not take it , on account of him who said it , and on account of his sense of right and wrong :
46010029	Right and wrong , I say , not for you , but for the other man ; for the fact that I am free is not dependent on another man's sense of right or wrong .
46010030	But if I give praise to God for the food which I take , let no man say evil of me for that reason .
46010031	So then , if it is a question of food or drink , or any other thing , whatever you do , do all to the glory of God .
46010032	Give no cause of trouble to Jews , or to Greeks , or to the church of God .
46010033	Even as I give way to all men in all things , not looking for profit for myself , but for the good of others , that they may get salvation .
46011001	So take me for your example , even as I take Christ for mine .
46011002	Now I am pleased to see that you keep me in memory in all things , and that you give attention to the teaching which was handed down from me to you .
46011003	But it is important for you to keep this fact in mind , that the head of every man is Christ ; and the head of the woman is the man , and the head of Christ is God .
46011004	Every man who takes part in prayer , or gives teaching as a prophet , with his head covered , puts shame on his head .
46011005	But every woman who does so with her head unveiled , puts shame on her head : for it is the same as if her hair was cut off .
46011006	For if a woman is not veiled , let her hair be cut off ; but if it is a shame to a woman to have her hair cut off , let her be veiled .
46011007	For it is not right for a man to have his head covered , because he is the image and glory of God : but the woman is the glory of the man .
46011008	For the man did not come from the woman , but the woman from the man .
46011009	And the man was not made for the woman , but the woman for the man .
46011010	For this reason it is right for the woman to have a sign of authority on her head , because of the angels .
46011011	But the woman is not separate from the man , and the man is not separate from the woman in the Lord .
46011012	For as the woman is from the man , so the man is through the woman ; but all things are from God .
46011013	Be judges yourselves of the question : does it seem right for a woman to take part in prayer unveiled ?
46011014	Does it not seem natural to you that if a man has long hair , it is a cause of shame to him ?
46011015	But if a woman has long hair , it is a glory to her : for her hair is given to her for a covering .
46011016	But if any man will not be ruled in this question , this is not our way of doing things , and it is not done in the churches of God .
46011017	But in giving you this order , there is one thing about which I am not pleased : it is that when you come together it is not for the better but for the worse .
46011018	For first of all , it has come to my ears that when you come together in the church , there are divisions among you , and I take the statement to be true in part .
46011019	For divisions are necessary among you , in order that those who have God's approval may be clearly seen among you .
46011020	But now , when you come together , it is not possible to take the holy meal of the Lord :
46011021	For when you take your food , everyone takes his meal before the other ; and one has not enough food , and another is the worse for drink .
46011022	What ? have you not houses to take your meals in ? or have you no respect for the church of God , putting the poor to shame ? What am I to say to you ? am I to give you praise ? certainly not .
46011023	For it was handed down to me from the Lord , as I gave it to you , that the Lord Jesus , on the night when Judas was false to him , took bread ,
46011024	And when it had been broken with an act of praise , he said , This is my body which is for you : do this in memory of me .
46011025	In the same way , with the cup , after the meal , he said , This cup is the new testament in my blood : do this , whenever you take it , in memory of me .
46011026	For whenever you take the bread and the cup you give witness to the Lord's death till he comes .
46011027	If , then , anyone takes the bread or the cup of the Lord in the wrong spirit , he will be responsible for the body and blood of the Lord .
46011028	But let no man take of the bread and the cup without testing himself .
46011029	For a man puts himself in danger , if he takes part in the holy meal without being conscious that it is the Lord's body .
