46011030	For this cause a number of you are feeble and ill , and a number are dead .
46011031	But if we were true judges of ourselves , punishment would not come on us .
46011032	But if punishment does come , it is sent by the Lord , so that we may be safe when the world is judged .
46011033	So then , my brothers , when you come together to the holy meal of the Lord , let there be waiting for one another .
46011034	If any man is in need of food , let him take his meal in his house ; so that you may not come together to your damage . And the rest I will put in order when I come .
46012001	But about the things of the spirit , my brothers , it is not right for you to be without teaching .
46012002	You are conscious that when you were Gentiles , in whatever way you were guided , you went after images without voice or power .
46012003	So it is my desire for you to be clear about this ; that no one is able to say by the Spirit of God that Jesus is cursed ; and no one is able to say that Jesus is Lord , but by the Holy Spirit .
46012004	Now there are different qualities given to men , but the same Spirit .
46012005	And there are different sorts of servants , but the same Lord .
46012006	And there are different operations , but the same God , who is working all things in all .
46012007	But to every man some form of the Spirit's working is given for the common good .
46012008	For to one are given words of wisdom through the Spirit ; and to another words of knowledge through the same Spirit :
46012009	To another faith in the same Spirit ; and to another the power of taking away disease , by the one Spirit ;
46012010	And to another the power of working wonders ; and to another the prophet's word ; and to another the power of testing spirits ; to another different sorts of tongues ; and to another the power of making clear the sense of the tongues :
46012011	But all these are the operations of the one and the same Spirit , giving to every man separately as his pleasure is .
46012012	For as the body is one , and has a number of parts , and all the parts make one body , so is Christ .
46012013	For through the baptism of the one Spirit we were all formed into one body , Jews or Greeks , servants or free men , and were all made full of the same Spirit .
46012014	For the body is not one part , but a number of parts .
46012015	If the foot says , Because I am not the hand , I am not a part of the body ; it is no less a part of the body .
46012016	And if the ear says , Because I am not the eye , I am not a part of the body ; it is a part of the body all the same .
46012017	If all the body was an eye , where would be the hearing ? if all was hearing , where would be the smelling ?
46012018	But now God has put every one of the parts in the body as it was pleasing to him .
46012019	And if they were all one part , where would the body be ?
46012020	But now they are all different parts , but one body .
46012021	And the eye may not say to the hand , I have no need of you : or again the head to the feet , I have no need of you .
46012022	No , those parts which seem to be feeble are the more necessary ;
46012023	And to those parts of the body which seem to have less honour we give all the more honour ; and to those parts of the body which are a cause of shame to us we give the greater respect ;
46012024	But those parts of the body which are beautiful have no need of such care : and so the body has been joined together by God in such a way as to give more honour to those parts which had need of it ;
46012025	So that there might be no division in the body ; but all the parts might have the same care for one another .
46012026	And if there is pain in one part of the body , all the parts will be feeling it ; or if one part is honoured , all the parts will be glad .
46012027	Now you are the body of Christ , and every one of you the separate parts of it .
46012028	And God has put some in the church , first , Apostles ; second , prophets ; third , teachers ; then those with wonder-working powers , then those with the power of taking away disease , helpers , wise guides , users of strange tongues .
46012029	Are all Apostles ? are all prophets ? are all teachers ? have all the power of working wonders ?
46012030	Are all able to take away disease ? have all the power of tongues ? are all able to give their sense ?
46012031	But let your desires be turned to the more important things given by the Spirit . And now I am pointing out to you an even better way .
46013001	If I make use of the tongues of men and of angels , and have not love , I am like sounding brass , or a loud-tongued bell .
46013002	And if I have a prophet's power , and have knowledge of all secret things ; and if I have all faith , by which mountains may be moved from their place , but have not love , I am nothing .
46013003	And if I give all my goods to the poor , and if I give my body to be burned , but have not love , it is of no profit to me .
46013004	Love is never tired of waiting ; love is kind ; love has no envy ; love has no high opinion of itself , love has no pride ;
46013005	Love's ways are ever fair , it takes no thought for itself ; it is not quickly made angry , it takes no account of evil ;
46013006	It takes no pleasure in wrongdoing , but has joy in what is true ;
46013007	Love has the power of undergoing all things , having faith in all things , hoping all things .
46013008	Though the prophet's word may come to an end , tongues come to nothing , and knowledge have no more value , love has no end .
46013009	For our knowledge is only in part , and the prophet's word gives only a part of what is true :
46013010	But when that which is complete is come , then that which is in part will be no longer necessary .
46013011	When I was a child , I made use of a child's language , I had a child's feelings and a child's thoughts : now that I am a man , I have put away the things of a child .
46013012	For now we see things in a glass , darkly ; but then face to face : now my knowledge is in part ; then it will be complete , even as God's knowledge of me .
46013013	But now we still have faith , hope , love , these three ; and the greatest of these is love .
46014001	Go after love ; still desiring to have the things which the Spirit gives , but most of all that you may have the prophet's power .
46014002	For he who makes use of tongues is not talking to men but to God ; because no one has the sense of what he is saying ; but in the Spirit he is talking of secret things .
46014003	But the word of the prophet gives men knowledge and comfort and strength .
46014004	He who makes use of tongues may do good to himself ; but he who gives the prophet's word does good to the church .
46014005	Now though it is my desire for you all to have the power of tongues , it would give me more pleasure to be hearing the prophet's word from you ; for this is a greater thing than using tongues , if the sense is not given at the same time , for the good of the church .
46014006	But , now , my brothers , if I come to you using tongues , what profit will it be to you , if I do not give you a revelation , or knowledge , or the word of the prophet , or teaching ?
46014007	Even things without life , having a voice , such as a music-pipe or other instrument , if they do not give out different sounds , who may be certain what is being played ?
46014008	For if the war-horn gives out an uncertain note , who will get ready for the fight ?
46014009	So if you , in using a strange tongue , say words which have no sense , how will anyone take in what you are saying ? for you will be talking to the air .
46014010	There are , it may be , a number of different voices in the world , and no voice is without sense .
46014011	But if the sense of the voice is not clear to me , I am like a man from a strange country to him who is talking , and he will be the same to me .
46014012	So if you are desiring the things which the Spirit gives , let your minds be turned first to the things which are for the good of the church .
46014013	For this reason , let the man who has the power of using tongues make request that he may , at the same time , be able to give the sense .
46014014	For if I make use of tongues in my prayers , my spirit makes the prayer , but not my mind .
46014015	What then ? let my prayer be from the spirit , and equally from the mind ; let my song be from the spirit , and equally from mind .
46014016	For if you give a blessing with the spirit , how will the man who has no knowledge say , So be it , after your prayer , seeing that he has not taken in what you are saying ?
46014017	For your giving of the blessing is certainly well done , but of no profit to the man without knowledge .
46014018	I give praise to God that I am able to make use of tongues more than you all :
46014019	But in the church it would be better for me to make use of five words of which the sense was clear , so that others might have profit , than ten thousand words in a strange tongue .
46014020	My brothers , do not be children in mind : in evil be as little children , but in mind be of full growth .
46014021	In the law it is said , By men of other tongues and by strange lips will my words come to this people ; and not even so will they give ear to me , says the Lord .
46014022	For this reason tongues are for a sign , not to those who have faith , but to those who have not : but the prophet's word is for those who have faith , and not for the rest who have not .
46014023	If , then , the church has come together , and all are using tongues , and there come in men without knowledge or faith , will they not say that you are unbalanced ?
46014024	But if all are teaching as prophets , and a man without faith or knowledge comes in , he is tested by all , he is judged by all ;
46014025	The secrets of his heart are made clear ; and he will go down on his face and give worship to God , saying that God is truly among you .
46014026	What is it then , my brothers ? when you come together everyone has a holy song , or a revelation , or a tongue , or is giving the sense of it . Let everything be done for the common good .
46014027	If any man makes use of a tongue , let it not be more than two , or at the most three , and in turn ; and let someone give the sense :
46014028	But if there is no one to give the sense , let him keep quiet in the church ; and let his words be to himself and to God .
46014029	And let the prophets give their words , but not more than two or three , and let the others be judges of what they say .
46014030	But if a revelation is given to another who is seated near , let the first be quiet .
46014031	For you may all be prophets in turn so that all may get knowledge and comfort ;
46014032	And the spirits of the prophets are controlled by the prophets ;
46014033	For God is not a God whose ways are without order , but a God of peace ; as in all the churches of the saints .
46014034	Let women keep quiet in the churches : for it is not right for them to be talking ; but let them be under control , as it says in the law .
46014035	And if they have a desire for knowledge about anything , let them put questions to their husbands privately : for talking in the church puts shame on a woman .
46014036	What ? was it from you that the word of God went out ? or did it only come in to you ?
46014037	If any man seems to himself to be a prophet or to have the Spirit , let him take note of the things which I am writing to you , as being the word of the Lord .
46014038	But if any man is without knowledge , let him be so .
46014039	So then , my brothers , let it be your chief desire to be prophets ; but let no one be stopped from using tongues .
46014040	Let all things be done in the right and ordered way .
46015001	Now I am going to make clear to you , my brothers , what the good news was which I gave to you , and which you took , and on which your faith is based ,
46015002	By which you have salvation ; that is to say , the form in which it was given to you , if it is fixed in your minds , and if your faith in it is not without effect .
46015003	For I gave to you first of all what was handed down to me , how Christ underwent death for our sins , as it says in the Writings ;
46015004	And he was put in the place of the dead ; and on the third day he came back from the dead , as it says in the Writings ;
46015005	And he was seen by Cephas ; then by the twelve ;
46015006	Then by more than five hundred brothers at the same time , most of whom are still living , but some are sleeping ;
46015007	Then he was seen by James ; then by all the Apostles .
46015008	And last of all , as by one whose birth was out of the right time , he was seen by me .
46015009	For I am the least of the Apostles , having no right to be named an Apostle , because of my cruel attacks on the church of God .
46015010	But by the grace of God , I am what I am : and his grace which was given to me has not been for nothing ; for I did more work than all of them ; though not I , but the grace of God which was with me .
46015011	If then it is I who am the preacher , or they , this is our word , and to this you have given your faith .
46015012	Now if the good news says that Christ came back from the dead , how do some of you say that there is no coming back from the dead ?
46015013	But if there is no coming back from the dead , then Christ has not come back from the dead :
46015014	And if Christ did not come again from the dead , then our good news and your faith in it are of no effect .
46015015	Yes , and we are seen to be false witnesses of God ; because we gave witness of God that by his power Christ came again from the dead : which is not true if there is no coming back from the dead .
46015016	For if it is not possible for the dead to come to life again , then Christ has not come to life again :
46015017	And if that is so , your faith is of no effect ; you are still in your sins .
46015018	And , in addition , the dead in Christ have gone to destruction .
46015019	If in this life only we have hope in Christ , we are of all men most unhappy .
46015020	But now Christ has truly come back from the dead , the first-fruits of those who are sleeping .
46015021	For as by man came death , so by man there is a coming back from the dead .
46015022	For as in Adam death comes to all , so in Christ will all come back to life .
46015023	But every man in his right order : Christ the first-fruits ; then those who are Christ's at his coming .
46015024	Then comes the end , when he will give up the kingdom to God , even the Father ; when he will have put an end to all rule and to all authority and power .
46015025	For his rule will go on till he has put all those who are against him under his feet .
46015026	The last power to come to an end is death .
46015027	For , as it says , He has put all things under his feet . But when he says , All things are put under him , it is clear that it is not said about him who put all things under him .
46015028	And when all things have been put under him , then will the Son himself be under him who put all things under him , so that God may be all in all .
46015029	Again , what will they do who are given baptism for the dead ? if the dead do not come back at all , why are people given baptism for them ?
46015030	And why are we in danger every hour ?
46015031	Yes , truly , by your pride in me , my brothers in Christ Jesus our Lord , my life is one long death .
46015032	If , after the way of men , I was fighting with beasts at Ephesus , what profit is it to me ? If the dead do not come to life again , let us take our pleasure in feasting , for tomorrow we come to an end .
46015033	Do not be tricked by false words : evil company does damage to good behaviour .
46015034	Be awake to righteousness and keep yourselves from sin ; for some have no knowledge of God : I say this to put you to shame .
46015035	But someone will say , How do the dead come back ? and with what sort of body do they come ?
46015036	Foolish man , it is necessary for the seed which you put into the earth to undergo death in order that it may come to life again :
46015037	And when you put it into the earth , you do not put in the body which it will be , but only the seed , of grain or some other sort of plant ;
46015038	But God gives it a body , as it is pleasing to him , and to every seed its special body .
46015039	All flesh is not the same flesh : but there is one flesh of men , another of beasts , another of birds , and another of fishes .
46015040	And there are bodies of heaven and bodies of earth , but the glory of the one is different from that of the other .
46015041	There is one glory of the sun , and another glory of the moon , and another glory of the stars ; for the glory of one star is different from that of another .
46015042	So is it with the coming back from the dead . It is planted in death ; it comes again in life :
46015043	It is planted in shame ; it comes again in glory : feeble when it is planted , it comes again in power :
46015044	It is planted a natural body ; it comes again as a body of the spirit . If there is a natural body , there is equally a body of the spirit .
46015045	And so it is said , The first man Adam was a living soul . The last Adam is a life-giving spirit .
46015046	But that which is natural comes before that which is of the spirit .
46015047	The first man is from the earth , and of the earth : the second man is from heaven .
46015048	Those who are of the earth are like the man who was from the earth : and those who are of heaven are like the one from heaven .
46015049	And in the same way as we have taken on us the image of the man from the earth , so we will take on us the image of the one from heaven .
46015050	Now I say this , my brothers , that it is not possible for flesh and blood to have a part in the kingdom of God ; and death may not have a part in life .
46015051	See , I am giving you the revelation of a secret : we will not all come to the sleep of death , but we will all be changed .
46015052	In a second , in the shutting of an eye , at the sound of the last horn : for at that sound the dead will come again , free for ever from the power of death , and we will be changed .
46015053	For this body which comes to destruction will be made free from the power of death , and the man who is under the power of death will put on eternal life .
46015054	But when this has taken place , then that which was said in the Writings will come true , Death is overcome by life .
46015055	O death , where is your power ? O death , where are your pains ?
46015056	The pain of death is sin ; and the power of sin is the law :
46015057	But praise be to God who gives us strength to overcome through our Lord Jesus Christ .
46015058	For this cause , my dear brothers , be strong in purpose and unmoved , ever giving yourselves to the work of the Lord , because you are certain that your work is not without effect in the Lord .
46016001	Now about the giving of money for the saints , as I gave orders to the churches of Galatia , so do you .
46016002	On the first day of the week , let every one of you put by him in store , in measure as he has done well in business , so that it may not be necessary to get money together when I come .
46016003	And when I come , I will send the men of your selection with letters to take the money you have got together to Jerusalem .
46016004	And if it is possible for me to go there , they will go with me .
46016005	But I will come to you after I have gone through Macedonia , for that is my purpose ;
46016006	But I may be with you for a time , or even for the winter , so that you may see me on my way , wherever I go .
46016007	For it is not my desire to see you now , on my way ; because it is my hope to be with you for some time , if that is the Lord's pleasure .
46016008	But I will be at Ephesus till Pentecost ;
46016009	For a great and important door there is open to me , and there are a number of people against me .
46016010	Now if Timothy comes , see that he is with you without fear ; because he is doing the Lord's work , even as I am :
46016011	See then that he has the honour which is right . But send him on his way in peace , so that he may come to me : for I am looking for him with the brothers .
46016012	But as for Apollos , the brother , I had a great desire for him to come to you with the brothers , but it was not his pleasure to come now ; but he will come when he has a chance .
46016013	Be on the watch , unmoved in the faith , and be strong like men .
46016014	Let all you do be done in love .
46016015	Now I make my request to you , my brothers , for you have knowledge that the house of Stephanas is the first-fruits of Achaia , and that they have made themselves the servants of the saints ,
46016016	That you put yourselves under such , and under everyone who is helping the Lord's work .
46016017	And I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus : for they have done what was needed to make your work complete .
46016018	For they gave comfort to my spirit and to yours : for which cause give respect to such people .
46016019	The churches of Asia send their love to you . So do Aquila and Prisca , with the church which is in their house .
46016020	All the brothers send their love to you . Give one another a holy kiss .
46016021	I , Paul , send you these words of love in my writing .
46016022	If any man has not love for the Lord , let him be cursed . Maran atha ( our Lord comes ) .
46016023	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
46016024	My love be with you all in Christ Jesus . So be it .
47001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the purpose of God , and Timothy the brother , to the church of God which is in Corinth , with all the saints who are in all Achaia :
47001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
47001003	Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of mercies and the God of all comfort ;
47001004	Who gives us comfort in all our troubles , so that we may be able to give comfort to others who are in trouble , through the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God .
47001005	For as we undergo more of the pain which Christ underwent , so through Christ does our comfort become greater .
47001006	But if we are troubled , it is for your comfort and salvation ; or if we are comforted , it is for your comfort , which takes effect through your quiet undergoing of the same troubles which we undergo :
47001007	And our hope for you is certain ; in the knowledge that as you take part in the troubles , so you will take part in the comfort .
47001008	For it is our desire that you may not be without knowledge of our trouble which came on us in Asia , that the weight of it was very great , more than our power , so that it seemed that we had no hope even of life :
47001009	Yes , we ourselves have had the answer of death in ourselves , so that our hope might not be in ourselves , but in God who is able to give life to the dead :
47001010	Who gave us salvation from so great a death : on whom we have put our hope that he will still go on to give us salvation ;
47001011	You at the same time helping together by your prayer for us ; so that for what has been given to us through a number of persons , praise may go up to God for us from all of them .
47001012	For our glory is in this , in the knowledge which we have that our way of life in the world , and most of all in relation to you , has been holy and true in the eyes of God ; not in the wisdom of the flesh , but in the grace of God .
47001013	For in our letters we say no other things to you , but those which you are reading , and to which you give agreement , and , it is my hope , will go on doing so to the end :
47001014	Even as you have been ready , in part , to say that we are your glory , in the same way that you are ours , in the day of the Lord Jesus .
47001015	And being certain of this , it was my purpose to come to you before , so that you might have a second grace ;
47001016	And by way of Corinth to go into Macedonia , and from there to come back again to you , so that you might send me on my way to Judaea .
47001017	If then I had such a purpose , did I seem to be changing suddenly ? or am I guided in my purposes by the flesh , saying , Yes , today , and , No , tomorrow ?
47001018	As God is true , our word to you is not Yes and No .
47001019	For the Son of God , Jesus Christ , whom we were preaching among you , even I and Silvanus and Timothy , was not Yes and No , but in him is Yes .
47001020	For he is the Yes to all the undertakings of God : and by him all the words of God are made certain and put into effect , to the glory of God through us .
47001021	Now he who makes our faith strong together with you , in Christ , and has given us of his grace , is God ;
47001022	And it is he who has put his stamp on us , even the Spirit , as the sign in our hearts of the coming glory .
47001023	But God is my witness that it was in pity for you that I did not come to Corinth at that time .
47001024	Not that we have authority over your faith , but we are helpers of your joy : for it is faith which is your support .
47002001	But it was my decision for myself , not to come again to you with sorrow .
47002002	For if I give you sorrow , who then will make me glad , but he who is made sad by me ?
47002003	And I said this very thing in my letter , for fear that when I came I might have sorrow from those from whom it was right for me to have joy ; being certain of this , that my joy is the joy of you all .
47002004	For out of much trouble and pain of heart and much weeping I sent my letter to you ; not to give you sorrow , but so that you might see how great is the love which I have to you .
47002005	But if anyone has been a cause of sorrow , he has been so , not to me only , but in some measure to all of you ( I say this that I may not be over-hard on you ) .
47002006	Let it be enough for such a man to have undergone the punishment which the church put on him ;
47002007	So that now , on the other hand , it is right for him to have forgiveness and comfort from you , for fear that his sorrow may be over-great .
47002008	For which cause my desire is that you will make your love to him clear by your acts .
47002009	And for the same reason I sent you a letter so that I might be certain of your desire to do my orders in all things .
47002010	But if you give forgiveness to anyone , I do the same : for if I have given forgiveness for anything , I have done it because of you , in the person of Christ ;
47002011	So that Satan may not get the better of us : for we are not without knowledge of his designs .
47002012	Now when I came to Troas for the good news of Christ , and there was an open door for me in the Lord ,
47002013	I had no rest in my spirit because Titus my brother was not there : so I went away from them , and came into Macedonia .
47002014	But praise be to God who makes us strong to overcome in Christ , and makes clear through us in every place the value of the knowledge of him .
47002015	For we are a sweet perfume of Christ to God in those who are getting salvation and in those who are going to destruction ;
47002016	To the one it is a perfume of death to death ; to the other a perfume of life to life . And who is enough for such things ?
47002017	For we are not like the great number who make use of the word of God for profit : but our words are true , as from God , being said as before God in Christ .
47003001	Do we seem to be again attempting to put ourselves in the right ? or have we need , as some have , of letters of approval to you or from you ?
47003002	You yourselves are our letter , whose writing is in our heart , open for every man's reading and knowledge ;
47003003	For you are clearly a letter of Christ , the fruit of our work , recorded not with ink , but with the Spirit of the living God ; not in stone , but in hearts of flesh .
47003004	And this is the certain faith which we have in God through Christ :
47003005	Not as if we were able by ourselves to do anything for which we might take the credit ; but our power comes from God ;
47003006	Who has made us able to be servants of a new agreement ; not of the letter , but of the Spirit : for the letter gives death , but the Spirit gives life .
47003007	For if the operation of the law , giving death , recorded in letters on stone , came with glory , so that the eyes of the children of Israel had to be turned away from the face of Moses because of its glory , a glory which was only for a time :
47003008	Will not the operation of the Spirit have a much greater glory ?
47003009	For if the operation of the law , producing punishment , had its glory , how much greater will be the operation of the Spirit causing righteousness ?
47003010	For the glory of the first no longer seems to be glory , because of the greater glory of that which comes after .
47003011	For if the order which was for a time had its glory , much more will the eternal order have its glory .
47003012	Having then such a hope , we keep nothing back ,
47003013	And are not like Moses , who put a veil on his face , so that the children of Israel might not see clearly to the end of the present order of things :
47003014	But their minds were made hard : for to this very day at the reading of the old agreement the same veil is still unlifted ; though it is taken away in Christ .
47003015	But to this day , at the reading of the law of Moses , a veil is over their heart .
47003016	But when it is turned to the Lord , the veil will be taken away .
47003017	Now the Lord is the Spirit : and where the Spirit of the Lord is , there the heart is free .
47003018	But we all , with unveiled face giving back as in a glass the glory of the Lord , are changed into the same image from glory to glory , even as from the Lord who is the Spirit .
47004001	For this reason , because we have been made servants of this new order , through the mercy given to us , we are strong :
47004002	And we have given up the secret things of shame , not walking in false ways , and not making use of the word of God with deceit ; but by the revelation of what is true , as before God , we have the approval of every man's sense of right and wrong .
47004003	But if our good news is veiled , it is veiled from those who are on the way to destruction :
47004004	Because the god of this world has made blind the minds of those who have not faith , so that the light of the good news of the glory of Christ , who is the image of God , might not be shining on them .
47004005	For our preaching is not about ourselves , but about Christ Jesus as Lord , and ourselves as your servants through Jesus .
47004006	Seeing that it is God who said , Let light be shining out of the dark , who has put in our hearts the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ .
47004007	But we have this wealth in vessels of earth , so that it may be seen that the power comes not from us but from God ;
47004008	Troubles are round us on every side , but we are not shut in ; things are hard for us , but we see a way out of them ;
47004009	We are cruelly attacked , but not without hope ; we are made low , but we are not without help ;
47004010	In our bodies there is ever the mark of the death of Jesus , so that the life of Jesus may be seen in our bodies .
47004011	For , while living , we are still being given up to death because of Jesus , so that the life of Jesus may be seen in our flesh , though it is under the power of death .
47004012	So then , death is working in us , but life in you .
47004013	But having the same spirit of faith , as it is said in the Writings , The words of my mouth came from the faith in my heart ; in the same way , our words are the outcome of our faith ;
47004014	Because we are certain that he who made the Lord Jesus come back from the dead , will do the same for us , and will give us a place in his glory with you .
47004015	For we go through all things on account of you , because the greater the number to whom the grace is given , the greater is the praise to the glory of God .
47004016	For which cause we do not give way to weariness ; but though our outer man is getting feebler , our inner man is made new day by day .
47004017	For our present trouble , which is only for a short time , is working out for us a much greater weight of glory ;
47004018	While our minds are not on the things which are seen , but on the things which are not seen : for the things which are seen are for a time ; but the things which are not seen are eternal .
47005001	For we are conscious that if this our tent of flesh is taken down , we have a building from God , a house not made with hands , eternal , in heaven .
47005002	For in this we are crying in weariness , greatly desiring to be clothed with our house from heaven :
47005003	So that our spirits may not be unclothed .
47005004	For truly , we who are in this tent do give out cries of weariness , for the weight of care which is on us ; not because we are desiring to be free from the body , but so that we may have our new body , and death may be overcome by life .
47005005	Now he who has made us for this very thing is God , who has given us the Spirit as a witness of what is to come .
47005006	So , then , we are ever without fear , and though conscious that while we are in the body we are away from the Lord ,
47005007	( For we are walking by faith , not by seeing , )
47005008	We are without fear , desiring to be free from the body , and to be with the Lord .
47005009	For this reason we make it our purpose , in the body or away from it , to be well-pleasing to him .
47005010	For we all have to come before Christ to be judged ; so that every one of us may get his reward for the things done in the body , good or bad .
47005011	Having in mind , then , the fear of the Lord , we put these things before men , but God sees our hearts ; and it is my hope that we may seem right in your eyes .
47005012	We are not again requesting your approval , but we are giving you the chance of taking pride in us , so that you may be able to give an answer to those whose glory is in seeming , and not in the heart .
47005013	For if we are foolish , it is to God ; or if we are serious , it is for you .
47005014	For it is the love of Christ which is moving us ; because we are of the opinion that if one was put to death for all , then all have undergone death ;
47005015	And that he underwent death for all , so that the living might no longer be living to themselves , but to him who underwent death for them and came back from the dead .
47005016	For this reason , from this time forward we have knowledge of no man after the flesh : even if we have had knowledge of Christ after the flesh , we have no longer any such knowledge .
47005017	So if any man is in Christ , he is in a new world : the old things have come to an end ; they have truly become new .
47005018	But all things are of God , who has made us at peace with himself through Christ , and has given to us the work of making peace ;
47005019	That is , that God was in Christ making peace between the world and himself , not putting their sins to their account , and having given to us the preaching of this news of peace .
47005020	So we are the representatives of Christ , as if God was making a request to you through us : we make our request to you , in the name of Christ , be at peace with God .
47005021	For him who had no knowledge of sin God made to be sin for us ; so that we might become the righteousness of God in him .
47006001	We then , working together with God , make our request to you not to take the grace of God to no purpose .
47006002	( For he says , I have given ear to you at a good time , and I have been your helper in a day of salvation : see , now is the good time ; now is the day of salvation ) :
47006003	Giving no cause for trouble in anything , so that no one may be able to say anything against our work ;
47006004	But in everything making it clear that we are the servants of God , in quiet strength , in troubles , in need , in sorrow ,
47006005	In blows , in prisons , in attacks , in hard work , in watchings , in going without food ;
47006006	In a clean heart , in knowledge , in long waiting , in being kind , in the Holy Spirit , in true love ,
47006007	In the true word , in the power of God ; with the arms of righteousness on the right hand and on the left ,
47006008	By glory and by shame , by an evil name and a good name ; as untrue , and still true ;
47006009	Unnoted , but still kept fully in mind ; as near to death , but still living ; as undergoing punishment , but not put to death ;
47006010	As full of sorrow , but ever glad ; as poor , but giving wealth to others ; as having nothing , but still having all things .
47006011	Our mouth is open to you , O Corinthians , our heart is wide .
47006012	It is not our feelings to you which are narrow , but yours to us .
47006013	Now to give me back payment of the same sort ( I am talking as to my children ) , let your hearts be wide open to me .
47006014	Do not keep company with those who have not faith : for what is there in common between righteousness and evil , or between light and dark ?
47006015	And what agreement is there between Christ and the Evil One ? or what part has one who has faith with one who has not ?
47006016	And what agreement has the house of God with images ? for we are a house of the living God ; even as God has said , I will be living among them , and walking with them ; and I will be their God , and they will be my people .
47006017	For which cause , Come out from among them , and be separate , says the Lord , and let no unclean thing come near you ; and I will take you for myself ,
47006018	And will be a Father to you ; and you will be my sons and daughters , says the Lord , the Ruler of all .
47007001	Because God , then , will give us such rewards , dear brothers , let us make ourselves clean from all evil of flesh and spirit , and become completely holy in the fear of God .
47007002	Let your hearts be open to us : we have done no man wrong , no man has been damaged by us , we have made no profit out of any man ,
47007003	It is not with the purpose of judging you that I say this : for I have said before that you are in our hearts for life and death together .
47007004	My words to you are without fear , I am full of pride on account of you : I have great comfort and joy in all our troubles .
47007005	For even when we had come into Macedonia our flesh had no rest , but we were troubled on every side ; there were fightings outside and fears inside .
47007006	But God who gives comfort to the poor in spirit gave us comfort by the coming of Titus ;
47007007	And not by his coming only , but by the comfort which he had in you , while he gave us word of your desire , your sorrow , your care for me ; so that I was still more glad .
47007008	For though my letter gave you pain , I have no regret for it now , though I had before ; for I see that the letter gave you pain , but only for a time .
47007009	Now I am glad , not that you had sorrow , but that your sorrow was the cause of a change of heart ; for yours was a holy sorrow so that you might undergo no loss by us in anything .
47007010	For the sorrow which God gives is the cause of salvation through a change of heart , in which there is no reason for grief : but the sorrow of the world is a cause of death .
47007011	For you see what care was produced in you by this very sorrow of yours before God , what clearing of yourselves , what wrath against sin , what fear , what desire , what serious purpose , what punishment . In everything you have made it clear that you are free from sin in this business .
47007012	So though I sent you a letter , it was not only because of the man who did the wrong , or because of him to whom the wrong was done , but so that your true care for us might be made clear in the eyes of God .
47007013	So we have been comforted : and we had the greater joy in our comfort because of the joy of Titus , for his spirit had been made glad by you all .
47007014	For I was not put to shame in anything in which I may have made clear to him my pride in you ; but as we said nothing to you but what was true , so the good things which I said to Titus about you were seen by him to be true .
47007015	And his love to you is the more increased by his memory of you all , how you gave way to his authority , and how you took him to your hearts with fear and honour .
47007016	It gives me great joy to see you answering to my good opinion of you in every way .
47008001	And now we give you news , brothers , about the grace of God which has been given to the churches of Macedonia ;
47008002	How while they were undergoing every sort of trouble , and were in the greatest need , they took all the greater joy in being able to give freely to the needs of others .
47008003	For I give them witness , that as they were able , and even more than they were able , they gave from the impulse of their hearts ,
47008004	Seriously requesting us that they might have a part in this grace of being servants to the needs of the saints :
47008005	And going even farther than our hope , they first gave themselves to the Lord and to us after the purpose of God .
47008006	So that we made a request to Titus that , as he had made a start before , so he might make this grace complete in you .
47008007	And that as you are full of every good thing , of faith , of the word , of knowledge , of a ready mind , and of love to us , so you may be full of this grace in the same way .
47008008	I am not giving you an order , but using the ready mind of others as a test of the quality of your love .
47008009	For you see the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ , how though he had wealth , he became poor on your account , so that through his need you might have wealth .
47008010	And in this I give my opinion : for it is to your profit , who were the first to make a start a year before , not only to do this , but to make clear that your minds were more than ready to do it .
47008011	Then make the doing of it complete ; so that as you had a ready mind , you may give effect to it as you are able .
47008012	For if there is a ready mind , a man will have God's approval in the measure of what he has , and not of what he has not .
47008013	And I am not saying this so that others may get off free , while the weight comes on you :
47008014	But so that things may be equal ; that from those things of which you have more than enough at the present time their need may be helped , and that if you are in any need they may be a help to you in the same way , making things equal .
47008015	As it says in the Writings , He who had taken up much had nothing over and he who had little had enough .
47008016	But praise be to God , who puts the same care for you into the heart of Titus .
47008017	For while he gladly gave ear to our request , he was interested enough to go to you from the impulse of his heart .
47008018	And with him we have sent a brother whose praise in the good news has gone through all the churches ;
47008019	And not only so , but he was marked out by the churches to go with us in the grace of this giving which we have undertaken to the glory of the Lord and to make clear that our mind was ready :
47008020	And so that no man might be able to say anything against us in the business of this giving which has been put into our hands :
47008021	For the business has been so ordered by us as to have the approval , not only of the Lord , but of men .
47008022	And we have sent with them our brother , whose ready spirit has been made clear to us at times and in ways without number , but it is now all the more so because of the certain faith which he has in you .
47008023	If any question comes up about Titus , he is my brother-worker , working with me for you ; or about the others , they are the representatives of the churches to the glory of Christ .
47008024	Make clear then to them , as representatives of the churches , the quality of your love , and that the things which we have said about you are true .
47009001	But there is no need for me to say anything in my letter about the giving to the saints :
47009002	For I have before made clear to those of Macedonia my pride in your ready mind , saying to them that Achaia has been ready for a year back ; and a great number have been moved to do the same by your example .
47009003	But I have sent the brothers , so that the good things we said about you may be seen to be true , and that , as I said , you may be ready :
47009004	For fear that , if any from Macedonia come with me , and you are not ready , we ( not to say , you ) might be put to shame in this thing .
47009005	So it seemed to me wise for the brothers to go before , and see that the amount which you had undertaken to give was ready , so that it might be a cause for praise , and not as if we were making profit out of you .
47009006	But in the Writings it says , He who puts in only a small number of seeds , will get in the same ; and he who puts them in from a full hand , will have produce in full measure from them .
47009007	Let every man do after the purpose of his heart ; not giving with grief , or by force : for God takes pleasure in a ready giver .
47009008	And God is able to give you all grace in full measure ; so that ever having enough of all things , you may be full of every good work :
47009009	As it is said in the Writings , He has sent out far and wide , he has given to the poor ; his righteousness is for ever .
47009010	And he who gives seed for putting into the field and bread for food , will take care of the growth of your seed , at the same time increasing the fruits of your righteousness ;
47009011	Your wealth being increased in everything , with a simple mind , causing praise to God through us .
47009012	For this work of giving not only takes care of the needs of the saints , but is the cause of much praise to God ;
47009013	For when , through this work of giving , they see what you are , they give glory to God for the way in which you have given yourselves to the good news of Christ , and for the wealth of your giving to them and to all ;
47009014	While their hearts go out to you in love and in prayer for you , because of the great grace of God which is in you .
47009015	Praise be to God for what he has given , which words have no power to say .
47010001	Now I , Paul , myself make request to you by the quiet and gentle behaviour of Christ , I who am poor in spirit when with you , but who say what is in my mind to you without fear when I am away from you :
47010002	Yes , I make my request to you , so that when I am with you I may not have to make use of the authority which may be needed against some to whom we seem to be walking after the flesh .
47010003	For though we may be living in the flesh , we are not fighting after the way of the flesh
47010004	( For the arms with which we are fighting are not those of the flesh , but are strong before God for the destruction of high places ) ;
47010005	Putting an end to reasonings , and every high thing which is lifted up against the knowledge of God , and causing every thought to come under the authority of Christ ;
47010006	Being ready to give punishment to whatever is against his authority , after you have made it clear that you are completely under his control .
47010007	Give attention to the things which are before you . If any man seems to himself to be Christ's , let him keep in mind that we are as much Christ's as he is .
47010008	For though I might take pride in our authority ( which the Lord gave for building you up , and not for your destruction ) , it will not be a cause of shame to me :
47010009	That I may not seem to have the desire of causing you fear by my letters .
47010010	For his letters , they say , have weight and are strong ; but in body he is feeble , and his way of talking has little force .
47010011	Let those who say this keep in mind that , what we are in word by letters when we are away , so will we be in act when we are present .
47010012	For we will not make comparison of ourselves with some of those who say good things about themselves : but these , measuring themselves by themselves , and making comparison of themselves with themselves , are not wise .
47010013	We will not give glory to ourselves in over-great measure , but after the measure of the rule which God has given us , a measure which comes even to you .
47010014	For we have no need to make ourselves seem more than we are , as if our authority did not come as far as to you : for we came even as far as you with the good news of Christ :
47010015	Not taking credit to ourselves for what is not our business , that is , for the work of others ; but having hope that , with the growth of your faith , we may get the credit for an increase which is the effect of our work ,
47010016	So that we may be able to go on and take the good news to countries still farther away than you are , and not take credit for another man's work in making things ready to our hand .
47010017	But whoever has a desire for glory , let his glory be in the Lord .
47010018	For the Lord's approval of a man is not dependent on his opinion of himself , but on the Lord's opinion of him .
47011001	Put up with me if I am a little foolish : but , truly , you do put up with me .
47011002	For I have a very great care for you : because you have been married by me to one husband , and it is my desire to give you completely holy to Christ .
47011003	But I have a fear , that in some way , as Eve was tricked by the deceit of the snake , your minds may be turned away from their simple and holy love for Christ .
47011004	For if anyone comes preaching another Jesus from the one whose preachers we are , or if you have got a different spirit , or a different sort of good news from those which came to you , how well you put up with these things .
47011005	For in my opinion , I am in no way less than the most important of the Apostles .
47011006	But though I am rough in my way of talking , I am not so in knowledge , as we have made clear to all by our acts among you .
47011007	Or did I do wrong in making myself low so that you might be lifted up , because I gave you the good news of God without reward ?
47011008	I took money from other churches as payment for my work , so that I might be your servant ;
47011009	And when I was present with you , and was in need , I let no man be responsible for me ; for the brothers , when they came from Macedonia , gave me whatever was needed ; and in everything I kept myself from being a trouble to you , and I will go on doing so .
47011010	As the true word of Christ is in me , I will let no man take from me this my cause of pride in the country of Achaia .
47011011	Why ? because I have no love for you ? let God be judge .
47011012	But what I do , that I will go on doing , so that I may give no chance to those who are looking for one ; so that , in the cause of their pride , they may be seen to be the same as we are .
47011013	For such men are false Apostles , workers of deceit , making themselves seem like Apostles of Christ .
47011014	And it is no wonder ; for even Satan himself is able to take the form of an angel of light .
47011015	So it is no great thing if his servants make themselves seem to be servants of righteousness ; whose end will be the reward of their works .
47011016	I say again , Let me not seem foolish to anyone ; but if I do , put up with me as such , so that I may take a little glory to myself .
47011017	What I am now saying is not by the order of the Lord , but as a foolish person , taking credit to myself , as it seems .
47011018	Seeing that there are those who take credit to themselves after the flesh , I will do the same .
47011019	For you put up with the foolish gladly , being wise yourselves .
47011020	You put up with a man if he makes servants of you , if he makes profit out of you , if he makes you prisoners , if he puts himself in a high place , if he gives you blows on the face .
47011021	I say this by way of shaming ourselves , as if we had been feeble . But if anyone puts himself forward ( I am talking like a foolish person ) , I will do the same .
47011022	Are they Hebrews ? so am I . Are they of Israel ? so am I . Are they the seed of Abraham ? so am I .
47011023	Are they servants of Christ ? ( I am talking foolishly ) I am more so ; I have had more experience of hard work , of prisons , of blows more than measure , of death .
47011024	Five times the Jews gave me forty blows but one .
47011025	Three times I was whipped with rods , once I was stoned , three times the ship I was in came to destruction at sea , a night and a day I have been in the water ;
47011026	In frequent travels , in dangers on rivers , in dangers from outlaws , in dangers from my countrymen , in dangers from the Gentiles , in dangers in the town , in dangers in the waste land , in dangers at sea , in dangers among false brothers ;
47011027	In hard work and weariness , in frequent watchings , going without food and drink , cold and in need of clothing .
47011028	In addition to all the other things , there is that which comes on me every day , the care of all the churches .
47011029	Who is feeble and I am not feeble ? who is in danger of falling , and I am not angry ?
47011030	If I have to take credit to myself , I will do so in the things in which I am feeble .
47011031	The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , to whom be praise for ever , is witness that the things which I say are true .
47011032	In Damascus , the ruler under Aretas the king kept watch over the town of the people of Damascus , in order to take me :
47011033	And being let down in a basket from the wall through a window , I got free from his hands .
47012001	As it is necessary for me to take glory to myself , though it is not a good thing , I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord .
47012002	I have knowledge of a man in Christ , fourteen years back ( if he was in the body , or out of the body , I am not able to say , but God only ) , who was taken up to the third heaven .
47012003	And I have knowledge of such a man ( if he was in the body , or out of the body , I am not able to say , but God only ) ,
47012004	How he was taken up into Paradise , and words came to his ears which may not be said , and which man is not able to say .
47012005	On account of such a one I will have glory : for myself I will take no glory , but only in my feeble body .
47012006	For if I had a desire to take credit to myself , it would not be foolish , for I would be saying what is true : but I will not , for fear that I might seem to any man more than he sees me to be , or has word from me that I am .
47012007	And because the revelations were so very great , in order that I might not be overmuch lifted up , there was given to me a thorn in the flesh , one sent from Satan to give me pain .
47012008	And about this thing I made request to the Lord three times that it might be taken away from me .
47012009	And he said to me , My grace is enough for you , for my power is made complete in what is feeble . Most gladly , then , will I take pride in my feeble body , so that the power of Christ may be on me .
47012010	So I take pleasure in being feeble , in unkind words , in needs , in cruel attacks , in troubles , on account of Christ : for when I am feeble , then am I strong .
47012011	I have been forced by you to become foolish , though it was right for my praise to have come from you : for in no way was I less than the chief of the Apostles , though I am nothing .
47012012	Truly the signs of an Apostle were done among you in quiet strength , with wonders and acts of power .
47012013	For what is there in which you were made less than the other churches , but in the one thing that I was not a trouble to you ? Let me have forgiveness for this wrong .
47012014	This is now the third time that I am ready to come to you ; and I will not be a trouble to you : my desire is for you , not for your property : for it is not the children's business to make store for their fathers , but the fathers for the children .
47012015	And I will gladly give all I have for your souls . If I have the more love for you , am I to be loved the less ?
47012016	But let it be so , that I was not a trouble to you myself ; but ( someone may say ) being false , I took you with deceit .
47012017	Did I make a profit out of you by any of those whom I sent to you ?
47012018	I gave orders to Titus , and I sent the brother with him . Did Titus make any profit out of you ? were we not guided by the same Spirit , in the same ways ?
47012019	It may seem to you that all this time we have been attempting to put ourselves in the right ; but we are saying these things before God in Christ . For all things , dear brothers , are for your profit .
47012020	For I have a fear that , when I come , you may not be answering to my desire , and that I may not be answering to yours ; that there may be fighting , hate , angry feeling , divisions , evil talk about others , secrets , thoughts of pride , outbursts against authority ;
47012021	And that when I come again , my God may put me to shame among you , and I may have grief for those who have done wrong before and have had no regret for their unclean ways , and for the evil desires of the flesh to which they have given way .
47013001	This is the third time that I am coming to you . From the mouth of two or three witnesses will every word be made certain .
47013002	I said before , and still say it before I come , as being present for the second time , though I am still away from you , to those who have done wrong before , and to all the others , that if I come again I will not have pity ;
47013003	Seeing that you are looking for a sign of Christ giving out his word in me ; who is not feeble in relation to you , but is strong in you :
47013004	For he was feeble in that he was put to death on the cross , but he is living by the power of God . And we are feeble in him , but we will be living with him through the power of God in relation to you .
47013005	Make a test of yourselves , if you are in the faith ; make certain of yourselves . Or are you not conscious in yourselves that Jesus Christ is in you , if you are truly Christ's ?
47013006	But it is my hope that you will have no doubt that we are truly Christ's .
47013007	Now our prayer to God is that you may do no evil ; not in order that it may be put to our credit , but so that you may do what is right , whatever we may seem .
47013008	Because we are able to do nothing against what is true , but only for it .
47013009	For we are glad when we are feeble and you are strong : and this is our prayer , even that you may be made complete .
47013010	For this cause I am writing these things while I am away , so that there may be need for me , when I am present , to make use of sharp measures , by the authority which the Lord has given me for building up and not for destruction .
47013011	Let this be my last word , brothers ; be glad ; be complete ; be comforted ; be of the same mind ; be at peace with one another : and the God of love and peace will be with you .
47013012	Give one another a holy kiss .
47013013	All the saints send their love to you .
47013014	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ , and the love of God , and the harmony of the Holy Spirit , be with you all .
48001001	Paul , an Apostle ( not from men , and not through man , but through Jesus Christ , and God the Father , who made him come back from the dead ) ,
48001002	And all the brothers who are with me , to the churches of Galatia :
48001003	Grace to you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ ,
48001004	Who gave himself for our sins , so that he might make us free from this present evil world , after the purpose of our God and Father :
48001005	To whom be the glory for ever and ever . So be it .
48001006	I am surprised that you are being so quickly turned away from him whose word came to you in the grace of Christ , to good news of a different sort ;
48001007	Which is not another sort : only there are some who give you trouble , desiring to make changes in the good news of Christ .
48001008	But even if we , or an angel from heaven , were to be a preacher to you of good news other than that which we have given you , let there be a curse on him .
48001009	As we have said before , so say I now again , If any man is a preacher to you of any good news other than that which has been given to you , let there be a curse on him .
48001010	Am I now using arguments to men , or God ? or is it my desire to give men pleasure ? if I was still pleasing men , I would not be a servant of Christ .
48001011	Because I say to you , my brothers , that the good news of which I was the preacher is not man's .
48001012	For I did not get it from man , and I was not given teaching in it , but it came to me through revelation of Jesus Christ .
48001013	For news has come to you of my way of life in the past in the Jews ' religion , how I was cruel without measure to the church of God , and did great damage to it :
48001014	And I went farther in the Jews ' religion than a number of my generation among my countrymen , having a more burning interest in the beliefs handed down from my fathers .
48001015	But when it was the good pleasure of God , by whom I was marked out even from my mother's body , through his grace ,
48001016	To give the revelation of his Son in me , so that I might give the news of him to the Gentiles ; then I did not take the opinion of flesh and blood ,
48001017	And I went not up to Jerusalem to those who were Apostles before me ; but I went away into Arabia , and again I came back to Damascus .
48001018	Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Cephas , and was there with him fifteen days .
48001019	But of the other Apostles I saw only James , the Lord's brother .
48001020	Now God is witness that the things which I am writing to you are true .
48001021	Then I came to the parts of Syria and Cilicia .
48001022	And the churches of Judaea which were in Christ still had no knowledge of my face or person :
48001023	Only it came to their ears that he who at one time was cruel to us is now preaching the faith which before had been attacked by him ;
48001024	And they gave glory to God in me .
48002001	Then after the space of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas , taking Titus with me .
48002002	And I went up by revelation ; and I put before them the good news which I was preaching among the Gentiles , but privately before those who were of good name , so that the work which I was or had been doing might not be without effect .
48002003	But not even Titus who was with me , being a Greek , was made to undergo circumcision :
48002004	And that because of the false brothers let in secretly , who came searching out our free condition which we have in Christ Jesus , so that they might make servants of us ;
48002005	To whom we gave way not even for an hour ; so that the true words of the good news might still be with you .
48002006	But from those who seemed to be important ( whatever they were has no weight with me : God does not take man's person into account ) : those who seemed to be important gave nothing new to me ;
48002007	But , quite the opposite , when they saw that I had been made responsible for preaching the good news to those without circumcision , even as Peter had been for those of the circumcision
48002008	( Because he who was working in Peter as the Apostle of the circumcision was working no less in me among the Gentiles ) ;
48002009	When they saw the grace which was given to me , James and Cephas and John , who had the name of being pillars , gave to me and Barnabas their right hands as friends so that we might go to the Gentiles , and they to the circumcision ;
48002010	Only it was their desire that we would give thought to the poor ; which very thing I had much in mind to do .
48002011	But when Cephas came to Antioch , I made a protest against him to his face , because he was clearly in the wrong .
48002012	For before certain men came from James , he did take food with the Gentiles : but when they came , he went back and made himself separate , fearing those who were of the circumcision .
48002013	And the rest of the Jews went after him , so that even Barnabas was overcome by their false ways .
48002014	But when I saw that they were not living uprightly in agreement with the true words of the good news , I said to Cephas before them all , If you , being a Jew , are living like the Gentiles , and not like the Jews , how will you make the Gentiles do the same as the Jews ?
48002015	We being Jews by birth , and not sinners of the Gentiles ,
48002016	Being conscious that a man does not get righteousness by the works of the law , but through faith in Jesus Christ , we had faith in Christ Jesus , so that we might get righteousness by faith in Christ , and not by the works of the law : because by the works of the law will no flesh get righteousness .
48002017	But if , while we were desiring to get righteousness through Christ , we ourselves were seen to be sinners , is Christ a servant of sin ? In no way !
48002018	For if I put up again those things which I gave to destruction , I am seen to be a wrongdoer .
48002019	For I , through the law , have become dead to the law , so that I might be living to God .
48002020	I have been put to death on the cross with Christ ; still I am living ; no longer I , but Christ is living in me ; and that life which I now am living in the flesh I am living by faith , the faith of the Son of God , who in love for me , gave himself up for me .
48002021	I do not make the grace of God of no effect : because if righteousness is through the law , then Christ was put to death for nothing .
48003001	O foolish Galatians , by what strange powers have you been tricked , to whom it was made clear that Jesus Christ was put to death on the cross ?
48003002	Give me an answer to this one question , Did the Spirit come to you through the works of the law , or by the hearing of faith ?
48003003	Are you so foolish ? having made a start in the Spirit , will you now be made complete in the flesh ?
48003004	Did you undergo such a number of things to no purpose ? if it is in fact to no purpose .
48003005	He who gives you the Spirit , and does works of power among you , is it by the works of law , or by the hearing of faith ?
48003006	Even as Abraham had faith in God , and it was put to his account as righteousness .
48003007	Be certain , then , that those who are of faith , the same are sons of Abraham .
48003008	And the holy Writings , seeing before the event that God would give the Gentiles righteousness by faith , gave the good news before to Abraham , saying , In you will all the nations have a blessing .
48003009	So then those who are of faith have a part in the blessing of Abraham who was full of faith .
48003010	For all who are of the works of the law are under a curse : because it is said in the Writings , A curse is on everyone who does not keep on doing all the things which are ordered in the book of the law .
48003011	Now that no man gets righteousness by the law in the eyes of God , is clear ; because , The upright will be living by faith .
48003012	And the law is not of faith ; but , He who does them will have life by them .
48003013	Christ has made us free from the curse of the law , having become a curse for us : because it is said in the Writings , A curse on everyone who is put to death by hanging on a tree :
48003014	So that on the Gentiles might come the blessing of Abraham in Christ Jesus ; in order that we through faith might have the Spirit which God had undertaken to give .
48003015	Brothers , as men would say , even a man's agreement , when it has been made certain , may not be put on one side , or have additions made to it .
48003016	Now to Abraham were the undertakings given , and to his seed . He says not , And to seeds , as of a great number ; but as of one , he says , And to your seed , which is Christ .
48003017	Now this I say : The law , which came four hundred and thirty years after , does not put an end to the agreement made before by God , so as to make the undertaking without effect .
48003018	Because if the heritage is by the law , it is no longer dependent on the word of God ; but God gave it to Abraham by his word .
48003019	What then is the law ? It was an addition made because of sin , till the coming of the seed to whom the undertaking had been given ; and it was ordered through angels by the hand of a go-between .
48003020	Now a go-between is not a go-between of one ; but God is one .
48003021	Is the law then against the words of God ? in no way ; because if there had been a law which was able to give life , truly righteousness would have been by the law .
48003022	However , the holy Writings have put all things under sin , so that that for which God gave the undertaking , based on faith in Jesus Christ , might be given to those who have such faith .
48003023	But before faith came , we were kept in prison under the law , waiting for the revelation of the faith which was to come .
48003024	So the law has been a servant to take us to Christ , so that we might have righteousness by faith .
48003025	But now that faith is come , we are no longer under a servant .
48003026	Because you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus .
48003027	For all those of you who were given baptism into Christ did put on Christ .
48003028	There is no Jew or Greek , servant or free , male or female : because you are all one in Jesus Christ .
48003029	And if you are Christ's , then you are Abraham's seed , and yours is the heritage by the right of God's undertaking given to Abraham .
48004001	But I say that as long as the son is a child , he is in no way different from a servant , though he is lord of all ;
48004002	But is under keepers and managers till the time fixed by the father .
48004003	So we , when we were young , were kept under the first rules of the world ;
48004004	But when the time had come , God sent out his Son , made of a woman , made under the law ,
48004005	That he might make them free who were under the law , and that we might be given the place of sons .
48004006	And because you are sons , God has sent out the Spirit of his Son into our hearts , saying , Abba , Father .
48004007	So that you are no longer a servant , but a son ; and if a son , then the heritage of God is yours .
48004008	But at that time , having no knowledge of God , you were servants to those who by right are no gods :
48004009	But now that you have come to have knowledge of God , or more truly , God has knowledge of you , how is it that you go back again to the poor and feeble first things , desiring to be servants to them again ?
48004010	You keep days , and months , and fixed times , and years .
48004011	I am in fear of you , that I may have been working for you to no purpose .
48004012	My desire for you , brothers , is that you may be as I am , because I am as you are . You have done me no wrong ;
48004013	But you have knowledge that with a feeble body I was preaching the good news to you the first time ;
48004014	And you did not have a poor opinion of me because of the trouble in my flesh , or put shame on it ; but you took me to your hearts as an angel of God , even as Christ Jesus .
48004015	Where then is that happy condition of yours ? because I give you witness , that , if possible , you would have taken out your eyes and given them to me .
48004016	So then am I no longer your friend , because I give you true words ?
48004017	Their interest in you is not good ; but their desire is that you may be shut out , so that you may go after them .
48004018	But it is good to have an interest in a good cause at all times , and not only when I am present with you .
48004019	My children , of whom I am again in birth-pains till Christ is formed in you ,
48004020	Truly my desire is to be present with you now , using a changed voice ; for I am troubled about you .
48004021	Say , you whose desire it is to be under the law , do you not give ear to the law ?
48004022	Because it is in the Writings , that Abraham had two sons , one by the servant-woman , and one by the free woman .
48004023	Now the son by the servant-woman has his birth after the flesh ; but the son by the free woman has his birth through the undertaking of God .
48004024	Which things have a secret sense ; because these women are the two agreements ; one from the mountain of Sinai , giving birth to servants , which is Hagar .
48004025	Now this Hagar is the mountain Sinai in Arabia , and is the image of the Jerusalem which now is : which is a servant with her children .
48004026	But the Jerusalem on high is free , which is our mother .
48004027	For it is in the Writings , You who have never given birth , be glad ; give cries of joy , you who have had no birth-pains ; for the children of her who has been given up by her husband are more than those of the woman who has a husband .
48004028	Now we , brothers , as Isaac was , are the children of the undertaking of God .
48004029	But as in those days he who had birth after the flesh was cruel to him who had birth after the Spirit , even so it is now .
48004030	What then do the Writings say ? Send away the servant-woman and her son ; for the son of the servant-woman will not have a part in the heritage with the son of the free woman .
48004031	So , brothers , we are not children of the servant-woman , but of the free woman .
48005001	Christ has truly made us free : then keep your free condition and let no man put a yoke on you again .
48005002	See , I Paul say to you , that if you undergo circumcision , Christ will be of no use to you .
48005003	Yes , I give witness again to every man who undergoes circumcision , that he will have to keep all the law .
48005004	You are cut off from Christ , you who would have righteousness by the law ; you are turned away from grace .
48005005	For we through the Spirit by faith are waiting for the hope of righteousness .
48005006	Because in Christ Jesus , having circumcision or not having circumcision are equally of no profit ; but only faith working through love .
48005007	You were going on well ; who was the cause of your not giving ear to what is true ?
48005008	This ready belief did not come from him who had made you his .
48005009	A little leaven makes a change in all the mass .
48005010	I am certain about you in the Lord , that you will be of no other mind ; but he who is troubling you will have his punishment , whoever he is .
48005011	But I , brothers , if I am still preaching circumcision , why am I still attacked ? then has the shame of the cross been taken away .
48005012	My desire is that they who give you trouble might even be cut off themselves .
48005013	Because you , brothers , were marked out to be free ; only do not make use of your free condition to give the flesh its chance , but through love be servants one to another .
48005014	For all the law is made complete in one word , even in this , Have love for your neighbour as for yourself .
48005015	But if you are given to fighting with one another , take care that you are not the cause of destruction one to another .
48005016	But I say , Go on in the Spirit , and you will not come under the rule of the evil desires of the flesh .
48005017	For the flesh has desires against the Spirit , and the Spirit against the flesh ; because these are opposite the one to the other ; so that you may not do the things which you have a mind to do .
48005018	But if you are guided by the Spirit , you are not under the law .
48005019	Now the works of the flesh are clear , which are these : evil desire , unclean things , wrong use of the senses ,
48005020	Worship of images , use of strange powers , hates , fighting , desire for what another has , angry feelings , attempts to get the better of others , divisions , false teachings ,
48005021	Envy , uncontrolled drinking and feasting , and such things : of which I give you word clearly , even as I did in the past , that they who do such things will have no part in the kingdom of God .
48005022	But the fruit of the Spirit is love , joy , peace , a quiet mind , kind acts , well-doing , faith ,
48005023	Gentle behaviour , control over desires : against such there is no law .
48005024	And those who are Christ's have put to death on the cross the flesh with its passions and its evil desires .
48005025	If we are living by the Spirit , by the Spirit let us be guided .
48005026	Let us not be full of self-glory , making one another angry , having envy of one another .
48006001	Brothers , if a man is taken in any wrongdoing , you who are of the Spirit will put such a one right in a spirit of love ; keeping watch on yourself , for fear that you yourself may be tested .
48006002	Take on yourselves one another's troubles , and so keep the law of Christ .
48006003	For if a man has an idea that he is something when he is nothing , he is tricked by himself .
48006004	But let every man make test of his work , and then will his cause for glory be in himself only , and not in his neighbour .
48006005	Because every man is responsible for his part of the work .
48006006	But let him who gets teaching in the word give a part in all good things to his teacher .
48006007	Be not tricked ; God is not made sport of : for whatever seed a man puts in , that will he get back as grain .
48006008	Because he who puts in the seed of the flesh will of the flesh get the reward of death ; but he who puts in the seed of the Spirit will of the Spirit get the reward of eternal life .
48006009	And let us not get tired of well-doing ; for at the right time we will get in the grain , if we do not give way to weariness .
48006010	So then , as we have the chance , let us do good to all men , and specially to those who are of the family of the faith .
48006011	See the size of the handwriting which I myself have made use of in writing to you .
48006012	Those who have the desire to seem important in the flesh , put force on you to undergo circumcision ; only that they may not be attacked because of the cross of Christ .
48006013	Because even those who undergo circumcision do not themselves keep the law ; but they would have you undergo circumcision , so that they may have glory in your flesh .
48006014	But far be it from me to have glory in anything , but only in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ , through which this world has come to an end on the cross for me , and I for it .
48006015	For having circumcision is nothing , and not having circumcision is nothing , but only a new order of existence .
48006016	And on all who are guided by this rule be peace and mercy , and on the Israel of God .
48006017	From this time on let no man be a trouble to me ; because my body is marked with the marks of Jesus .
48006018	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit , brothers . So be it .
49001001	Paul , an Apostle of Christ Jesus by the purpose of God , to the saints who are at Ephesus , and those who have faith in Christ Jesus :
49001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
49001003	Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , who has given us every blessing of the Spirit in the heavens in Christ :
49001004	Even as he made selection of us in him from the first , so that we might be holy and free from all evil before him in love :
