49001005	As we were designed before by him for the position of sons to himself , through Jesus Christ , in the good pleasure of his purpose ,
49001006	To the praise of the glory of his grace , which he freely gave to us in the Loved One :
49001007	In whom we have salvation through his blood , the forgiveness of our sins , through the wealth of his grace ,
49001008	Which he gave us in full measure in all wisdom and care ;
49001009	Having made clear to us the secret of his purpose , in agreement with the design which he had in mind , to put into his hands
49001010	The ordering of the times when they are complete , so that all things might come to a head in Christ , the things in heaven and the things on the earth ; in him , I say ,
49001011	In whom we have a heritage , being marked out from the first in his purpose who does all things in agreement with his designs ;
49001012	So that his glory might have praise through us who first had hope in Christ :
49001013	In whom you , having been given the true word , the good news of your salvation , and through your faith in him , were given the sign of the Holy Spirit of hope ,
49001014	Which is the first-fruit of our heritage , till God gets back that which is his , to the praise of his glory .
49001015	For this cause I , having had news of the faith in the Lord Jesus which is among you , and which you make clear to all the saints ,
49001016	Give praise without end for you , keeping you in mind in my prayers ;
49001017	That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of glory , may give to you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him ;
49001018	And that having the eyes of your heart full of light , you may have knowledge of what is the hope of his purpose , what is the wealth of the glory of his heritage in the saints ,
49001019	And how unlimited is his power to us who have faith , as is seen in the working of the strength of his power ,
49001020	By which he made Christ come back from the dead , and gave him a place at his right hand in heaven ,
49001021	Far over all rule and authority and power and every name which is named , not only in the present order , but in that which is to come :
49001022	And he has put all things under his feet , and has made him to be head over all things to the church ,
49001023	Which is his body , the full measure of him in whom all things are made complete .
49002001	And to you did he give life , when you were dead through your wrongdoing and sins ,
49002002	In which you were living in the past , after the ways of this present world , doing the pleasure of the lord of the power of the air , the spirit who is now working in those who go against the purpose of God ;
49002003	Among whom we all at one time were living in the pleasures of our flesh , giving way to the desires of the flesh and of the mind , and the punishment of God was waiting for us even as for the rest .
49002004	But God , being full of mercy , through the great love which he had for us ,
49002005	Even when we were dead through our sins , gave us life together with Christ ( by grace you have salvation ) ,
49002006	So that we came back from death with him , and are seated with him in the heavens , in Christ Jesus ;
49002007	That in the time to come he might make clear the full wealth of his grace in his mercy to us in Christ Jesus :
49002008	Because by grace you have salvation through faith ; and that not of yourselves : it is given by God :
49002009	Not by works , so that no man may take glory to himself .
49002010	For by his act we were given existence in Christ Jesus to do those good works which God before made ready for us so that we might do them .
49002011	For this reason keep it in mind that in the past you , the Gentiles in the flesh , who are looked on as being outside the circumcision by those who have circumcision , in the flesh , made by hands ;
49002012	That you were at that time without Christ , being cut off from any part in Israel's rights as a nation , having no part in God's agreement , having no hope , and without God in the world .
49002013	But now in Christ Jesus you who at one time were far off are made near in the blood of Christ .
49002014	For he is our peace , who has made the two into one , and by whom the middle wall of division has been broken down ,
49002015	Having in his flesh put an end to that which made the division between us , even the law with its rules and orders , so that he might make in himself , of the two , one new man , so making peace ;
49002016	And that the two might come into agreement with God in one body through the cross , so putting an end to that division .
49002017	And he came preaching peace to you who were far off , and to those who were near ;
49002018	Because through him the two of us are able to come near in one Spirit to the Father .
49002019	So then you are no longer as those who have no part or place in the kingdom of God , but you are numbered among the saints , and of the family of God ,
49002020	Resting on the base of the Apostles and prophets , Christ Jesus himself being the chief keystone ,
49002021	In whom all the building , rightly joined together , comes to be a holy house of God in the Lord ;
49002022	In whom you , with the rest , are united together as a living-place of God in the Spirit .
49003001	For this cause I Paul , the prisoner of Christ Jesus for you Gentiles ,
49003002	If that ordering of the grace of God has come to your knowledge , which was given to me for you ,
49003003	How by revelation the secret was made clear to me , as I said before in a short letter ,
49003004	By the reading of which you will be clear about my knowledge of the secret of Christ ;
49003005	Which in other generations was not given to the sons of men , but the revelation of it has now been made to his holy Apostles and prophets in the Spirit ;
49003006	Which is that the Gentiles have a part in the heritage , and in the same body , and in the same hope in Christ through the good news ,
49003007	Of which I was made a preacher , through that grace of God which was given to me in the measure of the working of his power .
49003008	To me , who am less than the least of all the saints , was this grace given , so that I might make clear to the Gentiles the good news of the unending wealth of Christ :
49003009	And make all men see what is the ordering of the secret which from the first has been kept in God who made all things ;
49003010	So that now to the rulers and the authorities in the heavens might be made clear through the church the wide-shining wisdom of God ,
49003011	Which is seen in his eternal purpose in Christ Jesus our Lord :
49003012	By whom we come near to God without fear through faith in him .
49003013	For this reason it is my prayer that you may not become feeble because of my troubles for you , which are your glory .
49003014	For this cause I go down on my knees before the Father ,
49003015	From whom every family in heaven and on earth is named ,
49003016	That in the wealth of his glory he would make you strong with power through his Spirit in your hearts ;
49003017	So that Christ may have his place in your hearts through faith ; and that you , being rooted and based in love ,
49003018	May have strength to see with all the saints how wide and long and high and deep it is ,
49003019	And to have knowledge of the love of Christ which is outside all knowledge , so that you may be made complete as God himself is complete .
49003020	Now to him who is able to do in full measure more than all our desires or thoughts , through the power which is working in us ,
49003021	To him be the glory in the church and in Christ Jesus to all generations for ever and ever . So be it .
49004001	I then , the prisoner in the Lord , make this request from my heart , that you will see that your behaviour is a credit to the position which God's purpose has given you ,
49004002	With all gentle and quiet behaviour , taking whatever comes , putting up with one another in love ;
49004003	Taking care to keep the harmony of the Spirit in the yoke of peace .
49004004	There is one body and one Spirit , even as you have been marked out by God in the one hope of his purpose for you ;
49004005	One Lord , one faith , one baptism ,
49004006	One God and Father of all , who is over all , and through all , and in all .
49004007	But to every one of us has grace been given in the measure of the giving of Christ .
49004008	For this reason he says , He went up on high , taking his prisoners with him , and gave freely to men .
49004009	( Now this , He went up , what is it but that he first went down into the lower parts of the earth ?
49004010	He who went down is the same who went up far over all the heavens so that he might make all things complete . )
49004011	And he gave some as Apostles , and some , prophets ; and some , preachers of the good news ; and some to give care and teaching ;
49004012	For the training of the saints as servants in the church , for the building up of the body of Christ :
49004013	Till we all come to the harmony of the faith , and of the knowledge of the Son of God , to full growth , to the full measure of Christ :
49004014	So that we may be no longer children , sent this way and that , turned about by every wind of teaching , by the twisting and tricks of men , by the deceits of error ;
49004015	But saying true words in love , may come to full growth in him , who is the head , even Christ ;
49004016	Through whom all the body , being rightly formed and united together , by the full working of every part , is increased to the building up of itself in love .
49004017	This I say , then , and give witness in the Lord , that you are to go no longer in the way of the Gentiles whose minds are turned to that which has no profit ,
49004018	Whose thoughts are dark , to whom the life of God is strange because they are without knowledge , and their hearts have been made hard ;
49004019	Who having no more power of feeling , have given themselves up to evil passions , to do all unclean things with overmuch desire .
49004020	For this was not the teaching of Christ which was given to you ;
49004021	If in fact you gave ear to him , and were given teaching in him , even as what is true is made clear in Jesus :
49004022	That you are to put away , in relation to your earlier way of life , the old man , which has become evil by love of deceit ;
49004023	And be made new in the spirit of your mind ,
49004024	And put on the new man , to which God has given life , in righteousness and a true and holy way of living .
49004025	And so , putting away false words , let everyone say what is true to his neighbour : for we are parts one of another .
49004026	Be angry without doing wrong ; let not the sun go down on your wrath ;
49004027	And do not give way to the Evil One .
49004028	Let him who was a thief be so no longer , but let him do good work with his hands , so that he may have something to give to him who is in need .
49004029	Let no evil talk come out of your mouth , but only what is good for giving necessary teaching , and for grace to those who give ear .
49004030	And do not give grief to the Holy Spirit of God , by whom you were marked for the day of salvation .
49004031	Let all bitter , sharp and angry feeling , and noise , and evil words , be put away from you , with all unkind acts ;
49004032	And be kind to one another , full of pity , having forgiveness for one another , even as God in Christ had forgiveness for you .
49005001	Let it then be your desire to be like God , as well-loved children ;
49005002	And be living in love , even as Christ had love for you , and gave himself up for us , an offering to God for a perfume of a sweet smell .
49005003	But evil acts of the flesh and all unclean things , or desire for others ' property , let it not even be named among you , as is right for saints ;
49005004	And let there be no low behaviour , or foolish talk , or words said in sport , which are not right , but in place of them the giving of praise .
49005005	Being certain of this , that no man who gives way to the passions of the flesh , no unclean person , or one who has desire for the property of others , or who gives worship to images , has any heritage in the kingdom of Christ and God .
49005006	Do not be turned from the right way by foolish words ; for because of these things the punishment of God comes on those who do not put themselves under him .
49005007	Have no part with such men ;
49005008	For you at one time were dark , but now are light in the Lord : let your behaviour be that of children of light
49005009	( Because the fruit of the light is in all righteousness and in everything which is good and true ) ,
49005010	Testing by experience what is well-pleasing to the Lord ;
49005011	And have no company with the works of the dark , which give no fruit , but make their true quality clear ;
49005012	For the things which are done by them in secret it is shame even to put into words .
49005013	But all things , when their true quality is seen , are made clear by the light : because everything which is made clear is light .
49005014	For this reason he says , Be awake , you who are sleeping , and come up from among the dead , and Christ will be your light .
49005015	Take care then how you are living , not as unwise , but as wise ;
49005016	Making good use of the time , because the days are evil .
49005017	For this reason , then , do not be foolish , but be conscious of the Lord's pleasure .
49005018	And do not take overmuch wine by which one may be overcome , but be full of the Spirit ;
49005019	Joining with one another in holy songs of praise and of the Spirit , using your voice in songs and making melody in your heart to the Lord ;
49005020	Giving praise at all times for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , to God , even the Father ;
49005021	Letting yourselves be ruled by one another in the fear of Christ .
49005022	Wives , be under the authority of your husbands , as of the Lord .
49005023	For the husband is the head of the wife , as Christ is the head of the church , being himself the saviour of the body .
49005024	And as the church is under Christ's authority , so let wives be under the rule of their husbands in all things .
49005025	Husbands , have love for your wives , even as Christ had love for the church , and gave himself for it ;
49005026	So that he might make it holy , having made it clean with the washing of water by the word ,
49005027	And might take it for himself , a church full of glory , not having one mark or fold or any such thing ; but that it might be holy and complete .
49005028	Even so it is right for husbands to have love for their wives as for their bodies . He who has love for his wife has love for himself :
49005029	For no man ever had hate for his flesh ; but he gives it food and takes care of it , even as Christ does for the church ;
49005030	Because we are parts of his body .
49005031	For this cause will a man go away from his father and mother and be joined to his wife , and the two will become one flesh .
49005032	This is a great secret : but my words are about Christ and the church .
49005033	But do you , everyone , have love for his wife , even as for himself ; and let the wife see that she has respect for her husband .
49006001	Children , do what is ordered by your fathers and mothers in the Lord : for this is right .
49006002	Give honour to your father and mother ( which is the first rule having a reward ) ,
49006003	So that all may be well for you , and your life may be long on the earth .
49006004	And , you fathers , do not make your children angry : but give them training in the teaching and fear of the Lord .
49006005	Servants , do what is ordered by those who are your natural masters , having respect and fear for them , with all your heart , as to Christ ;
49006006	Not only under your master's eye , as pleasers of men ; but as servants of Christ , doing the pleasure of God from the heart ;
49006007	Doing your work readily , as to the Lord , and not to men :
49006008	In the knowledge that for every good thing anyone does , he will have his reward from the Lord , If he is a servant or if he is free .
49006009	And , you masters , do the same things to them , not making use of violent words : in the knowledge that their Master and yours is in heaven , and he has no respect for a man's position .
49006010	Lastly , be strong in the Lord , and in the strength of his power .
49006011	Take up God's instruments of war , so that you may be able to keep your position against all the deceits of the Evil One .
49006012	For our fight is not against flesh and blood , but against authorities and powers , against the world-rulers of this dark night , against the spirits of evil in the heavens .
49006013	For this reason take up all the arms of God , so that you may be able to be strong in the evil day , and , having done all , to keep your place .
49006014	Take your place , then , having your body clothed with the true word , and having put on the breastplate of righteousness ;
49006015	Be ready with the good news of peace as shoes on your feet ;
49006016	And most of all , using faith as a cover to keep off all the flaming arrows of the Evil One .
49006017	And take salvation for your head-dress and the sword of the Spirit , which is the word of God :
49006018	With prayers and deep desires , making requests at all times in the Spirit , and keeping watch , with strong purpose , in prayer for all the saints ,
49006019	And for me , that words may be given to me in the opening of my mouth , to make clear without fear the secret of the good news ,
49006020	For which I am a representative in chains , and that I may say without fear the things which it is right for me to say .
49006021	But so that you may have knowledge of my business , and how I am , Tychicus , the well-loved brother and tested servant in the Lord , will give you news of all things :
49006022	Whom I have sent to you for this very purpose , so that you may have knowledge of our position , and that he may give comfort to your hearts .
49006023	Peace be to the brothers , and love with faith , from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
49006024	Grace be with all those who have true love for our Lord Jesus Christ .
50001001	Paul and Timothy , servants of Jesus Christ , to all the saints in Christ Jesus at Philippi , with the Bishops and Deacons of the church :
50001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
50001003	I give praise to my God at every memory of you ,
50001004	And in all my prayers for you all , making my request with joy ,
50001005	Because of your help in giving the good news from the first day till now ;
50001006	For I am certain of this very thing , that he by whom the good work was started in you will make it complete till the day of Jesus Christ :
50001007	So it is right for me to take thought for you all in this way , because I have you in my heart ; for in my chains , and in my arguments before the judges in support of the good news , making clear that it is true , you all have your part with me in grace .
50001008	For God is my witness , how my love goes out to you all in the loving mercies of Christ Jesus .
50001009	And my prayer is that you may be increased more and more in knowledge and experience ;
50001010	So that you may give your approval to the best things ; that you may be true and without wrongdoing till the day of Christ ;
50001011	Being full of the fruits of righteousness , which are through Jesus Christ , to the glory and praise of God .
50001012	Now it is my purpose to make clear to you , brothers , that the cause of the good news has been helped by my experiences ;
50001013	So that it became clear through all the Praetorium , and to all the rest , that I was a prisoner on account of Christ ;
50001014	And most of the brothers in the Lord , taking heart because of my chains , are all the stronger to give the word of God without fear .
50001015	Though some are preaching Christ out of envy and competition , others do it out of a good heart :
50001016	These do it from love , conscious that I am responsible for the cause of the good news :
50001017	But those are preaching Christ in a spirit of competition , not from their hearts , but with the purpose of giving me pain in my prison .
50001018	What then ? only that in every way , falsely or truly , the preaching of Christ goes on ; and in this I am glad , and will be glad .
50001019	For I am conscious that this will be for my salvation , through your prayer and the giving out of the stored wealth of the Spirit of Jesus Christ ,
50001020	In the measure of my strong hope and belief that in nothing will I be put to shame , but that without fear , as at all times , so now will Christ have glory in my body , by life or by death .
50001021	For to me life is Christ and death is profit .
50001022	But if I go on living in the flesh--if this is the fruit of my work--then I do not see what decision to make .
50001023	I am in a hard position between the two , having a desire to go away and be with Christ , which is very much better :
50001024	Still , to go on in the flesh is more necessary because of you .
50001025	And being certain of this , I am conscious that I will go on , yes , and go on with you all , for your growth and joy in the faith ;
50001026	So that your pride in me may be increased in Christ Jesus through my being present with you again .
50001027	Only let your behaviour do credit to the good news of Christ , so that if I come and see you or if I am away from you , I may have news of you that you are strong in one spirit , working together with one soul for the faith of the good news ;
50001028	Having no fear of those who are against you ; which is a clear sign of their destruction , but of your salvation , and that from God ;
50001029	Because to you it has been given in the cause of Christ not only to have faith in him , but to undergo pain on his account :
50001030	Fighting the same fight which you saw in me , and now have word of in me .
50002001	If then there is any comfort in Christ , any help given by love , any uniting of hearts in the Spirit , any loving mercies and pity ,
50002002	Make my joy complete by being of the same mind , having the same love , being in harmony and of one mind ;
50002003	Doing nothing through envy or through pride , but with low thoughts of self let everyone take others to be better than himself ;
50002004	Not looking everyone to his private good , but keeping in mind the things of others .
50002005	Let this mind be in you which was in Christ Jesus ,
50002006	To whom , though himself in the form of God , it did not seem that to take for oneself was to be like God ;
50002007	But he made himself as nothing , taking the form of a servant , being made like men ;
50002008	And being seen in form as a man , he took the lowest place , and let himself be put to death , even the death of the cross .
50002009	For this reason God has put him in the highest place and has given to him the name which is greater than every name ;
50002010	So that at the name of Jesus every knee may be bent , of those in heaven and those on earth and those in the underworld ,
50002011	And that every tongue may give witness that Jesus Christ is Lord , to the glory of God the Father .
50002012	So then , my loved ones , as you have at all times done what I say , not only when I am present , but now much more when I am not with you , give yourselves to working out your salvation with fear in your hearts ;
50002013	For it is God who is the cause of your desires and of your acts , for his good pleasure .
50002014	Do all things without protests and arguments ;
50002015	So that you may be holy and gentle , children of God without sin in a twisted and foolish generation , among whom you are seen as lights in the world ,
50002016	Offering the word of life ; so that I may have glory in you in the day of Christ , because my running was not for nothing and my work was not without effect .
50002017	And even if I am offered like a drink offering , giving myself for the cause and work of your faith , I am glad and have joy with you all :
50002018	And in the same way do you be glad and have a part in my joy .
50002019	But I am hoping in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you before long , so that I may be comforted when I have news of you .
50002020	For I have no man of like mind who will truly have care for you .
50002021	For they all go after what is theirs , not after the things of Christ .
50002022	But his quality is clear to you ; how , as a child is to its father , so he was a help to me in the work of the good news .
50002023	Him then I am hoping to send as quickly as possible , when I am able to see how things will go for me :
50002024	But I have faith in the Lord that I myself will come before long .
50002025	But it seemed to me necessary to send to you Epaphroditus , my brother , who has taken part with me in the work and in the fight , and your servant , sent by you for help in my need ;
50002026	Because his heart was with you all , and he was greatly troubled because you had news that he was ill :
50002027	For in fact he was ill almost to death : but God had mercy on him ; and not only on him but on me , so that I might not have grief on grief .
50002028	I have sent him , then , the more gladly , so that when you see him again , you may be happy and I may have the less sorrow .
50002029	So take him to your hearts in the Lord with all joy , and give honour to such as he is :
50002030	Because for the work of Christ he was near to death , putting his life in danger to make your care for me complete .
50003001	For the rest , my brothers , be glad in the Lord . Writing the same things to you is no trouble to me , and for you it is safe .
50003002	Be on the watch against dogs , against the workers of evil , against those of the circumcision :
50003003	For we are the circumcision , who give worship to God and have glory in Jesus Christ , and have no faith in the flesh :
50003004	Even though I myself might have faith in the flesh : if any other man has reason to have faith in the flesh , I have more :
50003005	Being given circumcision on the eighth day , of the nation of Israel , of the tribe of Benjamin , a Hebrew of Hebrews ; in relation to the law , a Pharisee :
50003006	In bitter hate I was cruel to the church ; I kept all the righteousness of the law to the last detail .
50003007	But those things which were profit to me , I gave up for Christ .
50003008	Yes truly , and I am ready to give up all things for the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord , which is more than all : for whom I have undergone the loss of all things , and to me they are less than nothing , so that I may have Christ as my reward ,
50003009	And be seen in him , not having my righteousness which is of the law , but that which is through faith in Christ , the righteousness which is of God by faith :
50003010	That I may have knowledge of him , and of the power of his coming back from the dead , and a part with him in his pains , becoming like him in his death ;
50003011	If in any way I may have the reward of life from the dead .
50003012	Not as if I had even now got the reward or been made complete : but I go on in the hope that I may come to the knowledge of that for which I was made the servant of Christ Jesus .
50003013	Brothers , it is clear to me that I have not come to that knowledge ; but one thing I do , letting go those things which are past , and stretching out to the things which are before ,
50003014	I go forward to the mark , even the reward of the high purpose of God in Christ Jesus .
50003015	Then let us all , who have come to full growth , be of this mind : and if in anything you are of a different mind , even this will God make clear to you :
50003016	Only , as far as we have got , let us be guided by the same rule .
50003017	Brothers , take me as your example , and take note of those who are walking after the example we have given .
50003018	For there are those , of whom I have given you word before , and do so now with sorrow , who are haters of the cross of Christ ;
50003019	Whose end is destruction , whose god is the stomach , and whose glory is in their shame , whose minds are fixed on the things of the earth .
50003020	For our country is in heaven ; from where the Saviour for whom we are waiting will come , even the Lord Jesus Christ :
50003021	By whom this poor body of ours will be changed into the image of the body of his glory , in the measure of the working by which he is able to put all things under himself .
50004001	So my brothers , well loved and very dear to me , my joy and crown , be strong in the Lord , my loved ones .
50004002	I make request to Euodias and Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord .
50004003	And I make request to you , true helper in my work , to see to the needs of those women who took part with me in the good news , with Clement and the rest of my brother-workers whose names are in the book of life .
50004004	Be glad in the Lord at all times : again I say , Be glad .
50004005	Let your gentle behaviour be clear to all men . The Lord is near .
50004006	Have no cares ; but in everything with prayer and praise put your requests before God .
50004007	And the peace of God , which is deeper than all knowledge , will keep your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus .
50004008	For the rest , my brothers , whatever things are true , whatever things have honour , whatever things are upright , whatever things are holy , whatever things are beautiful , whatever things are of value , if there is any virtue and if there is any praise , give thought to these things .
50004009	The things which came to you by my teaching and preaching , and which you saw in me , these things do , and the God of peace will be with you .
50004010	But I am very glad in the Lord that your care for me has come to life again ; though you did in fact take thought for me , but you were not able to give effect to it .
50004011	But I will not say anything about my needs , for I am able , wherever I am , to be dependent on myself .
50004012	It is the same to me if I am looked down on or honoured ; everywhere and in all things I have the secret of how to be full and how to go without food ; how to have wealth and how to be in need .
50004013	I am able to do all things through him who gives me strength .
50004014	But you did well to have care for me in my need .
50004015	And you have knowledge , Philippians , that when the good news first came to you , when I went away from Macedonia , no church took part with me in the business of giving to the saints , but you only ;
50004016	Because even in Thessalonica you sent once and again to me in my need .
50004017	Not that I am looking for an offering , but for fruit which may be put to your credit .
50004018	I have all things and more than enough : I am made full , having had from Epaphroditus the things which came from you , a perfume of a sweet smell , an offering well pleasing to God .
50004019	And my God will give you all you have need of from the wealth of his glory in Christ Jesus .
50004020	Now to God our Father be glory for ever and ever . So be it .
50004021	Give words of love to every saint in Christ Jesus . The brothers who are with me send you their love .
50004022	All the saints send their love to you , specially those who are of Caesar's house .
50004023	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit .
51001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ , by the purpose of God , and Timothy our brother ,
51001002	To the saints and true brothers in Christ at Colossae : Grace to you and peace from God our Father .
51001003	We give praise to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , making prayer for you at all times ,
51001004	After hearing of your faith in Christ Jesus , and of the love which you have for all the saints ,
51001005	Through the hope which is in store for you in heaven ; knowledge of which was given to you before in the true word of the good news ,
51001006	Which has come to you ; and which in all the world is giving fruit and increase , as it has done in you from the day when it came to your ears and you had true knowledge of the grace of God ;
51001007	As it was given to you by Epaphras , our well-loved helper , who is a true servant of Christ for us ,
51001008	And who , himself , made clear to us your love in the Spirit .
51001009	For this reason , we , from the day when we had word of it , keep on in prayer for you , that you may be full of the knowledge of his purpose , with all wisdom and experience of the Spirit ,
51001010	Living uprightly in the approval of the Lord , giving fruit in every good work , and increasing in the knowledge of God ;
51001011	Full of strength in the measure of the great power of his glory , so that you may undergo all troubles with joy ;
51001012	Giving praise to the Father who has given us a part in the heritage of the saints in light ;
51001013	Who has made us free from the power of evil and given us a place in the kingdom of the Son of his love ;
51001014	In whom we have our salvation , the forgiveness of sins :
51001015	Who is the image of the unseen God coming into existence before all living things ;
51001016	For by him all things were made , in heaven and on earth , things seen and things unseen , authorities , lords , rulers , and powers ; all things were made by him and for him ;
51001017	He is before all things , and in him all things have being .
51001018	And he is the head of the body , the church : the starting point of all things , the first to come again from the dead ; so that in all things he might have the chief place .
51001019	For God in full measure was pleased to be in him ;
51001020	Through him uniting all things with himself , having made peace through the blood of his cross ; through him , I say , uniting all things which are on earth or in heaven .
51001021	And you , who in the past were cut off and at war with God in your minds through evil works , he has now made one
51001022	In the body of his flesh through death , so that you might be holy and without sin and free from all evil before him :
51001023	If you keep yourselves safely based in the faith , not moved from the hope of the good news which came to you , and which was given to every living being under heaven ; of which I , Paul , was made a servant .
51001024	Now I have joy in my pain because of you , and in my flesh I undergo whatever is still needed to make the sorrows of Christ complete , for the salvation of his body , the church ;
51001025	Of which I became a servant by the purpose of God which was given to me for you , to give effect to the word of God ,
51001026	The secret which has been kept from all times and generations , but has now been made clear to his saints ,
51001027	To whom God was pleased to give knowledge of the wealth of the glory of this secret among the Gentiles , which is Christ in you , the hope of glory :
51001028	Whom we are preaching ; guiding and teaching every man in all wisdom , so that every man may be complete in Christ ;
51001029	And for this purpose I am working , using all my strength by the help of his power which is working in me strongly .
51002001	For it is my desire to give you news of the great fight I am making for you and for those at Laodicea , and for all who have not seen my face in the flesh ;
51002002	So that their hearts may be comforted , and that being joined together in love , they may come to the full wealth of the certain knowledge of the secret of God , even Christ ,
51002003	In whom are all the secret stores of wisdom and knowledge .
51002004	I say this so that you may not be turned away by any deceit of words .
51002005	For though I am not present in the flesh , still I am with you in the spirit , seeing with joy your order , and your unchanging faith in Christ .
51002006	As , then , you took Christ Jesus the Lord , so go on in him ,
51002007	Rooted and based together in him , strong in the faith which the teaching gave you , giving praise to God at all times .
51002008	Take care that no one takes you away by force , through man's wisdom and deceit , going after the beliefs of men and the theories of the world , and not after Christ :
51002009	For in him all the wealth of God's being has a living form ,
51002010	And you are complete in him , who is the head of all rule and authority :
51002011	In whom you had a circumcision not made with hands , in the putting off of the body of the flesh , in the circumcision of Christ ;
51002012	Having been put to death with him in baptism , by which you came to life again with him , through faith in the working of God , who made him come back from the dead .
51002013	And you , being dead through your sins and the evil condition of your flesh , to you , I say , he gave life together with him , and forgiveness of all our sins ;
51002014	Having put an end to the handwriting of the law which was against us , taking it out of the way by nailing it to his cross ;
51002015	Having made himself free from the rule of authorities and powers , he put them openly to shame , glorying over them in it .
51002016	For this reason let no man be your judge in any question of food or drink or feast days or new moons or Sabbaths :
51002017	For these are an image of the things which are to come ; but the body is Christ's .
51002018	Let no man take your reward from you by consciously making little of himself and giving worship to angels ; having his thoughts fixed on the things which he has seen , being foolishly lifted up in his natural mind ,
51002019	And not joined to the Head , from whom all the body , being given strength and kept together through its joins and bands , has its growth with the increase of God .
51002020	If you were made free , by your death with Christ , from the rules of the world , why do you put yourselves under the authority of orders
51002021	Which say there may be no touching , tasting , or taking in your hands ,
51002022	( Rules which are all to come to an end with their use ) after the orders and teaching of men ?
51002023	These things seem to have a sort of wisdom in self-ordered worship and making little of oneself , and being cruel to the body , not honouring it by giving it its natural use .
51003001	If then you have a new life with Christ , give your attention to the things of heaven , where Christ is seated at the right hand of God .
51003002	Keep your mind on the higher things , not on the things of earth .
51003003	For your life on earth is done , and you have a secret life with Christ in God .
51003004	At the coming of Christ who is our life , you will be seen with him in glory .
51003005	Then put to death your bodies which are of the earth ; wrong use of the flesh , unclean things , passion , evil desires and envy , which is the worship of strange gods ;
51003006	Because of which the wrath of God comes on those who go against his orders ;
51003007	Among whom you were living in the past , when you did such things .
51003008	But now it is right for you to put away all these things ; wrath , passion , bad feeling , curses , unclean talk ;
51003009	Do not make false statements to one another ; because you have put away the old man with all his doings ,
51003010	And have put on the new man , which has become new in knowledge after the image of his maker ;
51003011	Where there is no Greek or Jew , no one with circumcision or without circumcision , no division between nations , no servant or free man : but Christ is all and in all .
51003012	As saints of God , then , holy and dearly loved , let your behaviour be marked by pity and mercy , kind feeling , a low opinion of yourselves , gentle ways , and a power of undergoing all things ;
51003013	Being gentle to one another and having forgiveness for one another , if anyone has done wrong to his brother , even as the Lord had forgiveness for you :
51003014	And more than all , have love ; the only way in which you may be completely joined together .
51003015	And let the peace of Christ be ruling in your hearts , as it was the purpose of God for you to be one body ; and give praise to God at all times .
51003016	Let the word of Christ be in you in all wealth of wisdom ; teaching and helping one another with songs of praise and holy words , making melody to God with grace in your hearts .
51003017	And whatever you do , in word or in act , do all in the name of the Lord Jesus , giving praise to God the Father through him .
51003018	Wives , be under the authority of your husbands , as is right in the Lord .
51003019	Husbands , have love for your wives , and be not bitter against them .
51003020	Children , do the orders of your fathers and mothers in all things , for this is pleasing to the Lord .
51003021	Fathers , do not be hard on your children , so that their spirit may not be broken .
51003022	Servants , in all things do the orders of your natural masters ; not only when their eyes are on you , as pleasers of men , but with all your heart , fearing the Lord :
51003023	Whatever you do , do it readily , as to the Lord and not to men ;
51003024	Being certain that the Lord will give you the reward of the heritage : for you are the servants of the Lord Christ .
51003025	For the wrongdoer will have punishment for the wrong he has done , without respect for any man's position .
51004001	Masters , give your servants what is right and equal , conscious that you have a Master in heaven .
51004002	Give yourselves to prayer at all times , keeping watch with praise ;
51004003	And making prayer for us , that God may give us an open door for the preaching of the word , the secret of Christ , for which I am now in chains ;
51004004	So that I may make it clear , as it is right for me to do .
51004005	Be wise in your behaviour to those who are outside , making good use of the time .
51004006	Let your talk be with grace , mixed with salt , so that you may be able to give an answer to everyone .
51004007	Tychicus will give you news of all my business : he is a dear brother and true servant and helper in the word ;
51004008	And I have sent him to you for this very purpose , so that you may have news of how we are , and so that he may give your hearts comfort ;
51004009	And with him I have sent Onesimus , the true and well-loved brother , who is one of you . They will give you word of everything which is taking place here .
51004010	Aristarchus , my brother-prisoner , sends his love to you , and Mark , a relation of Barnabas ( about whom you have been given orders : if he comes to you , be kind to him ) ,
51004011	And Jesus , whose other name is Justus ; these are of the circumcision : they are my only brother-workers for the kingdom of God , who have been a comfort to me .
51004012	Epaphras , who is one of you , a servant of Christ Jesus , sends you his love , ever taking thought for you in his prayers , that you may be complete and fully certain of all the purpose of God .
51004013	For I give witness of him that he has undergone much trouble for you and for those in Laodicea and in Hierapolis .
51004014	Luke , our well-loved medical friend , and Demas , send you their love .
51004015	Give my love to the brothers in Laodicea and to Nymphas and the church in their house .
51004016	And when this letter has been made public among you , let the same be done in the church of Laodicea ; and see that you have the letter from Laodicea .
51004017	Say to Archippus , See that you do the work which the Lord has given you to do .
51004018	I , Paul , give you this word of love in my handwriting . Keep in memory that I am a prisoner . Grace be with you .
52001001	Paul and Silvanus and Timothy , to the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ : Grace to you and peace .
52001002	We give praise to God at all times for you , keeping you in memory in our prayers ;
52001003	Having ever in mind your work of faith and acts of love and the strength of your hope in our Lord Jesus Christ , before our God and Father ;
52001004	Being conscious , my brothers , dear to God , that you have been marked out by God's purpose ;
52001005	Because our good news came to you , not in word only , but in power , and in the Holy Spirit , so that you were completely certain of it ; even as you saw what our behaviour to you was like from our love to you .
52001006	And you took us and the Lord as your example , after the word had come to you in much trouble , with joy in the Holy Spirit ;
52001007	So that you became an example to all those who have faith in Christ in Macedonia and Achaia .
52001008	For not only was the word of the Lord sounding out from you in Macedonia and Achaia , but in every place your faith in God is made clear ; so that we have no need to say anything .
52001009	For they themselves give the news of how we came among you ; and how you were turned from images to God , to the worship of a true and living God ,
52001010	Waiting for his Son from heaven , who came back from the dead , even Jesus , our Saviour from the wrath to come .
52002001	For you yourselves , brothers , are conscious that our coming among you was not without effect :
52002002	But after we had first undergone much pain and been cruelly attacked as you saw , at Philippi , by the help of God we gave you the good news without fear , though everything was against us .
52002003	For our witness does not come from error or from an unclean heart or from deceit :
52002004	But even as the good news was given to us by the approval of God , so we give it out ; not as pleasing men , but God by whom our hearts are tested .
52002005	For it is common knowledge among you that we never made use of smooth-sounding false words , and God is witness that at no time were we secretly desiring profit for ourselves ,
52002006	Or looking for glory from men , from you or from others , when we might have made ourselves a care to you as Apostles of Christ .
52002007	But we were gentle among you , like a woman caring for her little ones :
52002008	Even so , being full of loving desire for you , we took delight in giving you not only God's good news , but even our lives , because you were dear to us .
52002009	For you have the memory , my brothers , of our trouble and care ; how , working night and day , so that we might not be a trouble to any of you , we gave you the good news of God .
52002010	You are witnesses , with God , how holy and upright and free from all evil was our way of life among you who have faith ;
52002011	Even as you saw how , like a father with his children , we were teaching and comforting you all , and giving witness ,
52002012	So that your lives might be pleasing to God , who has given you a part in his kingdom and his glory .
52002013	And for this cause we still give praise to God , that , when the word came to your ears through us , you took it , not as the word of man , but , as it truly is , the word of God , which has living power in you who have faith .
52002014	For you , my brothers , took as your examples the churches of God which are in Judaea in Christ Jesus ; because you underwent the same things from your countrymen as they did from the Jews ;
52002015	Who put to death the Lord Jesus and the prophets , violently driving us out ; who are unpleasing to God and against all men ;
52002016	Who , to make the measure of their sins complete , kept us from giving the word of salvation to the Gentiles : but the wrath of God is about to come on them in the fullest degree .
52002017	But we , my brothers , being away from you for a short time , in body but not in heart , had all the more desire to see your face ;
52002018	For which reason we made attempts to come to you , even I , Paul , once and again ; but Satan kept us from coming .
52002019	For what is our hope or joy or crown of glory ? Are not even you , before our Lord Jesus , at his coming ?
52002020	For you are our glory and our joy .
52003001	At last our desire to have news of you was so strong that , while we ourselves were waiting at Athens ,
52003002	We sent Timothy , our brother and God's servant in the good news of Christ , to give you strength and comfort in your faith ;
52003003	So that no man might be moved by these troubles ; because you see that these things are part of God's purpose for us .
52003004	And when we were with you , we said to you that trouble was before us ; and so it came about , as you see .
52003005	For this reason , when I was no longer able to keep quiet , I sent to get news of your faith , fearing that you might be tested by the Evil One and that our work might come to nothing .
52003006	But now that Timothy has come to us from you , and has given us good news of your faith and love , and that you have happy memories of us , desiring greatly to see us , even as we do to see you ;
52003007	For this cause , brothers , in all our trouble and grief we were comforted about you because of your faith ;
52003008	For it is life to us if you keep your faith in the Lord unchanged .
52003009	For how great is the praise which we give to God for you , and how great the joy with which we are glad because of you before our God ;
52003010	Night and day requesting God again and again that we may see your face and make your faith complete .
52003011	Now may our God and Father himself and our Lord Jesus make a way for us to come to you ;
52003012	And the Lord give you increase of love in fullest measure to one another and to all men , even as our love to you ;
52003013	So that your hearts may be strong and free from all sin before our God and Father , at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints .
52004001	And last of all , the prayer which we make to you from our heart and in the name of the Lord Jesus , is this : that as we made clear to you what sort of behaviour is pleasing to God , as in fact you are doing now , so you will go on in these ways , but more and more .
52004002	Because you have in mind the orders we gave you through the Lord Jesus .
52004003	For the purpose of God for you is this : that you may be holy , and may keep yourselves from the desires of the flesh ;
52004004	So that every one of you may keep his body holy and in honour ;
52004005	Not in the passion of evil desires , like the Gentiles , who have no knowledge of God ;
52004006	And that no man may make attempts to get the better of his brother in business : for the Lord is the judge in all these things , as we said to you before and gave witness .
52004007	Because it is God's purpose that our way of life may be not unclean but holy .
52004008	Whoever , then , goes against this word , goes against not man but God , who gives his Holy Spirit to you .
52004009	But about loving the brothers , there is no need for me to say anything to you in this letter : for you have the teaching of God that love for one another is right and necessary ;
52004010	And , truly , you are lovers of all the brothers in Macedonia ; but it is our desire that your love may be increased still more ;
52004011	And that you may take pride in being quiet and doing your business , working with your hands as we gave you orders ;
52004012	That you may be respected by those who are outside , and may have need of nothing .
52004013	But it is our desire , brothers , that you may be certain about those who are sleeping ; so that you may have no need for sorrow , as others have who are without hope .
52004014	For if we have faith that Jesus underwent death and came back again , even so those who are sleeping will come again with him by God's power .
52004015	For this we say to you by the word of the Lord , that we who are still living at the coming of the Lord , will not go before those who are sleeping .
52004016	Because the Lord himself will come down from heaven with a word of authority , with the voice of the chief angel , with the sound of a horn : and the dead in Christ will come to life first ;
52004017	Then we who are still living will be taken up together with them into the clouds to see the Lord in the air : and so will we be for ever with the Lord .
52004018	So then , give comfort to one another with these words .
52005001	But about the times and their order , my brothers , there is no need for me to say anything to you .
52005002	For you yourselves have the knowledge that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night .
52005003	When they say , There is peace and no danger , then sudden destruction will come on them , as birth-pains on a woman with child ; and they will not be able to get away from it .
52005004	But you , my brothers , are not in the dark , for that day to overtake you like a thief :
52005005	For you are all sons of light and of the day : we are not of the night or of the dark .
52005006	So then , let us not take our rest as the others do , but let us be self-controlled and awake .
52005007	For those who are sleeping do so in the night ; and those who are the worse for drink are so in the night ;
52005008	But let us , who are of the day , be serious , putting on the breastplate of faith and love , and on our heads , the hope of salvation .
52005009	For God's purpose for us is not wrath , but salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ ,
52005010	Who was put to death for us , so that , awake or sleeping , we may have a part in his life .
52005011	So then , go on comforting and building up one another , as you have been doing .
52005012	But we make this request to you , my brothers : give attention to those who are working among you , who are over you in the Lord to keep order among you ;
52005013	And have a high opinion of them in love because of their work . Be at peace among yourselves .
52005014	And our desire is that you will keep control over those whose lives are not well ordered , giving comfort to the feeble-hearted , supporting those with little strength , and putting up with much from all .
52005015	Let no one give evil for evil ; but ever go after what is good , for one another and for all .
52005016	Have joy at all times .
52005017	Keep on with your prayers .
52005018	In everything give praise : for this is the purpose of God in Christ Jesus for you .
52005019	Do not put out the light of the Spirit ;
52005020	Do not make little of the words of the prophets ;
52005021	Let all things be tested ; keep to what is good ;
52005022	Keep from every form of evil .
52005023	And may the God of peace himself make you holy in every way ; and may your spirit and soul and body be free from all sin at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ .
52005024	God , by whom you have been marked out in his purpose , is unchanging and will make it complete .
52005025	Brothers , keep us in mind in your prayers .
52005026	Give all the brothers a holy kiss .
52005027	I give orders in the name of the Lord that all the brothers are to be present at the reading of this letter .
52005028	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
53001001	Paul and Silvanus and Timothy , to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ :
53001002	Grace to you and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
53001003	It is right for us to give praise to God at all times for you , brothers , because of the great increase of your faith , and the wealth of your love for one another ;
53001004	So that we ourselves take pride in you in the churches of God for your untroubled mind and your faith in all the troubles and sorrows which you are going through ;
53001005	Which is a clear sign of the decision which God in his righteousness has made ; to give you a part in his kingdom , for which you have undergone this pain ;
53001006	For it is an act of righteousness on God's part to give trouble as their reward to those who are troubling you ,
53001007	And to you who are troubled , rest with us , when the Lord Jesus comes from heaven with the angels of his power in flames of fire ,
53001008	To give punishment to those who have no knowledge of God , and to those who do not give ear to the good news of our Lord Jesus :
53001009	Whose reward will be eternal destruction from the face of the Lord and from the glory of his strength ,
53001010	At his coming , when he will have glory in his saints , and will be a cause of wonder in all those who had faith ( because our witness among you had effect ) in that day .
53001011	For this reason , you are ever in our prayers , that you may seem to our God such as may have a part in his purpose and that by his power he will make all his good purpose , and the work of faith , complete ;
53001012	So that glory may be given to the name of our Lord Jesus through you , and you may have glory in him , by the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ .
53002001	Now as to the coming of the Lord Jesus Christ , and our meeting with him , it is our desire , my brothers ,
53002002	That you may not be moved in mind or troubled by a spirit , or by a word , or by a letter as from us , with the suggestion that the day of the Lord is even now come ;
53002003	Give no belief to false words : because there will first be a falling away from the faith , and the revelation of the man of sin , the son of destruction ,
53002004	Who puts himself against all authority , lifting himself up over all which is named God or is given worship ; so that he takes his seat in the Temple of God , putting himself forward as God .
53002005	Have you no memory of what I said when I was with you , giving you word of these things ?
53002006	And now it is clear to you what is keeping back his revelation till the time comes for him to be seen .
53002007	For the secret of evil is even now at work : but there is one who is keeping back the evil till he is taken out of the way .
53002008	And then will come the revelation of that evil one , whom the Lord Jesus will put to death with the breath of his mouth , and give to destruction by the revelation of his coming ;
53002009	Even the one whose coming is marked by the working of Satan , with all power and signs and false wonders ,
53002010	And with every deceit of wrongdoing among those whose fate is destruction ; because they were quite without that love of the true faith by which they might have salvation .
53002011	And for this cause , God will give them up to the power of deceit and they will put their faith in what is false :
53002012	So that they all may be judged , who had no faith in what is true , but took pleasure in evil .
53002013	But it is right for us to give praise to God at all times for you , brothers , loved by the Lord , because it was the purpose of God from the first that you might have salvation , being made holy by the Spirit and by faith in what is true :
53002014	And in this purpose he gave you a part through the good news of which we were the preachers , even that you might have part in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ .
53002015	So then , brothers , be strong in purpose , and keep the teaching which has been given to you by word or by letter from us .
53002016	Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself , and God our Father who had love for us and has given us eternal comfort and good hope through grace ,
53002017	Give you comfort and strength in every good work and word .
53003001	For the rest , my brothers , let there be prayer for us that the word of the Lord may go forward with increasing glory , even as it does with you ;
53003002	And that we may be made free from foolish and evil men ; for not all have faith .
53003003	But the Lord is true , who will give you strength and keep you safe from evil .
53003004	And we have faith in the Lord about you , that you are doing and will do the things about which we give you orders .
53003005	And may your hearts be guided by the Lord into the love of God and quiet waiting for Christ .
53003006	Now we give you orders , brothers , in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , to keep away from all those whose behaviour is not well ordered and in harmony with the teaching which they had from us .
53003007	For you yourselves are used to taking us as your example , because our life among you was ruled by order ,
53003008	And we did not take food from any man for nothing , but were working hard night and day not to be a trouble to any of you :
53003009	Not because we have not the right , but to make ourselves an example to you , so that you might do the same .
53003010	For even when we were with you we gave you orders , saying , If any man does no work , let him not have food .
53003011	For it has come to our ears that there are some among you whose behaviour is uncontrolled , who do no work at all , but are over-interested in the business of others .
53003012	Now to such we give orders and make request in the Lord Jesus , that , working quietly , they get their living .
53003013	And you , my brothers , do not get tired of well-doing .
53003014	And if any man does not give attention to what we have said in this letter , take note of that man , and keep away from him , so that he may be shamed .
53003015	Have no feeling of hate for him , but take him in hand seriously as a brother .
53003016	Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times and in every way . May the Lord be with you all .
53003017	These words of love to you at the end are in my writing , Paul's writing , and this is the mark of every letter from me .
53003018	May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all .
54001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ , by the order of God our Saviour and Christ Jesus our hope ;
54001002	To Timothy , my true child in the faith : Grace , mercy , peace , from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord .
54001003	It was my desire , when I went on into Macedonia , that you might make a stop at Ephesus , to give orders to certain men not to put forward a different teaching ,
54001004	Or to give attention to stories and long lists of generations , from which come questionings and doubts , in place of God's ordered way of life which is in faith ;
54001005	But the effect of the order is love coming from a clean heart , and a knowledge of what is right , and true faith :
54001006	From which some have been turned away , giving themselves to foolish talking ;
54001007	Desiring to be teachers of the law , though they have no knowledge of what they say or of the statements which they make so certainly .
54001008	We are conscious that the law is good , if a man makes a right use of it ,
54001009	With the knowledge that the law is made , not for the upright man , but for those who have no respect for law and order , for evil men and sinners , for the unholy and those who have no religion , for those who put their fathers or mothers to death , for takers of life ,
54001010	For those who go after loose women , for those with unnatural desires , for those who take men prisoners , who make false statements and false oaths , and those who do any other things against the right teaching ,
54001011	Which may be seen in the good news of the glory of the great God , which was given into my care .
54001012	I give praise to him who gave me power , Christ Jesus our Lord , because he took me to be true , making me his servant ,
54001013	Though I had said violent words against God , and done cruel acts , causing great trouble : but I was given mercy , because I did it without knowledge , not having faith ;
54001014	And the grace of our Lord was very great , with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus .
54001015	It is a true saying , in which all may put their faith , that Christ Jesus came into the world to give salvation to sinners , of whom I am the chief :
54001016	But for this reason I was given mercy , so that in me , the chief of sinners , Jesus Christ might make clear all his mercy , as an example to those who in the future would have faith in him to eternal life .
54001017	Now to the King eternal , ever-living , unseen , the only God , be honour and glory for ever and ever . So be it .
54001018	This order I give to you , Timothy my son , in harmony with the words of the prophets about you , so that by them you may be strong , fighting the good fight ,
54001019	Keeping faith , and being conscious of well-doing ; for some , by not doing these things , have gone wrong in relation to the faith :
54001020	Such are Hymenaeus and Alexander , whom I have given up to Satan , so that they may say no more evil words against God .
54002001	My desire is , first of all , that you will make requests and prayers and give praise for all men ;
54002002	For kings and all those in authority ; so that we may have a calm and quiet life in all fear of God and serious behaviour .
54002003	This is good and pleasing in the eyes of God our Saviour ;
54002004	Whose desire is that all men may have salvation and come to the knowledge of what is true .
54002005	For there is one God and one peacemaker between God and men , the man Christ Jesus ,
54002006	Who gave himself as an offering for all ; witness of which was to be given at the right time ;
54002007	And of this I became a preacher and an Apostle ( what I say is true , not false , ) and a teacher of the Gentiles in the true faith .
54002008	It is my desire , then , that in every place men may give themselves to prayer , lifting up holy hands , without wrath or argument .
54002009	And that women may be dressed in simple clothing , with a quiet and serious air ; not with twisted hair and gold or jewels or robes of great price ;
54002010	But clothed with good works , as is right for women who are living in the fear of God .
54002011	Let a woman quietly take the place of a learner and be under authority .
54002012	In my opinion it is right for a woman not to be a teacher , or to have rule over a man , but to be quiet .
54002013	For Adam was first formed , then Eve ;
54002014	And Adam was not taken by deceit , but the woman , being tricked , became a wrongdoer .
54002015	But if they go on in faith and love and holy self-control , she will be kept safe at the time of childbirth .
54003001	This is a true saying , A man desiring the position of a Bishop has a desire for a good work .
54003002	The Bishop , then , is to be a man of good name , the husband of one wife , self-controlled , serious-minded , having respect for order , opening his house freely to guests , a ready teacher ;
54003003	Not quickly moved to wrath or blows , but gentle ; no fighter , no lover of money ;
54003004	Ruling his house well , having his children under control with all serious behaviour ;
54003005	( For if a man has not the art of ruling his house , how will he take care of the church of God ? )
54003006	Not one newly taken into the church , for fear that , through his high opinion of himself , he may come into the same sin as the Evil One .
54003007	And he is to have a good name among those outside the church , so that nothing may be said against him and he may not be taken by the designs of the Evil One .
54003008	Deacons , in the same way , are to be serious in their behaviour , not false in word , not given to taking much wine or greatly desiring the wealth of this world ;
54003009	Keeping the secret of the faith in a heart free from sin .
54003010	And let these first be put to the test ; then let them become Deacons if there is nothing against them .
54003011	Women are to be serious in behaviour , saying no evil of others , controlling themselves , true in all things .
54003012	Let Deacons be husbands of one wife , ruling their children and their houses well .
54003013	For those who have done good work as Deacons get for themselves a good position and become free from fear in the faith which is in Christ Jesus .
54003014	I am writing these things to you , though I am hoping to come to you before long ;
54003015	But if I am long in coming , this will make clear to you what behaviour is right for men in the house of God , which is the church of the living God , the pillar and base of what is true .
54003016	And without argument , great is the secret of religion : He who was seen in the flesh , who was given God's approval in the spirit , was seen by the angels , of whom the good news was given among the nations , in whom the world had faith , who was taken up in glory .
54004001	But the Spirit says clearly that in later times some will be turned away from the faith , giving their minds to spirits of deceit , and the teachings of evil spirits ,
54004002	Through the false ways of men whose words are untrue , whose hearts are burned as with a heated iron ;
54004003	Who keep men from being married and from taking food which God made to be taken with praise by those who have faith and true knowledge .
54004004	Because everything which God has made is good , and nothing is evil , if it is taken with praise :
54004005	For it is made holy by the word of God and by prayer .
54004006	If you keep these things before the minds of the brothers , you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus , trained in the words of the faith and of the right teaching which has been your guide :
54004007	But have nothing to do with unclean and foolish stories . Give yourself training in religion :
54004008	For the training of the body is of profit for a little , but religion is of profit in every way , giving hope for the life which now is , and for that which is to come .
54004009	This is a true saying , in which all may put their faith .
54004010	And this is the purpose of all our work and our fighting , because our hope is in the living God , who is the Saviour of all men , and specially of those who have faith .
54004011	Let these be your orders and your teaching .
54004012	Let no one make little of you because you are young , but be an example to the church in word , in behaviour , in love , in faith , in holy living .
54004013	Till I come , give attention to the reading of the holy Writings , to comforting the saints , and to teaching .
54004014	Make use of that grace in you , which was given to you by the word of the prophets , when the rulers of the church put their hands on you .
54004015	Have a care for these things ; give yourself to them with all your heart , so that all may see how you go forward .
54004016	Give attention to yourself and your teaching . Go on in these things ; for in doing so you will get salvation for yourself and for those who give hearing to you .
54005001	Do not say sharp words to one who has authority in the church , but let your talk be as to a father , and to the younger men as to brothers :
54005002	To the older women as to mothers , to the younger as to sisters , with a clean heart .
54005003	Give honour to widows who are truly widows .
54005004	But if any widow has children or children's children , let these see that it is right to take care of their family and their fathers and mothers : for this is pleasing in the eyes of God .
54005005	Now she who is truly a widow and without family puts her hope in God , giving herself to prayer day and night .
54005006	But she who gives herself to pleasure is dead while she is living .
54005007	Give orders to this effect , so that no evil may be said of anyone .
54005008	If anyone has no care for his family and those in his house , he is false to the faith , and is worse than one who has no faith .
54005009	Let no woman be numbered among the widows who is under sixty years old , and only if she has been the wife of one man ,
54005010	And if witness is given of her good works ; if she has had the care of children , if she has been kind to travellers , washing the feet of the saints , helping those who are in trouble , giving herself to good works .
54005011	But to the younger widows say No : for when their love is turned away from Christ , they have a desire to be married ;
54005012	And they are judged because they have been false to their first faith ;
54005013	And they get into the way of doing no work , going about from house to house ; and not only doing no work , but talking foolishly , being over-interested in the business of others , saying things which they have no right to say .
54005014	So it is my desire that the younger widows may be married and have children , controlling their families , and giving the Evil One no chance to say anything against them ,
54005015	For even now some are turned away to Satan .
54005016	If any woman of the faith has relations who are widows , let her give them help , so that the care of them does not come on the church , and so it may give help to those who are truly widowed .
54005017	Let rulers whose rule is good be honoured twice over , specially those whose work is preaching and teaching .
54005018	For the Writings say , It is not right to keep the ox from taking the grain when he is crushing it . And , The worker has a right to his reward .
54005019	Do not take as true any statement made against one in authority , but only if two or three give witness to it .
54005020	Say sharp words to sinners when all are present , so that the rest may be in fear .
54005021	I give you orders before God and Christ Jesus and the angels of God's selection , to keep these orders without giving thought to one side more than another .
54005022	Do not put hands on any man without thought , and have no part in other men's sins : keep yourself clean .
54005023	Do not take only water as your drink , but take a little wine for the good of your stomach , and because you are frequently ill .
54005024	The sins of some men are clearly seen , going before them to be judged ; but with others , their sins go after them .
54005025	In the same way , there are good works which are clearly seen ; and those which are not so , may not be kept secret .
54006001	Let all who are servants under the yoke give all honour to their masters , so that no evil may be said against the name of God and his teaching .
54006002	And let those whose masters are of the faith have respect for them because they are brothers , working for them the more readily , because those who take part in the good work are of the faith and are dear . Give orders and teaching about these things .
54006003	If any man gives different teaching , not in agreement with the true words of our Lord Jesus Christ , and with the teaching which is in agreement with true religion ,
54006004	He has an over-high opinion of himself ; being without knowledge , having only an unhealthy love of questionings and wars of words , from which come envy , fighting , cruel words , evil thoughts ,
54006005	Bitter talk of men who , being evil in mind and dead to what is true , take the faith to be a way of making profit .
54006006	But true faith , with peace of mind , is of great profit :
54006007	For we came into the world with nothing , and we are not able to take anything out ;
54006008	But if we have food and a roof over us , let that be enough .
54006009	But those who have a desire for wealth are falling into danger , and are taken as in a net by a number of foolish and damaging desires , through which men are overtaken by death and destruction .
54006010	For the love of money is a root of all evil : and some whose hearts were fixed on it have been turned away from the faith , and been wounded with unnumbered sorrows .
54006011	But you , O man of God , keep yourself from these things , and go after righteousness , religion , faith , love , a quiet mind , gentle behaviour .
54006012	Be fighting the good fight of the faith ; take for yourself the life eternal , for which you were marked out , and of which you gave witness in the eyes of all .
54006013	I give you orders before God , the giver of life , and Christ Jesus , who before Pontius Pilate gave witness to the faith ,
54006014	To keep the word untouched by evil , clear from all shame , till the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ :
54006015	Which at the right time he will make clear , who is the eternal and only Ruler , King of kings , and Lord of lords ;
54006016	Who only has life for ever , living in light to which no man may come near ; whom no man has seen or is able to see : to whom be honour and power for ever . So be it .
54006017	Give orders to those who have money and goods in this life , not to be lifted up in their minds , or to put their hope in the uncertain chances of wealth , but in God who gives us in full measure all things for our use ;
54006018	And to do good , having wealth in good works , being quick to give , taking part with one another ;
54006019	Making ready for themselves a safe place for the time to come , so that the true life may be theirs .
54006020	O Timothy , take good care of that which is given to you , turning away from the wrong and foolish talk and arguments of that knowledge which is falsely so named ;
54006021	Through which some , who gave their minds to it , have been turned away from the faith . Grace be with you .
55001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the purpose of God , in the hope of the life which is in Christ Jesus ,
55001002	To Timothy , my well-loved child : Grace , mercy , peace , from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord .
55001003	I give praise to God , whose servant I have been , with a heart free from sin , from the time of my fathers , because in my prayers at all times the thought of you is with me , night and day
55001004	Desiring to see you , keeping in my memory your weeping , so that I may be full of joy ;
55001005	Having in mind your true faith , which first was in your mother's mother Lois , and in your mother Eunice , and , I am certain , is now in you .
55001006	For this reason I say to you , Let that grace of God which is in you , given to you by my hands , have living power .
55001007	For God did not give us a spirit of fear , but of power and of love and of self-control .
55001008	Have no feeling of shame , then , for the witness of our Lord or for me , his prisoner : but undergo all things for the good news in the measure of the power of God ;
55001009	Who gave us salvation , marking us out for his purpose , not on account of our works , but in the measure of his purpose and his grace , which was given to us in Christ Jesus before times eternal ,
55001010	But has now been made clear by the revelation of our Saviour Christ Jesus , who put an end to death and made life unending come to light through the good news ,
55001011	Of which I was made a preacher and an Apostle and a teacher ;
55001012	And for which I undergo these things : but I have no feeling of shame . For I have knowledge of him in whom I have faith , and I am certain that he is able to keep that which I have given into his care till that day .
55001013	Keep the form of those true words which you had from me , in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus .
55001014	That good thing which was given to you keep safe , through the Holy Spirit which is in us .
55001015	You have had news that all those in Asia went away from me ; among whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes :
55001016	May the Lord give mercy to the house of Onesiphorus because he frequently gave me help , and had no feeling of shame because I was in chains ;
55001017	But when he was in Rome , he went in search of me everywhere , and came to me
55001018	( May he have the Lord's mercy in that day ) ; and of all he did for me at Ephesus you have full knowledge .
55002001	So then , my child , be strong in the grace which is in Christ Jesus .
55002002	And the things which I have said to you before a number of witnesses , give to those of the faith , so that they may be teachers of others .
55002003	Be ready to do without the comforts of life , as one of the army of Christ Jesus .
55002004	A fighting man , when he is with the army , keeps himself free from the business of this life so that he may be pleasing to him who has taken him into his army .
