55002005	And if a man takes part in a competition he does not get the crown if he has not kept the rules .
55002006	It is right for the worker in the fields to be the first to take of the fruit .
55002007	Give thought to what I say ; for the Lord will give you wisdom in all things .
55002008	Keep in mind Jesus Christ , of the seed of David , who came back from the dead , as my good news gives witness :
55002009	In which I put up with the hardest conditions , even prison chains , like one who has done a crime ; but the word of God is not in chains .
55002010	But I undergo all things for the saints , so that they may have salvation in Christ Jesus with eternal glory .
55002011	This is a true saying : If we undergo death with him , then will we be living with him :
55002012	If we go on to the end , then we will be ruling with him : if we say we have no knowledge of him , then he will say he has no knowledge of us :
55002013	If we are without faith , still he keeps faith , for he will never be untrue to himself .
55002014	Put these things before them , giving them orders in the name of the Lord to keep themselves from fighting about words , which is of no profit , only causing error in their hearers .
55002015	Let it be your care to get the approval of God , as a workman who has no cause for shame , giving the true word in the right way .
55002016	But take no part in wrong and foolish talk , for those who do so will go farther into evil ,
55002017	And their words will be like poisoned wounds in the flesh : such are Hymenaeus and Philetus ;
55002018	Men whose ideas are all false , who say that the coming back from the dead has even now taken place , overturning the faith of some .
55002019	But God's strong base is unchanging , having this sign , The Lord has knowledge of those who are his : and , Let everyone by whom the name of the Lord is named be turned away from evil .
55002020	Now in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and silver , but others of wood and earth , and some which are honoured and some without honour .
55002021	If a man makes himself clean from these , he will be a vessel for honour , made holy , ready for the master's use , ready for every good work .
55002022	But keep yourself from those desires of the flesh which are strong when the body is young , and go after righteousness , faith , love , peace , with those whose prayers go up to the Lord from a clean heart .
55002023	And put away foolish and uncontrolled questionings , seeing that they are a cause of trouble .
55002024	For it is not right for the Lord's servant to make trouble , but he is to be gentle to all , ready in teaching , putting up with wrong ,
55002025	Gently guiding those who go against the teaching ; if by chance God may give them a change of heart and true knowledge ,
55002026	And so they may get themselves free from the net of the Evil One , being made the prisoners of the Lord's servant , for the purpose of God .
55003001	But be certain of this , that in the last days times of trouble will come .
55003002	For men will be lovers of self , lovers of money , uplifted in pride , given to bitter words , going against the authority of their fathers , never giving praise , having no religion ,
55003003	Without natural love , bitter haters , saying evil of others , violent and uncontrolled , hating all good ,
55003004	False to their friends , acting without thought , lifted up in mind , loving pleasure more than God ;
55003005	Having a form of religion , but turning their backs on the power of it : go not with these .
55003006	For these are they who go secretly into houses , making prisoners of foolish women , weighted down with sin , turned from the way by their evil desires ,
55003007	Ever learning , and never coming to the knowledge of what is true .
55003008	And as James and Jambres went against Moses , so do these go against what is true : men of evil minds , who , tested by faith , are seen to be false .
55003009	But they will go no farther : for their foolish behaviour will be clear to all men , as theirs was in the end .
55003010	But you took as your example my teaching , behaviour , purpose , and faith ; my long waiting , my love , my quiet undergoing of trouble ;
55003011	My punishments and pain ; the things which came to me at Antioch , at Iconium , at Lystra ; the cruel attacks made on me : and the Lord made me free from them all .
55003012	Yes , and all whose purpose is to be living in the knowledge of God in Christ Jesus , will be cruelly attacked .
55003013	Evil and false men will become worse and worse , using deceit and themselves overcome by deceit .
55003014	But see that you keep to the teaching you have been given and the things of which you are certain , conscious of who has been your teacher ;
55003015	And that from the time when you were a child , you have had knowledge of the holy Writings , which are able to make you wise to salvation , through faith in Christ Jesus .
55003016	Every holy Writing which comes from God is of profit for teaching , for training , for guiding , for education in righteousness :
55003017	So that the man of God may be complete , trained and made ready for every good work .
55004001	I give you orders , before God and Christ Jesus , who will be the judge of the living and the dead , and by his revelation and his kingdom ;
55004002	Be preaching the word at all times , in every place ; make protests , say sharp words , give comfort , with long waiting and teaching ;
55004003	For the time will come when they will not take the true teaching ; but , moved by their desires , they will get for themselves a great number of teachers for the pleasure of hearing them ;
55004004	And shutting their ears to what is true , will be turned away to belief in foolish stories .
55004005	But be self-controlled in all things , do without comfort , go on preaching the good news , completing the work which has been given you to do .
55004006	For I am even now being offered , and my end is near .
55004007	I have made a good fight , I have come to the end of my journey , I have kept the faith :
55004008	From now on , the crown of righteousness is made ready for me , which the Lord , the upright judge , Will give to me at that day : and not only to me , but to all those who have had love for his revelation .
55004009	Do your best to come to me before long :
55004010	For Demas has gone away from me , for love of this present life , and has gone to Thessalonica : Crescens has gone to Galatia , Titus to Dalmatia .
55004011	Only Luke is with me . Get Mark and take him with you ; for he is of use to me in the work .
55004012	Tychicus I sent to Ephesus .
55004013	The coat which I did not take from Troas and which is with Carpus , get when you come , and the books , specially the papers .
55004014	Alexander the copper-worker did me much wrong : the Lord will give him the reward of his works :
55004015	But be on the watch for him , for he was violent in his attacks on our teaching .
55004016	At my first meeting with my judges , no one took my part , but all went away from me . May it not be put to their account .
55004017	But the Lord was by my side and gave me strength ; so that through me the news might be given out in full measure , and all the Gentiles might give ear : and I was taken out of the mouth of the lion .
55004018	The Lord will keep me safe from every evil work and will give me salvation in his kingdom in heaven : to whom be glory for ever and ever . So be it .
55004019	Give my love to Prisca and Aquila and those of the house of Onesiphorus .
55004020	Erastus was stopping at Corinth ; but Trophimus , when I last saw him was at Miletus , ill .
55004021	Do your best to come before the winter . Eubulus sends you his love , and Pudens and Linus and Claudia , and all the brothers .
55004022	The Lord be with your spirit . Grace be with you .
56001001	Paul , a servant of God , and an Apostle of Jesus Christ , in agreement with the faith of the saints of God and the full knowledge of what is true in harmony with religion ,
56001002	In the hope of eternal life , which was made certain before eternal time , by the word of God who is ever true ;
56001003	Who , in his time , made clear his word in the good news , of which , by the order of God our Saviour , I became a preacher ;
56001004	To Titus , my true child in our common faith : Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour .
56001005	I did not take you with me when I went away from Crete , so that you might do what was necessary to put things in order there , placing men in authority over the churches in every town , as I said to you ;
56001006	Men having a good record , husbands of one wife , whose children are of the faith , children of whom it may not be said that they are given to loose living or are uncontrolled .
56001007	For it is necessary for a Bishop to be a man of virtue , as God's servant ; not pushing himself forward , not quickly moved to wrath or blows , not desiring profit for himself ;
56001008	But opening his house freely to guests ; a lover of what is good , serious-minded , upright , holy , self-controlled ;
56001009	Keeping to the true word of the teaching , so that he may be able to give comfort by right teaching and overcome the arguments of the doubters .
56001010	For there are men who are not ruled by law ; foolish talkers , false teachers , specially those of the circumcision ,
56001011	By whom some families have been completely overturned ; who take money for teaching things which are not right ; these will have to be stopped .
56001012	One of their prophets has said , The men of Crete are ever false , evil beasts , lovers of food , hating work .
56001013	This witness is true . So say sharp words to them so that they may come to the right faith ,
56001014	Giving no attention to the fictions of the Jews and the rules of men who have no true knowledge .
56001015	To the clean in heart all things are clean : but to those who are unclean and without faith nothing is clean ; they become unclean in mind and in thought .
56001016	They say that they have knowledge of God , while by their acts they are turning their backs on him ; they are hated by all , hard-hearted , and judged to be without value for any good work .
56002001	But let your words be in agreement with true and right teaching :
56002002	That old men are to be simple in their tastes , serious , wise , true in faith , in love , and of a quiet mind .
56002003	That old women are to be self-respecting in behaviour , not saying evil of others , not given to taking much wine , teachers of that which is good ,
56002004	Training the younger women to have love for their husbands and children ,
56002005	To be wise in mind , clean in heart , kind ; working in their houses , living under the authority of their husbands ; so that no evil may be said of the word of God .
56002006	To the young men give orders to be wise and serious-minded :
56002007	In all things see that you are an example of good works ; holy in your teaching , serious in behaviour ,
56002008	Saying true and right words , against which no protest may be made , so that he who is not on our side may be put to shame , unable to say any evil of us .
56002009	Servants are to be under the authority of their masters , pleasing them in all things , without argument ;
56002010	Not taking what is not theirs , but giving clear signs of their good faith , in all things doing credit to the teaching of God our Saviour .
56002011	For the grace of God has come , giving salvation to all men ,
56002012	Training us so that , turning away from evil and the desires of this world , we may be living wisely and uprightly in the knowledge of God in this present life ;
56002013	Looking for the glad hope , the revelation of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ ;
56002014	Who gave himself for us , so that he might make us free from all wrongdoing , and make for himself a people clean in heart and on fire with good works .
56002015	On all these points give teaching and help , and make clear what is right with all authority . Let all men give you honour .
56003001	Make clear to them that they are to put themselves under rulers and authorities , to do what they are ordered , to be ready for every good work ,
56003002	To say no evil of any man , not to be fighters , to give way to others , to be gentle in behaviour to all men .
56003003	For in the past we were foolish , hard in heart , turned from the true way , servants of evil desires and pleasures , living in bad feeling and envy , hated and hating one another .
56003004	But when the mercy of God our Saviour , and his love to man was seen ,
56003005	Not by works of righteousness which we did ourselves , but in the measure of his mercy , he gave us salvation , through the washing of the new birth and the giving of new life in the Holy Spirit ,
56003006	Which he gave us freely through Jesus Christ our Saviour ;
56003007	So that , having been given righteousness through grace , we might have a part in the heritage , the hope of eternal life .
56003008	This is a true saying ; and it is my desire that you may give certain witness about these things , so that those who have had faith in God may give attention to good works . These things are good and of profit to men ;
56003009	But have nothing to do with foolish questionings , and lists of generations , and fights and arguments about the law ; for they are of no profit and foolish .
56003010	A man whose opinions are not those of the church , after a first and second protest , is to be kept out of your society ;
56003011	Clearly he is in error and a sinner , being self-judged .
56003012	When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you , do your best to come to me at Nicopolis : for it is my purpose to be there for the winter .
56003013	Send Zenas , the man of law , and Apollos on their journey with all care , so that they may be in need of nothing .
56003014	And let our people go on with good works for necessary purposes , so that they may not be without fruit .
56003015	All who are with me send you their love . Give our love to our friends in the faith . Grace be with you all .
57001001	Paul , a prisoner of Jesus Christ , and Timothy our brother , to Philemon , our dear helper in the faith ,
57001002	And to Apphia , our sister , and to Archippus , our brother in God's army , and to the church in your house :
57001003	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
57001004	I give praise to God at all times and make prayer for you ,
57001005	Hearing of the love and the faith which you have to the Lord Jesus and to all the saints ;
57001006	That the faith which you have in common with them may be working with power , in the knowledge of every good thing in you , for Christ .
57001007	For I had great joy and comfort in your love , because the hearts of the saints have been made strong again through you , brother .
57001008	And so , though I might , in the name of Christ , give you orders to do what is right ,
57001009	Still , because of love , in place of an order , I make a request to you , I , Paul , an old man and now a prisoner of Christ Jesus :
57001010	My request is for my child Onesimus , the child of my chains ,
57001011	Who in the past was of no profit to you , but now is of profit to you and to me :
57001012	Whom I have sent back to you , him who is my very heart :
57001013	Though my desire was to keep him with me , to be my servant in the chains of the good news , in your place :
57001014	But without your approval I would do nothing ; so that your good works might not be forced , but done freely from your heart .
57001015	For it is possible that for this reason he was parted from you for a time , so that you might have him for ever ;
57001016	No longer as a servant , but more than a servant , a brother , very dear to me specially , but much more to you , in the flesh as well as in the Lord .
57001017	If then you take me to be your friend and brother , take him in as myself .
57001018	If he has done you any wrong or is in debt to you for anything , put it to my account .
57001019	I , Paul , writing this myself , say , I will make payment to you : and I do not say to you that you are in debt to me even for your life .
57001020	So brother , let me have joy of you in the Lord : give new life to my heart in Christ .
57001021	Being certain that you will do my desire , I am writing to you , in the knowledge that you will do even more than I say .
57001022	And make a room ready for me ; for I am hoping that through your prayers I will be given to you .
57001023	Epaphras , my brother-prisoner in Christ Jesus , sends you his love ;
57001024	And so do Mark , Aristarchus , Demas , and Luke , my brother-workers .
57001025	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . So be it .
58001001	In times past the word of God came to our fathers through the prophets , in different parts and in different ways ;
58001002	But now , at the end of these days , it has come to us through his Son , to whom he has given all things for a heritage , and through whom he made the order of the generations ;
58001003	Who , being the outshining of his glory , the true image of his substance , supporting all things by the word of his power , having given himself as an offering making clean from sins , took his seat at the right hand of God in heaven ;
58001004	Having become by so much better than the angels , as the name which is his heritage is more noble than theirs .
58001005	To which of the angels did God say at any time , You are my Son , this day I have given you being ? or , I will be his Father , and he will be my Son ?
58001006	And again , when he is sending his only Son into the world , he says , Let all the angels of God give him worship .
58001007	And of the angels he says , Who makes his angels winds , and his servants flames of fire :
58001008	But of the Son he says , Your seat of power , O God , is for ever and ever ; and the rod of your kingdom is a rod of righteousness .
58001009	You have been a lover of righteousness and a hater of evil ; and so God , your God , has put the oil of joy on your head more than on the heads of those who are with you .
58001010	You , Lord , at the first did put the earth on its base , and the heavens are the works of your hands :
58001011	They will come to their end ; but you are for ever ; they will become old as a robe ;
58001012	They will be rolled up like a cloth , even like a robe , and they will be changed : but you are the same and your years will have no end .
58001013	But of which of the angels has he said at any time , Take your seat at my right hand till I put all those who are against you under your feet ?
58001014	Are they not all helping spirits , who are sent out as servants to those whose heritage will be salvation ?
58002001	For this reason there is the more need for us to give attention to the things which have come to our ears , for fear that by chance we might be slipping away .
58002002	Because if the word which came through the angels was fixed , and in the past every evil act against God's orders was given its full punishment ;
58002003	What will come on us , if we do not give our minds to such a great salvation ? a salvation of which our fathers first had knowledge through the words of the Lord , and which was made certain to us by those to whom his words came ;
58002004	And God was a witness with them , by signs and wonders , and by more than natural powers , and by his distribution of the Holy Spirit at his pleasure .
58002005	For he did not make the angels rulers over the world to come , of which I am writing .
58002006	But a certain writer has given his witness , saying , What is man , that you keep him in mind ? what is the son of man , that you take him into account ?
58002007	You made him a little lower than the angels ; you gave him a crown of glory and honour , and made him ruler over all the works of your hands :
58002008	You put all things under his feet . For in making man the ruler over all things , God did not put anything outside his authority ; though we do not see everything under him now .
58002009	But we see him who was made a little lower than the angels , even Jesus , crowned with glory and honour , because he let himself be put to death so that by the grace of God he might undergo death for all men .
58002010	Because it was right for him , for whom and through whom all things have being , in guiding his sons to glory , to make the captain of their salvation complete through pain .
58002011	For he who makes holy and those who are made holy are all of one family ; and for this reason it is no shame for him to give them the name of brothers ,
58002012	Saying , I will give the knowledge of your name to my brothers , I will make a song of praise to you before the church .
58002013	And again he says , I will put my faith in him . And again , See , I am here , and the children which God has given to me .
58002014	And because the children are flesh and blood , he took a body himself and became like them ; so that by his death he might put an end to him who had the power of death , that is to say , the Evil One ;
58002015	And let those who all their lives were in chains because of their fear of death , go free .
58002016	For , truly , he does not take on the life of angels , but that of the seed of Abraham .
58002017	Because of this it was necessary for him to be made like his brothers in every way , so that he might be a high priest full of mercy and keeping faith in everything to do with God , making offerings for the sins of the people .
58002018	For having been put to the test himself , he is able to give help to others when they are tested .
58003001	For this reason , holy brothers , marked out to have a part in heaven , give thought to Jesus the representative and high priest of our faith ;
58003002	Who kept faith with God who gave him his place , even as Moses did in all his house .
58003003	And it was right for this man to have more honour than Moses , even as the builder of a house has more honour than the house .
58003004	For every house has a builder ; but the builder of all things is God .
58003005	And Moses certainly kept faith as a servant , in all his house , and as a witness of those things which were to be said later ;
58003006	But Christ as a son , over his house ; whose house are we , if we keep our hearts fixed in the glad and certain hope till the end .
58003007	And so , as the Holy Spirit says , Today if you let his voice come to your ears ,
58003008	Be not hard of heart , as when you made me angry , on the day of testing in the waste land ,
58003009	When your fathers put me to the test , and saw my works for forty years .
58003010	So that I was angry with this generation , and I said , Their hearts are in error at all times , and they have no knowledge of my ways ;
58003011	And being angry I made an oath , saying , They may not come into my rest .
58003012	My brothers , take care that there is not by chance in any one of you an evil heart without belief , turning away from the living God :
58003013	But give comfort to one another every day as long as it is still Today ; so that no one among you may be made hard by the deceit of sin :
58003014	For if we keep the substance of the faith which we had at the start , even till the end , we have a part with Christ ;
58003015	As it is said , Today if you will let his voice come to your ears , be not hard of heart , as when you made him angry .
58003016	Who made him angry when his voice came to them ? was it not all those who came out of Egypt with Moses ?
58003017	And with whom was he angry for forty years ? was it not with those who did evil , who came to their deaths in the waste land ?
58003018	And to whom did he make an oath that they might not come into his rest ? was it not to those who went against his orders ?
58003019	So we see that they were not able to go in because they had no belief .
58004001	Let us then , though we still have God's word that we may come into his rest , go in fear that some of you may be unable to do so .
58004002	And , truly , the good news came to us , even as it did to them ; but the hearing of the word did them no good , because they were not united in faith with the true hearers .
58004003	For those of us who have belief come into his rest ; even as he has said , As I said in my oath when I was angry , They may not come into my rest : though the works were done from the time of the making of the world .
58004004	For in one place he has said of the seventh day , And God had rest from all his works on the seventh day ;
58004005	And in the same place he says again , They will not come into my rest .
58004006	So that as it is clear that some have to go in , and that the first hearers of the good news were not able to go in because they went against God's orders ,
58004007	After a long time , again naming a certain day , he says in David , Today ( as he had said before ) , Today if you will let his voice come to your ears , be not hard of heart ,
58004008	For if Joshua had given them rest , he would not have said anything about another day .
58004009	So that there is still a Sabbath-keeping for the people of God .
58004010	For the man who comes into his rest has had rest from his works , as God did from his .
58004011	Because of this , let us have a strong desire to come into that rest , and let no one go after the example of those who went against God's orders .
58004012	For the word of God is living and full of power , and is sharper than any two-edged sword , cutting through and making a division even of the soul and the spirit , the bones and the muscles , and quick to see the thoughts and purposes of the heart .
58004013	And there is nothing made which is not completely clear to him ; there is nothing covered , but all things are open to the eyes of him with whom we have to do .
58004014	Having then a great high priest , who has made his way through the heavens , even Jesus the Son of God , let us be strong in our faith .
58004015	For we have not a high priest who is not able to be touched by the feelings of our feeble flesh ; but we have one who has been tested in all points as we ourselves are tested , but without sin .
58004016	Then let us come near to the seat of grace without fear , so that mercy may be given to us , and we may get grace for our help in time of need .
58005001	Every high priest who is taken from among men is given his position to take care of the interests of men in those things which have to do with God , so that he may make offerings for sins .
58005002	He is able to have feeling for those who have no knowledge and for those who are wandering from the true way , because he himself is feeble ;
58005003	And being feeble , he has to make sin-offerings for himself as well as for the people .
58005004	And no man who is not given authority by God , as Aaron was , takes this honour for himself .
58005005	In the same way Christ did not take for himself the glory of being made a high priest , but was given it by him who said , You are my Son , this day I have given you being :
58005006	As he says in another place , You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek .
58005007	Who in the days of his flesh , having sent up prayers and requests with strong crying and weeping to him who was able to give him salvation from death , had his prayer answered because of his fear of God .
58005008	And though he was a Son , through the pain which he underwent , the knowledge came to him of what it was to be under God's orders ;
58005009	And when he had been made complete , he became the giver of eternal salvation to all those who are under his orders ;
58005010	Being named by God a high priest of the order of Melchizedek .
58005011	Of whom we have much to say which it is hard to make clear , because you are slow of hearing .
58005012	And though by this time it would be right for you to be teachers , you still have need of someone to give you teaching about the first simple rules of God's revelation ; you have become like babies who have need of milk , and not of solid food .
58005013	For everyone who takes milk is without experience of the word of righteousness : he is a child .
58005014	But solid food is for men of full growth , even for those whose senses are trained by use to see what is good and what is evil .
58006001	For this reason let us go on from the first things about Christ to full growth ; not building again that on which it is based , that is , the turning of the heart from dead works , and faith in God ,
58006002	The teaching of baptisms , and of the putting on of hands , and of the future life of the dead , and of the judging on the last day .
58006003	Now we will do this , if God lets us .
58006004	As for those who at one time saw the light , tasting the good things from heaven , and having their part in the Holy Spirit ,
58006005	With knowledge of the good word of God , and of the powers of the coming time ,
58006006	And then let themselves be turned away , it is not possible for their hearts to be made new a second time ; because they themselves put the Son of God on the cross again , openly shaming him .
58006007	For a land , drinking in the frequent rain and producing good plants for those for whom it is worked , has a blessing from God :
58006008	But if it sends up thorns and evil plants , it is of no use and is ready to be cursed ; its only end is to be burned .
58006009	But , my loved ones , though we say this , we are certain that you have better things in you , things which go with salvation ;
58006010	For God is true , and will not put away from him the memory of your work and of your love for his name , in the help which you gave and still give to the saints .
58006011	And it is our desire that you may all keep the same high purpose in certain hope to the end :
58006012	So that you may not be slow in heart , but may take as your example those to whom God has given their heritage , because of their faith and their long waiting .
58006013	For when God made his oath to Abraham , because there was no greater oath , he made it by himself ,
58006014	Saying , Be certain that I will give you my blessing , and make your numbers very great .
58006015	And so , when he had been waiting calmly for a long time , God's word to him was put into effect .
58006016	For men at all times make their oaths by what is greater ; and any argument is ended by the decision of the oath .
58006017	So that when it was God's desire to make it specially clear to those who by his word were to have the heritage , that his purpose was fixed , he made it more certain with an oath ;
58006018	So that we , who have gone in flight from danger to the hope which has been put before us , may have a strong comfort in two unchanging things , in which it is not possible for God to be false ;
58006019	And this hope is like a strong band for our souls , fixed and certain , and going in to that which is inside the veil ;
58006020	Where Jesus has gone before us , as a high priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek .
58007001	For this Melchizedek , the king of Salem , a priest of the Most High God , who gave Abraham his blessing , meeting him when he came back after putting the kings to death ,
58007002	And to whom Abraham gave a tenth part of everything which he had , being first named King of righteousness , and then in addition , King of Salem , that is to say , King of peace ;
58007003	Being without father or mother , or family , having no birth or end to his life , being made like the Son of God , is a priest for ever .
58007004	Now see how great this man was , to whom our father Abraham gave a tenth part of what he had got in the fight .
58007005	And it is true that by the law , those of the sons of Levi who have the position of priests may take a tenth part of the people's goods ; that is to say , they take it from their brothers though these are the sons of Abraham .
58007006	But this man , who was not of their family , took the tenth from Abraham , and gave a blessing to him to whom God had given his undertaking .
58007007	But there is no doubt that the less gets his blessing from the greater .
58007008	Now at the present time , men over whom death has power take the tenth ; but then it was taken by one of whom it is witnessed that he is living .
58007009	And we may say that in Abraham , even Levi , who has a right to take the tenth part , gave it ;
58007010	Because he was still in his father's body when Melchizedek came to him .
58007011	Now if it was possible for things to be made complete through the priests of the house of Levi ( for the law was given to the people in connection with them ) , what need was there for another priest who was of the order of Melchizedek and not of the order of Aaron ?
58007012	Because if the priests are changed , it is necessary to make a change in the law .
58007013	For he of whom these things are said comes of another tribe , of which no man has ever made offerings at the altar .
58007014	Because it is clear that our Lord comes out of Judah , and Moses said nothing about priests from that tribe .
58007015	And this is even more clear if a second priest has come up who is like Melchizedek ,
58007016	That is to say , not made by a law based on the flesh , but by the power of a life without end :
58007017	For it has been witnessed of him , You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek .
58007018	So the law which went before is put on one side , because it was feeble and without profit .
58007019	( Because the law made nothing complete ) , and in its place there is a better hope , through which we come near to God .
58007020	And as this is not without the taking of an oath
58007021	( For those were made priests without an oath , but this one was made a priest with an oath by him who says of him , The Lord gave his oath , which he will not take back , that you are a priest for ever ) ;
58007022	By so much is it a better agreement which we have through Jesus .
58007023	And it is true that there have been a great number of those priests , because death does not let them go on for ever ;
58007024	But this priest , because his life goes on for ever , is unchanging .
58007025	So that he is fully able to be the saviour of all who come to God through him , because he is ever living to make prayer to God for them .
58007026	It was right for us to have such a high priest , one who is holy and without evil , doing no wrong , having no part with sinners , and made higher than the heavens :
58007027	Who has no need to make offerings for sins every day , like those high priests , first for himself , and then for the people ; because he did this once and for ever when he made an offering of himself .
58007028	The law makes high priests of men who are feeble ; but the word of the oath , which was made after the law , gives that position to a Son , in whom all good is for ever complete .
58008001	Now of the things we are saying this is the chief point : We have such a high priest , who has taken his place at the right hand of God's high seat of glory in heaven ,
58008002	As a servant of the holy things and of the true Tent , which was put up by God , not by man .
58008003	Now every high priest is given authority to take to God the things which are given and to make offerings ; so that it is necessary for this man , like them , to have something for an offering .
58008004	If he had been on earth he would not have been a priest at all , because there are other priests who make the offerings ordered by the law ;
58008005	Being servants of that which is a copy and an image of the things in heaven , as Moses , when he was about to make the Tent , had special orders from God : for , See , he said , that you make everything like the design which you saw in the mountain .
58008006	But now his position as priest is higher . because through him God has made a better agreement with man , based on the giving of better things .
58008007	For if that first agreement had been as good as possible , there would have been no place for a second .
58008008	For , protesting against them , he says , See , the days are coming when I will make a new agreement with the house of Israel , and with the house of Judah ;
58008009	Not like the agreement which I made with their fathers when I took them by the hand , to be their guide out of the land of Egypt ; for they did not keep the agreement with me , and I gave them up , says the Lord .
58008010	For this is the agreement which I will make with the people of Israel after those days : I will put my laws into their minds , writing them in their hearts : and I will be their God , and they will be my people :
58008011	And there will be no need for every man to be teaching his brother , or his neighbour , saying , This is the knowledge of the Lord : for they will all have knowledge of me , great and small .
58008012	And I will have mercy on their evil-doing , and I will not keep their sins in mind .
58008013	When he says , A new agreement , he has made the first agreement old . But anything which is getting old and past use will not be seen much longer .
58009001	Now the first agreement had its rules of worship , and a holy order .
58009002	For the first Tent was made ready , having in it the vessels for the lights and the table and the ordering of the bread ; and this is named the holy place .
58009003	And inside the second veil was the place which is named the Holy of holies ;
58009004	Having a vessel of gold in it for burning perfumes , and the ark of the agreement , which was covered with gold and which had in it a pot made of gold for the manna , and Aaron's rod which put out buds , and the stones with the writing of the agreement ;
58009005	And over it were the winged ones of glory with their wings covering the mercy-seat ; about which it is not possible now to say anything in detail .
58009006	Now while these things were in existence , the priests went into the first Tent at all times , for prayer and the making of offerings .
58009007	But only the high priest went into the second , once a year , not without making an offering of blood for himself and for the errors of the people :
58009008	The Holy Spirit witnessing by this that the way into the holy place had not at that time been made open , while the first Tent was still in being ;
58009009	And this is an image of the present time ; when the offerings which are given are not able to make the heart of the worshipper completely clean ,
58009010	Because they are only rules of the flesh , of meats and drinks and washings , which have their place till the time comes when things will be put right .
58009011	But now Christ has come as the high priest of the good things of the future , through this greater and better Tent , not made with hands , that is to say , not of this world ,
58009012	And has gone once and for ever into the holy place , having got eternal salvation , not through the blood of goats and young oxen , but through his blood .
58009013	For if the blood of goats and oxen , and the dust from the burning of a young cow , being put on the unclean , make the flesh clean :
58009014	How much more will the blood of Christ , who , being without sin , made an offering of himself to God through the Holy Spirit , make your hearts clean from dead works to be servants of the living God ?
58009015	And for this cause it is through him that a new agreement has come into being , so that after the errors under the first agreement had been taken away by his death , the word of God might have effect for those who were marked out for an eternal heritage .
58009016	Because where there is a testament , there has to be the death of the man who made it .
58009017	For a testament has effect after death ; for what power has it while the man who made it is living ?
58009018	So that even the first agreement was not made without blood .
58009019	For when Moses had given all the rules of the law to the people , he took the blood of goats and young oxen , with water and red wool and hyssop , and put it on the book itself and on all the people ,
58009020	Saying , This blood is the sign of the agreement which God has made with you .
58009021	And the blood was put on the Tent and all the holy vessels in the same way .
58009022	And by the law almost all things are made clean with blood , and without blood there is no forgiveness .
58009023	For this cause it was necessary to make the copies of the things in heaven clean with these offerings ; but the things themselves are made clean with better offerings than these .
58009024	For Christ did not go into a holy place which had been made by men's hands as the copy of the true one ; but he went into heaven itself , and now takes his place before the face of God for us .
58009025	And he did not have to make an offering of himself again and again , as the high priest goes into the holy place every year with blood which is not his ;
58009026	For then he would have undergone a number of deaths from the time of the making of the world : but now he has come to us at the end of the old order , to put away sin by the offering of himself .
58009027	And because by God's law death comes to men once , and after that they are judged ;
58009028	So Christ , having at his first coming taken on himself the sins of men , will be seen a second time , without sin , by those who are waiting for him , for their salvation .
58010001	For the law , being only a poor copy of the future good things , and not the true image of those things , is never able to make the people who come to the altar every year with the same offerings completely clean .
58010002	For if this had been possible , would there not have been an end of those offerings , because the worshippers would have been made completely clean and would have been no longer conscious of sins ?
58010003	But year by year there is a memory of sins in those offerings .
58010004	Because it is not possible for the blood of oxen and goats to take away sins .
58010005	So that when he comes into the world , he says , You had no desire for offerings , but you made a body ready for me ;
58010006	You had no joy in burned offerings or in offerings for sin .
58010007	Then I said , See , I have come to do your pleasure , O God ( as it is said of me in the roll of the book ) .
58010008	After saying , You had no desire for offerings , for burned offerings or offerings for sin ( which are made by the law ) and you had no pleasure in them ,
58010009	Then he said , See , I have come to do your pleasure . He took away the old order , so that he might put the new order in its place .
58010010	By that pleasure we have been made holy , by the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once and for ever .
58010011	And every priest takes his place at the altar day by day , doing what is necessary , and making again and again the same offerings which are never able to take away sins .
58010012	But when Jesus had made one offering for sins for ever , he took his place at the right hand of God ;
58010013	And has been waiting there from that time , till all who are against him are made a foot-rest for his feet .
58010014	Because by one offering he has made complete for ever those who are made holy .
58010015	And the Holy Spirit is a witness for us : for after he had said ,
58010016	This is the agreement which I will make with them after those days , says the Lord ; I will put my laws in their hearts , writing them in their minds ; he said ,
58010017	And I will keep no more memory of their sins and of their evil-doings .
58010018	Now where there is forgiveness of these , there is no more offering for sin .
58010019	So then , my brothers , being able to go into the holy place without fear , because of the blood of Jesus ,
58010020	By the new and living way which he made open for us through the veil , that is to say , his flesh ;
58010021	And having a great priest over the house of God ,
58010022	Let us go in with true hearts , in certain faith , having our hearts made free from the sense of sin and our bodies washed with clean water :
58010023	Let us keep the witness of our hope strong and unshaking , for he is true who has given his word :
58010024	And let us be moving one another at all times to love and good works ;
58010025	Not giving up our meetings , as is the way of some , but keeping one another strong in faith ; and all the more because you see the day coming near .
58010026	For if we do evil on purpose after we have had the knowledge of what is true , there is no more offering for sins ,
58010027	But only a great fear of being judged , and of the fire of wrath which will be the destruction of the haters of God .
58010028	A man who has gone against the law of Moses is put to death without pity on the word of two or three witnesses :
58010029	But will not the man by whom the Son of God has been crushed under foot , and the blood of the agreement with which he was washed clean has been taken as an unholy thing , and who has had no respect for the Spirit of grace , be judged bad enough for a very much worse punishment ?
58010030	For we have had experience of him who says , Punishment is mine , I will give reward . And again , The Lord will be judge of his people .
58010031	We may well go in fear of falling into the hands of the living God .
58010032	But give thought to the days after you had seen the light , when you went through a great war of troubles ;
58010033	In part , in being attacked by angry words and cruel acts , before the eyes of everyone , and in part , in being united with those who were attacked in this way .
58010034	For you had pity on those who were in prison , and had joy in the loss of your property , in the knowledge that you still had a better property and one which you would keep for ever .
58010035	So do not give up your hope which will be greatly rewarded .
58010036	For , having done what was right in God's eyes , you have need of waiting before his word has effect for you .
58010037	In a very little time he who is coming will come ; he will not be slow .
58010038	But the upright man will be living by his faith ; and if he goes back , my soul will have no pleasure in him .
58010039	But we are not of those who go back to destruction ; but of those who have faith even to the salvation of the soul .
58011001	Now faith is the substance of things hoped for , and the sign that the things not seen are true .
58011002	For by it our fathers had God's approval .
58011003	By faith it is clear to us that the order of events was fixed by the word of God , so that what is seen has not been made from things which only seem to be .
58011004	By faith Abel made a better offering to God than Cain , and he had witness through it of his righteousness , God giving his approval of his offering : and his voice still comes to us through it though he is dead .
58011005	By faith Enoch was taken up to heaven so that he did not see death ; he was seen no longer , for God took him away : for before he was taken , witness had been given that he was well-pleasing to God :
58011006	And without faith it is not possible to be well-pleasing to him , for it is necessary for anyone who comes to God to have the belief that God is , and that he is a rewarder of all those who make a serious search for him .
58011007	By faith Noah , being moved by the fear of God , made ready an ark for the salvation of his family , because God had given him news of things which were not seen at the time ; and through it the world was judged by him , and he got for his heritage the righteousness which is by faith .
58011008	By faith Abraham did as God said when he was ordered to go out into a place which was to be given to him as a heritage , and went out without knowledge of where he was going .
58011009	By faith he was a wanderer in the land of the agreement , as in a strange land , living in tents with Isaac and Jacob , who had a part with him in the same heritage :
58011010	For he was looking for the strong town , whose builder and maker is God .
58011011	And by faith Sarah herself had power to give birth , when she was very old , because she had faith in him who gave his word ;
58011012	So that from one man , who was near to death , came children in number as the stars in heaven , or as the sand by the seaside , which may not be numbered .
58011013	All these came to their end in faith , not having had the heritage ; but having seen it with delight far away , they gave witness that they were wanderers and not of the earth .
58011014	For those who say such things make it clear that they are searching for a country for themselves .
58011015	And truly if they had kept in mind the country from which they went out , they would have had chances of turning back .
58011016	But now their desire is for a better country , that is to say , for one in heaven ; and so it is no shame to God to be named their God ; for he has made ready a town for them .
58011017	By faith Abraham made an offering of Isaac , when he was tested : and he with whom the agreement had been made gave up as an offering the only son of his body ,
58011018	Of whom it had been said , From Isaac will your seed take their name :
58011019	Judging that God was able to give life even to the dead ; and because of this he did get him back as if from death .
58011020	By faith Isaac , blessing Jacob and Esau , gave news of things to come .
58011021	By faith Jacob gave a blessing to the two sons of Joseph , when he was near to death ; and gave God worship , supported by his stick .
58011022	By faith Joseph , when his end was near , said that the children of Israel would go out of Egypt ; and gave orders about his bones .
58011023	By faith Moses was kept secretly by his father and mother for three months after his birth , because they saw that he was a fair child ; and they had no fear of the king's orders .
58011024	By faith Moses , when he became a man , had no desire to be named the son of Pharaoh's daughter ;
58011025	Feeling that it was better to undergo pain with the people of God , than for a short time to have a taste of the pleasures of sin ;
58011026	Judging a part in the shame of Christ to be better than all the wealth of Egypt ; for he was looking forward to his reward .
58011027	By faith he went out of Egypt , not being turned from his purpose by fear of the wrath of the king ; for he kept on his way , as seeing him who is unseen .
58011028	By faith he kept the Passover , and put the sign of the blood on the houses , so that the angel of destruction might not put their oldest sons to death .
58011029	By faith they went through the Red Sea as if it had been dry land , though the Egyptians were overcome by the water when they made an attempt to do the same .
58011030	By faith the walls of Jericho came down , after they had been circled for seven days .
58011031	By faith Rahab , the loose woman , was not put to death with those who had gone against God's orders , because she had taken into her house in peace those sent to see the land .
58011032	What more am I to say ? For there would not be time to give the stories of Gideon , Barak , Samson , and Jephthah , of David and Samuel and the prophets :
58011033	Who through faith overcame kingdoms , did righteousness , got their reward , kept the mouths of lions shut ,
58011034	Put out the power of fire , got safely away from the edge of the sword , were made strong when they had been feeble , became full of power in war , and put to flight the armies of the nations .
58011035	Women had their dead given back to them living ; others let themselves be cruelly attacked , having no desire to go free , so that they might have a better life to come ;
58011036	And others were tested by being laughed at or by blows , and even with chains and prisons :
58011037	They were stoned , they were cut up with knives , they were tested , they were put to death with the sword , they went about in sheepskins and in goatskins ; being poor and in pain and cruelly attacked ,
58011038	Wandering in waste places and in mountains and in holes in the rocks ; for whom the world was not good enough .
58011039	And not one of these got the good things of the agreement , though they all had a good record through faith ,
58011040	Because God had kept some better thing for us , so that it was not possible for them to become complete without us .
58012001	For this reason , as we are circled by so great a cloud of witnesses , putting off every weight , and the sin into which we come so readily , let us keep on running in the way which is marked out for us ,
58012002	Having our eyes fixed on Jesus , the guide and end of our faith , who went through the pains of the cross , not caring for the shame , because of the joy which was before him , and who has now taken his place at the right hand of God's seat of power .
58012003	Give thought to him who has undergone so much of the hate of sinners against himself , so that you may not be tired and feeble of purpose .
58012004	Till now you have not given your blood in your fight against sin :
58012005	And you have not kept in mind the word which says to you as to sons , My son , do not make little of the Lord's punishment , and do not give up hope when you are judged by him ;
58012006	For the Lord sends punishment on his loved ones ; everyone whom he takes as his son has experience of his rod .
58012007	It is for your training that you undergo these things ; God is acting to you as a father does to his sons ; for what son does not have punishment from his father ?
58012008	But if you have not that punishment of which we all have our part , then you are not true sons , but children of shame .
58012009	And again , if the fathers of our flesh gave us punishment and had our respect , how much more will we be under the authority of the Father of spirits , and have life ?
58012010	For they truly gave us punishment for a short time , as it seemed good to them ; but he does it for our profit , so that we may become holy as he is .
58012011	At the time all punishment seems to be pain and not joy : but after , those who have been trained by it get from it the peace-giving fruit of righteousness .
58012012	For this cause let the hands which are hanging down be lifted up , and let the feeble knees be made strong ,
58012013	And make straight roads for your feet , so that the feeble may not be turned out of the way , but may be made strong .
58012014	Let your desire be for peace with all men , and to be made holy , without which no man may see the Lord ;
58012015	Looking with care to see that no man among you in his behaviour comes short of the grace of God ; for fear that some bitter root may come up to be a trouble to you , and that some of you may be made unclean by it ;
58012016	And that there may not be any evil liver , or any man without respect for God , like Esau , who let his birthright go for a plate of food .
58012017	For you have knowledge that even long after , when he was desiring the blessing for his heritage , he was turned away , though he made his request frequently and with weeping ; because the past might not be changed .
58012018	You have not come to a mountain which may be touched , and is burning with fire , and to a black cloud , and a dark smoke , and a violent wind ,
58012019	And to the sound of a horn , and the voice of words , the hearers of which made request that not a word more might be said to them :
58012020	For the order which said , If the mountain is touched even by a beast , the beast is to be stoned , seemed hard to them ;
58012021	And the vision was so overpowering that even Moses said , I am shaking and full of fear .
58012022	But you have come to the mountain of Zion , to the place of the living God , to the Jerusalem which is in heaven , and to an army of angels which may not be numbered ,
58012023	To the great meeting and church of the first of those who are named in heaven , and to God the judge of all , and to the spirits of good men made complete ,
58012024	And to Jesus by whom the new agreement has been made between God and man , and to the sign of the blood which says better things than Abel's blood .
58012025	See that you give ear to his voice which comes to you . For if those whose ears were shut to the voice which came to them on earth did not go free from punishment , what chance have we of going free if we give no attention to him whose voice comes from heaven ?
58012026	Whose voice was the cause of the shaking of the earth ; but now he has made an oath , saying , There will be still one more shaking , not only of the earth , but of heaven .
58012027	And the words , Still one more , make it clear that there will be a taking away of those things which are shaking , as of things which are made , so that there may be only those things of which no shaking is possible .
58012028	If then , we have a kingdom which will never be moved , let us have grace , so that we may give God such worship as is pleasing to him with fear and respect :
58012029	For our God is an all-burning fire .
58013001	Go on loving your brothers in the faith .
58013002	Take care to keep open house : because in this way some have had angels as their guests , without being conscious of it .
58013003	Keep in mind those who are in chains , as if you were chained with them , and those who are in trouble , as being yourselves in the body .
58013004	Let married life be honoured among all of you and not made unclean ; for men untrue in married life will be judged by God .
58013005	Be free from the love of money and pleased with the things which you have ; for he himself has said , I will be with you at all times .
58013006	So that we say with a good heart , The Lord is my helper ; I will have no fear : what is man able to do to me ?
58013007	Keep in mind those who were over you , and who gave you the word of God ; seeing the outcome of their way of life , let your faith be like theirs .
58013008	Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and for ever .
58013009	Do not be turned away by different strange teachings , because it is good for your hearts to be made strong by grace , and not by meats , which were of no profit to those who took so much trouble over them .
58013010	We have an altar from which those priests who are servants in the Tent may not take food .
58013011	For the bodies of the beasts whose blood is taken into the holy place by the high priest as an offering for sin are burned outside the circle of the tents .
58013012	For this reason Jesus was put to death outside the walls , so that he might make the people holy by his blood .
58013013	Let us then go out to him outside the circle of the tents , taking his shame on ourselves .
58013014	For here we have no fixed resting-place , but our search is for the one which is to come .
58013015	Let us then make offerings of praise to God at all times through him , that is to say , the fruit of lips giving witness to his name .
58013016	But go on doing good and giving to others , because God is well-pleased with such offerings .
58013017	Give ear to those who are rulers over you , and do as they say : for they keep watch over your souls , ready to give an account of them ; let them be able to do this with joy and not with grief , because that would be of no profit to you .
58013018	Make prayers for us , for we are certain that our hearts are free from the sense of sin , desiring the right way of life in all things .
58013019	I make this request more strongly , in the hope of coming back to you more quickly .
58013020	Now may the God of peace , who made that great keeper of his flock , even our Lord Jesus , come back from the dead through the blood of the eternal agreement ,
58013021	Make you full of every good work and ready to do all his desires , working in us whatever is pleasing in his eyes through Jesus Christ ; and may the glory be given to him for ever and ever . So be it .
58013022	But , brothers , take kindly the words which I have said for your profit ; for I have not sent you a long letter .
58013023	Our brother Timothy has been let out of prison ; and if he comes here in a short time , he and I will come to you together .
58013024	Give words of love from me to those who are rulers over you , and to all the saints . Those who are in Italy send you their love .
58013025	May grace be with you all .
59001001	James , a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ , sends words of love to the twelve tribes of the Jews living in all parts of the earth .
59001002	Let it be all joy to you , my brothers , when you undergo tests of every sort ;
59001003	Because you have the knowledge that the testing of your faith gives you the power of going on in hope ;
59001004	But let this power have its full effect , so that you may be made complete , needing nothing .
59001005	But if any man among you is without wisdom , let him make his request to God , who gives freely to all without an unkind word , and it will be given to him .
59001006	Let him make his request in faith , doubting nothing ; for he who has doubt in his heart is like the waves of the sea , which are troubled by the driving of the wind .
59001007	Let it not seem to such a man that he will get anything from the Lord ;
59001008	For there is a division in his mind , and he is uncertain in all his ways .
59001009	But let the brother of low position be glad that he is lifted up ;
59001010	But the man of wealth , that he is made low ; because like the flower of the grass he will come to his end .
59001011	For when the sun comes up with its burning heat , the grass gets dry and the grace of its form is gone with the falling flower ; so the man of wealth comes to nothing in his ways .
59001012	There is a blessing on the man who undergoes testing ; because , if he has God's approval , he will be given the crown of life , which the Lord has said he will give to those who have love for him .
59001013	Let no man say when he is tested , I am tested by God ; for it is not possible for God to be tested by evil , and he himself puts no man to such a test :
59001014	But every man is tested when he is turned out of the right way by the attraction of his desire .
59001015	Then when its time comes , desire gives birth to sin ; and sin , when it is of full growth , gives birth to death .
59001016	Do not be turned from the right way , dear brothers .
59001017	Every good and true thing is given to us from heaven , coming from the Father of lights , with whom there is no change or any shade made by turning .
59001018	Of his purpose he gave us being , by his true word , so that we might be , in a sense , the first-fruits of all the things which he had made .
59001019	You have knowledge of this , dear brothers . But let every man be quick in hearing , slow in words , slow to get angry ;
59001020	For the righteousness of God does not come about by the wrath of man .
59001021	For this reason , putting away all dirty behaviour and the overweight of evil , take into your souls without pride the word which , being planted there , is able to give you salvation .
59001022	But be doers of the word , and not only hearers of it , blinding yourselves with false ideas .
59001023	Because if any man is a hearer of the word and not a doer , he is like a man looking at his natural face in a glass ;
59001024	For after looking at himself he goes away , and in a short time he has no memory of what he was like .
59001025	But he who goes on looking into the true law which makes him free , being not a hearer without memory but a doer putting it into effect , this man will have a blessing on his acts .
59001026	If a man seems to have religion and has no control over his tongue but lets himself be tricked by what is false , this man's religion is of no value .
59001027	The religion which is holy and free from evil in the eyes of our God and Father is this : to take care of children who have no fathers and of widows who are in trouble , and to keep oneself untouched by the world .
59002001	My brothers , if you have the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory , do not take a man's position into account .
59002002	For if a man comes into your Synagogue in fair clothing and with a gold ring , and a poor man comes in with dirty clothing ,
59002003	And you do honour to the man in fair clothing and say , Come here and take this good place ; and you say to the poor man , Take up your position there , or be seated at my feet ;
59002004	Is there not a division in your minds ? have you not become judges with evil thoughts ?
59002005	Give ear , my dear brothers ; are not those who are poor in the things of this world marked out by God to have faith as their wealth , and for their heritage the kingdom which he has said he will give to those who have love for him ?
59002006	But you have put the poor man to shame . Are not the men of wealth rulers over you ? do they not take you by force before their judges ?
59002007	Do they not say evil of the holy name which was given to you ?
59002008	But if you keep the greatest law of all , as it is given in the holy Writings , Have love for your neighbour as for yourself , you do well :
59002009	But if you take a man's position into account , you do evil , and are judged as evil-doers by the law .
59002010	For anyone who keeps all the law , but makes a slip in one point , is judged to have gone against it all .
59002011	For he who said , Do not be untrue in married life , is the same who said , Put no man to death . Now if you are not untrue in married life , but you put a man to death , the law is broken .
59002012	Let your words and your acts be those of men who are to be judged by the law which makes free .
59002013	For the man who has had no mercy will be judged without mercy , but mercy takes pride in overcoming judging .
59002014	What use is it , my brothers , for a man to say that he has faith , if he does nothing ? will such a faith give him salvation ?
59002015	If a brother or a sister is without clothing and in need of the day's food ,
59002016	And one of you says to them , Go in peace , be warm and full of food ; but you do not give them the things of which their bodies have need , what profit is there in this ?
59002017	Even so faith without works is dead .
59002018	But a man may say , You have faith and I have works ; let me see your faith without your works , and I will make my faith clear to you by my works .
59002019	You have the belief that God is one , and you do well : the evil spirits have the same belief , shaking with fear .
59002020	Do you not see , O foolish man , that faith without works is of no use ?
59002021	Was not the righteousness of Abraham our father judged by his works , when he made an offering of Isaac his son on the altar ?
59002022	You see that his faith was helping his works and was made complete by them ;
59002023	And the holy Writings were put into effect which said , And Abraham had faith in God and it was put to his account as righteousness ; and he was named the friend of God .
59002024	You see that a man's righteousness is judged by his works and not by his faith only .
59002025	And in the same way , was not the righteousness of Rahab , the loose woman , judged by her works , when she took into her house those who were sent and let them go out by another way ?
59002026	For as the body without the spirit is dead even so faith without works is dead .
59003001	Do not all be teachers , my brothers , because we teachers will be judged more hardly than others .
59003002	For we all go wrong in a number of things . If a man never makes a slip in his talk , then he is a complete man and able to keep all his body in control .
59003003	Now if we put bits of iron into horses ' mouths so that they may be guided by us , we have complete control of their bodies .
59003004	And again ships , though they are so great and are moved by violent winds , are turned by a very small guiding-blade , at the impulse of the man who is using it .
59003005	Even so the tongue is a small part of the body , but it takes credit for great things . How much wood may be lighted by a very little fire !
59003006	And the tongue is a fire ; it is the power of evil placed in our bodies , making all the body unclean , putting the wheel of life on fire , and getting its fire from hell .
59003007	For every sort of beast and bird and every living thing on earth and in the sea has been controlled by man and is under his authority ;
59003008	But the tongue may not be controlled by man ; it is an unresting evil , it is full of the poison of death .
59003009	With it we give praise to our Lord and Father ; and with it we put a curse on men who are made in God's image .
59003010	Out of the same mouth comes blessing and cursing . My brothers , it is not right for these things to be so .
59003011	Does the fountain send from the same outlet sweet and bitter water ?
59003012	Is a fig-tree able to give us olives , my brothers , or do we get figs from a vine , or sweet water from the salt sea ?
59003013	Who has wisdom and good sense among you ? let him make his works clear by a life of gentle wisdom .
59003014	But if you have bitter envy in your heart and the desire to get the better of others , have no pride in this , talking falsely against what is true .
59003015	This wisdom is not from heaven , but is of the earth and the flesh and the Evil One .
59003016	For where envy is , and the desire to get the better of others , there is no order , but every sort of evil-doing .
59003017	But the wisdom which is from heaven is first holy , then gentle , readily giving way in argument , full of peace and mercy and good works , not doubting , not seeming other than it is .
59003018	And the fruit of righteousness is planted in peace for those who make peace .
59004001	What is the cause of wars and fighting among you ? is it not in your desires which are at war in your bodies ?
59004002	You are burning with desire , and have not your desire , so you put men to death ; you are full of envy , and you are not able to get your desire , so you are fighting and making war ; you have not your desire , because you do not make request for it .
59004003	You make your request but you do not get it , because your request has been wrongly made , desiring the thing only so that you may make use of it for your pleasure .
59004004	O you who are false to God , do you not see that the friends of this world are not God's friends ? Every man desiring to be a friend of this world makes himself a hater of God .
59004005	Or does it seem to you that it is for nothing that the holy Writings say , The spirit which God put into our hearts has a strong desire for us ?
59004006	But he gives more grace . So that the Writings say , God is against the men of pride , but he gives grace to those who make themselves low before him .
59004007	For this cause be ruled by God ; but make war on the Evil One and he will be put to flight before you .
59004008	Come near to God and he will come near to you . Make your hands clean , you evil-doers ; put away deceit from your hearts , you false in mind .
59004009	Be troubled , with sorrow and weeping ; let your laughing be turned to sorrow and your joy to grief .
59004010	Make yourselves low in the eyes of the Lord and you will be lifted up by him .
59004011	Do not say evil against one another , my brothers . He who says evil against his brother or makes himself his brother's judge , says evil against the law and is judging the law : and in judging the law you become , not a doer of the law but a judge .
59004012	There is only one judge and law-giver , even he who has the power of salvation and of destruction ; but who are you to be your neighbour's judge ?
59004013	How foolish it is to say , Today or tomorrow we will go into this town , and be there for a year and do business there and get wealth :
59004014	When you are not certain what will take place tomorrow . What is your life ? It is a mist , which is seen for a little time and then is gone .
59004015	But the right thing to say would be , If it is the Lord's pleasure and if we are still living , we will do this and that .
59004016	But now you go on glorying in your pride : and all such glorying is evil .
59004017	The man who has knowledge of how to do good and does not do it , to him it is sin .
59005001	Come now , you men of wealth , give yourselves to weeping and crying because of the bitter troubles which are coming to you .
59005002	Your wealth is unclean and insects have made holes in your clothing .
59005003	Your gold and your silver are wasted and their waste will be a witness against you , burning into your flesh . You have put by your store in the last days .
59005004	See , the money which you falsely kept back from the workers cutting the grass in your field , is crying out against you ; and the cries of those who took in your grain have come to the ears of the Lord of armies .
59005005	You have been living delicately on earth and have taken your pleasure ; you have made your hearts fat for a day of destruction .
59005006	You have given your decision against the upright man and have put him to death . He puts up no fight against you .
59005007	Go on waiting calmly , my brothers , till the coming of the Lord , like the farmer waiting for the good fruit of the earth till the early and late rains have come .
59005008	Be as calm in your waiting ; let your hearts be strong : because the coming of the Lord is near .
59005009	Say no hard things against one another , brothers , so that you will not be judged ; see , the judge is waiting at the doors .
59005010	Take as an example of pain nobly undergone and of strength in trouble , the prophets who gave to men the words of the Lord .
59005011	We say that those men who have gone through pain are happy : you have the story of Job and the troubles through which he went and have seen that the Lord was full of pity and mercy in the end .
59005012	But most of all , my brothers , do not take oaths , not by the heaven , or by the earth , or by any other thing : but let your Yes be Yes , and your No be No : so that you may not be judged .
59005013	Is anyone among you in trouble ? let him say prayers . Is anyone glad ? let him make a song of praise .
59005014	Is anyone among you ill ? let him send for the rulers of the church ; and let them say prayers over him , putting oil on him in the name of the Lord .
59005015	And by the prayer of faith the man who is ill will be made well , and he will be lifted up by the Lord , and for any sin which he has done he will have forgiveness .
59005016	So then , make a statement of your sins to one another , and say prayers for one another so that you may be made well . The prayer of a good man is full of power in its working .
59005017	Elijah was a man of flesh and blood as we are , and he made a strong prayer that there might be no rain ; and there was no rain on the earth for three years and six months .
59005018	And he made another prayer , and the heaven sent down rain and the earth gave her fruit .
59005019	My brothers , if one of you has gone out of the way of the true faith and another has made him see his error ,
59005020	Be certain that he through whom a sinner has been turned from the error of his way , keeps a soul from death and is the cause of forgiveness for sins without number .
60001001	Peter , an Apostle of Jesus Christ , to the saints who are living in Pontus , Galatia , Cappadocia , Asia , and Bithynia ,
60001002	Who , through the purpose of God , have been made holy by the Spirit , disciples of Jesus , made clean by his blood : May you have grace and peace in full measure .
60001003	Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , who through his great mercy has given us a new birth and a living hope by the coming again of Jesus Christ from the dead ,
60001004	And a heritage fair , holy and for ever new , waiting in heaven for you ,
60001005	Who , by the power of God are kept , through faith , for that salvation , which will be seen at the last day .
60001006	You have cause for great joy in this , though it may have been necessary for you to be troubled for a little time , being tested in all sorts of ways ,
60001007	So that the true metal of your faith , being of much greater value than gold ( which , though it comes to an end , is tested by fire ) , may come to light in praise and glory and honour , at the revelation of Jesus Christ :
60001008	To whom your love is given , though you have not seen him ; and the faith which you have in him , though you do not see him now , gives you joy greater than words and full of glory :
60001009	For so you have the true end of your faith , even the salvation of your souls .
60001010	For the prophets who gave the news of the grace which would come to you , made search with all care for knowledge of this salvation ;
60001011	Attempting to see what sort of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them was pointing to , when it gave witness to the pains which Christ would undergo and the glories which would come after them .
60001012	And it was made clear to those prophets that they were God's servants not for themselves but for you , to give you word of the things which have now come to your ears from the preachers of the good news through the Holy Spirit sent down from heaven ; things which even angels have a desire to see .
60001013	So make your minds ready , and keep on the watch , hoping with all your power for the grace which is to come to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ ;
60001014	Like children ruled by God , do not go back to the old desires of the time when you were without knowledge :
60001015	But be holy in every detail of your lives , as he , whose servants you are , is holy ;
60001016	Because it has been said in the Writings , You are to be holy , for I am holy .
60001017	And if you give the name of Father to him who , judging every man by his acts , has no respect for a man's position , then go in fear while you are on this earth :
60001018	Being conscious that you have been made free from that foolish way of life which was your heritage from your fathers , not through a payment of things like silver or gold which come to destruction ,
60001019	But through holy blood , like that of a clean and unmarked lamb , even the blood of Christ :
60001020	Who was marked out by God before the making of the world , but was caused to be seen in these last times for you ,
60001021	Who through him have faith in God who took him up again from the dead into glory ; so that your faith and hope might be in God .
60001022	And as you have made your souls clean , being ruled by what is true , and loving one another without deceit , see that your love is warm and from the heart :
60001023	Because you have had a new birth , not from the seed of man , but from eternal seed , through the word of a living and unchanging God .
60001024	For it is said , All flesh is like grass , and all its glory like the flower of the grass . The grass becomes dry and the flower dead :
60001025	But the word of the Lord is eternal . And this is the word of the good news which was given to you .
60002001	So putting away all wrongdoing , and all tricks and deceits and envies and evil talk ,
60002002	Be full of desire for the true milk of the word , as babies at their mothers ' breasts , so that you may go on to salvation ;
60002003	If you have had a taste of the grace of the Lord :
60002004	To whom you come , as to a living stone , not honoured by men , but of great and special value to God ;
